BuzzFeed News’s analysis suggests that gun sales are increasing in the Amazon states at a faster rate than the rest of the country under far-right president Jair Bolsonaro, whose family has ties to the US’s National Rifle Association. Visit the link in our bio for more on this story. (📸: Joao Laet / AFP / Getty Images, Mauro Pimentel / AFP / Getty Images)

The Game of Thrones prequel spin-off series House of the Dragon is receiving a straight-to-series order from HBO, network chief Casey Bloys announced late Tuesday. As the title suggests, the new series will focus on House Targaryen, set 300 years before the events of Game of Thrones. (📸: HBO Max)

Approximately 180,000 people have been ordered to evacuate as the massive Kincade and Tick fires threaten arid regions of both Northern and Southern California. In an effort to reduce the risk of sparking additional fires, Pacific Gas and Electric has shut off the power to nearly 3 million Californians in those regions. These pictures show how fires are affecting the people and wildlife of California. (📸: Reuters, Getty, AP, Los Angeles Daily News)

The Game of Thrones prequel starring Naomi Watts isn’t moving forward at HBO. Cast and crew members from the pilot episode of the prequel, announced in 2018, have reportedly been receiving emails saying HBO has officially passed. Before Game of Thrones even ended, the prequel was one of many related projects HBO put into development. But according to Variety, those projects are also believed to have been abandoned. HBO declined to confirm the reports. (📸: HBO)

The law — which was signed in May and sparked nationwide protests — was slated to go into effect Nov. 15. But a US district court judge issued a preliminary injunction, temporarily blocking it from taking effect "until the court resolves the case in full." The law was written by anti-abortion advocates as an effort to overturn Roe v. Wade. Read more on this story at the link in our bio. (📸: Tasos Katopodis/Getty Images)

A San Juan judge determined that Salvatore Anello was responsible for Chloe Wiegand’s death and charged him with negligent homicide, setting his bail at $80,000. In his testimony, he told officials that Chloe had asked him to pick her up, and he then put her on the rail by the window, expecting the glass to support her. Chloe's family blames Royal Caribbean for leaving a large window open in the children's area of the ship and plans to sue the cruise line, according to their attorney. Anello is set to appear in court Nov. 20. (📸: Lipcon, Margulies, Alsina & Winkleman)

Austin police told BuzzFeed News that officers were called to the bar, Stereotype, shortly after 2 a.m. on Sunday and arrested Padalecki. The 37-year-old actor allegedly hit two employees in the face after starting a verbal argument. According to online records for the Travis County Jail, Padelecki is no longer in custody. (📸: Handout/Getty Images)

LuLaRoe, the controversial multilevel marketing company, announced it will be laying off all 167 employees at its Corona, California warehouse five days before Christmas. The last few years have been rough for LuLaRoe with angry former consultants speaking out and filing class-action lawsuits in 2017, claiming they had been hoodwinked into nothing more than a "pyramid scheme." The company's main clothing supplier, Providence Industries, also sued LuLaRoe for $49 million in 2018, claiming it hadn't been paid. (📸: LuLaRoe)

House Speaker Nancy Pelosi set the vote for Thursday on a resolution affirming the inquiry after weeks of attacks from Republicans. The White House has previously refused to cooperate in part because the House had not yet voted to authorize the probe. The vote will also establish the procedure for public impeachment hearings on TV. (📸: Zach Gibson/Getty Images)

Inyoung You, a former Boston College student from South Korea, was allegedly so physically, verbally, and psychologically abusive towards Alexander Urtula during their relationship that she caused him to take his own life, the Suffolk County District Attorney said at a press conference. According to prosecutors, You sent Urtula 47,000 text messages in the two months prior to his death, including "repeated admonitions for Mr. Urtula to 'go kill himself'." Prosecutors also said You was aware of his "spiraling depression and suicidal thoughts," but continued to urge him to kill himself. Read more on this story at the link in our bio. (📸: Suffolk County District Attorney’s Office)

Julie Kirchner, the US Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) Ombudsman, offered President Donald Trump her resignation this week, according to an email sent to staffers by acting DHS Secretary Kevin McAleenan. It was not immediately clear why Kirchner had resigned. Kirchner had previously worked at FAIR, a group that advocated for policies that restrict immigration. Michael Dougherty, assistant secretary for border, immigration, and trade policy, will be taking over the ombudsman role, which is tasked with helping applicants fix problems with their immigration status.(📸: DHS)

Hill’s resignation comes after the conservative website Redstate published text messages and photos indicating that she had been in a relationship with a female campaign staffer and alleged she was involved with male member of her office staff. Hill admitted and apologized for having a relationship with the female staffer, but denied any improper relationship with the male staffer. Hill also appears to be a victim of revenge porn as the nude photos of her were published without her consent. Read more at the link in our bio. (📸: Mario Tama/Getty Images)

Conyers, 90, was a civil rights icon and represented a Detroit district from 1965 until his resignation in December 2017. At the time of his resignation he was the longest-serving member of the House of Representatives and the ranking member of the House Judiciary Committee. His decades-long career in Congress ended when he was accused of sexual harassment and abuse by multiple women. (📸: Mark Wilson / Getty Images)

The elusive ISIS leader whose terror group organized and inspired horrific attacks that murdered people around the world was cornered in a dead-end tunnel then blew himself up, President Trump said in an address early Sunday morning. No US personnel were reportedly killed in the operation. Baghdadi's death came as Trump pulled US troops away from the Turkey-Syria border, leading to fears that the terror group could regain some strength after being significantly incapacitated. Read more on this story at the link in our bio. (📸: Prakash Singh/AFP/Getty Images; Abaca Press/Sipa USA via AP)

A Southwest flight attendant has sued the airline after claiming two pilots secretly recorded video of the plane's bathroom on an iPad during a flight. According to the lawsuit, the attendant says she was warned that if she told people about the incident, "no one would ever fly our airline again." Read more about this story through the link in our bio. (📸: Mark Ralston / Getty Images)

Kim Kardashian revealed that her husband banned their daughter North from wearing makeup until she's a teenager and it caused a "big fight" in their household. "North is trying to get in on the makeup but she's being blocked heavily because her dad has stopped all makeup for her until she is a teenager," Kim said. In a recent interview, Kanye also said he's banned his 6-year-old from wearing crop tops because "I think and feel differently now, now that I'm Christian." (📸: Getty, @kimkardashian)

The judge ruled that Aela Mansmann's note was constitutionally protected free speech and blocked the school's three day suspension of Mansmann for bullying. Mansmann and other female students placed notes in the school's women's bathrooms on Sept. 16, and security camera footage identified Mansmann as the author of the original notes. Two other students were also suspended. Though no student was named in the notes, court records said "a certain male student...experienced what could be described as ostracism by his peers" and missed school for several days. Mansmann's parents and the ACLU had filed a lawsuit against Cape Elizabeth High School on Mansmann's behalf. (📸: AP)

Kelly Bachman, the comedian who confronted Harvey Weinstein when he showed up at an event for young performers in New York Wednesday said she "wanted to go so much harder" and "say more" to the disgraced Hollywood movie producer. "I didn’t know we had to bring our own Mace and rape whistles to Actor's Hour," Bachman said during her set, which received boos from the crowd. Two other women were kicked out of the venue for protesting Weinstein's attendance. In a statement to BuzzFeed News, Weinstein said he was "happy to address anyone's questions." Click our link in bio to read more. (📸: Kelly Bachman, Zoe Stuckless)

Thomas Alexander, 66, was hunting in the woods near his home in northern Arkansas Tuesday and shot a buck, or a male deer. When he approached the animal, it got up, attacked him, and ran away. Alexander was able to call his wife at some point, and emergency medical services were contacted. Rescuers were able to retrieve him from the woods, but he was pronounced dead upon arrival at the hospital. Although Alexander's exact cause of death is yet to be determined, the hospital noted a number of puncture wounds, likely from the buck's antlers. The deer is still at large. (📸: Getty)

The Houston Astros fired assistant general manager Brandon Taubman after he reportedly yelled at three female reporters about a pitcher suspended for domestic violence. "Thank God we got Osuna! I'm so f------ glad we got Osuna!" Taubman yelled near reporters — one of them wearing a domestic-violence awareness bracelet — in reference to relief pitcher Roberto Osuna, who served a 75-game suspension for allegations of domestic violence. The comments were reported by Sports Illustrated's Stephanie Apstein, with the team initially calling it "misleading and completely irresponsible." The Astros have also apologized to Apstein. (📸: Michael Ciaglo/AP)

Nusrat Jahan Rafi, 19, died in April after she was set on fire for refusing to withdraw her complaint against the principal at her madrasa, or Islamic school. Follow @world for more on this story and more global news. (📸: Getty)

Collin Hewett said about a quarter of the bottle came gushing out all over his bride-to-be. “Well, we found the right angle, but I didn’t find the right angle with the bottle,” he told BuzzFeed News. The result was...not exactly romantic. Luckily, Alyssa Snodsmith brought a second outfit so the shoot could continue. People thought the pictures were a hilarious take on the expectation vs. reality meme 🍾😂 (📷: Brianna Bender/ Chandler Lefever)

Documents obtained by BuzzFeed News show the Secret Service interviewed the rapper about “threatening lyrics” in his rap song “Framed” after receiving an email from a TMZ staffer. It appears the TMZ employee was seeking comment from the Secret Service. Hours before the email was sent, TMZ had published a story about Eminem’s lyrics criticizing Trump. The agency’s Protective Intelligence and Assessment Division conducted a background check on Eminem and started to arrange an interview with the rapper through his attorneys on Dec. 20, 2017. Tap the link in our bio for more details. (📸: Christopher Polk/Getty Images; Secret Service)

Even though the state is located nearly smack in the center of the United States, hundreds of miles away from Mexico, President Trump said that the wall will be one "you can't get over, you can't get under,” while speaking at a conference. President Trump addressed the confusing comment on Twitter Wednesday night, writing that he had made the comment, "Kiddingly." Swipe 👈 to see some of the reactions to his comment. (📸: Evan Vucci/AP)

British performer Mina Lioness — who had been in a months-long battle with Lizzo and the singer's management – will be given songwriting credit on Lizzo's smash hit "Truth Hurts." Lizzo has admitted a 2017 tweet by Mina inspired the song, though Lizzo initially called the claim "crazy." Justin and Jeremiah Raisen also argue that they deserve a songwriting credit on "Truth Hurts," which Lizzo denied in a post celebrating Mina and her tweet on Wednesday. Click our link in bio for more. (📸: Theo Wargo / Getty Images)

Attorneys representing Roxsana Hernández's family said ICE was required to preserve the surveillance footage for pending litigation. "ICE and CoreCivic have consistently denied wrongdoing and stated that they in effect provided Roxsana with all the health care she needed," attorney Andrew Free told BuzzFeed News. "The video would be essential and frankly irreplaceable evidence of whether that was true." Hernández was in the custody of ICE at a private prison operated by CoreCivic when she died in 2018. Read the full story through the link in our bio. (📷: Luc Forsyth/ AP)

In video of the confrontation, Phoenix Police Officer Christopher Meyer can be seen with his gun drawn. The family — 22-year-old Dravon Ames, his pregnant fiancé, and their two young children, ages 1 and 4 — had been shopping at Family Dollar when police officers were called following a report of a woman trying to steal aluminum foil. The family said their daughter walked out of the store with a doll without them noticing, and they were then followed by officers to their apartment complex. The lawsuit alleges Ames was pulled from the car by Meyer who yelled, "I'm going to put a cap in your ass." Click our link in bio for more. (📸: @ megoconnor via Twitter)

A transgender man who was hired by actor Rosario Dawson to complete construction work on her home has filed a lawsuit accusing the star and her family of physical and verbal abuse, including allegedly being pulled through a window and thrown to the ground by Dawson's mother, Isabel, while Dawson helped restrain him. In the lawsuit, Dedrek Finley also accused Dawson, her mother and stepfather, Gregory Dawson, of frequently misgendering and discriminating against him because of his gender identity. Finley was granted a restraining order against Dawson’s mother in April 2018. (📸: Rich Polk/Getty)

Hundreds of thousands of people across Lebanon have been protesting against the climbing cost of living, tax increases, and to oust politicians who have been in power for decades. These are some of the best signs from the protests. Follow @world for more.(📸: Getty)

President Donald Trump once again used a racist remark, this time calling the ongoing impeachment inquiry against him a "lynching.” His tweet sparked swift condemnation from Democratic lawmakers — and a few Republicans — while the White House later defended the president saying he "has used many words to describe the way he has been treated" by the press. Trump has previously used incendiary, racist remarks as a way to divide Americans against each other and change the conversation from something he doesn't like.(📸: Win Mcnamee/Getty Images)

Trudeau’s Liberal Party will hold on to power, winning the most seats in a national election, but losing a parliamentary majority after a divisive campaign plagued by scandal. It’s a result that will force the leader to work with at least one opposition party to govern. The 2019 election campaign was one of the most divisive and negative in the country’s history with Trudeau having to address multiple old photos of him appearing in blackface and brownface. (📸:Cole Burston/Getty Images)

Cayla Campos was playing the game around a park with her boyfriend Friday night when she spotted two people in the area robbing someone who was sitting in a car. When Campos turned her car around to drive away, multiple shots were fired into her vehicle. Police said she was hit by one of the bullets and crashed into an unoccupied home. In a Facebook post, Campos's father called his daughter a "very special person" who was "murdered in cold blood." No one has been arrested and police are asking for the public's help in identifying possible suspects. (📸: Facebook)

Sunday Riley agreed to settle with the Federal Trade Commission over allegations that the skincare brand faked reviews on Sephora’s website to boost its sales for almost two years. The agreement between Riley and the FTC doesn’t require that the company admit to writing fake reviews. Rather, the company has promised not to do so in the future. “The proposed settlement prohibits Sunday Riley from again posting fake reviews, but does not require any refunds to consumers, forfeiture of profits, or admission of wrongdoing,” an FTC spokesperson said. Read the full story at the link in our bio 📝🤑 (📷: @sundayriley)

The governor of Santiago said Monday that 11 people had died as a result of protest-linked violence over the weekend. Student-led protests began last week when people jumped over subway ticket barriers in opposition to increased prices. But by Friday the unrest had morphed into a larger protest movement against inequality and the rising cost of living in Chile. “It’s not about 30 pesos, it’s about 30 years,” was a common chant from protesters, referencing the increase in subway fares and rising inequality over the last three decades. Follow @world for more news from around the globe 🌎🇨🇱 (📷: Getty/ AP/ Reuters)

Lyndsey Raby wanted her wedding to her partner to be super special and after being inspired by Pinterest, she called on four very special women to be her flower girls. "We don’t have any young kids in our family and, honestly, I thought my spunky grandmothers would be even cuter, and it definitely was,” Raby told BuzzFeed News. “They all mean the world to me and I was just happy to share my day with them.” 👵❤️ (📸: Natalie Caho)

The proposed regulation from the Department of Justice that enables immigration officers to collect DNA does not take effect immediately. There will be 20 days for the public to provide comments. According to officials, the FBI will provide the Department of Homeland Security with DNA collection kits and will analyze the samples collected. Read more on this story at the link in our bio. (📸: John Moore/Getty Images)

The first full trailer for the upcoming season offers fans of the lavish period drama their first real look at the new set of actors playing the British royal family as they — and the country — struggle to keep up with the pace of change in the 1960s and ‘70s. Watch the trailer at the link in our bio and see how it all unfolds when the season premieres on Nov. 17 👑 (📸: Sophie Mutevelian/Netflix)

During a Fox News interview, acting White House chief of staff Mick Mulvaney said that Trump "was honestly surprised at the level of pushback" and defended the president's desire to host the G7 at his hotel. In tweets Saturday night, Trump said he "thought he was doing something very good for our country" by using his own property for the meeting. After blaming "hostile media" and anger from Democrats, he said that the US would host the 2020 summit at another site. (📸: Tom Pennington/Getty Images)

The T-shirts went on sale following the PrEP+ club party Ocean hosted in New York City. But some took issue with how much the merchandise cost. The New York chapter of Act Up, an international advocacy group that has worked for decades to combat HIV/AIDS, tweeted that the shirt's price tag echoed the steep mark-up by a pharmaceutical company that produces PrEP. Ocean has not made clear what he intends to do with the profits from the T-shirts, which are sold alongside his music merchandise on his website. (📸: Afp Contributor/AFP/Getty Images; Twitter)

"Around Season 2 or 3, my body started to mature and I started to become a woman," Williams told Vogue magazine, "but Arya was still very much like trying to be disguised as a boy." She went on to say that the costume and makeup she had to wear for Arya's disguise made her feel "ashamed" of her own maturing body. But since then Williams says she's taken the opportunity since the show ended to experiment with more feminine fashions and to embrace her body. (📸: Getty Images/HBO)

The State Department said toxicology results from the FBI have been consistent with the findings of local officials, and the tourists appear to have died of natural causes. The deaths of Miranda Schaup-Werner, Edward Nathaniel Holmes, and Cynthia Ann Day within days of each other in May prompted a wave of concern among vacationers in the Caribbean nation. You can read more about this story through the link in our bio. (📸: Facebook, WFMZ)

From the ongoing impeachment inquiry against President Trump to the Turkish invasion of northern Syria, these are the most striking and memorable pictures from this past week. (📷: White House/ AP/ Getty / Reuters)

People who own a bottle of Johnson's Baby Powder from Lot #22318RB should stop using it, Johnson & Johnson Consumer Inc. said in a release announcing the recall. The company is facing a slew of lawsuits from women claiming the talcum products caused them to develop cancer. Talc can be contaminated with asbestos because deposits of both of the naturally occurring minerals can occur close to each other underground. The WHO’s International Agency for Research on Cancer considers all forms of asbestos carcinogenic to humans. Tap the link in our bio for more details. (📷: Frederic J. Brown/ AFP/ Getty Images)

In this week's .JPG newsletter, which features the best photos from around the world, we have an interview with photography icon Annie Leibovitz. Hit up the link in our bio to sign up! (📸: Getty Images)

Friday's spacewalk is the first time in more than half a century of space exploration that two women walked in space together. Astronauts Jessica Meir and Christina Koch were assigned to replace a battery/discharge united on the International Space Station's exterior structure. An all-female flight was scrapped earlier this year after NASA determined it didn't have properly-sized spacesuits for two women. (📸: AP/NASA)

At their peak in the mid-20th century, drive-in theaters were the perfect place to catch a flick from the comfort and privacy of your car 🍿🚙 (📸: J.R. Eyerman/Getty Images, Bettmann /Bettmann Archive, Allan Grant/Getty Images, Newsday/Getty Images)

A detention center holding immigrant detainees waited more than seven hours to transfer an ailing 37-year-old Mexican man to a hospital, where he died from bleeding in his brain, according to internal documents obtained by BuzzFeed News. “A seven-hour delay in responding to this patient does not seem consistent with adequate care,” said Marc Stern, a public health expert and faculty at the University of Washington. “This may have been a preventable death.” Tap the link in bio for more details on this story. (📸: Gregory Bull / AP)

Perry informed Trump that he would soon step down from his cabinet position, as attention continues to focus on his role in the Ukraine scandal that has launched an impeachment investigation against the president. Tap the link in bio for more on his resignation. (📸: Petras Malukas / Getty Images)

Acting White House Chief of Staff Mick Mulvaney acknowledged for the first time during a contentious press conference that the aid was “absolutely no question” withheld in part because Trump wanted Ukraine to look into “corruption that related to the DNC server." Mulvaney denied, however, that the aid was withheld in relation to Trump’s request that Ukraine look into Joe Biden. Read more at the link in our bio. (📸; Jim Watson / Getty Images)

Warner Brothers confirmed to BuzzFeed News that Dano will be playing the tricky evildoer. The last time the Ridder appeared in a live-action Batman was 1995's Batman Forever, in which comedian Jim Carrey portrayed the character. According to the Hollywood Reporter, Dano's Riddler will go by the name Edward Nashton. The Batman will debut in theaters on June 25, 2021 🎬🦇 (📷: Frazer Harrison / Getty Images)

A report sent to the global megacharity WWF's top bosses raised alarm about “accelerating” allegations of abuses being carried out “in connivance with and under the watchful eyes of WWF staff.” Read the full investigation through the link in our bio. (📸: Michael Gottschalk/Getty Images)

The Baltimore congressman died "due to complications concerning longstanding health challenges," his office said in a statement. As chairman of the House Committee on Oversight and Reform, Cummings was a central figure in the impeachment investigation of the Trump administration. After news broke of his death, Speaker Nancy Pelosi ordered the flags at the US Capitol to be flown at half-staff. (📸: Win Mcnamee/Getty Images)

Marjorie Klapper, 50, was sentenced to three weeks in prison for paying $15,000 to boost her son’s ACT scores. In addition to the test score inflation, Klapper also falsified her son's college applications by claiming that he was black or Latino and that he was a first-generation college student, even though both she and his father graduated from college. She’s the ninth parent to be sentenced for her role in the college admissions scandal. (📷: Nathan Klima / Boston Globe via Getty).

The wildfires raging in the Mount Lebanon mountain range were described by Lebanon’s Civil Defense director-general as the worst the country has experienced in decades. At least three people have died while fighting the fires, one in Lebanon and two in Syria. The Red Cross announced it has treated more than 70 people for fire-related injuries. Fueled by high temperatures and strong winds, the cause remains unclear. Some residents have also had to evacuate their homes and villages. Follow @world for more stories from around the globe 🇱🇧🌍 (📸: Getty, AP, Reuters)

Check the link in our bio and sign up for The Stakes 2020, our newsletter about what really matters in 2020 election — and also with texts between editor-in-chief Ben Smith and the candidates. It doesn't always go as planned 😬

The 190-pound mastiff was hiking with his human and got so worn out he couldn’t make it back to the car. They were stuck on the trail for hours until about five concerned hikers passed by and called 911. The Salt Lake County Search and Rescue team arrived armed with helmets, ropes, radios, and a litter — a piece of equipment used to carry people — to rescue him. However, the wheel on the litter broke about a mile into the rescue, so the crew had to carry the massive mastiff the rest of the way down. Floyd handled the entire situation like a champ. Swipe 👈 to see more pictures of this chonky boi’s rescue ❤️ (📸: Salt Lake County Sheriff's Search and Rescue)

The parents of Harry Dunn, the British teen killed in a car crash with a US diplomat's wife, went to the White House expecting to push Trump on waiving diplomatic immunity for the American woman so they can seek justice for their son. Instead, he arranged a meeting with her without their knowledge. The Dunn family said they refused the meeting, but said they "would still love to meet with her but it has to be on our terms and on UK soil." At a conference on Wednesday, Trump added that accidents like the one that killed Harry Dunn are common for visiting Americans because "the roads are opposite." (📸: Eduardo Munoz/Reuters; Facebook: Justice4Harry19)

Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez will endorse Bernie Sanders for president, the senator’s campaign confirmed. Since shooting into the national spotlight, Ocasio-Cortez has become a significant voice in progressive politics, with major sway among young voters. | 📸: Getty Images

Presidential candidate Kamala Harris received applause during Tuesday night's debate after bringing up women’s access to reproductive health care as a missed point in previous debates. (📸: Saul Loeb/AFP via Getty Images)

The actor was already facing an allegation of sexual assault after a woman said he grabbed her breast and squeezed it without her consent at a Manhattan bar in June, and was arraigned on two additional counts of misdemeanor forcible touching. The prosecution said they would like to call as many as 12 additional accusers to the stand when the case goes to trial. Gooding has denied any wrongdoing. Click our link in bio for more. (📸: Getty)

According to RTV, the eldest brother, who is 25, turned up at a bar in a nearby village and said he had brothers and sisters and wanted to save them. The siblings were found in the house along with a 58-year-old man, who is not their father. It's unclear how long the family had been living in the basement, but several Dutch outlets reported that the 25-year-old man told locals he hadn't been outside for nine years. According to the village’s mayor, it is unclear if the man who was arrested and the siblings are related. (📸: NU.nl / Via youtube.com)

Aaron Dean was held on suspicion of murder Monday evening on a $200,000 bond, county jail records showed. Police said he was taken into custody at 6 p.m., and investigators were working closely with the Tarrant County District Attorney's office, but by 10 p.m., he was no longer listed in custody at the county jail. (📸: Tarrant County Corrections Center)

Players rejoice! After the viral video game sensation had been offline for two days following a black hole event that ended its 10th season, the game is back online with a brand new map! Swipe to see some of the best reactions to the game’s return 👈 (📸: Fortnite)

Typhoon Hagibis made landfall in Japan on Saturday, slamming islands with torrential rain and heavy winds. The storm flooded rivers and caused secondary weather patterns like tornados that destroyed homes and public property in areas east of Tokyo. Prior to the storm, Japan's weather agency issued the highest-level warning for rain in seven prefectures 💨🇯🇵 (📷: Kyodo/ Kim Hong-ji/ Reuters/ Carl Court/ Franck Fife/ Odd Andersen/ Karyn Nishimura/ Getty Images)

Fort Worth police Chief Ed Kraus said that he had intended to fire the officer, Aaron Dean, but Dean resigned before that could happen. Kraus also said that Dean was not being “cooperative” with the interview process and that he tended his resignation before police could interview him as part of their investigation. Jefferson’s family urged the police department to recuse themselves from investigating the shooting and called for an independent third-party investigation. However, Kraus said that his department would continue with both the criminal and the internal affairs investigations. (📸: Facebook; Fort Worth police)

Choi Jin-ri, a South Korean singer-actress known by the stage name Sulli, was found dead at her apartment in Seoul. According to Yonhap News Agency, a police official said it seemed that she took her own life, but they are also looking into other possibilities. "We are very sad and sorry to deliver this sad news. Sulli has left us,” her agency, SM Entertainment, said. (📸: Instagram)

Atatiana Jefferson was playing video games with her nephew when they heard someone outside the window, an attorney said. Police were performing a wellness check after a neighbor called a non-emergency line after spotting her door open and lights on. Police body camera footage shows them walking around the property in the dark. One officer then apparently saw a person through the window and fired one shot, killing Jefferson, police said. The entire exchange lasted less than four seconds and the officer does not identify himself as a police officer in the video. Read more at the link in our bio. (📸: Facebook)

Simone Biles won her 25th medal at the gymnastics world championships, breaking the record for both male and female gymnasts and cementing her status as the best of the best. "I can't be more thrilled with the performance I put out at this World Championships and it only gives me confidence moving forward," Biles said 🏅 (📸: Laurence Griffiths/Getty Images)

The video featured an unauthorized use of the song in its entirety and the band had "already entered into a process to call for non use of Queen song copyrights by the Trump campaign” hours after it went up, according to a representative. By Sunday, the video was no longer available on Twitter, and a band representative told BuzzFeed News the takedown was handled by Queen's music publisher. (📸: Angela Weiss/AFP/Getty Images, Eric Baradat/Getty Images)

As health agencies scramble to control the rash of vaping-related lung injuries, YouTube is playing host to dozens of videos showing how to make black-market THC vape oil. Some of these videos, which are rife with safety hazards, have been viewed millions of times. Tap the link in our bio for the full story. (📸: Screenshots via YouTube)

West High School chemistry teacher Matt Baish had been placed on administrative leave pending an investigation by the school district. His comment about 16-year-old Thunberg sparked outrage from community members and parents, who pointed out that Baish was threatening violence against someone who is the same age as some of his students. The Waterloo Community School District told BuzzFeed News on Friday that Baish had resigned, effective immediately. (📷: Facebook)

During the CNN equality town hall on Thursday night, Warren was asked what she would say to someone who told her that they believe "marriage is between one man and one woman." Judging by the attention her comedic answer received online, people were thrilled. Swipe 👈 for more online reactions. (📷: Mario Tama/Getty)

The president played "Purple Rain" ahead of his rally in Minneapolis on Thursday night. According to a letter the Prince estate shared on Twitter, Trump's lawyers agreed in 2018 not to play the artist's music at campaign events. Spokespeople for Trump's campaign did not respond to a request for comment. (📸: Stephen Maturen / Getty Images, Jonathan Daniel / Getty Images)

We've gathered pictures from around the globe of the tremendous and selfless work that teachers do to enlighten the next generation of minds 🍏📚 (📸:Wikus de Wet/Getty Images, Valery Matytsin/TASS, Jim Watson/Getty Images, Frédéric Soltan/Getty Images, Anadolu Agency/Getty Images, Giles Clarke/Getty Images)

Iranian women were allowed to watch the nation's men’s soccer team play for the first time in nearly 40 years on Thursday, after the conservative theocracy faced pressure and a possible ban from FIFA if it didn’t allow women into the match. The regime allocated 4,000 tickets for women at the approximately 80,000 seat stadium. Women were reportedly seated separately from the men, and were provided separate female security guards ⚽️ Follow @world for more headlines from around the 🌎

Parents are “livid” after finding out that Kevin John, the man who created Blippi and plays him in videos, won't actually be at the live show. Instead, an actor will be playing the character, and the only way you'd know that is if you bothered to read the fine print on the Blippi Live website. “I called Ticketmaster and argued with them as they were equating it to Disney on Ice and him being a ‘character,’” said a mother who spent $460 on meet-and-greet packages for her family. (📸: YouTube)

Officials arrested Brian Steven Smith as a suspect in the case, the Anchorage Police Department said. Two days after police received the card, authorities were notified about a dead body found along a highway and officials believe the remains belong to the woman in the videos. According to a charging document, the memory card contained 39 images and 12 videos and was titled "homicide at midtown Marriott." (📸: Loren Holmes/AP)

Lev Parnas (left) and Igor Fruman (right), two key subjects in House Democrats' impeachment inquiry, were charged with conspiring to get around federal laws that prohibit foreign nationals from contributing to US campaigns, according to an indictment. The indictment does not name the candidates and political committees that allegedly received illegal contributions from Parnas and Fruman. Tap the link in the bio to read more on the story. (📸: Alexandria Sheriff's Office)

Apple removed the app, HKmap.live, days after the company was criticized in Chinese state media for aiding “rioters” in Hong Kong. In a statement released by Apple, they said they verified with the Hong Kong Cybersecurity and Technology Crime Bureau that the app had been used to “ambush police” and by criminals to “victimize residents.” However, the developers of the app tweeted that it “never solicits, promotes, or encourages criminal activity.” (📸: Chris McGrath/Getty Images)

About 2.4 million California residents could go up to a week without electricity as the state's largest utility company,  Pacific Gas and Electric (PG&E), shuts down power to nearly 800,000 homes and businesses in parts of the state to prevent its faulty power lines from starting wildfires. PG&E began shutting off power at midnight Wednesday with plans to roll out the shutdown in phases, leaving many scrambling for supplies and gas. The shutdown is unprecedented in scale, but largely seen as the new normal in preventing wildfires. (📸: AP)

Jamil said she only learned about George W. Bush on Wednesday after initially defending TV host Ellen DeGeneres for hanging out with the former US president. However, given Jamil's age and the global implications of the Bush presidency, people were suspicious about her claims. Old tweets then resurfaced from Jamil in which she did appear aware of Bush and the chaos in Iraq. Tap the link in our bio for more. (📸: Craig Barritt/Getty Images)

In a letter sent to Variety via his attorney, Lauer admitted to having an extramarital affair with Brooke Nevils, his colleague at the time, in his hotel room, adding "each act was mutual and completely consensual." But Nevils' allegation, which is detailed in journalist Ronan Farrow's newest book, Catch and Kill, tells a completely different story. In his letter, Lauer called Nevils' claim "a dangerous and defamatory new allegation.” (📸: Slaven Vlasic/Getty Images)

CORRECTION: An earlier version of this post misspelled Matt Lauer’s last name.

Blizzard announced that Chung Ng Wai, known by his screen name Blitzchung, had broken Hearthstone Grandmasters Official Competition Rules after he voiced his support for Hong Kong protesters. As a result, his prize money was rescinded and he was suspended from competitive play. Now, people who play Blizzard games have started a boycott, saying it was a cowardly act of censorship in favor of the Chinese government. Tap the link in our bio to read more. (📸: Twitter: InvenGlobal)

John Goodenough, of the University of Texas at Austin, Stanley Whittingham of Binghamton University, State University of New York, and Akira Yoshino of the Asahi Kasei Corporation in Japan were announced as the winners by the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences. The rechargeable lithium-ion battery technology they developed powers a variety of modern electronics such as smartphones, laptops, and medical devices. Goodenough, 97, is also the oldest person to ever win a Nobel prize, according to the secretary general of the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences. Read more at the link in our bio. (📸: Niklas Elmedhed/Nobel Media/Via Twitter: @NobelPrize)

The next star of The Bachelor, Peter Weber, was reportedly hospitalized and received 22 stitches as a result of the head injury he sustained while filming. “He got a cut on his head, he did get stitches, but he’s 100% OK and production is already back underway,” show host Chris Harrison said in a statement. “He’s still the dashing, handsome pilot we’ve all dreamed of.” 🌹(📸: @pilot_pete)

The shooting death of 28-year-old Joshua Brown sparked outcry among people who believed he was murdered for participating in Guyger's contentious murder trial. However, police say Brown got into a physical altercation with one of three men who came to his apartment to buy drugs. During the incident, Brown allegedly opened fire on one of the men and was then shot twice in his lower body. Tap the link in bio for more on this story. (📸: Instagram)

Aela Mansmann said she'd gotten "pretty fed up" with the amount of sexual assault and harassment her classmates were facing, apparently without consequences for the perpetrators. So she and a friend put up that sticky note. Soon after, many more students posted similar notes in the bathroom speaking about their stories of sexual violence at the hands of classmates. "It was really addressing the general culture of our school, and keeping in mind several specific cases," Mansmann said. Tap the link in bio to find out more about the story. (📸: Aela Mansmann)

Deandre Somerville was sent to jail for 10 days because he'd slept through jury duty in August, court records show. He had no criminal record before Circuit Civil Judge John Kastrenakes convicted him of direct criminal contempt last month. Now, Somerville's record has been cleared entirely, according to a Monday court filing obtained by BuzzFeed News. In the court order, Kastrenakes rescinded the conviction and said Somerville had been "totally rehabilitated." (📸: Brynn Anderson/AP)

James Peebles of Princeton University was awarded the prize for cosmological discoveries, and Michel Mayor and Didier Queloz of Switzerland's University of Geneva were honored for the 1995 discovery of the planet 51 Pegasi b, according to the announcement from the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences in Stockholm. The award winners will split the prize of 9 million Swedish kronor, about $908,000, and will receive gold medals from the King of Sweden in a Dec. 10 ceremony. Read more at the link in our bio. (📸: Niklas Elmehed/Nobel Media)

Selena Gomez said she wanted her Netflix documentary Living Undocumented to give undocumented people a voice. The pop star served as an executive producer on the six-part series which follows eight undocumented families across the US under the Trump administration. Tap the link in our bio to watch a new behind the scenes video provided exclusively to BuzzFeed News. (📷: Netflix)

According to a police report, the woman was asked to show her boarding pass when she was found to be sitting in another passenger's seat. Several Delta employees tried to get her to leave the seat, but she wouldn't budge and claimed she threw out her boarding pass. The woman also reportedly showed a selfie when asked for an official ID. She was removed from the flight and all passengers were screened again, delaying the flight for nearly three hours. It’s unclear how the woman managed to get on the plane and a TSA spokesperson told BuzzFeed News the woman had gone through TSA screening. Police are now investigating the incident with help from the FBI. (📸: Paul J. Richards / Getty Images)

No longer will you cringe while seeing your friends' or coworkers' thirsty late-night likes. Instagram’s “following” tab — a feed that shows the likes, comments, and follows of your friends — is going away. However, few people would notice that it’s gone as the company suspected “many users didn't know it existed,” Vishal Shah, Instagram’s head of product, told BuzzFeed News. (📸: Instagram)

William Kaelin of the Dana-Farber Cancer Institute at Harvard University, Sir Peter Ratcliffe of Oxford University, and Gregg Semenza of Johns Hopkins University were jointly awarded the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for their discoveries. Their research has clinical applications in treating anemia, as well as potentially finding new ways to thwart the growth of tumors in cancer. Read more on this story at the link in our bio. (📸:Niklas Elmedhed/Nobel Media)

CORRECTION: A previous version of this caption misspelled William Kaelin’s name.

US District Judge Victor Marrero dismissed Trump's lawsuit challenging a grand jury subpoena issued by New York District Attorney Cyrus Vance. Marrero wrote that Trump's argument for complete presidential immunity from a criminal investigation was "repugnant to the nation's governmental structure and constitutional value." Trump's lawyers immediately appealed after his decision. (📸: Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images)

The government’s use of a colonial-era law was designed to keep people off the streets, but it had the opposite effect as mass protests in their 18th week once again degenerated into violence. “We believe that the new law will create a deterrent effect against masked violent protesters and rioters,” Chief Executive Carrie Lam said as she announced the ban on Friday. The four months of unrest in Hong Kong started over an unpopular bill that would have allowed extraditions to China. Lam has since said she plans to scrap it. But in renewed protests over the weekend, Hong Kongers made clear that they would not accept this ban on masks either. (📸: Anthony Kwan/ Laurel Chor/ Willie Siau/ SOPA Images /LightRocket via Getty Images)

Joshua Brown was shot and killed by an unknown assailant two days after a Dallas County jury sentenced Amber Guyger to 10 years in prison, according to Lee Merritt, a civil rights attorney who represented the Jean family. Brown was shot in the back and thigh around 10:30 p.m. Friday night and witnesses said they heard gunfire and saw a silver car speed out of a parking lot, the Dallas News reported, citing a government official. Merritt said that Brown "lived in constant fear that he could be the next victim of gun violence." (📸: Tom Fox/AP)

The second whistleblower is said to have direct information of President Trump's dealings with Ukraine that have become the center of the impeachment inquiry, according to their lawyer. The news comes after text messages released Thursday by House Democrats revealed top US diplomats to Ukraine discussed that aid to the country — in the form of either military funding or the president's support — would be withheld until it did the bidding of the president's personal political interests. (📸: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds/Getty Images)

Trump’s order takes effect Nov. 3 and applies to those who apply for immigrant visas abroad and do not have health insurance set up within a month after their entry or the financial means to pay for medical costs. The move appears to be the latest front in the administration’s extensive efforts to restrict immigration to the US. Read the full story through the link in our bio. (📸: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds / Getty Images)

Soon after Emily Clow applied for the job, the company took a bikini photo from her Instagram account and posted it to their story, warning other applicants to not "share your social media accounts with a potential employer if this is the kind of content on it." Clow tweeted about the experience, saying she felt "objectified." Since the tweet, thousands of people have come to her support, with some offering to help Clow find a job. Read the full story through the link in our bio. (📸: Emily Clow)

Marcel McClinton helped organize the March for Our Lives Houston rally when he was 16. Two years later, he’s the first teen from the movement to run for government office. “What shaped my politics was the Parkland shooting,” said McClinton. “It was watching people my age on TV after the most traumatic experience of their life demanding fucking change.” Days after McClinton's interview with us, he was nearly stabbed while trying to stop a knife-wielding thief. Read more about McClinton through the link in our bio. (📸: Annie Mulligan for BuzzFeed News)

Six elephants fell to their deaths after trying to save each other from a waterfall in Thailand. The incident occurred at Khao Yai National Park after a baby elephant slipped over a cliff and into the waterfall. Two other elephants found standing on a nearby cliff were rescued Saturday afternoon, Thai officials said. Tap the link in our bio to read more details, and follow @world for more stories from around the 🌎 (📸: Panupong Changchai/ Getty Images/Thailand Department of National Parks)

The FDA has warned people not to use any vaping products with THC after 18 deaths and more than 1,000 vaping-related injuries have been reported across the United States. Although officials said the exact cause behind the injuries has not been determined, most of the people who have suddenly fallen sick have reported using vaping products that contained THC. Click our link in bio to read more. (📸: AP)

Ortiz-Magro allegedly slapped and punched his on-again, off-again girlfriend Jen Harley before chasing her with a knife, TMZ reported. He was reportedly holding their 18-month-old daughter during the chase. After Harley fled, Ortiz-Magro allegedly locked himself and the infant in the Airbnb until police came and broke the door down. He was tased and arrested on suspicion of domestic violence, Los Angeles police confirmed. His bail was set at $100,000. (📷: Jamie McCarthy/Getty)

Bruley's owner Michelle Silva, who serves as a producer on the show, said the pup died from a heart attack. "In the last year of his life, he found fame! Over the course of 16 episodes of @queereye, in just a few moments on screen, you guys all got a glimpse of the Bru I knew and loved,” she wrote in an Instagram tribute. Rest in peace, Bruley 🐶💔 (📷: @queereye)

In a recent interview on @jimmykimmellive, Iger said that it was clear from fan reaction at D23 that fans "wanted Tom back as Spider-Man" and that, after the event, Holland reached out to Disney for Iger’s contact details. Iger said that it was "clear that he cared so much" about the situation and wanted to get it resolved. Following the phone call with Holland, Iger reached out to people at Disney Studios before contacting the head of Sony Pictures to rehash a deal 🎬🕸👏 (📷: Chung Sung-jun / Getty Images)

The case pertains to a Louisiana law passed in 2014 that requires abortion clinics to have hospital admitting privileges. The ruling could also have larger implications for abortion rights, potentially undermining the definition of an “undue burden,” a benchmark used to determine whether or not a law restricting abortion is unconstitutional under Roe v. Wade. Read more about this story through the link in our bio. (📸: Saul Loeb/Getty Images)

When Elon Musk called a British cave rescuer who insulted him a “pedo guy,” the billionaire had no evidence to back his claims – so Musk later hired a private investigator – and convicted felon – to dig up dirt. BuzzFeed News found that the self-proclaimed private investigator, James Howard-Higgins, was a convicted felon who stole money from his business partners and was sentenced to three years in prison for fraud. Musk hired Higgins-Howard after he offered to “dig deep” into Vernon Unsworth, a Brit who played a key role in the rescue of a boys soccer team from a Thailand cave in July 2018. Click our link in bio to read more. (📸: Getty/Bournemouth CID)

Attorney General Bill Barr, along with officials from the United Kingdom and Australia, are asking the company to delay plans until it can guarantee the added privacy does not reduce public safety. The letter raises concerns that Facebook’s plan to build end-to-end encryption into its messaging apps will prevent law enforcement agencies from finding illegal activity conducted through Facebook, including child sexual exploitation, terrorism, and election meddling. Read the letter in full at the link in our bio. (📸: Alex Wong/Getty Images)

Threads is a new standalone photo-based messaging app where you can send photos to your Close Friends list. If someone you send a photo to through Threads doesn't have the app or hasn't added you back as a Close Friend, it will just get sent to their regular Instagram DMs. You can also set a status message, a feature that does not exist on regular Instagram DMs. Tap the link in our bio to read more. (📸: Instagram)

A video shared by President Trump edited the song's music video to show an old photo of former vice president Joe Biden on a golf course with his son Hunter, and his son's longtime business associate.  A Twitter spokesperson told BuzzFeed News via email, "Per our copyright policy, we respond to valid copyright complaints sent to us by a copyright owner or their authorized representatives." (📸: Twitter/Via Twitter: @ realDonaldTrump)

A fierce battle over the regulation of the internet was riddled with millions of fake comments. Our reporting reveals new details about the operatives who helped skew that FCC debate and other democratic proceedings across America. Read this investigation through the link in our bio. (📸: John J. Custer for BuzzFeed News)

The younger brother of Botham Jean, who was shot and killed by Amber Guyger in his own apartment, hugged and offered his forgiveness to the former Dallas police officer after a jury sentenced her to 10 years in prison. “If you truly are sorry — I know I can speak for myself — I forgive you," Brandt Jean said in court. "I love you as a person and I don't wish anything bad on you." He then walked over to Guyger and embraced her as she cried in his arms. (📷: Tom Fox / The Dallas Morning News via AP)

Wednesday marks one year since Washington Post columnist Jamal Khashoggi was killed inside Saudi Arabia’s consulate in Istanbul. Saudi agents allegedly murdered and dismembered Khashoggi during his visit to collect marriage paperwork. His remains have never been located. At a vigil for Khashoggi outside the former consulate, Khashoggi’s fiance embraced Amazon founder Jeff Bezos, who owns the Washington Post. Agnés Callamard, a UN human rights investigator, encouraged journalists to “persist, insist, expose — for Jamal and the other Jamals around the world,” the Washington Post reported. Follow @world for more news from around the 🌍 (📸: Getty, Reuters)

The jury, which found Guyger guilty of murder Tuesday, unanimously decided the sentence after listening to Jean and Guyger’s families, friends, and coworkers over two days of emotional testimony. “My life has not been the same,” his mother told the jurors. “It’s just been like a roller coaster. I cannot sleep, I cannot eat.” While judges usually determine sentences for defendants, Texas allows juries to do so. Guyger was facing between five to 99 years in prison after the jury found her guilty of murder. (📷: Dallas County Sheriff's Department via AP/ Facebook)

In the draft regulation obtained by BuzzFeed News, administration officials cite the DNA Fingerprint Act of 2005, which allows federal agencies to collect DNA from individuals in their custody, including those who are not American. But previous regulations exempted agencies under the Department of Homeland Security — including CBP and ICE — in certain circumstances. The Trump administration is arguing that the exemption is no longer necessary and that DNA collection would aid border officials in better assessing the individuals who cross into the US without authorization. To read more, tap the link in our bio. (📸: Lm Otero/Associated Press)

Sanders’ stent procedure comes after months of campaigning. According to his aides, his presidential campaign events have been canceled "until further notice.” A Sanders aide also told BuzzFeed News the campaign would postpone a planned $1.3 million ad buy in Iowa that was due to begin Thursday. (📸: Scott Eisen/Getty Images)

Khyler Edman’s body was found inside his home after police noticed it had been broken into while apprehending a suspicious man wandering through the neighborhood acting erratically. His little sister was unharmed. “It appears that the suspect had broken into this residence, a violent encounter ensued where we believe that the teenager was trying to protect the home and protect their younger sibling,” the sheriff said. Edman’s family, friends, and members of his community gathered Sunday to honor Edman with a candlelight vigil. “Khyler will always hold the title of an awesome big brother to his siblings, especially his sister. He was kind, caring, loving, and will be missed by many,” his family wrote in their tribute. (📸: GoFundMe/ Valerie’s House)

Ukraine believed $391 million in military aid was already on its way to Kyiv when President Trump and President Zelensky spoke, three officials told BuzzFeed News. They only found out from a “letter sent to us from our Washington Embassy” that provided no explanation for the move, the acting deputy foreign minister at the time of the call said. Read more at the link in our bio. (📸: Saul Loeb/AFP/Getty Images)

A federal judge has blocked a Georgia law, which banned abortion after about 6 weeks of pregnancy and defined a fetus as a “natural person.” The law is one of a slew of highly restrictive abortion laws passed in states with conservative legislatures over the summer, all of which are now the subject of legal battles. Tap the link in bio to find out more details on the case. (📸: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds / Getty Images)

Reporter Alice Martinelli handed Secretary Pompeo a hunk of Parmesan during a press conference as an apparent appeal against Trump's administration putting tariffs on the famed Italian cheese. "Take it to Mr. Trump, please, and tell him that we make it from the heart. We make it from the heart!" Martinelli said before being led away. Up to $8 billion in tariffs on European goods are reportedly on the table after a recent World Trade Organization ruling regarding subsidies to Airbus 🧀 (📸: Alberto Pizzoli / Getty Images)

Instagram uses artificial intelligence and machine learning to flag and remove child nudity and images of exploitation. That means it could be a robot, not a person, that decided the photos had to go. Nonetheless, mothers like Tori Spooner, whose account was removed after posting her 4-year-old son on the beach, want to see changes from the company. "Find a solution so we’re allowed to post our boys with long hair," Spooner said. "Have somebody manually view them if they get flagged." (📸: @parkersavesthesea, @turk3ys_, @livemomlife, @ekgavin)

Amber Guyger was found guilty of murder for fatally shooting 26-year-old Botham Jean in his own apartment after saying she mistook it for her own. Prosecutors said it was unreasonable for a trained, five-year veteran of the police to enter the wrong apartment and shoot an unarmed man — who was not a threat to anyone — in the chest. “Self-defense is an option of last resort,” Dallas County prosecutor Jason Hermus said, mocking Guyger’s claims that she shot Jean in self defense. “She killed him unreasonably and unjustifiably.” (📸: Tom Fox/AP)

A video circulating online by pro-democracy supporters shows the protester being shot at point blank range during violent clashes with riot police. The shooting is the first such incident since mass demonstrations began in the city in June. For more on this story, and video from the demonstrations, visit the link in our profile. (📸: Chris McGrath/Getty Images)

Alongside the Season 4 renewal, the Duffer Brothers also inked a multiyear overall pact with Netflix, according to the Hollywood Reporter. “We’re thrilled to expand our relationship with them to bring their vivid imaginations to other film and series projects our members will love,” Netflix's chief content officer said. Tap the link in our bio to watch the short teaser 🎬👀 (📷: Netflix)

Forever 21 said it's filing for Chapter 11 bankruptcy due to low sales, online competition, and changing consumer tastes. It will close up to 178 stores in the United States, as well as ceasing brick-and-mortar operations in 40 countries. (📸: Drew Angerer/Getty Images)

The preliminary injunction blocks the Department of Homeland Security’s plans to expand quick deportations to those who cannot prove they have been in the country continuously for two years. The process would have allowed immigration officers to arrest and deport undocumented immigrants without a hearing in front of a judge. The order takes effect immediately and DHS won't be allowed to enforce the policy as the appeals process moves forward. (📸: Getty Images)

Thomas Gilbert Jr. shot his 70-year-old father in the head and staged the shooting to apparently look like a suicide after his parents “incrementally reduced” his allowance from $1,000 a week to $300 in January 2015, prosecutors said. Gilbert Jr.'s mother and his lawyer argued he was insane at the time of the shooting and should be institutionalized. "We are definitely going to appeal," Gilbert Jr.'s lawyer told BuzzFeed News. (📸: Getty Images/AP)
Photographer Jim Marshall has spent his career capturing iconic musicians like Jimi Hendrix, Janis Joplin, and Bob Dylan. A new book showcases his storied career 🎶 🎸 (📸: Jim Marshall)

A friend of 16-year-old Channing Smith told BuzzFeed News that teens had bullied him before the social media attack. Smith's family members say county prosecutors have not adequately investigated his death, and school leaders have also been criticized for not holding an assembly to discuss his death and condemn bullying. Read more about this story through the link in our bio. (📸: Joshua Smith)

Landmark Theaters is banning customers from wearing masks or costumes to Joker screenings amid concerns that the Batman villain origin story may be a target for violence by so-called incels. "I want customers to be comfortable in their surroundings," Landmark’s CEO told the Hollywood Reporter. Earlier this week, AMC reminded patrons that it banned masks, face painting, or face-coverings since 2012 following the deadly mass shooting in Aurora, Colorado. Families of the Aurora victims have been calling on Warner Bros. to take action against gun violence. Read the full story through the link in our bio. (📷: Warner Bros)

Baloch, 26, was drugged and strangled in July 2016. Her brother, Waseem Azeem Baloch, admitted to her murder at a press conference, saying Baloch had brought “dishonor to the family name.” Baloch was a frequently provocative and divisive figure in Pakistan because of what she posted on social media. These posts ranged from the mundane — complaining of a headache — to the risqué — offering to strip for the Pakistani cricket team, but her singular refusal to be shamed by Pakistani society for what she wore, said, or did made her both iconic and reviled. Follow @world for more stories from around the 🌎 (📸: Ss Mirza/AFP/Getty)

Sony and Disney announced that the Spider-Man character would be staying in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. The two will jointly produce a third film in the Spider-Man Homecoming series starring Tom Holland, and Spidey will appear in a future Marvel Studios film. Read more through the link in our bio (📸: Marvel Studios)

The prince walked along the same street in Angola where his mother brought global attention to the landmine crisis 22 years ago. Harry said visiting the iconic location left him "humbled." Read more about this story through the link in our bio. (📸: John Stillwell/Press Association and Dominic Lipinski/Getty Images)

According to Variety, the Amazon Studios deal involves Waller-Bridge creating new TV shows and content for the streaming site, which will exclusively premiere on Amazon Prime Video. “I’m insanely excited to be continuing my relationship with Amazon,” Waller-Bridge said. “Working with the team on Fleabag was the creative partnership dreams are made of. It really feels like home. I can’t wait to get going!” 🎬💰 (📷: AFP/Getty Images/Amazon)

The US intends to slash the number of refugees allowed into the country in the next fiscal year to 18,000, the fewest since the government began its refugee program in 1980, the State Department announced. The drastic cut is the latest in a series of moves by the Trump administration that have decimated the country’s refugee program designed to admit those fleeing dangerous conditions. Last year, the administration capped the number of refugees at 30,000, far fewer than the 110,000 allowed in the final year of the Obama administration. (📷: AFP/Getty Images)
It’s the first time the two performers will take the stage together. Super Bowl LIV will take place on Feb. 2 in Miami 🏈🔥 (📷: @pepsi)

United States Citizenship and Immigration Services officials are looking to insert more references to the term ‘alien' into its policy manual — which has 800 references to ‘foreign national’ — to describe those who are not citizens of the US. While the term ‘alien’ is within US code and is regularly referenced in the immigration system and in court rulings the word has, in recent years, been wiped from the California Labor Code and the Library of Congress after advocate efforts. (📸: Getty)

The Federal Trade Commission is alleging that Match Group sent emails to nonsubscribers about accounts that liked or favorited their account, messaged them on the website, or emailed them to persuade people to pay for a subscription — even though those accounts had been flagged as fraudulent. As a result, many of those subscribers wound up interacting with a scammer, thereby exposing them to the risk of fraud. Users were also subject to “deceptive” cancellation policies, according to the FTC. Match.com said that it intends to “vigorously defend ourselves against these claims in court.” (📸: Match.com)

White House officials said President Donald Trump "abused his office for personal gain" by asking the president of Ukraine, Volodymyr Zelensky, to investigate Joe Biden ahead of the 2020 election, leaving them "deeply disturbed," according to the complaint. The complaint also alleges that after the phone call between Trump and Zelensky, senior White House officials were directed to "lock down" records of the call by White House lawyers. Read more on this story at the link in our bio. (📸: Reuters)

The world's oceans are warming at an alarming rate, melting glaciers, depleting fish populations, supercharging tropical cyclones, and threatening the livelihoods of millions of people who live in coastal areas and the Arctic, according to a new report from the United Nations' body in charge of monitoring climate change 🌎 (📸: Getty Images)

The unnamed student's body was reportedly discovered after students complained of a mysterious stench in the dorm. The young man's father had contacted the police when he could not get in touch with his son. The cause of death is still being investigated. It is not yet clear how the student's death could have gone unnoticed for so long. Tap the link in bio for more on the investigation. (📸: AP)

Four-month-old Archie joined his parents, the Duke and Duchess of Sussex, as they visited Archbishop Desmond Tutu and his daughter, Thandeka. In a personal message on Instagram, the duke and duchess wrote: “Thank you Archbishop Tutu for your incredibly warm hospitality, Archie loved meeting you!” The royal couple were visiting the Desmond & Leah Tutu Legacy Foundation, which aims to raise global awareness of the critical issues affecting the world 👑🇿🇦(📸: Press Association Images)

Laura Dern confirmed that she, along with Sam Neill and Jeff Goldblum, will be starring in “major roles” for the third installment of the Jurassic World series, marking the first time all three actors have been onscreen together since the first film was made. According to Deadline, production on the film begins next year 🎥🦖 (📸: Getty Images)

Pelosi’s announcement came nearly two and a half years after the first Democrat in Congress called for impeachment proceedings against Trump. Needless to say, people pounced on it on social media. (📸: Twitter)

Trump told Ukraine's president it would "be great" if he investigated Joe Biden and asked for help attacking the Mueller investigation.

Swipe 👈 to read about five moments from the phone call that could fuel the impeachment investigation. (📸: Getty Images)

Juul's announcement comes amid the influx of vaping-related lung illnesses and deaths across the US. The company also will end its "Make The Switch" campaign, which portrays e-cigarettes as a safer alternative to traditional cigarettes. CEO, Kevin Burns, also stepped down and was replaced by K.C. Crosthwaite, an executive at tobacco giant Altria. (📸: Getty Images)

Devin Sloane was sentenced to four months in prison for paying $250,000 to get his son into the University of Southern California as a fake water polo player. He is the second parent to be sentenced for his role in the college admissions scandal after actor Felicity Huffman's sentencing earlier this month. Sloane was also ordered to pay a $95,000 fine and perform 500 hours of community service. (📸: AP, Getty)

In an open letter to the Warner Bros. CEO, the families wrote it gave them "pause" when the when they learned that the titular character would be given "a sympathetic origin story." The letter also requested that the studio sever ties with political candidates who receive funds from the National Rifle Association and vote against gun reform. Read more on the story at the link in our bio. (📸: Warner Bros.)

Thunberg, who has Asperger's syndrome, delivered a powerful speech at the United Nations and it was the subject of a segment on Fox News featuring reaction from conservative writer Michael Knowles. The network added it has “no plans" for Knowles to appear as a guest on future shows. (📸: Fox News/Getty Images)

Officer Dennis Turner has been fired after he arrested two 6-year-old students at their school on suspicion of misdemeanor battery charges, prompting outcry and an internal investigation. Orlando Police Chief Orlando Rolón said Monday that the incident made him “sick to [his] stomach,” especially when he found out the children had been put in the back of a squad car. “It was clear today when I came into work that there was no other remedy than to terminate this officer,” Rolón said. (📸: WFTV)

“The next time a woman, especially a woman of color, because she stands to make 52 cents on the dollar compared to her white male counterpart, tells you what she needs in order to do her job, listen to her, believe her, because one day she might stand in front of you and say thank you for allowing her to succeed because of her workplace environment and not in spite of it,” Williams said. Tap the link in bio to read more of her speech 🏆 (📸: Getty Images)

Nintendo started as a small Japanese trading card company in 1889 and would pivot into electronic entertainment nearly 100 years later, growing into the quintessential video game company we know today 🎮 (📸: Getty Images, AP, Eriko Sugita, Public Domain)

Ayesha Tan-Jones held up their hands on the runway during Milan Fashion Week to display a message that read: “Mental health is not fashion.” “As an artist and model who has experienced my own struggles with mental health, as well as family members and loved ones who have been affected by depression, anxiety, bipolar and schizophrenia, it is hurtful and insensitive for a major fashion house such as Gucci to use this imagery as a concept for a fleeting fashion moment,” Tan-Jones wrote in an Instagram post about the protest. (📸: Getty Images)

NASA’s decision comes after the largest asteroid to come so close to earth in a century passed in July — only being detected just 24 hours before. The spacecraft, slated to be ready by 2025 if it gets $500 to $600 million of funding from Congress, should be able to detect 90% of all threatening space rocks aimed at Earth. "We are finally going to rely on knowledge, rather than luck, as our plan for dealing with hazardous asteroids," MIT planetary scientist Richard Binzel told BuzzFeed News. Tap the link in our bio to read more. (📸: NASA/JPL-Caltech; BuzzFeed News; Wikimedia Commons)

Although Thomas Lennon didn’t explicitly say Huffman’s name, there aren’t a lot of actors who have been deeply involved in college admission scandals. The actor, who received an Emmy in 2005 for her role in Desperate Housewives, was recently sentenced to 14 days in prison. According to Elizabeth Wagmeister, a journalist who was at the ceremony, the audience didn’t love the joke — but for some of those watching from home, the joke was hilarious 👀 (📸: Getty Images)

Game of Thrones took home Outstanding Drama Series, while Fleabag was crowned Outstanding Comedy Series and picked up awards for writing, directing and acting as well. Tap the link in our bio to see all of the night's winners. (📷: Amazon/HBO)
In honor of tonight’s ceremony, take a look back at some of the most memorable moments from Emmy Award history 🏆🎬 (📷: WireImage/ Getty Images/ Fotos International)

Kenesha Antoine said that she was in an underwater room in the Manta Resort when her boyfriend, Steven Weber, tapped on the glass with a message — and a ring. Antoine said Weber didn't make it out of the water, and he never got to hear her say yes to his proposal. The resort described what happened to Weber as a tragic accident. (📸: Facebook)

Officer Dennis Turner was on duty as a school resource officer when he arrested two students, a 6-year-old and an 8-year-old, on misdemeanor charges in separate incidents in Florida. Meralyn Kirkland, 6-year-old Kaia Rolle's grandmother, was told her granddaughter had been arrested on a battery charge and taken away in a police car after throwing a tantrum at Lucious and Emma Nixon Academy, the Orlando charter school she attends as a first grader. Kirkland said her granddaughter was then handcuffed, fingerprinted, and even had mug shots taken. (📸: WKMG News/ YouTube)

Despite all the viral hype online, there was no storming of the highly secretive Area 51 facility on Friday. And all the supposed alien life forms that hundreds of thousands of people on social media vowed to free remained secret. Tap the link in our bio for more details on the meet up 👽(📸: Mikayla Whitmore/ Salvador Hernandez)

Furious anti-vax parents in New York this week are posting memes and images of sad children — and have shown up in person to protest the governor — because a new law prohibiting unvaccinated children from attending school went into effect. Tap the link in bio to find out more about the response to the new law. (📸: Getty Images)

Abderraoof Alkhawaldeh and Issam Abdallah have filed a complaint with the US Department of Transportation after their flight from Birmingham, Alabama, to Dallas was cancelled “due to concerns raised by a crew member and a passenger.” “It was the most horrible, humiliating day of my life,” Abdallah said. An airline spokesperson told BuzzFeed News that the company is “conducting a thorough investigation of this matter.” (📸: YouTube, Getty)
Climate strikes are happening all around the world today. Here are the best signs. For more stories from around the globe, follow @world 🌍 (📷: Getty Images)

Carter, who is currently serving a 15-month sentence, will remain in prison after her parole was denied. The parole board said it was "troubled" that Carter not only encouraged her boyfriend, Conrad Roy, to kill himself, but also "actively prevented others in intervening in his suicide." In July, Carter's lawyers appealed to the Supreme Court to review her case, arguing that her conviction for urging 18-year-old Roy to kill himself “based on her words alone” violated her First Amendment right to free speech. (📸: Bristol County Sheriff's Office/Court evidence)

A 9-year-old girl in Missouri came up with a sharp idea for eating cheese in class: a lip balm tube. The girl's mother, Valerie Schremp Hahn, posted a photo of her daughter's genius creation to Twitter, garnering praise for the fourth-grader who told BuzzFeed News she got the idea from YouTube. The video was a compilation of back-to-school pranks on sneaking food into class from Troom Troom, and used an empty glue stick tube. (📸: Valerie Schremp Hahn)

Rapper Tekashi 69 named fellow rapper Jim Jones as a member of the Nine Trey Gangsta Bloods gang during his trial. He also named Cardi B, though she has publicly talked about her affiliation with the gang before. Tekashi, whose birth name is Daniel Hernandez, is on trial for racketeering, drug trafficking, and other crimes. Details of his plea deal revealed he would be given a lighter sentence if he were to cooperate with authorities. Click our link in bio for more. (📷: Getty Images)

The plane was traveling from Atlanta to Fort Lauderdale and made an emergency landing in Tampa after plunging from nearly 39,000 to 10,000 feet in less than 7 minutes. "It was like a roller coaster as we were going down," said Brandon Tomlinson, who was on the flight with his 1-year-old son and his mother. The descent was a precautionary measure taken due to a "possible issue with the aircraft depressurization," according to a Delta Airlines spokesperson. (📸: Brandon Tomlinson)

The detention center in Homestead, FL has not held a child since Aug. 3 and costs $720,000 a day to keep the facility open. Jonathan Hayes, director of the Office of Refugee Resettlement, said that it would take 90 to 120 days to reactivate the facility in the event that it was needed. (📸: AP)

A video from the early 1990s of Trudeau in blackface raising his hands in the air and sticking his tongue out was published Thursday by Canadian TV station Global News. Less than a day earlier, Trudeau acknowledged photos of him wearing brownface at a party in 2001 and admitted he wore offensive makeup during a high school talent show. (📸: AP)

The policy will impact Facebook content as well. Instagram's public policy manager, Emma Collins, said that the changes were aimed at dealing with the growing industry of influencer marketing on the platform. "We want Instagram to be a positive place for everyone that uses it and this policy is part of our ongoing work to reduce the pressure that people can sometimes feel as a result of social media," Collins said. The company plans to introduce new tools in the coming weeks that will allow users to report a post if they believe it violates the new policy 📲❌ (📷: @kimkardashian)

Thirteen other states follow California's clean car regulations, which are stricter than federal standards. The decision is expected to be challenged in court, which one state official called "the fight of a lifetime." Read more at the link in our bio. (📸: Getty Images)

After a months-long campaign to make Mike Johnson the next star of The Bachelor, ABC announced it had selected Peter Weber instead. Johnson became a fan favorite early on in the season and support for him to become the next Bachelor quickly grew. However, many fans were disappointed that ABC was choosing not to pick a black man, despite the campaign and them never having a black Bachelor. (📸: @bachelorabc/Twitter)

India has banned the production, sale, import, and advertising of vaping products, like Juul, as part of an initiative to stop the “impact of e-cigarettes on the youth.” People will be jailed for up to three years and fined up to $7,000 if caught selling them. Existing users will not face penalties. (📸: Getty Images)

Buck was arrested on drug charges and battery, following years of controversy and the deaths of two black men inside his California home, and the overdose of a third man, who survived. Buck is also facing charges of administering methamphetamine and maintaining a drug house in connection with the overdose. (📸: Getty Images)

Justin and Angela Johnson, who run Timberview Helicopters in Florida, have been conducting volunteer search and rescue missions and supply runs to parts of the Bahamas decimated by Hurricane Dorian. When they recently landed in a devastated part of the Abaco Islands, about 30 to 40 people began climbing out of crushed cars, crumpled homes, and debris. "It was unbelievable," Angela Johnson said. "No one knew they were there this entire time.” The next day, a nonprofit team arrived with boxes of food, water, baby supplies and other necessities for the survivors. (📸: Facebook)

The Justice Department’s regulation draft proposes that immigrants pay $975 to request an appeal of an immigration judge’s ruling, and $895 to request a case be reopened or reconsidered.
