The current fee to apply is $110. The move could shift how and whether immigrants appeal and will be likely challenged by advocates. (📸: Getty)

The musical adaptation of the film will debut at Chicago’s James M. Nederlander Theatre on July 14, 2020 and will run its pre-Broadway engagement from mid-July to August 2020. Tony winner Anna D. Shaporio will helm as the director, Paul Rudinick is producing the book, Shaina Taub is responsible for lyrics, and Grammy award-winning singer Elton John has been tapped to create the music. Dates or casting news for a Broadway run have not been announced 🎬🎭 (📷: Fox 2000 Pictures)

Millennials carry an average of $27,900 in debt, not including mortgages and Gen Z, the oldest of whom are now 22 years old, have an average debt of $14,700 according to new data released by Northwestern Mutual. Millennials' main source of debt is credit card bills, and Gen Z's is student loans. Read more at the link in our bio. (📸: Getty Images)

Weeks after announcing that he was nearing remission, Trebek revealed that he's going back on chemotherapy to treat his stage IV pancreatic cancer. The legendary gameshow host added that his treatments “worked very well the first time” and that doctors were "expecting good results again." (📸: Getty Images)

Michael Wayne Jones Jr. has been arrested for allegedly killing his wife Casei and their four young children, whose bodies were discovered after he was involved in a car crash. Jones told officers who responded to the accident that Casei’s body was in his van. He later led detectives to the remains of the four children. Jones has been charged with second-degree murder and more charges are likely to follow as the investigation continues, officials say. (📸: Marion County Sheriff's Office)

Rykard Jenkins, a fitness trainer who appeared on the second season of the British reality dating show, discovered that one of his photos was being used to advertise a "Trump 2020" hat. However, the president’s reelection team says the hat is not an official piece of campaign merchandise. "I couldn’t believe my photo had been used and altered to back a political campaign — especially one that is not of my own country,” Jenkins told BuzzFeed News. (📸: @rykardjenkins, conservativenews.co)

Mila, Speedy, Mama, Karl, and more than 165 other dogs and cats have been shipped to no-kill shelters in the states after surviving the Category 5 storm. Nearly 155 other animals died when the Humane Society they were being housed in flooded. Tap the link in our bio to find out more about their journey to safety 🐶🐈 (📸: Holly Pickett for @BuzzFeedNews, AP)

Gillis’ firing comes after off-color remarks he made on his podcast, Matt and Shane’s Secret Podcast, in 2018 were resurfaced by reporter Seth Simons. In Simons’ viral tweet, Gillis and cohost Matt McCusker are seen mocking Asian accents, and, at one point, Gillis uses a racial slur. In a statement after NBC’s announcement on Monday, Gillis was defiant, saying, “I was always a [Mad TV] guy anyway.” Gillis also made anti-gay comments and stereotyped Muslims on his show, Variety reported. Read more details at the link in our bio. (📸: SNL)
Tap the link in our bio for the detailed explainer on this week's rise in gas prices ⛽️

After the New York Times published new details about sexual misconduct allegations against Supreme Court Justice Brett Kavanaugh, Democrats, including presidential hopefuls Sen. Elizabeth Warren, Julián Castro, Beto O'Rourke, and Sen. Kamala Harris, have called for his impeachment. Kavanaugh has denied these sexual assault claims and Trump has stood by him tweeting that Kavanaugh should start “suing people for libel” or that “the Justice Department should come to his rescue.” Republicans disputed there was any reason to revisit Kavanaugh’s suitability to serve on the Supreme Court. (📸: Getty Images)

The solid gold toilet, created by Italian conceptual artist Maurizio Cattelan and titled “America,” was stolen from the Blenheim Palace in the UK. Because the toilet was a functional piece of plumbing as well as art, its removal caused flooding and “significant damage,” police said. Authorities have arrested a 66-year-old man in connection with the theft. Cattelan is known as a prankster in the art world, but he said that the theft was serious and he “wish[ed] it was a prank.” (📸: Getty Images)

Casey Viner was sentenced to 15 months in prison after pleading guilty to conspiring to make fake calls to Wichita police. The sentencing was a result of a 2017 “swatting” incident in which Viner was upset over a $1.50 bet in the video game with Shane Gaskill and wanted officers to respond to Gaskill’s home. Gaskill gave Viner the wrong address and police responded to the home of an unrelated man, Andrew Finch. Fearing he was armed, officers shot and killed him.  In addition to his sentence, Viner is restricted from playing games online for two years. (📸: Roxana Hegeman/AP)

CORRECTION: An earlier version of this post said Gaskill was sentenced to 20 years in prison. That is incorrect. Gaskill has made a deal with prosecutors for “deferred prosecution,” which could lead to his charges being dropped, the AP reported.

The department's inspector general is conducting an investigation into the hand-drawn Nazi symbol. "This display of hate and cowardice does not represent the dedicated hardworking men and women of the Department of Homeland Security," an agency spokesperson said. (📸: Reuters)
People from far and wide came to Brooklyn to participate in the Coney Island Beard and Mustache Competition, held at the site of the seaside resort's famous sideshow. (📸: B. A. Van Sise)

In 2018, Thunberg began to skip school every Friday to sit outside Sweden’s parliament to demand the country act on climate change. As the most visible spokesperson of the #FridaysForFuture movement, the Swedish teen has inspired thousands of students and young activists around the world to organize their own climate strikes and demand politicians and adults take action to help save the planet. Thunberg joined the group on Friday as part of a six-day visit to Washington ahead of the Global Climate Strike scheduled for September 20 🌎✊ (📷: AFP/Getty Images/AP)

Late Late Show host James Corden shut down Bill Maher’s take on fat-shaming after the fellow late-night host and comedian claimed we needed to bring it back in order to address obesity. “Some amount of shame is good,” Maher said. Corden wasn’t buying it, pointing out that fat-shaming only harms fat people and triggers depression and self-destructive behavior. Watch the full video at the link in our bio. (📷: @latelateshow)

The Desperate Housewives actor was also ordered to pay a fine of $30,000, and to serve one year of supervised release and 250 hours of community service. Huffman pleaded guilty in May to fraud charges for paying $15,000 to get her daughter’s SAT answers corrected. "I am deeply sorry to the students, parents, colleges, and universities who've been impacted by my actions. I am sorry to my daughter Sophia, and Georgia, and I am sorry to my husband Will. I have betrayed them,” Huffman said in tears. (📷: Getty Images)

Singer Sam Smith, who came out as nonbinary earlier this year, announced in a candid Twitter thread that their preferred gender pronouns are they/them. When they previously came out as non-binary, Smith said they would keep he/him pronouns. Their thoughts and feelings on the matter have since evolved. (📸: Jeff Spicer / Getty Images)

In the wake of the mass shooting in Beto’s hometown of El Paso — the city he also once represented in Congress — something has changed about the presidential candidate. In recent weeks, Beto has broken through the Democratic primary’s noise with expressions of raw, visceral, and expletive-laden anger over issues like gun violence and racism. And he has taken a stance that no other major Democratic presidential candidate has touched: calling for mandatory assault weapon buybacks. Read more on Beto’s campaign reboot at the link in our bio. (📷: Getty Images)
Zingers flew throughout tonight’s debate, and people were here for it 😂 (📸: Twitter)

Teens like Fabian Castillo are using social media to warn their peers about the life-threatening medical complications that come along with vaping. "I looked at myself and I saw the stress that I was putting my mother through and I just don’t want to see anybody go through that," Castillo told BuzzFeed News. "I want people to look at me and use me as an example and picture them in that situation." Tap the link in bio to read more on their stories. (📸: @salazar383412)

The fire that killed 34 people on a commercial dive boat off Santa Cruz Island started while all crew members were asleep, federal investigators said Thursday, confirming the lack of a "night watchman" whose job it is to look after the vessel overnight. Officials say initial examinations indicate the 33 passengers and a member of the crew died of smoke inhalation before being burned. Only the five crew members above deck were able to escape the flames. (📸: Reuters)

Bowen Yang, SNL staff writer and co-host of the Las Culturistas podcast, has been announced as one of three new cast members. Yang joins newcomers Chloe Fineman and Shane Gillis on the show’s upcoming 45th season, which premieres on Sept. 28 📺 (📸: Alex Schaefer, Phil Provencio, Stephanie Nelson)

Youtuber Ties Granzier (left) and Govert Charles Wilhelmus Jacob Sweep (right) from the Netherlands were about three miles inside the compound before being detained and questioned. Deputies found cameras, a phone, a laptop, and a drone inside the car they brought and allowed the deputies to review footage, which revealed video they shot from the secure area. The men said that they had come for the “Storm Area 51, They Can't Stop All of Us” event and had seen multiple “No Trespassing” signs along the way, but they “wanted to see the facility.” (📸: Nye County Sheriff's Office)

The 37-year-old man had been in ICE custody since Sept. 3 at the McHenry County Adult Correctional Facility in Woodstock, Illinois. He died Tuesday at a hospital. ICE officials had issued him a notice to appear in immigration court for deportation proceedings. ICE did not immediately respond to a request for comment. (📷: Reuters/AFP/Getty)

Crowd-control equipment — like tear gas — will be barred from being shipped into Hong Kong, according to the bipartisan bill. This comes after a BuzzFeed News investigation discovered that a US company relied on low-wage workers in sometimes unsafe conditions to produce the tear gas. Tap the link in our bio to read more. (📸: Getty Images/Zeynep Tufekci)

The Trump administration plans to remove all non-tobacco vape flavors as the FDA continues cracking down on teen vape use. The move comes amid a massive outbreak of a vaping-linked lung illness that has killed at least 6 people and affected hundreds of others. (📸: Reuters)

After surviving a Category 5 hurricane that left 70,000 people homeless, Bahamians trying to temporarily flee the decimated islands have found themselves trapped in a new disaster: navigating changing US immigration rules. The Department of Homeland Security released new visa restrictions that Bahamians arriving in the US by sea “must be in possession of a valid passport AND valid travel visa.” Now, many are just trying to get access to running water, buy food, and stay with family for a few nights. Read the whole story at the link in our bio. (📸: Holly Pickett)

Enlight Quickshot, the app Tupi Saravia uses to impose fake clouds into her travel photos, is partnering with her to make more fake cloud patterns. The company told BuzzFeed News it’s inked a deal with Saravia to come up with “a new cloud pack” she will personalize.” [We’ll] possibly offer her followers to submit their clouds for her pack as well,” it added ☁️ (📸: @tupisaravia)
In honor and remembrance, here are some of the most powerful 9/11 monuments around the world. (📸: Getty Images/AP/CQ-Roll Call, Inc.)

Like many Bahamians who fled to Florida after Hurricane Dorian destroyed their homes, Twanette Keyser and her family are wondering how long they will be allowed to stay in the US before they are homeless once again. “We’re really hoping there will be some special allowance for people like us,” she said, in reference to other hurricane victims. So far, the Trump administration has no clear answers on how long Bahamian evacuees will get to stay. (📸: Supplied)

A festival associated with the viral “Storm Area 51, They Can’t Stop All of Us” Facebook event has been canceled after millions of people RSVP’d. “We are not interested in, nor will we tolerate any involvement in a [Fyre Festival] 2.0,” the organizers said. (📸: Getty Images)

The biggest distinction between the highly anticipated phones are the cameras. The iPhone 11 has dual cameras while the new 11 Pro and Pro Max sport three. Some of the many features that they also have are better front facing cameras, (PET!) portrait mode, and battery life. Pricing for the new iPhone 11 starts at $699 while the iPhone 11 Pro starts at $999 and iPhone 11 Pro Max starts at $1099. Tap the link in our bio for more📱 (📷: Apple)

Bolton’s firing follows reports that the two sparred over the president’s plan to meet with Taliban officials at Camp David to negotiate the withdrawal of American forces from Afghanistan. Trump and Bolton appeared to clash often on foreign policy issues, including on diplomacy challenges with North Korea. Bolton became the national security adviser in 2018, replacing HR McMaster. He is the third person to serve the position in the Trump administration. (📸: Getty Images)

Ryan and his parents have been "deceiving millions of young children" by taking ad deals and not disclosing them properly, according to a complaint filed with the FTC. The complaint also says that because the disclosures are woven into the videos, it can be hard for kids to recognize they are being sold a product. Shion Kaji, Ryan’s father, has said that the family "strictly follow[s]" all platforms’ guidelines, including "advertising disclosure requirements." Tap the link in our bio to read more. (📸: @ryantoysreview)

Police say Pennsylvania couple Robert and Tiffany Williams were charged with a felony for spending $120,000 deposited in their account due to a bank error. They allegedly bought several vehicles, including a race car, an all-terrain vehicle, a camper van, and a car trailer, despite admitting to police they knew the money wasn't theirs. They also paid off bills, made car repairs, doled out money to friends, and made "random cash purchases," according to a police report. (📸: Google Maps)

The hack requires only a basic knowledge of HTML and a browser, and allows content posted to private Instagram and Facebook accounts to be accessed, downloaded and distributed publicly by friends and followers. A user simply inspects images and videos being loaded on the page and then pulls out the source URL. This URL can then be shared with people who are not logged into Instagram or do not follow that private user. The hack works even when images and videos in a private Instagram story expire or are deleted. Unlike simply screenshotting a private account you follow, public URLs contain some basic info about the photo or video they link to — update time, photo dimensions – and prove authenticity; You can’t fake one. Click our link in bio to learn more. (📸: Getty)

Todd Palin, the husband of Sarah Palin, the former Alaska governor who was Sen. John McCain’s running mate in the 2008 presidential election, appears to have filed for divorce. A plaintiff listed as TMP with the same birth date as Todd lodged a “complaint for divorce (with children)" in Anchorage Superior Court. The Palins have five kids and have been married since 1988. (📸: Getty)

After the Bahamians had boarded the US-bound ferry in Freeport, it was announced that only individuals with US visas could leave the island — a contradiction of US policy — and they were told to disembark. According to CBP guidelines, Bahamian citizens traveling from the Bahamas do not usually require a US visa as long as they have a clean police record and are only planning to visit for a short time. CBP has denied that it was to blame for the incident. (📸: Getty Images)

Period tracking apps including MIA Fem and Maya sent women’s use of contraception, timings of their monthly period, and when they last had sex to Facebook and other third party services, according to findings by Privacy International. This has raised questions about how much users knowingly consent to sensitive information being shared with companies like Facebook. Read the full story at the link in our bio. (📸: Getty/App Store)

After Laura Snyder, a fourth-grade teacher at Altamonte Elementary School in Florida posted on Facebook about a student who was bullied for the University of Tennessee logo he made for College Colors Day, UT fans rallied their support. "I know kids can be cruel, I am aware that it’s not the fanciest sign, BUT this kid used the resources he had available to him to participate in a spirit day," Snyder wrote. The university sent the boy and his class a "Volunteer Proud Pack" with school swag, and announced they would be making the student's hand-drawn design into an official T-shirt and donating a portion of the proceeds to an anti-bullying foundation. (📸: Facebook/UTVolShop)

Officials fear the final death toll will be "significantly" higher from the Category 5 storm. Residents from the worst-hit islands have been evacuating by boat or plane after losing everything in the devastating hurricane. (📸: Getty)

The beauty YouTuber called out the brand after they tweeted a teaser of their new palette (priced between $25 and $29) that looked “extremely similar” to the $39 one he created with Morphe last year. While Charles added that he doesn’t claim to “own” the colors, the brand did not try to hide the fact that they copied his palette. (📸: Getty Images/ @jamescharles / @wetnwildbeauty)

The Pose star was receiving a Magazine Cover of the Year award for their history-making Elle cover and showed up to the ceremony in "Keepsake" earrings composed of photos of 16 trans women murdered in 2019. In May, Indya became the first trans and the first openly nonbinary person to appear on the cover of Elle. They also carried a framed photo of Bailey Reeves, because the 17-year-old was killed three days before the event and after the earrings had been made. “Just like me, these women dared to exhaust their freedom to exist by being visible,” Indya said. “However, instead of being celebrated, they’re punished for it." (📷: Getty)

Anderson, best known for her work on The X-Files, said she was looking forward to the challenge of playing the controversial Conservative, who was Britain's first female prime minister. "Thatcher was undoubtedly formidable," she said, "but I am relishing exploring beneath the surface, and dare I say, falling in love with the icon, who whether loved or despised, defined an era." It had been rumored that Anderson would be playing Thatcher, but Netflix had stayed silent on the casting until now 🎬👑 (📷: Hulton Archive/Getty/AFP)

In an interview with Elle, EIlish said “I was born with DNA that was gonna give me big-ass boobs” when she opened up about the viral picture. Eilish also said that if she ever wanted to make a video where she wanted to look desirable that she feels people would "lose all respect" for her and "it would be a huge thing.” Eilish has previously said that she prefers to cover up in baggy clothes to keep part of herself a “mystery” and prevent from being judged. (📸: Getty Images)

Humor has always been a centerpiece of Mason Whitis and Madison Moxley’s relationship. So, when it came time to get some engagement photos done, they both had a brilliant idea. First, they visited a thrift shop and picked out retro outfits. Then they went to the only place that could capture that '80s vibe — a JCPenney portrait. "It was so much fun, we couldn't stop laughing," said Moxley 📸🤓💞 (📷: Dawn Winebrenner)

Maria Isabel Bueso has lived in the US for the past 16 years under a medical deferral for removal, but in August, she and other patients were told the program was ending and that they had 33 days to leave the country. The Trump administration announced it would reconsider its decision after her case caught national attention. But the Buesos have still received no direction from immigration officials and are unclear if they’ll be allowed to stay past the deadline. “If she were returned to Guatemala, she would no longer have access to the medication and she would die,” her doctor wrote in a letter to US immigration officials. Read more on this story at the link in our bio. (📷: Courtesy of the Bueso family)

Evelyn Hernández, who said the pregnancy was the result of rape, was acquitted of aggravated homicide charges last month after a retrial, having spent almost three years in prison. But despite everything the 21-year-old has had to endure, she might have to stand trial once more. “There are no elements to consider her a victim,” the attorney general’s office said in a statement Friday, “on the contrary, the only victim is her son.” Read the full story at the link in our bio. (📸:Getty Images)

The vaping lung illness outbreak, which has been connected to three deaths, now has 450 cases. The deaths have been connected to black market vaping liquids, but no one ingredient stands out definitively as the culprit. The CDC says people should consider not using e-cigarettes while an investigation is ongoing. Tap the link in our bio for more details. (📷: Reuters)

Robert Mugabe, the former political prisoner, first black leader of an independent Zimbabwe, and unrepentant strongman, has died, the nation's current president announced Friday. He was 95. Follow @world for more news from around the globe 🇿🇼🌎(📷: Reuters/Getty Images)

A jury couldn't agree whether Derick Almena, who converted the Ghost Ship warehouse into an artists colony and event space, was guilty of involuntary manslaughter following the 2016 fire. 17-month-old Anderson Davis was sitting in her car seat next to her twin brother when the gunman shot at her family's car as it drove on Highway 191. After a fishing trip off Florida’s coast, Brielle Owens nearly lost her leg due to a deadly form of Vibrio, a group of bacteria naturally found in warm, brackish, and ocean waters all over the world. People can become infected by eating contaminated seafood, particularly raw oysters, or exposing cuts or breaks in the skin to water containing the bacteria. This summer, hundreds of cases of Vibrio have been reported up and down the Atlantic Coast, across the Gulf states, and in the Pacific Northwest, with the increase in illnesses coming as climate change and coastal urbanization create a perfect storm for waterborne bacteria. Tap the link in our bio for more information. (📸: Brielle Owens, Getty Images)

"The tumor was treated definitively and there is no evidence of disease elsewhere in the body," a spokesperson for the Supreme Court said. An amicus brief filed by the Justice Department weighed in on two cases involving gay workers and what is meant by Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, which bans discrimination "because of sex.” The administration argued courts nationwide should stop reading the civil rights law to protect gay, lesbian, and bisexual workers from bias because it was not originally intended to do so. The Amazon rainforest has come under unprecedented assault this year. Brazil’s President Jair Bolsonaro has vowed to speed up development of the rainforest, raising serious concerns among environmentalists. Bolsonaro fired the head of an agency which revealed some 1,330 square miles of forest had been lost since he took office — up 39% over the same period last year. Scientists estimate that if we lose another 20% of this lush habitat, a catastrophic series of events known as dieback could occur, where the forest dries out and is more susceptible to fires and droughts. (📷: Reuters/NASA/AP/AFP/Getty Images)

Day turned to night around 3 p.m., according to the Folha de S.Paulo newspaper, and persisted for over an hour. Brazil’s space research center INPE said the number of fires detected in the Amazon so far this year had reached 72,843 — an 83% increase over the same period last year, according to Reuters. (📷: Agencia Estado via AP)

In an interview with PBS’s Frontline, Mayor Dee Margo said Trump made the “Republican In Name Only” remark, which Republicans hurl at one another to imply they’re not conservative enough, after the mayor pushed back against the president’s false claim that a border fence had made El Paso safer. “He said, ‘You’re a RINO,’ and I said, ‘No, sir. Pedro Arriago-Santoya, 44, is the seventh person to die in ICE custody since October. Francisco Erwin Galicia, 18, was stopped at a Customs and Border Protection checkpoint on June 27 as he traveled from Edinburg, Texas to Ranger College for a soccer scouting event, the Dallas Morning News reported. On Tuesday, he was released from ICE custody. Read the full story at the link in our bio. (📷: The San Antonio Express-News via AP)

A group of neighbors formed a human chain to protect a member of their community and his 12-year-old son as ICE agents arrived to take him into custody. The drug bremelanotide, sold as Vyleesi, is meant to be injected with a pen about 45 minutes ahead of time. It increases the activity of a hormone linked to lowered anxiety and moderately improved desire in past studies — but the mechanism by which it does that is unknown, the FDA said. The FDA didn’t convene an advisory committee vote on the drug, a common step, and the full clinical trial results of the drug’s largest test on 1,200 has not yet been published, which one expert says is concerning. Many sex educators and psychologists alike say medication is “not usually a complete solution in and of itself” for low libido in women, and should be combined with therapy or counseling. Tap the link in our bio to read more. (📷: AMAG Pharmaceuticals)

Suicide rates were 33% higher in 2017 than in 1999 according to a new report by the CDC. Indigenous women have been disproportionately affected: the suicide rate for that group has increased by 139%. On June 19, 1865, enslaved African-Americans in Galveston, Texas, finally learned the news that they were a free people. Today, the holiday of Juneteenth commemorates that day and the emancipation of all slaves in the US, and is marked by a joyous celebration of life and culture, filled with music, dancing, parades, and food. (📸: Getty)

A new study by the World Health Organization shows that 1 in 3 people in France disagree that vaccines are safe. In Ukraine, only about half the population thinks vaccines work. Full page ads Trump ran in 1989 advocated for bringing the death penalty back to "punish" the teen suspects, who were eventually exonerated. Korey Wise, Raymond Santana, Kevin Richardson, Antron McCray, and Yusef Salaam were charged with assault, robbery, rape, and other counts based on confessions they made during police interrogations that lasted for hours and without their parents/attorneys present. The teens withdrew the confessions and pleaded not guilty, but were convicted and sentenced to prison. In 2002, the men were exonerated after a convicted murderer admitted to the rape. There’s been renewed outcry about the injustice of the case after Netflix’s When They See Us started streaming in May. (📷: Getty)

Carli Lloyd scored two goals and Julie Ertz added another to clinch a place in the knockout stage for the USA. ⚽ 🇺🇸 👏 (📸: Getty Images)

A Target spokesperson said the company is aware of the issues with its registers and is investigating. At one store in Florida, a shopper told BuzzFeed News that everyone, “just kind of dropped their stuff where they were and walked out.” (📸: Jeff Clark/Blair Driscoll)

Matarazzo, who is best known for his role as Dustin on Stranger Things, will host “Prank Encounters” on Netflix, which will be centered around tricking people on the first day of what they think is a new job. People on Twitter roundly criticized the concept of the new show. (📸: Getty)

Leyla Cox, 53, died Monday at the Excellence resort in Punta Cana, her son said, adding that he was told his mother died of a heart attack, but the family has suspicions due to the number of deaths and illnesses reported in the country. Americans Jerry Curran, Edward Nathaniel Holmes, Cynthia Ann Day, and Miranda Schaup-Werner also died while visiting the Dominican Republic this year. The FBI is providing assistance to local authorities with toxicology tests in some of the deaths. (📸: Facebook)

Ethan said he purposefully posed as an underage girl online using Snapchat’s gender filter to catch sexual predators – leading to the arrest of 40-year-old police officer Robert Edward Davies. Davies messaged a Tinder account Ethan had created posing as a girl, Esther, and continued the conversation even after “Esther” told him she was 16. Per police, Davies and "Esther" talked about "engaging in sexual activity,” and Davies was arrested after Ethan sent the information to a crime stopper tip line. Click our link in bio to read more. (📸: NBC Bay Area, San Jose Police Department)

At least 100 people have been killed in a violent crackdown by Sudan’s military. Since then, there’s been an internet blackout which has limited the information flowing in and out of the country. To raise awareness about the violence, many people — celebrities included — have changed their profile pictures to blue in solidarity.

Last week, Sudan’s security forces shot unarmed protesters at a sit-in in Khartoum. Doctors and activists said over 100 people have been killed since. One of those who died was Mohamed Hashim Mattar, who had a blue profile picture when he was killed. After a Twitter user found a tweet from Mattar's account that said, "I paint the sky blue," people became determined to cover social media with the color as a visible way to stand in solidarity with people in Sudan and pay respect to those who were killed. (📸: @reresolve_ , @mattar77 )

"For me, terminating my pregnancy was not an easy choice, but it was my choice," Jayapal said in an op-ed for the New York Times. In an interview with BuzzFeed News after her essay op-ed was published, Jayapal said her motivation to tell the story "had been building" as white men continued to erode abortion access. Visit the link in our bio to read more. (📸: Chip Somodevilla/Getty)

The state will no longer allow parents to refuse vaccines for their kids due to religious reasons, and will require vaccines for all children attending school or daycare. New York City and Rockland County are facing a measles outbreak crisis among their Orthodox Jewish communities, fueled by misinformation about vaccines. (📸: Getty)

Many fans and fellow YouTubers had speculated that the lipsticks were expired and were leftovers from an earlier product development, but Hill insisted that the lipsticks were manufactured in May 2019. Hill said that while there were some manufacturing issues that created a gritty texture, and cotton gloves that she says left hairs on the lipsticks, the products were never unsafe. Hill apologized for the "very embarrassing" problem and offered full refunds. Tap the link in our bio for more details. (📸: Jaclyn Hill, @ itsv_82 via Twitter)

The combative Trump press secretary who admitted to lying to the media is leaving her post at the end of the month. According to Mueller's final report into Russian interference in the 2016 election, Sanders admitted she had no basis for suggesting that "countless members of the FBI" had lost faith in former FBI Director James Comey at the time of his firing. (📸: Getty)

When Scott Dittman decided to join his friend Denna, who was providing "Free Mom Hugs" at the Pittsburgh Pride Parade, to give his own "Free Dad Hugs" he wasn't prepared for the emotional response he received from complete strangers. "He just sobbed and sobbed and thanked us," Dittman said of a man who told them he was abandoned by his parents when he came out at 19. "You could tell they hadn’t had something as simple as a hug from their dad in a long time. That broke my heart." (📸: Scott Dittman, Pamela Luu)
Trump's tweet referred to when he met Charles, Prince of Wales, at a state banquet in the UK. An encounter with a "Prince of Whales" would be a very different thing entirely 😂 🐳

Authorities arrested and charged Kendrell Lavar Lyles with the murder of Muhlaysia Booker, a 23-year-old black transgender woman, and two other women who police did not identify. The arrest comes during a spate of murders of young, black transgender women in the area. (📸: Dallas Police Department, Via Robyn Crowe)

In the days since the miniseries aired, an uptick of visitors have begun swarming the area, tour operators told CNN. A look through the geotags for the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant and the nearby ghost town of Pripyat shows a bevy of tourists eager to let their followers know that they're posted up at a spot where an untold number of people died. It's gotten to the point that show creator Craig Mazin has asked people who visit the Exclusion Zone to be just a bit more chill. (📷: Reuters/Getty)

Last week, GQ published a photo of Silicon Valley executives from their Italy trip to visit luxury designer Brunello Cucinelli. But if you think something looks off, you’re right: A BuzzFeed News “investigation” revealed that two women CEOs were photoshopped into what originally was a photo featuring 15 men. “We meant no harm or had any malicious intent in doing this and we are sorry,” Cucinelli’s spokesperson said. The photo has since been removed from GQ’s story. Tap the link in bio for more details on how we made this discovery 📸🔎 (📷: @gq/@brunellocucinelli/LinkedIn)

An upcoming episode titled “The Last Crusade” will feature Aunt Holiday and Auntie Lofty, a lesbian pony couple who takes care of the school-aged character Scootaloo. "I think it’s fantastic that we can show that what truly defines a family is love — that, to me, is the core of My Little Pony," writer Michael Vogel told BuzzFeed News. The episode has already aired in Europe, but US audiences will get to see it on Saturday 📺🏳️‍🌈💜(📷: Hasbro)

John Vandemoer had admitted to accepting $610,000 in bribes to designate two prospective students as sailing recruits. Vandemoer did not pocket the bribe money, but rather put it towards the team. After the scandal emerged, he was fired and pleaded guilty to racketeering charges. He was sentenced to two years of supervised release with six months of home detention. He was also ordered to pay a $10,000 fine. (📷: Getty)

Thousands of people protested outside the government headquarters in semiautonomous Hong Kong on Wednesday, as protesters managed to delay a debate over the bill. But the bill, which would allow criminal suspects in Hong Kong to be sent for trial on the mainland, is still expected to become law this month. The proposed law has provoked the largest protests in Hong Kong since 1997, when it was returned to Chinese sovereignty by the UK. (📷: Getty/AFP/Reuters)

People reported that Grande's donation from her June 8 concert is worth about $250,000. Planned Parenthood said it will use the money to "fight back" against anti-abortion laws like the one passed last month in Georgia, which effectively bans abortions after about six weeks of pregnancy. (📸: Getty Images)

The US Women's National Soccer Team scored the most goals ever in a single World Cup match beating Thailand 13-0 in their first match of the 2019 tournament. The Americans, the No. 1 ranked team in the tournament, broke the previous record set in 1954, when Austria beat Switzerland 7-5 in the quarterfinal game of the men's World Cup for a total of 12 goals ⚽️🇺🇸🙌 (📷: Getty Images)

Fans on social media say the lipsticks they ordered have arrived full of holes, small bumps that look like plastic, covered in what looks like hair, and more. After several days, @jaclynhill addressed the issue, saying her team is working “nonstop” to address the issues and offered fans refunds and new product. Read the full story at the link in our bio. (📷: Jaclyn Hill/RawBeautyKristi)

Ivan Golunov was arrested on Friday and allegedly beaten after police said they found drugs on him. Golunov has denied the drugs were his and accused police of planting them on him for his work exposing government and corporate corruption. His detention was met with immediate outcry from journalists in and out of Russia, and in a rare act of media solidarity, Russia’s three major business newspapers all published identical front pages in protest, declaring “I AM/WE ARE IVAN GOLUNOV.” He was released to house arrest before the government announced on Tuesday that the case would be dropped entirely. (📷: Getty/Reuters)

The unanimous decision is a huge boost for LGBT rights in Africa and comes just weeks after the Kenyan High Court upheld similar laws that prohibit gay sex. “There are also many people of same-sex relationships in this country who have been violated and have also suffered in silence for fear of being discriminated [against],” President Mokgweetsi Masisi said in November. “Just like other citizens, they deserve to have their rights protected.” (📷: Getty)
The helicopter made a "hard landing or an emergency landing" on the roof of the 54-story building on Seventh Avenue in Manhattan, New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo told reporters. (📸: AP)

“The older I get, the more I think that I’m nonbinary,” Van Ness said. “I’m gender nonconforming. Like, some days I feel like a man, but then other days I feel like a woman.” The Netflix star has clarified that while he doesn’t identify as a man, he uses he/him pronouns 🏳️‍🌈 (📸: Getty Images)

Photos of US travelers and license plate images have been stolen in a “malicious cyber-attack,” the Customs and Border Protection says. The database had been transferred to a CBP subcontractor's company network without the US agency's authorization or knowledge. The subcontractor's network was then hacked, though CBP says its own systems have not been compromised. (📸: Flickr)

The Stop Violence in the Sex Trades Act is a new bill introduced by a group of progressive state legislators that would repeal most misdemeanor charges related to prostitution. It does not change any sections of the penal code that outlaw sex trafficking or offenses related to minors. Sex worker advocates say the goal is to reduce the violence sex workers face from police and customers. Tap the link in our bio for more details. (📷: Getty)

The 8-year-old girl was out looking for her horses in Jammu and Kashmir in January 2018 when she was lured away and kidnapped by men as part of a premeditated conspiracy. According to the police report, she was drugged, starved, locked up in a Hindu temple, and raped repeatedly by multiple men before she was killed. The men who were charged were allegedly right-wing Hindus, and the case sparked widespread protests. Tap the link in our bio to read more. (📷: Getty)

Organizers said more than 1 million people joined the protest — roughly 1 in 7 of the territory’s population — though local police put the estimate at several hundred thousand. Either way, it was one of Hong Kong’s largest protests in decades. Protesters say the new extradition bill, which would allow people suspected of crimes in the mainland to be sent back there for trial, could undercut Hong Kong’s legal system and lead to abuse by China. “If the law is implemented anyone can disappear from Hong Kong,” one teacher said. “No one will get justice in China. We know there are no human rights.” Tap the link in our bio to read more. (📷: AP/Getty)

Over 100 people are dead, 600 injured, and at least 120 are missing as the brutal military crackdown continues, a representative of the UK-based Sudan Doctors Union, which is linked to the protesters, told BuzzFeed News. That number is much higher than the count given by the Sudanese health ministry, controlled by the military, which says 61 people died. A government blackout on almost all internet and phone services has made getting information out of the country difficult. Tap the link in our bio to read more. (📷: Getty)

The 12th and ostensibly final film in the 19-year-old X-Men franchise opened with an estimated $33 million at the domestic box office — the lowest domestic debut yet during the 2019 summer movie season, and the worst ever debut for an X-Men film by a considerable margin. Tap the link in our bio to read more. (📷: 20th Century Fox)

Meghan Markle took a break from maternity leave to join other members of the royal family for Trooping The Colour, the Queen’s annual birthday parade (she turned 93 on April 21.) Markle wore a navy Givenchy look by her wedding dress designer, Clare Waight Keller. (📷: WireImage; Getty)

Randy and Amy English have ushered three kids aged between 22 and 25 into the “real world” but said they hadn’t yet been able to enjoy their freedom. “Parenting is by far one of the most difficult ‘jobs’ one can ever have,” Amy English said. “There is no instruction book, and more importantly, there is no reset button.” Their cheeky photoshoot — shot by their youngest daughter — has now gone viral on Twitter 🏡 (📷: Haley Marie Photog)

Police say over Memorial Day weekend, 18-year-old Devon Robinson shot five people inside a home and killed Alunte Davis, 21; Timothy Blancher, 20; and Paris Cameron, 20. Authorities are calling it an anti-gay attack. “The alleged actions of this defendant are disturbing on so many levels, but the fact that this happened during Pride Month adds salt into the wound,” the county prosecutor said in a statement. (📷: Facebook)

While her parents were sleeping, Benita Diamond downloaded the Uber app on her mother's phone and requested a ride to a parking garage, where she killed herself. Now, her family is demanding the ride-hailing company make changes to enforce its policy of not allowing minors to use the service without an adult. “Uber took my daughter past the point of no return,” the girl’s father, Ronald Diamond, said. (📸: Supplied, Facebook)

The president has declared that the moon is part of Mars. That’s right, the red planet that is roughly 33.9 million miles from Earth. And well, people naturally had thoughts 🤔🌚 (📸: Twitter, Getty Images, Giphy)

In 1938, the Salvation Army celebrated the first National Doughnut Day in honor of the “Doughnut Lassies,” the women who traveled to the frontlines of World War I to serve the sweet treats to soldiers. Tap the 🔗 in bio to find out more about the pastry’s special day 🍩 (📸: Getty Images)

Last week’s premiere of the miniseries created by Ava DuVernay, which focuses on the wrongful rape conviction of five black New York teenagers in 1989, has sparked another wave of outcry about injustice in the case, prompting #CancelLindaFairstein to trend online. Tap the link in bio to find out more about the case and series. (📸: Getty Images)

Hiram Johnson wanted to know about his heritage, so he took a DNA test. He ended up connecting with new family — and identifying who raped his grandmother when she was imprisoned in the 1920s. Read the full story at the link in our bio. (📷: BuzzFeed News)

Former Minneapolis cop Mohamed Noor fatally shot Justine Damond in 2017 after she called 911 to report a possible sexual assault. Earlier this year, Noor was convicted on charges of third-degree murder and second-degree manslaughter, but was not found guilty of second-degree murder. (📸: AP/Reuters)

The protests at NYC’s Stonewall Inn began on June 28, 1969, when police raided the popular bar that was a gathering place for the LGBT community. Though they claimed it was because they were violating liquor laws, harsh police action against the community was a common tactic at the time. For days after, hundreds of people rioted outside the bar, with many being arrested or injured. (📷: New York Public Library/NYPD/Getty)

The charges include four counts of aggravated criminal sexual assault, two counts of criminal sexual assault, and five counts of aggravated criminal sexual abuse, according to court documents. The R&B singer has been accused of sexual misconduct dating back to the 1990s, as detailed in the Lifetime docuseries “Surviving R. Kelly.” (📷: Getty)
On this day 75 years ago, allied troops stormed the beaches of Normandy to liberate Europe from the grips of Nazi tyranny. (📷: Getty)

Mail Online published a story claiming a Dutch teen who had been sexually abused as a child was legally euthanized at home “because she felt her life was unbearable due to depression.” The story was picked up by international press, but it is not true: 17-year-old Noa Pothoven had requested euthanasia under Dutch law but been refused. She died in her home after refusing fluids and food since the beginning of June. Her parents and doctors agreed not to force feed her, and offered palliative care instead. Pothoven’s autobiography, “Winnen of Leren” (Win or Learn), details her experience with sexual abuse, PTSD, anorexia, and depression. She hoped it would reform how young people facing mental health crises would be treated. Tap the link in our bio to read more. (📷: @winnenofleren)

Ruby Howell, 70, lost her job with Kampgrounds of America after video of the confrontation at Mississippi’s Oktibbeha County Lake went viral. In the video, Howell holds a gun as she talks to Jessica and Franklin Richardson, who had been attempting to have a picnic. The couple didn't know they needed a reservation at the campground to sit by the lake. Howell has been charged with a misdemeanor count of threatening exhibition of a weapon. (📷: Oktibbeha County Sheriff's Department/Jessica Richardson via Facebook)

Georgia Clark, an English teacher since 1998, thought her tweets to the president were private. At a special meeting of the Fort Worth Independent School District on Tuesday, over a dozen members of the public urged officials to fire Clark. All eight members of the board subsequently voted for Clark to be fired. “We wish to ensure these students that all children and their parents and/or guardians, that all children are welcome in Fort Worth ISD," the board president said. (📷: Fort Worth ISD)

Officials are scaling back or shutting down activities for unaccompanied immigrant children "that are not directly necessary for the protection of life and safety,“ citing budget constraints as the number of detainees continues to grow. (📸: Getty Images)

YouTube estimates the policy change will lead to the removal of thousands of videos and channels. The announcement comes a day after the company received intense backlash for saying right-wing personality Steven Crowder (left) didn’t violate its policy by targeting Vox host Carlos Maza with years of anti-gay and racist harassment. Tap the link in our bio to read more. (📷: Steven Crowder via YouTube)

In a viral Twitter thread, Vox host Carlos Maza detailed the years of racist and anti-gay harassment he’s been experiencing from right-wing personality Steven Crowder, who has made multiple videos calling Maza a “lispy queer” and “anchor baby.” YouTube says Crowder’s language is “clearly hurtful” but doesn’t violate their policies. The company is facing backlash from Maza and other LGBT creators, who say YouTube consistently prioritizes views and engagement over adequately enforcing their hate speech policies. Tap the link in our bio to read more. (📷: Carlos Maza via Twitter)

Biannca and Damien Prince, who run "The Prince Family" YouTube channel, shared a vlog documenting the birth of their daughter, Nova Grace, which has since drawn criticism. “She's going to have brown eyes for sure," Biannca says of her newborn. "I thought you were going to have pretty eyes." Biannca also asks whether Nova will be the same "color" as her son DJ, to which her husband responds that Nova will be darker-skinned, prompting a nurse to say "but she's beautiful." Click our link in bio for more. (📸: YouTube)

Scot Peterson, the Broward County Sheriff's deputy who waited outside Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School while the Parkland shooter opened fire, killing 17 people, has been arrested in connection to what the State Attorney's Office described as his "lack of response" to the shooting. Peterson faces 11 criminal charges, including child neglect, culpable negligence, and perjury. Tap the link in our bio for more. (📸: Reuters)
Trump claimed to have missed the protesters on his official state visit to the UK and called it “fake news.” Swipe 👈 for more photos (📷: Hannah Al-Othman for BuzzFeed News)

Johana Medina Leon was 25 and seeking asylum in the US. An advocate with Diversidad Sin Fronteras, an LGBT human rights organization, said Medina had on multiple occasions told staff at the processing center where she was held that “she needed an (IV) solution, that she could do it herself but she just needed the medication.” (Medina was a certified nurse in El Salvador, but wasn’t able to practice because she was living openly as a trans woman.) She was eventually taken to a hospital after she complained about chest pains. Tap the link in our bio to read more. (📷: Diversidad Sin Fronteras)
The first family of the US meets the royal family of the UK 👑🇬🇧 (📷: AFP/Getty Images)

Tetsuya, a former chemistry teacher in Japan, let his grandson, Naoya Kudo, dress him and take photos of him. Kudo told BuzzFeed News that while it was his idea to dress Tetsuya, his granddad was surprisingly enthusiastic about it and had lots of suggestions about where to shoot. “The rest of the family went wild when they first saw him dressed up,” Kudo said 😎🔥 Follow @world for more stories from around the 🌏 (📷: @slvr.tty)

The announcement comes after the company said it is investing $800 million dollars in its fulfillment network to increase the speed of its standard Prime delivery from two-day shipping to one-day shipping. Amazon’s free one-day delivery is available to Prime members in the US. The service requires no minimum purchase amount and applies to those 10 million select items 📦 (📷: Getty)

• You can now log into various apps with your Apple ID, instead of your Facebook/Google accounts
• iOS is getting dark mode, new privacy features, and audio sharing
• Apple Photos and Maps are getting some polish
• The long-awaited new Mac Pro is completely reimagined
• iPad is getting its own iOS for supercharged multitasking
There’s a lot more — tap the link in our bio for more details from today’s conference 🍎 (📷: Apple)

Kohli wore his rainbow-themed turban to San Diego Pride last year and re-shared it this month. He says the response has been overwhelmingly positive ✨ Some have asked where they can get their own, but Kohli says turbans are a responsibility for Sikh men and not the same as throwing on a rainbow hat: “I wouldn’t want people to have the impression that I’m just wearing it as an accessory. A turban is a sign to the world that you’re a person the world can turn to for help.” (📷: Jiwandeep Kohli via Twitter)

The tweets followed an opinion piece written by London mayor Sadiq Khan that said it was “un-British to be rolling out the red carpet for a state visit for a president whose behaviour flies in the face of the ideals America was founded upon.” Trump all but avoided London during his last visit after tens of thousands of people pledged to protest him in the streets. (📷: Getty Images/@realdonaldtrump)

When Thomas Tobin was the auxiliary bishop of Pittsburgh, his diocese was named in a grand jury report on the cover-up of sexual abuse by the Catholic Church. Given that history, the president of Rhode Island Pride called the tweet “frankly outrageous” and said they want every child who reads the tweet to know they are loved. A Pride rally has been planned in response for Sunday night. Tap the link in our bio for more. (📷: AP)

A May 24 referendum acknowledged same-sex couples’ constitutional right to marry. Taiwan is now the first place in Asia to legally recognize same-sex unions. Tap the link in our bio for more photos 🌈 (📷: Getty/AP/Shutterstock/Reuters)

A fundraising campaign in honor of Emilia Clarke has raised more than £80,000 ($100,000) for the charity SameYou, of which she is the founder. A separate campaign created Friday in honor of Kit Harington has raised over £20,000 (roughly $25,000) for the charity Mencap, for which he is an ambassador, in less than a day.  Clarke posted an emotional video thanking fans for their donations 🐉 ⚔️ 💗 (📷: @emilia_clarke/@justgiving)

A review of the Facebook accounts of thousands of officers around the US — the largest database of its kind — found officers endorsing violence against Muslims, women, and criminal defendants. Read the story by clicking the link in our bio. (📸: Facebook)

Officials say a fellow city employee opened fire inside a Virginia Beach government complex, killing 12 people. The 12th victim was a local contractor who had come to the building to try to obtain a permit. “I have worked with most of them for many years,” Virginia Beach City Manager Dave Hansen said. “They leave a void that we will never be able to fill.” (📸: City of Virginia Beach)

Waller-Bridge, the creator and star of "Fleabag," called the iconic spy "absolutely relevant," but emphasized the franchise needed to grow. "It has just got to evolve, and the important thing is that the film treats the women properly," Waller-Bridge told Deadline. "He doesn't have to. He needs to be true to this character." (📸: Getty Images)

🚨BREAKING: At least 11 people were killed and six others injured after a longtime public utilities employee opened fire at the Virginia Beach Municipal Center Friday, officials said. The shooter "began to indiscriminately fire upon all the victims” after entering Building 2, the police chief said. Officers exchanged gunfire with the shooter, who was killed. One police officer was injured by gunfire. Latest details at the link in bio. (📷: AP)

A surprise visit at five Border Patrol facilities in Texas by a government watchdog group found that immigrants also had limited access to showers and clean clothing, with some wearing soiled clothing for days or weeks. El Paso Del Norte Processing Center’s maximum capacity is 125 detainees, but on May 7 and 8, Border Patrol’s custody logs showed there were about 750 and 900 detainees, respectively. The limited space also made it difficult to separate detainees who were sick from the general population. Tap the link in bio for more details. (📷: DHS Office of Inspector General)

Trump made history as the first Republican president to acknowledge Pride Month, but his administration has attacked the rights of the LGBT community. Just last week, the Trump administration finalized one rule allowing medical workers to refuse to treat trans people based on religious objections, while drafting another that would allow homeless shelters to turn away trans individuals. Read more at the link in bio. (📷: AP)

The film will be written and directed by Matt Reeves, and is expected to open in June 2021. On Friday, Variety reported that Pattinson “is officially” Batman, but a spokesperson for Warner Bros. told BuzzFeed News the casting is “in negotiations.” 🎬🦇💥 (📷: AFP/Getty Images)

A judge ruled that the Planned Parenthood in St. Louis can continue operating. The clinic's license was scheduled to elapse at midnight Friday, which would have forced it to close and made Missouri the first state without an abortion services provider since the Supreme Court ruled on Roe v. Wade in 1973. (📸: Jeff Roberson/AP)

Calls for a boycott of the state came after Gov. Brian Kemp signed a bill that would ban abortions after a heartbeat is detected. “None of us voted for this, and we shouldn’t have to suffer because of what the politicians decided," a key grip told BuzzFeed News. For more on this story, check the link in our bio. (📸: Courtesy of Callie Moore)

After more than three and a half hours of competition, officials ran out of words — but still had eight contestants left. The winners, who will all get $50,000, are Rishik Gandhasri, Erin Howard, Saketh Sundar, Shruthika Padhy, Sohum Sukhatankar, Abhijay Kodali, Christopher Serrao, and Rohan Raja. (📸: Patrick Semansky/AP)

Gov. John Bel Edwards has signed a bill banning nearly all abortions when a fetal heartbeat is detected, as early as 6 weeks, and before many women know they're pregnant. There are no exceptions for cases of rape or incest. Several other states have recently passed similar laws, including Georgia, Kentucky, Mississippi, and Ohio. (📸: Getty, AP)

The singer faces four counts of aggravated criminal sexual assault, two counts of criminal sexual assault, and five counts of aggravated criminal sexual abuse, according to court documents. The new charges involve a woman who was under the age of 18 at the time of the alleged abuse.(📸: AP)

Kelsey Dawn Williamson didn't expect anything unusual when she ordered a Frog And Toad t-shirt for her 3-year-old daughter Salem from AliExpress, an online Chinese retailer, so she was shocked when it arrived with an....unusual addition. "Of all the things they could have added, why that? On a children’s size shirt?" she asked. Williamson's post about the shirt went viral, and she's still trying to figure how exactly the mistake happened. Click our link in bio to read more. (📸: Facebook)

Amanda Deibert said that the fact that her tweet went viral made her “sad.” "It just hit me like...wow, this is something most women think about every time we go out to get exercise or even just walk to our car," she added. Some women have nifty gadgets, and others have engineered their own weapon carriers. Swipe 👈 to see how some women protect themselves (📷: Amanda Deibert)

The eight schools in the Lockport City School District in western New York will begin using the Aegis system to track sex offenders, students and staff who have been suspended, and credible safety threats. The tech is a testing phase during the summer and will be broadly operational in September. Go to the link in our bio to read more on this story. (📸: Getty Images)

Lewis Bennett was sentenced to 8 years for the death of Isabella Hellman after she disappeared and was presumed dead during their 2017 honeymoon at sea. Bennett was an experienced sailor, but Hellman was not, and he didn't require her to wear a life jacket, harness, or personal locator beacon while she sailed as he slept en route to Florida from Cuba. Bennett claimed he woke to the boat sinking, but did not call for help until he was on a life raft, and did not look for his missing wife, whose body was never found. Click the link in our bio for more. (📸: Broward County Sheriff's Office)

Franklin and Jessica Richardson were picnicking at Mississippi's Oktibbeha County Lake, a site run by Kampgrounds of America (KOA), when a woman who identified herself as the campground's manager pulled out a gun and told the couple to leave, that they didn't belong, and that they needed reservations. KOA clarified that reservations are not required for the site, which is privately owned, and said the woman has been let go. Click our link in bio for more. (📸: Facebook)

Trebek told People magazine that the improvement in his health since he started treatment for stage 4 pancreatic cancer has been “mind-boggling” and that his doctors “said they hadn’t seen this kind of positive result in their memory.” According to the Mayo Clinic, pancreatic cancer has a five-year survival rate of just 7%. Trebek is crediting his progress to the support and prayers he’s received from fans ✨ (📷: AP)

Mark Lindblom used an underground tunnel that club members exclusively use to go back-and-forth between the grounds and the beach. He was cleared by Secret Service and wandered around for 20 minutes before he was detained. The 18-year-old pleaded guilty to unlawfully entering or remaining in a restricted area and was sentenced to a year of probation and a $25 fine. (📷: AP)

Broadway actor Joshua Dela Cruz is playing the lead role on Nickelodeon’s new show Blue’s Clues and You. A first trailer confirmed familiar faces from the original, like the Felt Friends and Magenta, will also be back. (📸: Nick Jr.)

“Kit has decided to utilize this break in his schedule as an opportunity to spend some time at a wellness retreat to work on some personal issues,” a representative for Harington said. Harington has reportedly checked into the retreat to cope with stress related to the Game of Thrones ending. In an interview with Variety, Harington said that after he found out the fate of his character and the show, he started going to therapy. (📸: Getty)

The photo of the panda was captured in April with an infrared camera. Researchers believe the panda is between one and two years old but could not determine its sex. As victims began to arrive at Littleton Adventist Hospital on Tuesday, doctors and nurses were ready. The hospital treated Columbine victims in 1999. When Shaymaa Ismaa’eel went to the Islamic Circle of North America convention, she saw a group of men with signs protesting outside and shouting at attendees each day. So on day three of the convention, she asked her friend to take a photo of her – and it went viral. "The positivity from this is very uplifting," she said. "It’s making me happy to know that the youth can see someone being unapologetic in the face of people who hate their religion." (📸: @shaymaadarling)

Madison County Deputy Jeff Graves is on leave for anti-gay comments he made on a Facebook post advocating for more awareness about bullying after 15-year-old Nigel Shelby, a gay high school freshman, killed himself. In response to another Facebook user who identified Graves as a sheriff's deputy in the comments, Graves said he was exercising his free speech rights and that he was "off duty on my personal time," the screenshots show. (📸: @ laurenamylove Gia Twitter, Facebook)

Judges ruled that putting a chalk mark on tires in order to track how long a vehicle has been parked is a violation of the Fourth Amendment, which protects people against unreasonable searches of their property. The opinion was issued in regard to a lawsuit filed by a Michigan woman who received 15 parking citations in three years, and judges found that the chalking of her car tires amounted to an unreasonable search of the car and one that would require a search warrant. (📸: Getty)

Olabinjo and Abimbola “Bola” Osundairo are suing Smollett's attorneys for claiming the brothers "led a criminally homophobic, racist, and violent attack against Mr. Smollett," even after they knew it was untrue, according to a federal lawsuit. They say Smollett's lawyers defamed their business by claiming they sell foreign steroids, as well as falsely insinuating that “Bola” and Smollett had a sexual relationship. Click the link in our bio to read more. (📸: Getty)

Laura Janke, the ex-assistant women's soccer coach at USC, agreed to plead guilty to conspiracy to commit racketeering for making fake athletic profiles for Olivia Jade and other students, often fabricating awards to make them appear to be strong recruits. Janke faces a maximum of 20 years in prison, three years of supervised release, and a fine of $250,000. (📸: Getty)

Harris said she would mandate universal background checks on anyone selling more than five guns a year and bar people classified as fugitives from buying guns. She would also, her campaign said, close a loophole in federal law that allows perpetrators of domestic violence to keep their guns if they are not married to their partner. For more plan details, tap the link in bio. (📷: Getty)
It’s unclear if the jewelry choices are hinting at something, but Thanos is definitely 👀 (📷: Getty)

The album has been exclusively streaming on Tidal since its 2016 release. Now, three years to the day of its first release, you can stream it on Spotify, Apple Music, and other services. (📸: Spotify, Larry Busacca/Getty Images for Coachella)

The court will look at whether Title VII of the Civil Rights Act, which prevents discrimination “on the basis of sex,” applies to LGBT individuals. If the Supreme Court rules in favor of the employees claiming discrimination, it will be an important win for LGBT advocates who have been advocating for protections under the Civil Rights Act for decades. It would also be a major hit for the Trump administration. (📷: Getty Images)

Clare O'Connor shared her dad’s hilarious email on Twitter, and it went viral. Many people are thanking him for snapping them back to reality and getting their financial priorities on track. "Maybe this’ll prompt him to finally get a smartphone (I won’t hold my breath) so he can share his musings with his new fanbase more often," O'Connor told BuzzFeed News 💰😂 (📷: Clare O'Connor)
Look at that smile! 😭 To nobody's surprise, the photos taken by the Duchess of Cambridge are SUPER cute. Happy 1st birthday, Prince Louis! 🎉👑 (📷: @kensingtonroyal)

Riverside County Animal Services told BuzzFeed News that had a transient not discovered the 3-day-old puppies within a 15-minute window, they would not have survived. Temperatures in Coachella that day were in the mid-90s. The seven puppies were transported to a rescue group, where they're being bottle-fed. Authorities are planning to pursue a felony charge of animal cruelty against the woman. For more details, tap the link in bio. (📷: Riverside County Animal Services)

After the screens on several Galaxy Fold review units started failing, Samsung said it is taking "measures to strengthen the display protection." The Galaxy Fold is priced starting at $1,980 through AT&T and T-Mobile. It has a unique folding design, with a smaller touchscreen on the outside, and a larger tablet-sized touchscreen on the inside. The new release date will be announced in the coming weeks, Samsung said 📱❌ (📷: Samsung)

Warren is now the first major 2020 candidate with a large-scale student debt forgiveness plan. Her plan would entirely wipe out the debt of 75% of Americans with student loans, the campaign says. It would also include free undergraduate tuition at public colleges — and the total cost would be covered by a proposed tax on the ultra-wealthy (we’re talking billionaires and people making more than $50 million.) Tap the link in our bio for more details. (📷: Getty Images)

The 30-year-old Grammy award-winning singer married social entrepreneur Simon Konecki in a secret ceremony in 2016. They have a 6-year-old son, and said in a statement they’re committed to “raising their son together lovingly.” (📷: Getty Images)

The armed right-wing group, which calls itself “United Constitutional Patriots”, detained hundreds of migrant people at the border at gunpoint. Larry Mitchell Hopkins, the leader of the group, was arrested for being a felon in possession of firearms and ammunition. Read the full story at the link in bio. (📷: Getty Images)

Officials are warning against spreading disinformation and sowing division in the aftermath of the attacks, which come 10 years after a violent, decades-long civil war. Facebook and Instagram were temporarily shut down according to the Sri Lankan government news portal, and websites that track blocked platforms say the ban extended to WhatsApp, Snapchat, Viber, and more. (📷: Getty)

Archivist Michael W. Gorth recently discovered a previously unseen collection of amateur photographs taken on the streets of New York during its annual Easter celebration 🐰 (📷: Gorth/Lost Colour Library)

At least 207 people were reportedly killed and 450 injured. Three churches and three hotels near Colombo were targeted with almost simultaneous blasts — then, hours later, two more explosions went off at a guesthouse and overpass on the outskirts of the city, the BBC reports. 7 suspects have been arrested, according to the AP, but no group has claimed responsibility for the attacks. Tap the link in our bio to read more. (📷: Getty)

In an interview with Rotten Tomatoes, the Russo brothers explained why they're being so secretive with the script: "It just takes a lot of pressure off of people because it is hard to constantly censor yourself about what you're saying, how you talk." (📸: Marvel/Getty Images)

Bess Kalb’s Hawaii vacation happened to fall during the Jewish holiday of Passover. But to her parents, being out of town didn’t mean she had to skip the holiday. So they tracked down Bess’ hotel and sent her and her husband a box with everything for s Seder on the fly. (📸: Bess Kalb)

Caitlin Burch says her daughters kept talking about a “creature” in their room, but when Caitlin checked she didn’t see anything. Three days later, Caitlin and her husband looked again and saw the possum. “It’s very much an ‘I told you so’ moment for [the girls,]” Caitlin said. (📸: Caitlin Burch)

Raniya Wright died March 27, two days after collapsing following an altercation with another fifth-grade student at her elementary school. Officials say Wright died of a previously undetected congenital condition that can cause hemorrhaging and death, and that she had been complaining of headaches in the weeks before she died. Police say no criminal charges will be filed in Wright's death, and the other student involved has reportedly returned to school. (📸: Facebook)

“The Mueller report lays out facts showing that a hostile foreign government attacked our 2016 election to help Donald Trump and Donald Trump welcomed that help,” Warren tweeted. Warren is the first Democratic presidential candidate to publicly support moving forward with impeachment proceedings against the president,  as many in her party have said they are not in favor. (📸: Getty)

David and Louise Turpin, who have 13 children, had pleaded guilty to shackling, torturing, beating and starving 12 of their children in squalid conditions in their home. The Turpins' then 17-year-old daughter escaped about a year ago and led authorities to the siblings, who were 2 to 29-years-old, but so malnourished and cognitively impaired that authorities initially believed they were all minors. Click the link in our bio for the full story. (📸: ABC7)

Carson says the new rule will reduce long waitlists for public housing for citizens. Housing advocates say all it will do is split up families with mixed immigration status. Read more details by clicking the link in our bio. (📸: Getty Images)

Lyra McKee, a Northern Irish journalist, was killed while covering riots on the eve of the 21st anniversary of the Good Friday Agreement. McKee’s work included examining the fallout of decades of violence in her country. Police have launched a murder inquiry into her death. (📸: Facebook/Getty Images)

Measles outbreaks are now active in 20 states, with 555 confirmed cases in the US this year alone, according to the CDC. All of the new US outbreaks originally derived from infections transmitted by travelers. And the booming anti-vaccine movement in the US and across the world is making it harder to keep it in check, public health experts say. Read more at the link in bio. (📷: CDC)

Jared Walter, 32, has been in and out of jail for years in connection with his offenses against women on the city's buses and trains. The registered sex offender has become known as the "TriMet Barber," and has officially been banned from local public transportation. It's the first time Portland's public transit system has issued a lifetime ban. (📷: Multnomah County Sheriff's Office/AP)

Barr held a presser ahead of the release of Mueller’s report, which Democrats criticized as political spin on the president’s behalf. The attorney general said that while Mueller had found multiple instances of potential obstruction of justice, Barr concluded there was not enough evidence to support finding Trump had broken the law. He also repeatedly used Trump's own language in his defense, including at one point saying the report had found "no collusion." (📷: Getty)

Nusrat Jahan Rafi, an 18-year-old student, went to police to accuse her principal of sexually harassing her. They filmed her accusation without her consent and leaked the video. Days later, attackers set her on fire, burning her so badly she died. Now multiple people have been arrested, and thousands are demanding justice. Check the link in our bio for more. (📸: Facebook, Getty Images)

Rose Collins said everyone has loved their awkward ‘80s engagement announcements. As for the wedding, the couple plans to marry in July 2021. Collins said she is sure they’ll have more tricks up their sleeve for the big day. “I'm really glad I found someone who is as ridiculous as I am," she said 🤓💍🤣 (📷: Matt Dutiel Creative)

Mueller ultimately declined to make a “prosecutorial judgment” about whether Trump committed obstruction offenses, choosing to submit his evidence and legal analysis on the issue to AG Bill Barr. Barr, after consulting with Justice Department officials, concluded that the evidence did not support finding that Trump committed a crime. Read more at the link in bio. (📷: Getty Images)

It was 70 degrees and chemistry major Jake Wolf (left) was so excited to wear shorts that he forgot his lab required pants. In "desperation mode" he started running back to his dorm, realized he wasn't going to make it, and spotted Sam Brown (right). “Dude, I need your pants,” Wolf told Brown. Brown said it all happened so fast that he just went along with it. After their classes, Brown and Wolf met up to swap bottoms. Wolf tucked $20 into the pocket as a thank-you👖😂 (📷: Jake Wolf/Sam Brown)

In an email obtained by BuzzFeed News, a staff doctor at Google wrote that a worker who had recently been in one of its Mountain View buildings had been diagnosed with measles. The dangerous virus was eliminated from the US in 2000 — but there are now 555 cases across 20 states, the CDC said this week. (📷: Getty Images)

The Traditional Arts and Ethnology Centre (TAEC) is asking @maxmara to pull the clothing, donate the proceeds to "an organization that advocates for the intellectual property rights of ethnic minorities," and to commit to never plagiarizing again. “These designs are not 'inspired by' or 'an interpretation of' Oma motifs; they are copied,” TAEC added ✂️💡🇱🇦 (📷: MaxMara/TAEC)

It’s a big deal: India is the company’s largest market, home to over 120 million of the app’s 500 million users. The app has been a viral hit in small Indian towns, where millions of people are getting access to the internet via smartphones for the first time. The ban has raised free speech concerns — read more at the link in bio. (📷: Getty)

Reporters at The Verge, Bloomberg, and CNBC said the larger screens on their Galaxy Fold review units failed. Beyoncé dropped a live Coachella album along with the "Homecoming" Netflix documentary — and it's available on all music streaming platforms. Tap the link in bio to read more and see the Hive's reaction 🐝 (📸: Spotify)

Jose Gonzalez Carranza was allowed back into the US five days after being deported to Mexico from his home and 12-year-old daughter in Arizona. Gonzalez Carranza entered the US illegally at 15, but was granted a reprieve after his wife, Army Private First Class Barbara Vieyra, was killed in Afghanistan in 2010. His lawyer says he doesn't know why Gonzalez Carranza's case was refiled, but he was never notified about an immigration hearing, where he was ordered removed from the US. Read more at the link in bio. (📸: Jose Gonzalez Carranza)

Police are reviewing whether an attack on Muhlaysia Booker by a man paid $200 to punch and kick her qualifies as a hate crime. The incident began after Booker accidentally backed into one of the suspect's car and attempted to flee. Booker suffered a fractured wrist, bruising and swelling of the face, and a concussion. Edward Thomas has been arrested and charged with aggravated assault, and police say they're working to identify additional suspects. (📸: AP/Facebook)

It took nearly 400 firefighters 9 hours to fully extinguish the fire. The cathedral's structure and main artworks were preserved, and experts will now establish the damage. French billionaires and major companies, including Apple, have already pledged at least 600 million euros to help reconstruct the Notre Dame. (📸: Getty Images)

“The Queen of Tejano music” was shot by the president of her fan club in 1995, after she accused the woman, Yolanda Saldívar, of embezzling money. The Mexican-American singer had hits like “Como La Flor” and “Bidi Bidi Bom Bom,” and was portrayed by Jennifer Lopez in the biopic “Selena.” 🎤🌹 (📸: AP)

The boy was part of a group of boys who planned to take a selfie in the girl’s bathroom as a form of “protest” against a student — transitioning from female to male — who posted a selfie from the boy’s bathroom. The Notre Dame Cathedral caught fire Monday, causing catastrophic damage. Here's a look back at one of Paris’s most historic landmarks. For more photos, tap the link in our bio. (📷: AP/Reuters/Photo12/Getty/Print Collector)

Within hours of the Notre Dame Cathedral fire, François-Henri Pinault and his family pledged 100 million euros to help reconstruct it. Sanders' tax returns from the past 10 years were released by his campaign aides for the first time Monday, and show he earned more than $2.7 million from 2016 through 2018. (📸: Getty)

In response to Trump's tweet that tanker jets should be used to extinguish the blaze at Notre Dame, French officials batted down his suggestion with a tweet in English, explaining the water force could destroy the cathedral. The fire posed a unique challenge for firefighters as they tried to save the 13th Century structure, but firefighters were able to save both towers. (📸:AP)

"Everything is burning, nothing will remain from the frame," a church spokesman said of the fire, which broke out before 7 p.m. local time and occurred as the historic cathedral was undergoing renovations. No deaths have been reported as the cathedral was closed to the public at the time, and the cause of the fire is unknown. (📸: Getty)

"The firefighters of Paris are trying to control the flames," the city's mayor wrote. "We are mobilized on the ground, in close collaboration with the Paris diocese." This is a developing story. Check the link in our bio for updates. (📷: AFP/Getty)
