Marvin Hajos was attacked by either one or two cassowary birds, which can be up to 6 feet tall and are considered one of the most dangerous birds in the world. Hajos, 75, owned the farm where the incident occurred. (📸: Mark Ralston / AFP / Getty/ Brave Wilderness)
HBO released the trailer, which revealed that the show will officially premiere on Sunday, June 9th. Tap the link in bio to watch the full trailer. (📸: HBO)

Glover, aka Childish Gambino, gave a moving speech about living in the moment. "I lost my dad this year, we lost Nipsey, we lost Mac. What I'm starting to realize, all we really have is memories at the end of the day, that's all we are." (📸: Getty)

Swift has changed her profile photos on social media to an image of pastel pink clouds, resembling other images she’s posted to Instagram, and put a countdown clock on her website and IG story. It all suggests ... something is coming on April 26 👀 (📸: Getty Images/@taylorswift)

Photographer @winniewow collaborated with costume designer @marieyan to make a collection of unique and fashionable dog cones, reminiscent of the typical “cone of shame.” Au has used these portraits to ask for donations to New York City’s Animal Haven Shelter 🙌🐶 (📸: @winniewow)

Parents should stop using the Rock 'N Play sleeper immediately, federal regulators said. On April 5, the Consumer Product Safety Commission and Fisher-Price said they didn't believe the sleeper was dangerous if used correctly: before infants were 3 months old and could turn over on their own. At that time, 10 deaths had been linked to the sleeper. Since then, that number has been updated to over 30. (📷: USPSC/Fisher Price)

In Lebanon's fractured political scene, banners supporting various parties and candidates can be found hanging around the capital. It was in that spirit that architect Faysal Timrawi said he decided to hang a few of his own. “We were just waiting and counting the days for the final season to show up,” he added 🐉👏 (📷: Z_iad via Twitter)

The Pentagon has used a rhetorical sleight of hand to insist the new policy doesn’t actually ban transgender people, arguing soldiers can simply pretend they’re not and serve as their birth sex. But it is certainly a ban. “We are pleased,” the Pentagon told BuzzFeed News. Read more at the link in bio. (📷: Akira Wyatt/Getty/Alivia Stehlik)

Johnny Bobbitt Jr, who conspired with a New Jersey couple to devise a GoFundMe scam around him giving his last $20 to help a woman with car trouble, was sentenced to five years probation. Bobbitt must also complete an in-patient drug treatment program and cooperate with prosecutors in their cases against his alleged co-conspirators. If he breaks any part of the plea deal, he will go to jail. (📷: GoFundMe/AP)

The trailer for "The Rise Of Skywalker" dropped during a panel at Star Wars Celebration Chicago 2019, which was hosted by Stephen Colbert. Carrie Fisher, who died in 2016, will still appear in the movie as Princess Leia, using unseen footage from “The Force Awakens.” Watch the trailer at the link in our bio. (📸: Lucasfilm)

Don Cheadle — aka War Machine — told Jimmy Kimmel that he, Ruffalo, and Tom Holland all wear a "very revealing" unitard while filming. To stay covered up, Ruffalo "invented this cloth that sort of comes down in the front and in the back," Cheadle said. (📸: Marvel)

"Boy With Luv" is the title track of their album "Map Of The Soul: Persona" and parallels @bts.bighitofficial's 2014 song "Boy In Luv". It features two rap breaks, one from Suga and another from RM. A South Korean court deemed the law that made abortion a crime unconstitutional. Under the ruling, the country’s parliament has until the end of 2020 to revise the law or it will become null and void. Under the current law, women who have abortions can be fined and imprisoned. Follow @world for more from around the globe 🌍🇰🇷⚖️

Aaron Parmar was on duty the night of the Manchester attack. Parmar is now raising money for the victims, running 22 10km races to commemorate each person who died. Amelia Mae Thompson, a 13-year-old survivor, had been supporting his fundraising on Twitter. When he saw her tweet that she was going to the Shawn Mendes concert alone, he arranged with Amelia’s mom to take her. “It was important for me to do that because she feels safe with me because I’m a fireman, it’s part of my job,” he said 👏❤️ (📷: Aaron Parmar)

Authorities said physical evidence from the scene tied 21-year-old Holden Matthews to the crimes. The suspect has been charged with three counts of arson on religious buildings. The three St. Landry Parish churches burned to the ground within 10 days of each other. (📷: AP)
"Nipsey saw potential. He saw hope. He saw a community that even through its flaws taught him to always keep going," Obama wrote. Visit the link in our bio for more. (📸: @karencivil)

The Wikileaks founder was dramatically dragged from Ecuador's London embassy, where he spent nearly seven years. He was arrested for his alleged role in "one of the largest compromises of classified information" in American history, the US Justice Department said. (📸: Getty)

Amazon says "an extremely small sample of Alexa voice recordings" is annotated by employees, and reviewing the audio helps “train our speech recognition” so Alexa can better understand requests. Recordings are associated with the customer's first name, device serial number, and an account number. (📸: Getty Images)

Republican Gov. Mike DeWine says he will sign the "heartbeat bill" banning abortion after the fetus’s heartbeat can be heard — usually after about six weeks of pregnancy. Opponents point out that the bill has no exceptions for the cases of rape or incest, and some women may not even know they're pregnant at six weeks. The Ohio legislature has passed similar bills twice before, but Gov. John Kasich vetoed it both times. (📸: AP, Getty)

Tom Holland has a reputation for giving away spoilers (ahem, Spiderman,) so "Endgame" director Joe Russo said Holland was not given the full script to the newest Avengers movie to avoid accidentally spoiling anything. (📸: Getty Images/@tomholland2013)

Kardashian West, who helped free Alice Marie Johnson from prison last year, told Vogue she’s studying 18 hours a week to become a lawyer and plans to take the Bar Exam in 2022. The reality star has been working on an apprenticeship with a law firm since last summer, and said her experience with Johnson inspired her to change the criminal justice system. (📸: @voguemagazine)

The series will air in 2020 on Apple TV, @sussexroyal confirmed. It will focus on “inspiring viewers to have an honest conversation about the challenges each of us faces, and how to equip ourselves with the tools to not simply survive, but to thrive.” 👑🎥 (📷: Getty Images)

A woman in Oregon told 911 she saw shadows under her bathroom door, and authorities said “rustling” noises could be heard. Deputies surrounded the house, and after multiple commands for the suspect to come out were ignored, police opened the bathroom door...only to discover the Roomba. (📸: Washington County Sheriff’s Office)

You're looking at the first ever image of a black hole, which scientists released Wednesday. It resides 55 million light-years from Earth in a galaxy known as Messier 87, and has a mass 6.5 billion times that of the sun, according to the National Science Foundation. (📸: @nsfgov)
The trailer gave us new looks at Beyoncé’s Nala and Chiwetel Ejiofor’s Scar. Watch the full trailer at the link in our bio 🦁✨ (📸: Disney)

The series is a follow-up to 2016's "The Young Pope," which starred Law as the sovereign of the Vatican City State. Law's Pope Pius XIII is a deeply conservative character on the show, but it seems — at least in these stills — that he's relaxed a bit 🎬👀 (📷: Ciao/Ciao Pix/BACKGRID)

The 16 parents have been accused of laundering bribe money through the Key Worldwide Foundation, which prosecutors say was set up as a front by the scam's ringleader, William “Rick” Singer. They've also been accused of transferring money into the US from overseas. (📷: Getty)

Wheeler, a former coal lobbyist, has been serving as the EPA’s acting administrator since Scott Pruitt resigned amid multiple ethics investigations. Under Wheeler’s watch, the agency has continued his predecessor’s plans to roll back environmental rules. (📷: Getty Images)

The lack of a deal came as a surprise, and a previously scheduled lunch and signing ceremony were canceled. “Sometimes you have to walk, this was one of those times,” Trump said at a press conference after the summit ended. (📸: Getty Images)

Cohen said his concern that Trump wouldn't cede power peacefully if he lost the next election was one of the reasons he decided to testify before the House Committee on Oversight and Reform: "Given my experience working for Mr. Trump, I fear that if he loses the election in 2020 that there will never be a peaceful transition of power," Cohen said. (📷: AP)

Howard “Matt” Webb was arrested after a Facebook video allegedly showed him placing his testicles on a food order being delivered by a friend, supposedly in retaliation for an 89-cent tip. The delivery company, Dinner Delivered, said it terminated the driver and contacted police. Webb could face a possible sentence of 3 to 15 years in prison. (📸: Maryville Police Department, Facebook)

The popular lip-synching karaoke app faced allegations that it did not ask for parents’ consent for sign-ups, which is required for online services to collect data from users under 13. Starting today, users under 13 will also not be able to share their videos on the platform, comment on others' videos, message with users, or maintain a profile or follows. (📸: Getty)

Michael Cohen testified that he threatened Fordham University, which Trump attended for two years, with legal action if it released Trump's grades and SAT scores to the media without his consent. A letter to Fordham also requested that the school "permanently seal" Trump's records. (📸: AP)

The six-episode series will air on Fox and star Tori Spelling, Jennie Garth, Jason Priestley, Gabrielle Carteris, and Brian Austin Green playing themselves getting ready to revive the hit ’90s show. Shannen Doherty and Luke Perry are the only two original cast members who won’t be returning. (📷: Getty)

Detric McGowan was arrested by the DEA the same day a photo of him with Girl Scouts, from whom he bought $540 worth of cookies so they could get out of the cold, went viral. McGowan is accused of trafficking heroin and fentanyl, among other charges. (📸: Facebook)

Thompson wrote the letter to announce she was stepping down from the animated film "Luck" in response to the hiring of John Lasseter, the Pixar cofounder accused of sexual misconduct. "If people who have spoken out — like me — do not take this sort of a stand then things are very unlikely to change at anything like the pace required to protect my daughter’s generation.” (📸: Getty)

The National Resources Management Act would protect millions of acres of land and rivers across the US and create over 1 million acres of new wilderness and four national monuments in California, Utah, Mississippi, and Kentucky. The act received overwhelming support from both parties in both chambers and now heads to Trump, who is reportedly expected to sign it 🏞🌲 (📸: AP)

There have been nearly 6,000 reports of sexual abuse involving unaccompanied immigrant children while in US custody in the last four years. Allegations include facility staff members touching minors’ genitals, showing children porn, and kissing them. Documents show 178 allegations of sexual abuse by staff members on minors and at least 833 allegations of unaccompanied children sexually abusing other children. (📸: AP)

Lil Xan’s girlfriend, Annie Smith, claims to be about nine weeks pregnant and shared the ultrasound photos in a recent YouTube video, but internet sleuths say that Googling phrases such as “week 9 ultrasound" turn up photos bearing a close remembrance to the ones Smith showed. (📸: Annie Smith via YouTube)

The rotund rodent was found stuck on Sunday in Germany. “She had a lot of winter flab and was stuck fast at her hip,” an animal rescuer told local media, according to the BBC. A whole team of firefighters eventually had to be called to free the poor little thing 🐀😭 (📷: Berufstierrettung Rhein Neckar)
Jeremy Rupke noticed his 4-year-old son Mason was always chatting away at hockey practice, so he decided to put a microphone on him. The results are absolutely adorable 👨‍👦🏒 (📸: YouTube)
The baby humpback whale was found with birds scavenging its carcass about 50 feet away from the ocean in Brazil, according to the Bicho D'agua Institute 🐋 (📸: @bicho_dagua)

Following Singapore Airlines and American Airlines passengers’ privacy concerns over cameras spotted in seat-back entertainment displays, United Airlines and Delta have confirmed that some of their screens also include camera lenses. While the world debates whether women like Shamima Begum (left) should go home, Yazidi women who survived sexual slavery and genocide perpetrated by ISIS say “ISIS brides” participated in torturing and abusing them and need to be held accountable for their crimes. “In some cases, [the wives] were the ones who made women shower and put on clean clothes and makeup before they were brought to the men to be raped,” said Pari Ibrahaim (right), who leads an advocacy group for Yazidi survivors. “Period. End Of Sentence.” won Best Documentary Short. It follows women in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh as they try to fight the taboo around periods and distribute pads in their village. Lady Gaga follows in the footsteps of Barbra Streisand, who also won the same award for her iteration of “A Star Is Born.” Gaga was also nominated in the Best Actress category for her role as Ally in the film, which garnered a total of seven nominations 🌟🎶 (📷: Getty Images)

Mahershala Ali became the first black actor and Muslim man to win two #Oscars in the Best Supporting Actor category. Ali, who previously won for his role in “Moonlight,” joins Denzel Washington as the only two black people to win multiple acting Oscars. The longtime costume designer shouted out director Spike Lee, who she thanked for giving her a start in the industry. ”Marvel may have created the first black superhero, but through costume design, we turned him into an African king,” she said 🏆✊🏾 (📷: AP/ Marvel Studios)
They might've been shafted on the nominations this year, but this regal cast did NOT come to the #Oscars to play 😍 (📷: Getty Images)

Neighbors told the Greenville News that Nancy Cherryl Burgess-Dismuke often played with her boxer-mixes outside her home. They ran to help when they heard screaming and used tools to beat the dogs away and get her to safety. “One arm was already bit completely off, the other arm was barely hanging on by a piece of meat,” one neighbor said. Burgess-Dismuke lost a large amount of blood and went into cardiac arrest at the hospital. The dogs are scheduled to be euthanized. (📷: WYFF)

R. Kelly was arrested Friday after being charged with aggravated criminal sexual abuse. Kelly was also barred from communicating with any of his four alleged victims and was told he could not have any relations with anyone aged 18 years old or younger. (📸: Chicago Police are)

Kaling posted “Funniest shit ever,” along with a photo of her ticket. The post was met with a flood of comments, with many fans criticizing her. “I am a champion of women. Yna Sertalf says she’s been told that she resembles Rihanna since she was a teenager. “I’ve heard it for a long time and sometimes people ask to take pictures with me when I go out,” she told BuzzFeed News. (📸: Getty Images/@ynasertalf)

The singer turned himself in to police Friday night, and is scheduled to appear for a bond hearing Saturday. Allegations against Kelly date back to the ’90s, including the alleged sexual assaults of underage girls, and Kelly could face years in prison if convicted. (📸: Getty)

The NYC Commission on Human Rights says the guidelines will predominately protect black people who have been discriminated against for their natural hair. It identifies black people's rights to wear "locs, cornrows, twists, braids, Bantu knots, fades, Afros, and/or the right to keep hair in an uncut or untrimmed state." (📷: NYCCHR)

Justice Ginsburg participated in oral arguments for the first time in more than two months since undergoing surgery for lung cancer late last year. Ginsburg worked from home and recovered throughout January, participating in a handful of votes. (📸: Getty Images)

Little did they know, local station WBTV coordinated with Chappelle to surprise the couple with dinner and four tickets to the show: "Always get your tickets from reliable sources,” Chappelle said. Heather Lundberg Green staged the shoot to celebrate her son Adrian Brown’s 20th birthday as well as him coming out as trans. When Dalton Mort married her high school sweetheart, she knew she wanted her daughter to be part of the big day – so she ended up carrying 2-year-old Ellora down that aisle on her back. According to a local journalist attending the musical, people were “screaming and running” and “shouts of ‘gun’ could be heard.” Three people were injured as a result of the pandemonium, one with a broken leg and the other two with moderate injuries. (📸: Hamilton Musical)

Several other people, including five police officers, were injured. The gunman, identified as Gary Martin, was reportedly an employee of the plant and was killed by responding officers. (📸: AP)

Twenty-eight students were taken to hospitals on Valentine's Day after complaining of nausea and disorientation. Underwood apologized for leaving a charity event in California early, saying he was "grabbed and touched inappropriately" by fans. The event had been advertised as a meet and greet opportunity, but Underwood said he "didn’t sign up to be a piece of meat or a zoo animal." (📸: Getty)

After the UK prime minister said 15,000 UK students who boycotted school to demonstrate “wastes lesson time,” the 16-year-old girl who inspired the protest movement replied, “political leaders have wasted 30 [years] of inaction.” (📸: Getty Images)

Amazon’s deal to build a headquarters in Queens faced blacklash from activists and lawmakers over the $3 billion in tax incentives offered by the city. We went to the neighborhood where Amazon was supposed to move in and asked people for their messages to Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos.

Declaring a national emergency could allow Trump to build a border wall without congressional approval. Five months after Prime Time Sports in Colorado started selling Nike goods at half-price “until its all gone,” the store’s owner said he was going out of business. “I really doubt that I can survive without Nike,” Stephen Martin told local news. (📸: Getty Images/Stephen Martin)
“Empire” actor Jussie Smollett says he’s “pissed off” by people who doubt he was attacked. The Chicago Police Department and FBI are investigating the incident as a possible hate crime. (📷ABC)

Opportunity was killed by a massive dust storm. It was originally meant to survive for only three months, and survived beyond NASA’s wildest expectations. It is survived by the Curiosity rover, which is exploring a crater for signs of past habitable conditions on Mars. (📷: NASA)

Jesse Pinkman lives! When we last saw him in the 2013 series finale, he was sobbing with joy after escaping a group of white supremacists. The new movie will air first on Netflix, then on AMC 🎬☣️ (📷: AMC)

Harris also said that she smoked marijuana in college. “I did inhale. Yes, it was a long time ago,” she admitted. Harris’s stance on marijuana legalization has evolved. Los Angeles police said suspects ransacked the home, and then fled. Representatives for Pacquiao believe it took place while the boxer was in the ring Saturday night. The 40-year-old welterweight fought Adrien Broner, winning a unanimous victory in 12 rounds. (📷: AP/Getty)

The WHO noted complacency, lack of access, and poor confidence in vaccines as key factors. Anti-vaxxers are threatening to reverse decades of progress made since the widespread implementation of immunization programs. Air pollution, humanitarian crises, and HIV also made the list. (📷: Getty)

The show occurred on Sunday when the sun, Earth, and moon aligned, creating a total lunar eclipse. The January full moon is known as the "wolf moon" — a name that comes from “The Old Farmer's Almanac,” which said it was the month when wolves howled at the moon 🌕 (📷: Getty/Reuters)

The founder and former CEO of the cult skin care brand Deciem was 40 years old. His cause of death is not yet known. Truaxe was ousted from Deciem in 2018 after posting a rambling video to Instagram in which he said the company was immediately shutting down and he accused his colleagues of being "involved in a major criminal activity." (📷: AP/Deciem)

Gigi Wu, 36, a Taiwanese woman known for climbing mountains in swimwear, died while hiking in central Taiwan. She used a satellite phone to call for help after falling down a 65-foot valley on Sunday, according to Taiwan Times, but bad weather delayed a rescue. (📸: Facebook)

Maryann Rolle, a restaurant owner on the Exuma Islands, lost tens of thousands of her savings following the failed festival. A spokesperson for GoFundMe confirmed the authenticity of the fundraiser to BuzzFeed News. (📸: Netflix)

Harris, a California senator and former state attorney general, made her announcement on "Good Morning America" on Martin Luther King Jr. Day — a clear signal that her presidential run is likely to embrace her identity as a black woman. Her campaign’s logo, her staff said, is inspired by the logo of Shirley Chisholm, the first black woman to run for president for a major party. (📸: Getty Images)

Maria Island’s unusually chilled-out wombats are getting swamped by tourists, according to @buzzfeedyarns. Tourism Tasmania is asking visitors to the island to sign a pledge to protect the wildlife and stop bothering the island’s wombats with selfies.(📷: Tourism Tasmania)

From the confirmation hearing of William Barr for US attorney general to a terrorist attack in Kenya, these are the most striking pictures from this past week. Follow @buzzfeedphoto for more 📸 (📷: Reuters/Getty/AP)

"Margaritaville" singer Jimmy Buffett performed the national anthem ahead of the NFC Championship Game in New Orleans, and uhhhhh...it was ~interesting~. Some people thought the singer might've been an impostor, and others respected Jimmy for just going for it. 🏈😂 (📷: Getty)

Fox News commentator Tomi Lahren tried to mock Cardi B over her recent video criticizing Trump for leaving thousands of federal workers without pay. The video went viral and at Women’s Marches events across the country on Saturday, marchers carried signs quoting Cardi’s comments. (📷: Getty)

Everyone has different ideas when it comes to acceptable dating behavior…We asked a bunch of people why they’ve ghosted someone they dated. Here are some of the responses. Share your 👻 stories in the comments if you dare.

Two women are seen in the viral Snapchat video, one of whom is applying black paint to her face and can be heard saying “I am a nigger” to the camera. The University of Oklahoma and Tri Delta have both publicly condemned the incident amid outrage from UO students and alumna. “To those students directly impacted by this senseless act of racism, we are deeply sorry, and we know that’s not enough,” Tri Delta’s chapter president said in a statement. (📷: gabbyhahaa via Twitter)

At least 81 people remain hospitalized, some with burns on more than 80% of their bodies, Mexico’s health minister said. Mexico is in the middle of a gas shortage, now in its second week, and in the hours before the explosion, thousands of people had reportedly gathered around the geyser of gas. Footage appeared to show soldiers guarding the pipeline as people helped themselves to gasoline. (📷: Getty)

US-born Marine Jilmar Ramos-Gomez was detained by the Kent County Sheriff’s Office for over an hour so he could be transferred to ICE custody, where he remained in custody for three days until his lawyer proved he was a US citizen. The sheriff’s office now says it will no longer detain people for ICE without a judicial warrant. (📸: Courtesy of the Gomez family)

An autopsy report found Meenakshi “Minaxi” Moorthy, 30, and Vishnu Viswanath, 29, were drunk when they died in October. The official investigation into their deaths is ongoing, but Viswanath’s brother said they set up a tripod to take a selfie on the cliff where they fell. (📸: College of Engineering, Chengannur)

Boo died in his sleep Friday at the age of 12. Over the last decade, Boo amassed a massive following on his Facebook page and was the subject of several books and other merchandise. (📸: @buddyboowaggytails)

The Pentagon has identified 3 of the 4 Americans killed in a suicide bombing in Syria: Navy Chief Petty Officer Shannon Kent, the first woman US service member killed in the fight against ISIS, Army Chief Warrant Officer 2 Jonathan Farmer, and Scott Wirtz, a Defense Department civilian. (📸: Reuters)

Jason Van Dyke was convicted of murder and sentenced to 81 months for firing 16 shots at Laquan McDonald in 2014. Dashcam video showed Van Dyke firing at the teen, who was seen armed with a knife, and continuing to shoot after he fell to the ground. (📸: Reuters)

Scottish ultramarathon runner Jasmin Paris became the first woman to win the grueling 268-mile nonstop Montane Spine Race in England this week, clocking in at 83 hours, 12 minutes, and 23 seconds. Paris, 35, crushed the course record by 12 hours, and was almost 10 miles ahead of the second-place runner, even after having to stop to pump breastmilk for her daughter. (📸: Montane Spine Race)

Sony Music’s RCA Records has opted to end its working relationship with Kelly, according to both Billboard and Variety. The recent documentary “Surviving R. Kelly” refocused public attention on decades-long claims that Kelly is a sexual predator and explored allegations first reported by BuzzFeed News in 2017 from parents who said he was holding their adult daughters in a sex “cult.” He is currently being investigated in Georgia and Illinois. (📷: AP)

The House Intelligence Committee will investigate the revelation that Trump ordered his personal attorney to lie about a potentially lucrative real estate project in Moscow. “The allegation that the President of the United States may have suborned perjury before our committee in an effort to curtail the investigation and cover up his business dealings with Russia is among the most serious to date,” committee chair Adam Schiff said in a statement. “We will do what’s necessary to find out if it’s true.” (📸: Getty Images)

BREAKING 🚨 Sources also say Trump, along with his children Ivanka and Donald Jr., received regular, detailed updates about the project from Cohen, even as Trump told the public he had no business deals with Russia. (📷: Reuters)

Cohen, Trump’s former personal lawyer who was recently sentenced to three years in prison, paid a private company called RedFinch to create a Twitter account and make it appear as if it were run by thirsty women tweeting about how amazing, sexy, selfless, and manly he is. (📷: Getty/WomenForCohen via Twitter)

In response to a bill that passed the House this week, the White House rejected the idea of extending disaster funding for food stamps in Puerto Rico. The measure would have provided $600 million for the island’s food stamp program to help provide for more Puerto Ricans in the aftermath of Hurricane Maria. (📷: AP)

Nancy Pelosi had been scheduled to go on a congressional delegation trip, and because members of Congress would travel via military aircraft, Trump has the power to nix their transportation. Trump’s decision comes one day after Pelosi sent a letter calling on him to delay his State of the Union address. Pelosi argued that Trump should hold off until the government shutdown is over. (📷: Getty)

The conviction hinged on the testimony of a jailhouse informant who allegedly told retired Chicago detective Reynaldo Guevara and his partner that Iglesias had confessed the murder to him. The informant has since given sworn statements claiming police fed him details of the crimes and coerced his false testimony. At least 17 more Guevara defendants who claim the detective framed them are still behind bars. (📷: Alyssa Schukar)

Superstar Cardi B posted an Instagram video calling the government shutdown “really fucking serious.” She called the country a “hellhole right now” and expressed sympathy for furloughed employees who “gotta go to fucking work to not get motherfucking paid.” Democratic senators liked the video, but struggled with whether or not to share her colorful language 🔥 (📸: @iamcardib)

A judge in Pittsford, New York had ordered Doug Lamb, 65, to write 10-year-old Julian Moore an apology for crashing the Range Rover he was driving into Julian and then leaving the scene before police arrived. The boy was wearing a helmet and only suffered scrapes and bruises, his mother said. (📸: Courtesy of Jenny Moore)

With a majority of the MSU community board pushing for his resignation, John Engler submitted an 11-page letter Wednesday announcing his plan to step down while also defending his one-year tenure. (📷: Getty Images)

The siege at the Dusit complex, which began Tuesday, is now over. The National Police Service said five terrorists, thought to be al-Shabaab militants, had been “eliminated.” Victims confirmed so far include two Kenyans of Somali descent who worked in the aid sector, and an American cofounder of a global investment company. A police officer was also killed. (📷: Getty)

Carell will again team up with the executive producers of “The Office” to create the comedy. Trump announced his plan for a “space force” in 2018 without much detail on what it would entail, when it would be established, how it would function, and other key details. Just like the real life space force, there is no word yet on when “Space Force” the series will premiere on Netflix. (📷: Getty)

Second Lady Karen Pence will be teaching art twice a week at Immanuel Christian School, where she previously taught during her husband’s tenure in Congress. As part of the school’s admission process, parents of prospective students must sign an agreement that states that the school will refuse enrollment to students and families who are “participating in, supporting, or condoning sexual immorality, homosexual activity or bi-sexual activity, promoting such practices, or being unable to support the moral principles of the school.” (📷: AP)
We tried making a flowchart explaining the shitshow that is British politics right now 🇬🇧 🔥

A security company discovered a susceptible website on Epic Games’ domain that could be used to capture authentication tokens, which would allow hackers to log into Fortnite accounts without usernames or passwords. Epic says they’ve patched the vulnerability. (📸: Getty Images)

The singer filed a federal lawsuit Tuesday against her father, Ronald Fenty, alleging he and his business partner "fraudulently misrepresented" that their company, Fenty Entertainment, is affiliated with her and have "used these lies in a fraudulent effort to solicit millions of dollars from unsuspecting third parties." (📷: Getty)

With no clear signs of when the government would reopen, IRS officials said they would not let a lack of funds prevent Americans from getting their 2018 tax refunds. But that means an unprecedented number of IRS staff will be required to work without pay. “We work to help the taxpayers… We feel like we’re doing a good service to our country and our fellow citizens. And then to be shut down like this without knowing when our next paycheck is coming, it’s really heartbreaking,” IRS worker Jenny Brown said. (📷: Getty)
Gillibrand, a third-term New York Senator, is one of several Democrats who have already taken steps to run against President Donald Trump in 2020. (📷: AP)

A Manhattan judge ruled that asking people whether they are a citizen “was unlawful for a multitude of independent reasons and must be set aside.” State and local governments, along with many advocacy groups, sued over the question, alleging it would deter participation in the once-a-decade survey, thereby undermining the purpose of the census. (📷: Reuters)

Channing’s trademark was her distinctive, oft-parodied voice, which helped her create her most iconic role, Dolly Levi in the musical “Hello, Dolly!” She was also known for her roles in “Gentlemen Prefer Blondes,” “Alice in Wonderland,” and “Thoroughly Modern Millie.” She died of natural causes and is survived by her son Chan Lowe. (📷: Getty)

Her withdrawal agreement was opposed by 432 votes to 202, a historic margin of 230. The Labour party leader Jeremy Corbyn is expected to immediately call a vote of no confidence in the government. While May is expected to survive, defeat in that vote – which might come as soon as Wednesday – could force a general election. (📷: Reuters)

The price changes will roll out for current US subscribers over the next few months, and to new Netflix members immediately. This is the second time in less than 15 months Netflix has increased its prices, with a previous hike in October 2017 🍿 💸 (📸: AP)

Bryan Duane Stewart was arrested for aggravated battery and aggravated assault after allegedly targeting a neighbor named Jessie James Hunter with the knife. Hunter told police he believed Stewart attempted to attack him in retaliation for his asking Stewart to “keep it down.” (📷: Santa Rosa County Jail Log)

TSA agents are among the federal employees not being paid during the partial federal government shutdown. But because they are considered an essential service, agents are expected to continue working, despite missing their Jan. 11 paycheck. Typically, federal employees are paid retroactively once a shutdown is over, but in the meantime, the agency says the number of TSA agents not showing up for their shifts has doubled. (📷: Getty)

The Clemson Tigers were invited after winning the national championship, but because of the government shutdown there was no food to feed them. President Trump decided he would feed them “great American food,” which included McDonald’s, Wendy’s, and Burger King. Trump said he was “personally paying” for the meal himself. 🍔🍟 (📷: Getty)

Faith Rodgers, who participated in Lifetime’s “Surviving R. Kelly” documentary, says the singer is retaliating against her by threatening to reveal details of her sex life. In a 2018 lawsuit, Rodgers accused Kelly of “mentally, sexually, and verbally” abusing her. She has also claimed he knowingly gave her a sexually transmitted disease. (📷: Getty/AP)

Neomi Rao, who’s nominated for Justice Brett Kavanaugh’s former seat on the DC Circuit, once wrote that “a good way to avoid a potential date rape is to stay reasonably sober.” In several op-eds she penned between 1994 and 1996 while at Yale, she described race as a “hot, money-making issue,” affirmative action as the “anointed dragon of liberal excess,” welfare as being for “for the indigent and lazy,” and LGBT issues as part of “trendy” political movements. (📷: Sipa USA via AP)

Elliott has written for some of the most popular musicians in the industry during her decadeslong career. “I am so humbly grateful to now be inducted,” the legendary rapper wrote on Twitter. 🎶 🌟 (📸: Getty Images)

The last immigrant child held inside the “tent city" in Tornillo was released Friday, government contractors said. The camp was opened in June 2018 as a result of Trump “zero tolerance" policy. As of December, the facility held about 2,800 teens, many of whom were separated from their parents who crossed the border illegally. The vast majority of the children were released to sponsors, including family, and about 300 were transferred to other facilities operated by the Office of Refugee Resettlement. (📷: Reuters)

The egg on @world_record_egg’s account has been liked over 19 million times. Until the egg burst on to the scene, this picture (swipe 👈) posted last February by Kylie Jenner announcing her daughter's name, Stormi Webster, had held the record for most-liked photo on Instagram. BuzzFeed News reached out to the egg account, and the account holder replied that it was being run by "Henrietta" — a chicken from the British countryside 🥚🚨 (📷: @world_record_egg/ Getty)

The victims overdosed on what appeared to be the synthetic opioid drug fentanyl. Police said first responders arrived after receiving a 911 call from a residence in the Chico area and administered CPR and naloxone, a narcotic overdose treatment, at the scene. Fentanyl is a lab-made substances, 30 to 50 times more potent than nonsynthetic heroin. (📷: Getty/Reuters)

Alex Jones will have to turn over tax returns, business plans, and marketing data, a judge ordered. Families of the Sandy Hook victims are suing Jones, saying he pushed conspiracy theories to get rich. (📷: Getty Images)

This plain photo of an egg is the only post on @world_record_egg’s account, and was published Jan. 4. The egg post crossed 10 million likes by 11am ET Sunday. Its goal is 18.1 million likes, a record set when Jenner posted a photo announcing her daughter’s name, Stormi Webster. ♥🥚 (📸: @world_record_egg / Getty Images)

A story published by UK tabloid the Daily Star drew widespread controversy over Johnson’s alleged criticism of “Generation Snowflake.” The actor said in an Instagram video the interview “never took place, never happened, I never said any of those words.” The tabloid did not say why the story was removed. (📸: Getty Images)

Protesters rallied for a second time this week to amplify the #MuteRKelly movement after the airing of "Surviving R. Kelly", a documentary detailing decades of sexual misconduct claims against him, including the allegation that he holds women in a cult, first reported by BuzzFeed News. Protesters chanted "R. Kelly, your time is up!" and "Black girls matter!" while two cars flaunting "R. Kelly We (heart) U" signs played his music, according to Chicago Tribune video. The protests came after Illinois officials denied a permit for an upcoming concert set hosted by the singer. (📷: Getty)

Castro, the former Obama-era housing and urban development secretary, could likely be one of the only Latino candidates in what's expected to be a crowded field for Democrats in 2020. “The challenge for me is to articulate a strong vision for the future that includes everybody,” he told BuzzFeed News. “At the same time, right now the Latino community feels attacked by this administration, and so of course there’s a special significance to me standing up on that stage.” Castro is one of the first Democrats to officially jump into the presidential race. Rep. Tulsi Gabbard announced her campaign on Saturday and Sen. Elizabeth Warren has formed an exploratory committee ahead of a likely campaign. (📷: MediaPunch)

13-year-old Jayme Closs was found alive on Thursday three months after her parents were murdered. Her aunt and now legal guardian posted the photo to social media on Friday after Closs was medically cleared and reunited with her family. "She is so glad to be home. And she is obviously thrilled to have her dog. Her dog was everything to her," a family friend told People magazine. "She wanted a dog forever. She had begged and begged [her mother] Denise to get a dog. And finally, Denise caved." (📷: Jennifer Smith)

It's the 22nd day of the partial shutdown. (The previous record: 21 days in December 1995 during Clinton's presidency, affected only a third as many workers.) During the history-making moment, Congress was empty as lawmakers returned home for the weekend, and Trump and Democratic leaders remained divided over border wall funding. About 800,000 federal workers have now missed their first paycheck, TSA workers are calling in sick in droves, and the organization tasked with stabilizing the spike in asylum claims has been largely shut down. (📷: Reuters)

The publisher, Chooseco, is suing over the latest “Black Mirror” special, alleging that Netflix unlawfully used the publisher’s intellectual property and caused “reputational harm” to the tune of $25 million. Chooseco says Netflix is attempting to “capitalize on viewers’ nostalgia” from the 1980s and 90s, but the publisher objects to the association with the violence in the movie. (📷: Chooseco/Netflix)

When the “We The People Will Build the Wall” campaign was created in December, Brian Kolfage set an ambitious $1 billion goal and pledged to refund all the money himself if the target was not met. However, in an update today, Kolfage wrote that rather than donating the $20 million raised to the federal government, it would instead be handed over to a private non-profit he said he had established in order to construct a wall himself. As a result, GoFundMe is refunding the donations made by hundreds of thousands of people. (📷: GoFundMe)

Buku Abi, who was previously known as Joann Kelly, said on her Instagram story that she was speaking out to make it clear that her long standing silence on her estranged father should not be interpreted as her condoning his alleged behavior. She wrote, “The same monster you are all confronting me about is my father. I am well aware of who and what he is. I grew up in that house. My choice to not speak on him and what he does is for my peace of mind. My emotional state. And for my healing.” (📷: @bu.k.u/Getty)

The 18-year-old girl caught the world’s attention with her live tweets about fleeing her allegedly abusive family and fighting deportation by barricading herself in a Thai hotel room. The UN assessed her claims and recognized her as a refugee after her social media campaign, #saverahaf, went viral. Justin Trudeau said on Friday that Canada would grant her asylum: “Canada has been unequivocal that we will always stand up for human rights and women’s rights around the world.” (📷: HRW/Phil Robertson via Twitter)

13-year-old Jayme Closs was found Thursday, three months after her parents were killed in their house and she went missing. Authorities say she escaped from a remote area and found a woman walking her dog, who immediately recognized her. Investigators believe Closs was the target of Jake Thomas Patterson and that he killed her parents during the abduction, police said. (📷: Barron County Sheriff’s Department)

Fret, called the “first openly gay pioneer” of Latin trap music,  died after being shot in San Juan. The 24-year-old was riding a motorbike when he was shot eight times at around 5:30 a.m. local time, according to El Nuevo Día. (📸: Kevin Fret / YouTube)

The Barron County Sheriff's Office in Wisconsin said Jayme Closs was found by deputies in Douglas County, and a suspect was taken into custody. The girl disappeared in October after her parents were killed in their home. A 911 call had been placed from the house, but no one communicated with dispatchers. When deputies checked the home, they found evidence of gunshots and James Closs and Denise Closs dead. Their daughter was not found. (📷: Barron County Sheriff's Office)

Matthew Herrick’s ex, identified only as “J.C.,” created fake profiles on Grindr and sent men seeking sex and drugs to Herrick’s apartment and workplace. Herrick says that despite hundreds of complaints, Grindr looked the other way while his ex tormented him. “It was like an episode of ‘Black Mirror,'” he said. J.C. is facing criminal charges, while Herrick continues to fight Grindr in appeals court. (📷: Getty/Larry Hamilton)

Austin McBroom, the dad from the popular ACE Family YouTube channel, apparently posted a video showing a little girl in a store asking him to purchase the adult-themed candy. “She said she was going to steal it if I didn’t buy it, so better me buy it,” McBroom claimed in the video, laughing throughout. (📷: @austinmcbroom)

Lady Gaga posted the statement to Twitter apologizing for working with R. Kelly on her 2013 song "Do What U Want," writing that she stands by "anyone who has been a victim of sexual assault." She attributed her work with Kelly to her own experience with sexual assault and her failure to adequately address the trauma it caused her. (📸: Getty Images)

Nick Vallelonga, the producer and Golden Globe-winning co-screenwriter of “Green Book,” has deleted his Twitter account following backlash to the 2015 tweet. The tweet appears to reference when Trump claimed that he had seen “thousands and thousands” of people in Jersey City cheering the towers coming down. No footage or credible reports have ever corroborated those claims. (📷: Getty/Patti Perret)

Dalton Tannehill started chatting on Grindr with a sugar daddy who claimed he could help him with his credit card debt. After some convincing, Tannehill gave James his bank login and Social Security number. But the sugar daddy turned out to be a scammer. When Tannehill realized what had happened, he contacted his bank and tried to file an identity theft report with the Federal Trade Commission. However, because of the partial government shutdown, which has so far lasted 19 days, he can’t. (📷: Dalton Tannehill)

Buckey Wolfe allegedly admitted to police that he stabbed his brother with a sword. Responding officers found James Wolfe dead with the weapon “still protruding from his head.” A Facebook profile appearing to belong to Buckey often posted about Christianity, Trump, and QAnon conspiracy theories. Some QAnon supporters believe that global elites are lizard people. “God told me he was a lizard,” Buckey told 911. (📷: Buckey Wolfe/James Wolfe via Facebook)

The alleged victim told police she had gone to the bathroom of a bar when she was approached by Jessica Fowler and Amber Nicole Harrell, who allegedly exposed themselves, groped her, and verbally abused her. The woman said the assault continued at the bar after they left the bathroom, and the two women wouldn’t stop touching her after being asked twice by a bartender who had noticed what was happening. The women have been charged with kidnapping and sexual battery. (📷: Raleigh/Wake City-County)

The NYPD has closed its investigations into complaints that Batali sexually assaulted two women in 2004 and 2005. One woman said she blacked out after drinking at Babbo — one of Batali’s Manhattan restaurants — and when she woke up, the chef was raping her. Another woman alleged that Batali sexually assaulted her in 2005 at the Spotted Pig, where Batali was a partner. The woman said she blacked out after drinking with the chef and she woke up with a “very deeply wounded leg” and semen on her skirt. (📷: AP)

Jeff Bezos and his wife MacKenzie, the world’s richest couple, announced they are splitting up after 25 years of marriage. The couple married while working at a New York-based hedge fund in the early ’90s. (📸: AP Images)

"I'm done with it. It gets no more energy from me," Kevin Hart said on "Good Morning America." Hart repeatedly told host Michael Strahan that he had "addressed" his anti-gay jokes in the late 2000s and when the comments resurfaced when he was named as Oscars host last year. (📸: John Nacion/STAR MAX/IPx)

A gambling site offered odds on whether Trump would lie at least four times during his eight-and-a-half minute Oval Office address. An odds consultant told BuzzFeed News he expects the site to lose $276,424 as 92% of bettors wagered Trump would lie a lot. (📸: AP)

Trump delivered a national address on Tuesday to push for funding to build his wall. The president said funding for the wall was crucial and called on Congress to close what he called “border security loopholes.” The situation at the US-Mexico border, however, is much more nuanced. Here is what’s actually going on 👆(📷: BuzzFeed News)

The sisters allegedly stabbed their mother, Ericka Hall, multiple times and shot her once in the chest with a small-caliber handgun inside the family’s home. They also allegedly tried earlier in the week to run her over with a car. Amariyona Hall, 14, who is being charged as an adult, and her younger sister, who has not been identified because she is being charged as a juvenile, were both charged with murder. (📷: Pike County Sheriff’s Office/Ericka Hall via Facebook)

Cast members include Georgie Henley, who played Lucy in the “Chronicles of Narnia” films, Jamie Campbell Bower and Toby Regbo from “Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald,” and Ivanno Jeremiah, who starred in “Black Mirror.” HBO hasn’t specified what roles the actors are playing. The show will take place thousands of years before the events of “Game of Thrones,” depicting the descent into the darkest hour of the golden Age of Heroes. (📷: HBO)

Georgia officials are reaching out to people who appeared in “Surviving R. Kelly,” a documentary series that detailed sexual abuse allegations against the R&B singer. Kelly has also been accused of pursuing sexual relationships with underage girls and was acquitted on child pornography charges in 2008. (📷: Getty)

Consumer Electronics Show organizers picked a sex toy called Osé as one its honorees in the robotics and drones Innovation Awards program. But two weeks later, they disqualified the device and banned its exhibition at the event. The Osé was developed in partnership with an engineering professor and uses “biometric mimicry” for hands-free vaginal and clitoral stimulation. (📸: Lora DiCarlo

Photos from the Sundance Film Festival in January 2016 show Legend and Chrissy Teigen, his wife, smiling and embracing Weinstein, who is currently facing charges in New York of rape and sexual assault. People shared the photo to accuse him of hypocrisy. (📸: Getty Images)

Kendall and her mom Kris Jenner had been teasing a “big announcement” involving a “raw story” about her life in a bid to help and inspire others. Kris told fans to prepare to be “moved,” using #bethechange and #changetheconversation. Turns out the big reveal was a sponsorship deal with Proactiv. (📷: Proactiv)

Authorities said Marissa Tietsort killed Benson Xiong, placed his body in a car seat, and pulled a hat over the 2-month-old’s eyes so his mother would think he was asleep. It wasn’t until later when the mother removed him from the car seat that she realized he was not breathing. Tietsort, who is pregnant with her sixth child, told police she did not kill Benson, but allegedly admitted that he died in her care. She has been charged with first-degree intentional homicide. (📷: Wausau Police/ Justice for Benson Xiong via Facebook)
HBO released a first look at the new season of "Big Little Lies" during the Golden Globes. Nicole Kidman recently told CNN the show might return to television in June. (📷: HBO)

Spacey was charged with indecent assault and battery last month for allegedly groping an 18-year-old bus boy at a Nantucket bar in 2016. According to the criminal complaint, Spacey plied the teen with several drinks before putting his hands down the alleged victim’s pants and groping his genitals for around three minutes. (📸: AP)

Brown, who has been in jail for 15 years, will be released to parole supervision on August 7. She was sentenced to life in prison for killing a man paying her for sex when she was 16. “Imposing a life sentence on a juvenile that would require her to serve at least 51 years before even being eligible for parole consideration is too harsh, especially in light of the extraordinary steps Ms. Brown has taken to rebuild her life,” Tennessee Gov. Bill Haslam said in a statement. (📸: AP)
April can't come soon enough 🐲🔥❄ (📸: HBO)

“Black Panther” was nominated for three Golden Globes: Best Motion Picture — Drama, Best Original Score, and Best Original Song. But it lost in each category to “Bohemian Rhapsody,” “First Man,” and “A Star Is Born,” respectively. Even though the film didn’t win any awards, the “Black Panther” cast was on hand to introduce it during the awards ceremony, complete with the iconic “Wakanda Forever” salute. (📸: NBC)
“Green Book,” “Bohemian Rhapsody,” and FX’s “The Assassination of Gianni Versace” all won big at the Golden Globes 🏆🙌 (📸: Getty Images)
Here are some of our favorite looks from the #GoldenGlobes 😍 🎬💫(📸: Getty Images, Wire Image)

Sandra Oh took home the Best Actress in a TV Drama award at the #GoldenGlobes, becoming the first Asian woman to win in that category in almost 40 years. She is the first Asian woman to take home the award since Yoko Shimada won first in 1980 for her role in “Shogun” 🏆 👏 (📸: Getty Images)

Sandra Oh made history as the first person of Asian descent to host the #GoldenGlobes. “If I could take a moment here in all honesty, I said yes to the fear of being on this stage tonight because I wanted to be here to look out into the audience and witness this moment of change," Oh said in an emotional speech at the top of the show 😭 👏 (📸: Hollywood Foreign Press Association)

Michelle Yeoh shines on the red carpet of the #GoldenGlobes wearing the emerald ring featured in “Crazy Rich Asians.” Yeoh actually owned the ring herself even before the movie was filmed 💍💚 (📸: Getty Images)

Trump said on Sunday that his demand for border wall funding is “a very important battle to win.” It’s now the sixteenth day that some 800,000 federal workers are either furloughed or being forced to work without pay if they are considered “essential.” “The shutdown could end tomorrow or it also could go on for a long time,” Trump told reporters. (📷: Getty)

Jazmine Barnes was killed, and her mother and sister shot, in what police described as an unprovoked attack while the family was in their car a week ago. After a days-long manhunt, police arrested a suspect, Eric Black Jr., who admitted to being involved in the shooting and was charged with capital murder, authorities say. In a statement, the local sheriff’s office said the Barnes family was possibly shot as a result of mistaken identity. (📸: Harris County Sherrif's Office)

A jogger in Oakland, California fended off a dog attack, only to be tackled and bitten on the arm by the dog’s owner, identified as 19-year-old Alma Cadwalader. The incident occurred when the woman jogger defended herself from one of Cadwalader's attacking dogs with pepper spray. When the jogger later returned to the location of the attack, Cadwalader allegedly tackled and punched her multiple times before biting her on the forearm. Cadwalader arrested Friday, a day after the attack, after a judge issued a warrant for her arrest. (📸: East Bay Regional Parks PD)

Robert Crosland, a science teacher at Preston Junior High School in Eastern Idaho, was found not guilty of animal cruelty for feeding a puppy to a snapping turtle in front of his students in March 2018. Crosland had been charged with one count of misdemeanor animal cruelty in connection with the incident. A teen who witnessed the incident testified that Crosland told him and other students in the room that he was going to feed the puppy, which was described as being sick and very small, to the turtle and asked if they wanted to watch. “I honestly thought I was doing the right thing by putting it out of its misery,” Crosland said in a recording of an interview with investigators. (📸: Preston School District, Getty)

In a powerful on-air appeal, Lemon addressed Hart’s anti-gay tweets and told him he could “help change homophobia in the black community.” “Walking away right now, that is your choice,” Lemon said. “But many of us really need to keep the conversation going — it’s life or death.” Lemon also criticized Ellen Degeneres for forgiving Hart, saying that she doesn’t speak for the whole community. Hart appeared to respond in an Instagram post that partly said, “When did we get to the point where we forgot that we all learn, then we all have the ability to grow and with that growth comes a wealth of knowledge. You can’t change without a understanding of what GROWTH means.” (📷: Getty)

At McCarran International Airport in Las Vegas, call outs have increased to three times their normal levels, a TSA officer told BuzzFeed News. Other officials told CNN call outs increased by 200% - 300% at Dallas-Fort Worth International Airport in Texas, and that as many as 170 employees were out each day this week at JFK in New York. The TSA says “security effectiveness will not be compromised” but that “wait times may be affected depending on the number of call outs.” (📷: AP)

Phoenix police have opened an investigation into allegations the woman was sexually abused at the Hacienda Skilled Nursing Facility in Phoenix. An anonymous whistleblower told @arizonasfamily the woman requires around the clock care, and many of the facility’s employees have access to her room. Men working at the facility are reportedly no longer allowed in the rooms of female patients alone. (📸: Getty Images)

For the first time since President Trump announced a ban on transgender military personnel in 2017, the administration scored a win in court. The decision from the US Court of Appeals for the DC Circuit could boost the administration’s position as the litigation goes forward. But it won’t result in any immediate change in policy because injunctions blocking the ban issued by other courts remain in effect. (📷: Getty)

John Legend said he wasn’t worried about appearing in Lifetime’s “Surviving R. Kelly” documentary, which aired Thursday, because he believes the sexual misconduct allegations against the singer. “To everyone telling me how courageous I am for appearing in the doc, it didn’t feel risky at all,” Legend tweeted. “I believe these women and don’t give a fuck about protecting a serial child rapist.” (📷: Getty)

While Rep. Rashida Tlaib of Michigan, one of the first two Muslim women in Congress, cast her vote for Nancy Pelosi as Speaker of the House, her two young sons were dabbing on the haters (via @davidmackau)

Donna Kelly, a 63-year-old security officer for the Smithsonian, is wondering if her high blood pressure medication will last through the end of the month — let alone the entire shutdown. When the government repoens, an estimated 1,500 workers likely won’t receive any back pay from the duration of the shutdown. Kelly said, “I don’t know how I’m going to pay any bills.” (📷: Getty/Julie Karant, 32BJ)
Two months ago, Britney’s dad was suddenly rushed to a hospital after his colon spontaneously ruptured and spent 28 days there. She said he almost died in the ordeal.(📸: @britneyspears)

Tlaib, a progressive from Michigan sworn in Thursday, told a group of supporters that "We’re going to go in there and we’re going to impeach the motherfucker." Her office stood by the remarks, adding that the congresswoman was “elected to shake up Washington, not continue the status quo. (📸: Getty Images)

"We're a huge group of people who love you and want to see you host the Oscars," Ellen told Hart while he was on her show. Hart had relinquished his hosting duties after apparently being given an ultimatum by the Academy — either apologize for past anti-gay tweets or step down. (📸: The Ellen Show)

Kamilah Campbell says she didn't prepare for her original SAT test and scored 900 out of 1600, making her ineligible for a scholarship she wanted to attend Florida State, but after six months of tutoring and preparation she scored a 1230 on her second try. In October, Campbell received a letter from ETS, the company that administers the SAT, notifying her that her "score had been flagged for further review" and was later deemed invalid. The College Board said it does "not cancel scores based on a score gain alone,” and must have "substantial evidence to do so." Campbell’s attorney is now requesting evidence of her cheating from ETS. Campbell's school district has also contacted the College Board for clarification. (📸: Ben Crump Law)

A spokesperson for National Geographic says the network “chose to hold new episodes of Star Talk until the investigation is completed.” Four women, including Ashley Watson (left) and Katelyn Allers (right) have accused Tyson of sexual misconduct, including rape. Just three episodes of StarTalk’s fifth season had aired prior to the announcement, which was reportedly supposed to have 20 episodes. Tyson has confirmed parts of several women’s allegations, attributing his behavior to not being “sensitive to people’s personal space,” but has denied the rape allegation. (📷: Supplied)

The Louvre says Beyoncé and Jay-Z's "Apeshit" music video is partly to thank for drawing more than 10 million people to the museum in 2018 –  a 25% increase over the previous year and the most visitors to any museum ever. The video, which dropped in June, featured the couple in front of the museum's most iconic pieces, including Leonardo da Vinci's "Mona Lisa." (📸: YouTube)

As votes poured in for the California representative, her granddaughter Bella clapped and bounced in her seat. When it came time for Pelosi to cast her vote, she held hands with Bella, who jumped up and down and shouted, "PELOSIIIII!" (📸: Getty)

Ariana Grande will be just the fourth female artist — and the youngest woman ever — to headline the event. Childish Gambino and Tame Impala will also headline. Tickets go on sale Friday. (📸: @coachella)

Lara Kollab was a supervised resident at the Cleveland Clinic from July to September 2018, and was placed on leave after a series of anti-Semitic social media posts were brought to light. In the posts, which dated back to 2011, Kollab called Jewish people “stupid,” expressed a lack of sympathy for Holocaust victims, and wrote about purposely giving Jewish people "the wrong meds." Her social media profiles and website have been deleted, and the State Medical Board of Ohio says Kollab effectively can no longer practice medicine. (📷: Canary Mission)

The movie has yielded lots of memes, most of them focusing on Bullock’s character having to wear a blindfold in order to avoid seeing supernatural creatures that cause people to kill themselves. Some fans have since been posting videos of themselves wearing blindfolds and performing activities using the hashtag #BirdBoxChallenge. Apparently worried that someone was going to seriously hurt themselves (or someone else), Netflix pleaded with fans to meme with caution 😬🐦 (📷: Netflix)

Due to the shutdown, open-air national landmarks such as the National Mall remain open, but with services — like bathroom access and trash cleanup — suspended. As a result, many of the city’s top tourist sites have been decorated with overflowing garbage cans. The situation has improved since DC Mayor Muriel Bowser announced the city government would take over while federal services remain closed. (📷: Getty)

The New Horizons spacecraft flew past the tiny frozen world called “Ultima Thule” early on Tuesday morning. It’s only 22 miles wide at most and spins in a comet belt about 4 billion miles from the sun. High resolution pictures are expected in February and should answer questions about how comets first formed some 4.5 billion years ago, whether in dramatic collisions or as loose collections of icy particles. (📷: JHUAPL / NASA)

The couple will have their fourth child via surrogate, a source confirmed to BuzzFeed News. The baby is reportedly a boy and due in May 👶 He’ll be their second child via surrogate after Kim experienced life-threatening medical issues during her first two pregnancies. (📷: @kimkardashian)

Las Vegas police are searching for a woman they say killed a nail salon worker with a stolen car after refusing to pay for her $35 manicure. The victim, 51-year-old Nhu "Annie" Ngoc Q. Nguyen was trying to stop the customer from leaving after her credit card was declined, according to police. The woman drove her vehicle into Nguyen and dragged her briefly behind the car before taking off. "She ran off for $35 and killed my wife — $35 to run my wife over,” Sonny Chung, Nguyen’s partner said. (📸: GoFundMe, Getty Images)
NASA's New Horizons probe has just flown past Ultima Thule, an icy object 6.5 billion kilometres from Earth, in the most distant exploration ever of an object in space 🚀 (📸:Getty Images)

These young women are different ages, from different states, have different racial backgrounds, and different upbringings. However they all have one thing in common. They were all allegedly killed before the age of 20 in 2018 by a man they at one point had a romantic relationship with. The CDC estimates at least 8.5 million women in the US have experienced physical violence, rape, or stalking from an intimate partner in their lifetime — and that it all began before they were 18 years old. (📸: Phoenix Police Department, Fairfax County Police Department, gunmemorial.org, gofundme.com, Facebook)

A DoubleTree hotel has fired two employees after they called the police on a black guest who was talking to his mom on the phone in the lobby and kicked him out of the hotel. Jermaine Massey said a security guard and a manager at the hotel called the police to remove him, saying that he was "a safety threat to other guests" and "a disturbance because [he] took a personal phone call from [his] mom in a more remote area of the lobby." The hotel chain addressed the incident on Twitter, saying it "has zero tolerance for racism." (📸: Instagram)

Swift and her friends “decided to dress up as our childhood heroes” to celebrate the new year, she wrote on Instagram. Taylor dressed as Ariel, Gigi Hadid dressed as Mary Poppins, and Blake Lively dressed as Dorothy 🎉🥂 (📸: @taylorswift)

Williams, playing for the United States alongside Frances Tiafoe, went head to head with Federer, representing his home county of Switzerland alongside Belinda Benic. The Swiss pair won 2-1. 🐐🐐 🎾 (📸: Getty Images)
Netflix also released a promo poster for the show, with the tagline “One summer can change everything.” 👀 (📸: Netflix)
This is how people around the world are ringing in the new year 🎉 L➡️R: Brazil, Indonesia, Australia, Germany. Happy New Year from all of us at BuzzFeed News! (📷: Getty Images)

One man has been detained in connection with the incident. Two civilians, a man and a woman in their fifties, were transported to a hospital with knife injuries. A British Transport Police officer was also being treated for a stab wound to the shoulder. North West Ambulance Service said the three victims were taken to the hospital in a "very serious condition." | 📷: Getty Images

Surveillance video of the Southwest Key facility, which has since been shut down, was obtained by the Arizona Republic. It shows a staffer dragging a child into a room by his arms, then shoving him towards a door. The child is seeing swinging his arm at the staffer, who then appears to slap the child. In another incident, two staffers are seeing dragging children by their arms through a door. On Friday, the local sheriff’s office said the incidents “did not rise to the level of criminal charges” — but after the story was published and videos circulated on social media, it said it would file a case with prosecutors. (📷: @azcentral)

Warren, a senator from Massachusetts, is the first Democrat with a national profile to take concrete steps toward a run. She announced an exploratory committee, which means she can raise money and fill staff positions ahead of a likely campaign. Warren became a star of the progressive movement by taking on Wall Street and helping the Obama administration launch the Consumer Financial Protection Board after the 2008 financial crisis. “America’s middle class is under attack,” she said in a video to supporters. “But this dark path doesn’t have to be our future. We can make our democracy work for all of us. We can make our economy work for all of us.” (📷: Getty)

Padma Lakshmi told PROFILE that she felt compelled to tell her own #MeToo story after President Trump expressed doubt over Christine Blasey Ford’s allegations against Supreme Court Justice Brett Kavanaugh in September. In a New York Times op-ed, she wrote about the shame she experienced after being raped when she was 16 years old, an incident she didn’t report at the time. “We had no language in the 1980s for date rape,” Lakshmi wrote in the newspaper. “I imagined that adults would say: ‘What the hell were you doing in his apartment? Why were you dating someone so much older?’” Watch her full interview on the “PROFILE by BuzzFeed News” Facebook page. (📸: BuzzFeed News)

In a statement announcing the decision, organizers of the local Women's March chapter said that it had noticed that its past events had lacked diversity, "representation from several perspectives in our community," and "crucial voices." Instead of holding the January 19 rally, the group said it will use its time and energy "for outreach." ✊♀ (📸: Getty Images, Facebook user Beth Ann Wylie)

A lion attacked and killed 22-year-old Alexandra Black, who was cleaning its enclosure, at a North Carolina zoo. Black, a recent graduate of Indiana University had been working as an intern at the center for two weeks. According to the center, a team led by a trained animal keeper was cleaning the enclosure when one lion escaped a locked space intended to keep it separate from the humans. It wasn't immediately clear how the lion escaped. "The Conservators Center is devastated by the loss of a human life today," the center said in a statement. (📸: Facebook, LinkedIn)

This year saw a number of notable wildfires, storms, and droughts ravage many regions around the world. More frequent and intense events are on the horizon as the climate continues to warm, according to this year’s National Climate Assessment. The report also warns of further loss of life, substantial economic impact, and a transformation of current ecosystems so significant that "future generations can expect to experience and interact with the natural environment in ways that are different from today." (📸: Getty Images)
🎁👀😱😂 (📸: Twitter - valbobias, carlyhawk02, gretchencordy, lockhartsamara)

The Cotton Bowl, which featured Clemson and Notre Dame, opened with the National Anthem and a flyover by a bald eagle. But after the anthem, the eagle kept going and landed on a couple of fans. “It was amazing,” one of the fans told Sports Illustrated. “I couldn’t even believe it.” 🏈🦅 (📸: AP)

Adding to the intrigue, the tweet is still showing the beluga whale image on some devices and browsers — meaning that what people were seeing in the tweet depended on how they are accessing it. It’s also not the first time an image in an old tweet has abruptly changed. In September, people noticed a tweet from the Chicago Cubs in 2012 with a photo of a former player had changed to feature an explicit porn image.

Abdullah Hassan was brought to a San Francisco hospital from Egypt by his father a few months ago to care for a genetic brain condition. Hassan and his father are US citizens, but his mother, who is from Yemen and lives in Egypt, is not. As Hassan's health got worse, the family fought for the mother to get a visa waiver so she could see her son one last time. (📷: Council on American Islamic Relations)

In his first public comments on the deaths of two young migrant children in the custody of Border Patrol this month, President Trump  blamed Democrats and the children's grieving parents for their deaths, while also sharing a false version of events. Contrary to the president's tweet, Jakelin's father has said he made sure his daughter had enough food and water during their voyage. Additionally, the president's claim that both children were "very sick before" being taken into custody was incorrect. | 📷: AP, Getty Images

During an argument with his wife, Jerald Jeske allegedly said “You love those dogs more than you love me. … I’m going to kill those dogs.” After hearing the “screeching” of a dog, the wife went into the backyard and found her elderly chihuahua on the ground, bleeding but breathing, the Chicago Sun Times reported. Jeske was charged with aggravated cruelty to animals. (📸: Chicago Police Department)
This year was marked by incredible images of inspiration, tragedy, and preserverance. These are the pictures that defined the year. (📸: Getty Images/AP)

Gustavo Perez Arriaga, an undocumented immigrant from Mexico and Sureño gang member, was arrested Friday for the murder of California police officer Ronil Singh. The officer was shot and killed after stopping Arriaga for a suspected DUI on Wednesday. Two other men, Adrian Virgen and Erik Razo Quiroz, were arrested on Thursday for helping Arriaga escape. The Stanislaus Sheriff said that Arriaga had crossed the border into Arizona illegally several years ago and was planning to flee to Mexico after the shooting. (📷: Stanislaus Sheriff via Twitter)

14-year-old Emily Ikue-Rose Hampshire died Nov. 3 from diabetic ketoacidosis. Her mother, Amber Hampshire, was charged with involuntary manslaughter Thursday after allegedly failing to treat her daughter’s diabetes for five years. Hampshire allegedly concealed her daughter’s illness from Emily’s father and lied to Emily’s school about the diagnosis. Authorities say there is “no known evidence” that Emily’s insulin prescription was ever filled. If convicted, Hampshire could face 3-14 years in prison for involuntary manslaughter and 2-10 years for endangering the life of a minor. (📷: Alton Police Department)

Authorities said the blue flash was the result of an explosion at a power plant in Astoria, Queens. Fire officials say there appear to be no injuries. An ensuing power outage temporarily closed LaGuardia Airport and grounded planes. Of course, during the initial lack of explanation for the blue light, Twitter came through with theories. As you can guess, they were mostly about aliens. 👽 (📷: Getty)

When asked if she would ever get into politics in a BBC interview, Jolie said she would’ve “laughed” at the question 20 years ago, but suggested her thinking was evolving. “I really don’t know. I always say I’ll go where I’m needed. I honestly will do whatever I think can really make change.” (📸: Getty Images)

When Pon-san, a shiba inu in Saitama prefecture, Japan, goes out for a walk, she likes to sleep outside her neighbors’ house and often refuses to go home. Pon-san’s owner told BuzzFeed News that one day her daughter drew parking lines around Pon-san’s favorite spot, so they started creating parking spots for Pon-san around their neighborhood. For more 🐶 from around the 🌏, follow @world (📸: @ponsan_shiba)

On Sunday, the legal blood alcohol level in Utah will go from 0.08% to 0.05% — the lowest DUI standard in the nation. Currently, all US states have a blood alcohol limit of 0.08% for drivers 21 and over, which is considered about four drinks in under an hour for a 160-pound man. 0.05% of alcohol is considered about three drinks. (📷: AP)

The monkey, named Fiji and featured in his Instagram stories, was seized by the California Department of Fish and Wildlife when officers executed a search warrant at Brown’s home. Brown allegedly bought the monkey for his daughter Royalty. If convicted, he could face up to six months in jail. The Los Angeles City Attorney’s Office said the monkey was taken to a sanctuary “and is doing well.” (📷: Getty/@chrisbrownofficial)

Hal Vaughan went above and beyond to be with his daughter Pierce on Christmas by joining her on the multiple trips she had to work as a Delta flight attendant. The story was first shared by Mike Levy, a passenger seated next to Hal during one of the flights. "What a fantastic father!" Levy wrote. (📷: Facebook: mlevy1987)

Photo agencies have started aggressively pursuing legal action against celebrities who use paparazzi images without permission, adding to the friction that already exists between stars and the relentless photographers who pursue them. Jennifer Lopez, Gigi Hadid, 50 Cent, Jessica Simpson, and Khloé Kardashian have all been sued after pulling photos of themselves off the internet and posting them on their social media. It may seem counterintuitive that one's own image can be out of bounds, but legal experts said copyright law clearly favors the photographer. (📷: Getty Images)

The update, which hit for just about an hour Thursday morning, let users navigate posts with taps, much like with Instagram Stories. People absolutely lost their minds over it. Some even threatened to quit the app or stage a boycott till the update was reversed. Instagram said the change was "caused by a bug," and CEO Adam Mosseri confirmed to BuzzFeed News it would be rolled back. (📷: Instagram)

A cryptic trailer was dropped this morning, featuring the words "You are not in control." While there is still no confirmation by Netflix, it looks like this may be the highly speculated choose-your-own-adventure episode, which means that you at home will be able to choose what happens next. The YouTube description: "In 1984, a young programmer begins to question reality as he adapts a sprawling fantasy novel into a video game and soon faces a mind-mangling challenge. Welcome back." (📷: Netflix)

The bodies were identified as 14-year-old Mary Crocker, last seen in October, and her elder brother Elwyn Crocker Jr., who was also 14 when he went missing in November 2016. The children’s father, Elwyn Crocker, his wife, Candice Crocker, her mother, Kim Wright, and Wright’s boyfriend, Roy Anthony Prater, were arrested and charged with concealing the death of another and first-degree cruelty to children. Neither child had been reported as missing to police. (📷: Effingham County Sheriff’s Office)

Cyrus shared three photos on Instagram, showcasing her and Hemsworth embracing one another affectionately while in some fancy schmancy outfits. “10 years later,” she wrote on one of the photos, referring to how long the on-again, off-again couple have been in each other’s lives. Cyrus and Hemsworth became an item after filming the romantic drama “The Last Song” in 2009. They experienced a breakup in 2013 before taking some time apart before getting engaged in 2016. Congrats! 👰🤵 (📷: @mileycyrus)

Thousands of patients are being urged to get tested after the HealthPlus Surgery Center in Saddle Brook, New Jersey was found to have unsanitary conditions. The New Jersey Department of Health says that following “lapses in infection control in sterilization/cleaning instruments and the injection of medications,” the facility has warned approximately 3,700 patients about possible exposure to hepatitis B, hepatitis C, and HIV. HealthPlus said that it would be paying for the affected patients to be tested. (📷: Getty)

The president and the first lady met with troops stationed in Al Asad Air Base in the country’s northwest. The secret trip came amid a government shutdown and less than a week after Secretary of Defense Jim Mattis resigned following the president’s decision to withdraw US troops from Syria and Afghanistan. (📸: Reuters/Getty Images)

Kevin watches a movie called "Angels With Filthy Souls," which is responsible for the famous "Keep the change, you filthy animal" line. A lot of people thought it was a real old movie. But when Seth Rogen tweeted it was fake he broke the news to lots of other people who still had no idea.

Ginsburg had undergone a pulmonary lobectomy on Friday to remove two cancerous nodules from her lung. A Supreme Court spokesperson said last week that doctors found the nodules were malignant and found no remaining evidence of the disease in Ginsburg’s body. (📸: AP)

Collman Lloyd’s parents told BuzzFeed News they were not bothered by President Trump asking her if she still believes in Santa Claus and then said, “at 7 it’s marginal, right?” In fact, her dad said he would have used similar language with his daughter: “I think it’s crazy it became a big deal.
