It’s Christmas time. I’d love to keep politics out of Christmas." Collman told us that she had no idea what the president was trying to say in that moment — and she still has no idea what "marginal" means. "He used it with ‘Santa’ so maybe it has something to do with Christmas?" | 📷: Erica Lloyd

The child, who was from Guatemala, was in CBP custody on Dec. 24 when he began showing “signs of potential illness,” according to a statement from border authorities. He was transferred to the hospital accompanied by his father. After being held for 90 minutes for observation, the child and his father were released on Monday afternoon. That evening, the child was sent back to the hospital, where he passed away shortly after midnight, CBP said. Earlier this month, a 7-year-old girl from Guatemala died hours after she and her father were taken into custody in New Mexico. | 📷: AP

It's been a very Trumpy Christmas. On Christmas Eve, Trump complained that he was "all alone (poor me) in the White House" due to the government shutdown. The president later asked a child — who was calling to ask how close Santa was — whether she still believes in Santa Claus. "Are you still a believer in Santa — because at 7 it's marginal, right?" Trump said. On Christmas morning, Trump reiterated that he won't reopen the government until funding is approved for the border wall, which by the way, is going to be "very high." Then, on a call with troops, Trump went on a tangent about former FBI director James Comey and the Russia investigation — and he added, "It's a disgrace what's happening in this country, but other than that, I wish everybody a merry Christmas." (📷: Getty Images)

UPDATE: Collman Lloyd, the girl who spoke to Trump, said "Yes, sir” when asked if it's “marginal" for a 7-year-old to believe in Santa, though she had never heard the word, she told @postandcourier. Despite that, she still believes!

We apologize to Collman for initially using the wrong pronoun above and have fixed the mistake.

In the video, Spacey seems to reference the allegations against him through acting as his former "House of Cards" character, Frank Underwood. The charges come after former Boston TV news anchor Heather Unruh alleged in November 2017 that Spacey had groped her then–18-year-old son the year prior. At a news conference at the time, Unruh said her son met Spacey at the Club Car restaurant on Nantucket in July 2016 and was "star-struck." The actor allegedly bought him "drink after drink” before reaching his hand down the teenager's pants and groping his genitals. (📷: Imeh Akpanudosen)

LeBron James apologized for an Instagram story that showed him singing along to the song "ASMR," in which 21 Savage raps, "We been gettin' that Jewish money, everything is kosher." The song does not contain other references to Jewish people. The longstanding stereotype that Jewish people are unduly wealthy was one of the justifications the German Nazi government used for the Holocaust. (📷: Getty)

Peele said "Us," unlike “Get Out,” "is not about race" but is instead about an undeniable truth: we can all be our own worst enemies. The Oscar-winning writer said it was very important to him to have a black family at the center of the horror film, which stars fellow Oscar winner Lupita Nyong'o and Winston Duke. The trailer shows Adelaide and Gabe Wilson (Nyong'o and Duke) en route to California for a summer getaway with their children, played by Shahadi Wright Joseph and Evan Alex. Nyong'o described the film as a "relentless nightmare" that will tap into people's "deepest fears." (📷: MonkeyPaw Productions)

GoFundMe says it has refunded more than $400,000 to people who donated money after hearing the fake story about a veteran who is homeless who gave his last $20 to a woman whose car had run out of gas. The trio has been charged with second-degree theft by deception and conspiracy to commit theft by deception. If convicted, they face up to 10 years in jail. (📸: AP)

UPDATE: Collman Lloyd, the girl who spoke to Trump, said "Yes, sir” when asked if it's “marginal" for a 7-year-old to believe in Santa, though she had never heard the word, she said in an interview with  @postandcourier. Despite that, she still believes!

We corrected the pronoun for Collman below and apologize to her for using the wrong one above 🙏 ————— Trump asked a 7-year-old, who called the North American Aerospace Defense Command (NORAD), which tracks Santa, if she still believes in Santa. "Are you still a believer in Santa? 'Cause at seven it's marginal, right?" the president asked after the child asked about Santa's location. NORAD has been tracking Santa since the 1950s and isn't affected by the partial government shutdown 🎅(📸: Getty Images)

Former Disney Channel actor Stoney Westmoreland has been charged with six felony counts after being arrested earlier this month for trying to have sex with a 13-year-old. Westmoreland played the grandfather, Ham Mack, on Disney Channel's Andi Mack show. He was fired by Disney after his arrest on Dec. 13 in Utah, where the series is filmed. (📸: Getty Images)

The S&P 500 and the Dow Jones, both indicators of the overall health of the stock market, both suffered their largest Christmas Eve drops ever and their most severe December dives since the Great Depression. Meanwhile, Trump attacked the Federal Reserve on Twitter and Treasure Secretary Steven Mnuchin spooked traders by asking major banks earlier this week if they had cash reserves on hand to lend consumers and businesses, appearing to foreshadow a possible recession in 2019. (📷: Reuters)

In a now viral video, ref Alan Maloney reportedly forced Andrew Johnson, a black high school wrestler, to cut his dreadlocks or forfeit his match (despite official rules stating he should have been permitted to do so and had done so previously without incident.) Johnson’s hair was chopped off and he won his match. Still, he walked off the court looking emotionally defeated. Maloney, who reportedly previously used the n-word in an argument with a black referee in 2016, will be sidelined from matches pending a New Jersey civil rights investigation into the “potential bias incident.” (📷: @snjtoday reporter Mike Frankel via Twitter)

• The iconic Rockettes kick off the season at Radio City Music Hall (1967)
• The New York Post Office keeps up with holiday demand (1955)
• City-slicker Santas cruise down the streets of New York (1969)
• US troops celebrate in Vietnam (1967)
• Women rock 42-inch holiday hairdos (1961)
(📷: Getty)

Four men have been arrested in connection to the killings of two Scandinavian tourists in a popular hiking spot in Morocco. The bodies of Maren Ueland (left), a 28-year-old from Norway, and Louisa Vesterager Jespersen (right), a 24-year-old from Denmark, were found by other tourists in an isolated area in the Atlas Mountains on Monday, according to the AP. Follow @world for more news from around the globe 🌍

The Jennie-O Turkey Store announced they were pulling the poultry from shelves on Friday, alerting consumers in 17 states to look for products that "use or freeze by Nov. 12 or 13." Food safety officials are asking people who have recently purchased and frozen products from the company to check labels for the number P-579 on the side of the tray. The recalled meat was packaged in October and includes Jennie-O's standard lean, ground turkey; taco-seasoned ground turkey; and Italian seasoned ground turkey. (📷: USDA)

The death toll from the tsunami in Indonesia has risen to 220 with at least 843 people injured and dozens missing, according to the latest figures. The extent of the devastation appears to be widespread, and the numbers of those injured and missing are expected to rise. Rescuers used heavy machinery to move debris and begin the search for survivors. (📷: Getty/AP/Reuters)

Nicole Parsons, a junior at the University of Massachusetts, told BuzzFeed News that she decided to put up the sign after a swastika was drawn over a "Happy Hanukkah" sign on a resident assistant's door. After posting the sign in her dorm window, she received an email from a resident director asking her to remove the sign over "issues of inclusion." "This email tells me the university cares more about the feelings of Nazis than the safety of their students,” said Parsons. UMass Amherst said the university "rejects Nazis" but it is "sensitive to the use of profanity." (📷: Nicole Parsons)

Chase Bishop, 30, was in the middle of a dance circle at a bar when he did a backflip, causing his gun to fall out of his pants. When he picked it up, the gun went off, hitting a man in the leg. Video of the incident went viral. Bishop will be sentenced to two years of probation. His victim says he now has chronic pain, lost his job, and may never be able to run again, but holds no personal grudge against Bishop: “I’ve done stupid things at bars to impress girls too.” (📷: RyanHaarer via Twitter)

Trump tweeted that he’ll replace Mattis with his deputy, Patrick Shanahan, on January 1. Mattis was set to leave in February after he resigned over disagreements with the president over his decision to withdraw troops from Syria and Afghanistan. On Saturday, the US envoy for the global coalition to fight ISIS, Brett McGurk, also resigned over the president’s decision. (📷: Getty)

The average woman in the US was 170.6 pounds and 5 ft 3 inches tall and the average man was 197.9 pounds and 5 ft 7 inches tall in 2016, according to new data from the CDC. That means the average BMI for women is 29.6 and 29.1 for men (a BMI of 30 or over is considered obese, and 25-29 is considered overweight.) Keep in mind that BMI  isn’t a great measure of health because it can’t differentiate between muscle and fat mass (among other issues), but experts say it’s a useful data point for large groups over time because it can reveal trends. (📷: Getty)

A tsunami that may have been caused by underwater landslides from a volcanic island hit Indonesia Saturday night, killing at least 43 people and injuring 582 others, with the death toll expected to rise. The tsunami occurred around 9:27 p.m. local time, striking coastal areas of Pandeglang, Serang, and South Lampung. Officials said the landslides coupled with tidal waves caused by the full moon may have contributed to the sudden tsunami. (📸: AP)

Demi Lovato has posted a series of tweets telling her followers that her recovery is going well and urging them to ignore "sickening" news about her in the tabloids. The singer was hospitalized in July following a suspected overdose. Since then, multiple stories that rely on anonymous sources discussing Demi's recovery have been published, many of which the singer says are inaccurate. In her tweets, Demi said that she will speak about her own recovery on her own terms and that she is "sober and grateful to be alive". (📸: Getty)

Teething jewelry is often worn by infants or adults and used to relieve a baby’s pain while their first set of teeth are growing in (and to prevent them from chewing on clothes or fingers.) But the FDA says they pose health risks including choking, strangulation, and injuries to the mouth. The agency says a 7-month-old infant choked on wooden beads from a teething bracelet but was taken to the hospital and survived. In another case, an 18-month-old child died after being strangled by a teething necklace during a nap. (📷: Getty)

The former “Gossip Girl” actor told British LGBT outlet Pink News that in a perfect world, any actor could play any role. “But that’s not the world we live in,” he said. “We live in a world that does not recognize virtually anyone outside of the white male or the beautiful white woman who has to be an object of desire and affection.” People who exist “at any intersection of oppression beyond the box of white male” should be duly represented in roles of that type, and not the people who haven’t “lived the experience portraying them,” Badgley said. “Because then at the end of the day, you’re getting a real portrayal.” (📷: Getty)

Matt Nelson, the owner of WeRateDogs, announced the news on Friday and gave Pippin an official rating of 15/10: “Pippin passed away this week due to complications of old age, but he’ll live on with every post.” Nelson found Pippin’s photo by googling “funny dogs” in 2015, and when the WeRateDogs account started taking off, he and Pippin’s owner developed a special relationship. RIP Pippin, the goodest of dogs. (📷: @weratedogs)

Trump has been threatening for weeks to shutdown the government over funding for his border wall and Congress has yet to come up with an agreement to keep the government open. Several federal departments including Homeland Security, Justice, and State, among others, will officially shut down on Saturday, Dec. 22. Trump said last week, “I will shut down the government. And I am proud to shut down the government for border security.” However, he later tried to lay blame for the shutdown on Democrats. (📷: Reuters)

Former Lehigh University student Yukai Yang allegedly attempted to murder his roommate Juwan Royal by putting small amounts of poison in his food and drinks over a period of at least two months. Royal, who didn’t know why he had been falling ill for several months, was “dumbfounded” when he found out his roommate of four years was responsible. In addition to the poisoning, Yang was also previously arrested for leaving racist graffiti on his roommate’s desk. (📷: Getty/Northhampton District Attorney’s Office)

Cardi B just dropped the music video for "Money.” The song was released back in October, but the reality TV star turned rapper made the music video well worth the wait thanks to its amazing visuals. She stuns in the video with looks resembling a fun house version of a Cruella de Vil, Nefertiti, and more. In one scene, she's breastfeeding a baby, who we can only assume is her little one Kulture. In another, she plays piano in the nude. (📷: Atlantic)

Katrina Danforth has appeared in multiple porn films under the name Lynn Pleasant. She's now being held without bail. Court documents show that 31-year-old Danforth is being charged with allegedly using a telephone to hire a person to kill a victim. The alleged target was reportedly never harmed. (📷: Instagram)

Ginsburg underwent surgery Friday to remove two cancerous nodules from her lung, which were determined to be malignant. The surgery — a pulmonary lobectomy — took place at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in New York City, the Supreme Court's public information office reported. "Post-surgery, there was no evidence of any remaining disease," according to a statement from the court. (📷: Getty)

Most sea otters don't live past 15 years old, but Eddie was nearly 21 when a sharp decline in health prompted zoo officials to euthanize him. Twelve years after his arrival at the Oregon zoo, Eddie needed therapy for arthritic elbow joints, so zoo keepers trained the aging otter to dunk a toy basketball, a video of which quickly went viral. Eddie also had knack for, ahem, ~pleasuring~ himself in public. RIP Eddie 😭❤️ (📷: Oregon Zoo)

James Mattis’s resignation comes a day after Trump announced he’d withdraw troops from Syria, which Mattis opposes, and reports that he may also withdraw troops from Afghanistan. In a letter to the president, Mattis wrote about his beliefs in "treating allies with respect," and that the US "must be resolute and unambiguous" in how it approaches countries "whose strategic interests are increasingly in tension with ours," including China and Russia. The letter from Mattis made clear the decision was not that harmonious. He said that his last day in office would be Feb. 28, 2019. (📷: Getty)

It’s a massive shift in immigration policy at the border. BuzzFeed News first reported in November that the administration was considering such a plan. The Mexican government said it was told early Thursday that the Trump administration intended to move forward with it. (📷: Getty)

A judge in New York on Thursday did not dismiss criminal charges against Harvey Weinstein in his rape and sexual assault cases involving three women. Since Weinstein's arrest six months ago, his legal team has been aggressively fighting to get the charges tossed out. If convicted of all charges, the disgraced movie mogul faces life in prison. Actors Amber Tamblyn, Marisa Tomei, and Nia Vardalos attended the Thursday morning hearing wearing Times Up T-shirts, which they covered up in the courtroom. (📷: Getty Images)

If you search "Bandersnatch" on Netflix right now, you will see this: A Netflix Film: Black Mirror Bandersnatch. What is unclear is whether this apparent "Netflix film" will be separate to the fifth season or whether it has something to do with reports of a "choose your own adventure" episode. (📷: Netflix)

Photographer Claire Rothstein said in the photo caption, “A million reasons why I wanted to post this picture. Obviously #rachelmcadams looks incredible and was quite literally the dream to work with but also this shoot was about 6 months post her giving birth to her son, so between shots, she was expressing/pumping as still breastfeeding.” She said that she believes it was McAdams’ idea to have the photo taken, and that if the photo could change one person’s perception of breastfeeding, then that would be “amazing.” 😍👏 (📷: @clairerothstein / @girls.girls.girls.magazine)

In a post memorializing the one-year anniversary of her sugar daddy’s death, retired escort Amanda Drago wrote, “Brad, you bought me my first pair of Louboutins, my first Birkin and my first and only race horse 🐎 You understood the value of my time and for that, I honor you with my time today by making this post for you.” She goes on to detail the nature of their “incredibly toxic relationship” and a scary encounter with whippits, and claims that his ghost is haunting her. On the first two nights after Brad’s death, Drago said she and her boyfriend heard strange, loud noises in their bedroom. Brad “knows I’m so afraid of ghosts,” she said, so she believes he was creating those noises to troll her. (📷: @theheauxmentor)

Actors Lana Condor and Noah Centineo will be returning to reprise their roles. “To All The Boys I've Loved Before” was adapted from the work of author Jenny Han and featured a scene at the end that included a major character from the next book in the Lara Jean trilogy. A title for the sequel was not announced, but the next book in the trilogy is “PS, I Still Love You.” 🎬💌 (📷: Netflix)

Attorneys for Jakelin Caal’s family are accusing Customs and Border Protection of failing to provide her water for eight hours and potentially violating its own rule that requires agents contact medical professionals in the event of a “medical emergency.” The family’s attorney says CBP determined that Caal was sick around 5 am on Dec. 7, listing her as a “medical emergency” in its reports. However, they placed her on a bus with other immigrants and asylum seekers and dispatched her to another facility. During the ride, Caal’s conditioned worsened, and it was only then that agents contacted CBP’s Lordsburg facility. (📷: Getty)

Ashley Bemis posted pictures of herself and her “fictitious firefighter husband” on social media to solicit donations, eventually garnering more than $2,000 in cash and donations, such as socks, sports drinks and camping equipment. “My Shane works for Cal Fire and is out on the Holy Fire right now,” Bemis wrote on Facebook. A local captain became suspicious of her posts and reached out to the sheriff’s department. Detectives found that Bemis had also allegedly committed prior instances of deception for money, “including prior faked pregnancies in an attempt to illegally obtain money from unsuspecting victims.” (📷: Getty/Orange County Sheriff’s Department)

Meghan Panu of St. Louis has spent the last two years building her own tiny house. On Friday night, Meghan Panu parked her 8 foot x 10 foot tiny house in its usual place, but when she returned on Saturday morning, it was gone. Panu put out a call on social media and spoke to several local news stations about the theft. People began messaging her with sightings of the tiny house, pictures and locations. The house was found by law enforcement on Wednesday approximately 30 miles from its original spot. A local towing company is returning the home to Panu for free as an early Christmas present. (📷: St. Louis Tiny Living via Facebook)

The new film features Will Smith as Genie, while Mena Massoud plays Aladdin, and Naomi Scott is Jasmine. There are already a ton of opinions about Smith's appearance as Genie — most notably that he isn't blue. (📸: @entertainmentweekly)

Update: Will Smith has spoken. He says Genie will be blue 💙

The tornado touched down in Port Orchard around 2 p.m., the National Weather Service said. Some people reported minor injuries. Tornadoes in Washington state are unusual with an average of just 2 to 3 per year, and are even more rare in the month of December. Thursday's storm appeared to be the strongest in the state since an EF-2 tornado struck in 1986. (📷: Kitsap County Sheriff's Office)

The 16 new episodes will premiere in two parts, Part 3 and Part 4, with a release date still to be determined. A stand-alone, holiday-themed episode, “A Midwinter’s Tale,” also premiered on Dec. 14, and Part 2 is set to start streaming on Netflix on April 5, 2019. Praise Satan! ✨ (📷: Netflix)

The McDonald’s manager told authorities that Anthony Gallagher showed him the weed after he was told how much he owed. Gallagher told police that he did offer to swap weed for the food but only as a joke. He was arrested on suspicion of driving under the influence and possession of cannabis. (📷: Port St. Lucie Police Department/Getty)
Marshall was also the director of "Big" and "A League Of Their Own." She was 75. (📸: Getty Images)

New York’s attorney general sued Trump’s charity in June, alleging the non-profit was used to fund personal and political transactions for the Trump family. Under the supervision of a judge, the foundation’s funds will be distributed to other charitable organizations. (📸: Getty Images)

Bump stocks allow semi-automatic weapons to fire more rapidly. The gunman in the Las Vegas massacre last year used a bump stock attached to a rifle, prompting Trump to suggest a ban. (📸: Getty Images)
The result of the referendum will be binding. Earlier this month, New Zealand passed a law allowing people with terminal illnesses to smoke cannabis 🌲 💨 (📸: Getty Images)

Alfonso Ribeiro filed a federal lawsuit Monday against Epic Games for direct infringement of a copyright. Fortnite is now selling Ribeiro’s dance as part of an in-game purchase, where it's included under the name “Fresh,” for players to customize their avatars. Ribeiro’s attorneys said the game did not obtain his client’s permission to use his likeness. (📷: Getty/NBC)

David Berry, Jr., killed hundreds of deer and left their bodies to rot, authorities say. Officials don’t have an exact count of how many deer were killed in the years-long poaching operation, but the prosecutor said that in the last three months of 2015 alone, the Berry family killed around 100 deer, according to photos taken from their phones. (📷: AP/Lawrence County Sheriff)

Moonves negotiated a departure settlement in September amid allegations that he sexually harassed six women. As more women came forward with sexual misconduct allegations, the executive tried to use his power and influence to thwart investigators, CBS determined. Moonves has so far faced no criminal charges stemming from the allegations. (📷: Getty)

For four years, Diana Rowland has set up inflatable dragons in her yard to celebrate Christmas and Halloween. But this year, a neighbor apparently had enough and sent Rowland an anonymous letter asking her to take the “inappropriate” display down. To “fix” the display, Rowland added two more dragons, and halos atop all the inflatable beasts’ heads. Rowland says the dragon display reflects the true meaning of Christmas: spreading joy. 🐉🎄 (📷: Diana Rowland)

Federal prosecutors have indicted Bijan Kian, the former business partner of Flynn, President Donald Trump’s first national security adviser, for failing to register as a foreign agent. The indictment lays out the most detailed account yet of Turkish government efforts to persuade the US to extradite a political opponent of Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan. (📸: Getty Images)

After her child’s stillbirth, Gillian Brockell noticed she was still being flooded with advertising on social media tailored toward pregnant women. Brockell tried stopping the ads, but the algorithms assumed her child was healthy and began showing her ads for new moms. She then wrote an open letter to the major tech companies, saying, “If you’re smart enough to realize that I’m pregnant, that I’ve given birth, then surely you’re smart enough to realize that my baby died.” (📸: The Washington Post)

Mohit Gupta and Mahathi S Kumar met two Christmases ago while sharing a table at a crowded restaurant during a Harry Potter quiz night in Delhi. Long story short, they chatted and exchanged numbers, and two years later, the happy Potterheads held a *surprise surprise* Harry Potter-themed engagement party riddled with spells, floating candles, a Marvolo Gaunt black stone ring for Gupta and a Golden Snitch ring for Kumar presented in Helga Hufflepuff's cups ⚡️💖 (📷: Mohit Gupta)

Lily originally joined “Sesame Street” for a 2011 PBS special about hunger in the US. In the special, Lily’s family lacked consistent access to food. Now, Lily’s family has lost their home and must stay with friends. The storyline was developed to address the growing number of young people experiencing homelessness. For now, Lily will only appear on Sesame Street in Communities — an online resource for young children. (📷: Sesame Street)

The colorfully decorated tomb is considered to be "one of a kind in the last decades" for its pristine condition and the fact that it hasn't been looted. It's decorated with statues of pharaohs, hieroglyphics, and vibrant yellows and blues, and is believed to be the final resting place of a purification priest named Wahtye. Swipe to see more. (📷: Getty/Reuters)
Colin Kroll also served as the CEO of HQ Trivia. Police say he was pronounced dead early Sunday morning and suspect a drug overdose. (📷: Bryan Steffy)

The father of Jakelin Caal, the 7-year-old Guatemalan girl who died less than 24 hours after being taken into Customs and Border Patrol Custody, denied the Trump administration's claims that she “had not eaten or consumed water for several days,” insisting she showed no signs of ill health prior to being taken into custody. Attorneys for Nery Gilberto Caal also denied allegations that they spent days in the desert south of the New Mexico border. Caal died Dec. 8 after being taken into custody Dec. 6 in a remote part of the New Mexico border. The CBP has blamed Caal’s death on dehydration and shock, but the medical examiner has not released her official cause of death. (📸: Reuters)

New York police say they've spoken with comedian Pete Davidson during a wellness check after he posted a message to Instagram saying he was feeling suicidal, leaving fans and celebrities extremely concerned. Davidson was at NBC offices Saturday afternoon, where the cast of SNL was preparing for the evening’s episode. It's unclear whether he'll be on the show Saturday night. (📷: Getty)

Stoney Westmoreland, who played a grandfather on “Andi Mack,” was arrested in a sting operation. Police told BuzzFeed News he had been using a dating app to communicate with someone who he thought was 13 years old — it was actually undercover police — and allegedly asked for nude photos and oral sex. He was arrested after taking a rideshare to a trailer park address where police were waiting. (📷: Getty)
The outdoorsman, known for his love of taxidermy, is leaving the Interior after allegations that he used his power for personal financial gain. (📸: Getty Images)

The shocking ruling could lead to millions of people losing their health insurance. US District Judge Reed O’Connor found that a tweak to the Affordable Care Act that Congress made last year means protections for people with pre-existing health conditions are unconstitutional. Opponents will have a chance to challenge the ruling in the US Court of Appeals. (📷: Getty)

Eliza Dushku alleged that Michael Weatherly, who plays the titular character on “Bull,” joked that he wanted to rape her and suggested she take part in a threesome with him and another cast member. Dushku said that, shortly after she confronted Weatherly about the remarks, she was written off the show. CBS confirmed the settlement, saying Dushku’s claims showed the network needs to do more to improve working conditions. (📷: Getty)

Mick Mulvaney, director of the Office of Management & Budget, will replace John Kelly as the acting White House Chief of Staff. Trump announced his pick on Twitter after several contenders for the job publicly took themselves out of the running. He tweeted, “I look forward to working with him in this new capacity as we continue to MAKE AMERICA GREAT AGAIN!” (📷: Getty)

She calls the doll “Shayspar” and her mom told BuzzFeed News the late playwright “has really captured her imagination,” making the two inseparable. “She cuddles ‘Shayspar’ at night, brushes his gross old man hair and puts him on the potty.” (📷: Sophie McBain)

Facebook said a security flaw potentially exposed up to 6.8 million people’s public and unposted private photos to developers. “We’re sorry this happened,” the company said about its latest privacy scandal in a year full of them. (📷: Facebook)

It’s that time of year again. Kensington Palace released a very autumnal new photo of Kate Middleton, Prince William snd their kids, and a new photo from Prince Harry’s wedding to Meghan Markle 👑 (📷: @kensingtonroyal)

A 7-year-old girl from Guatemala suffering from dehydration died hours after she and her father were taken into custody by Border Patrol agents at the US–Mexico border last week. The hospital’s initial findings for the girl’s cause of death were septic shock, fever, and dehydration. (📸: AP)
The public drama between Kanye West and Drake is back on (📸: Getty Images)

Aggie Lal, best known as @travel_inhershoes, is under fire after netting nearly $200,000 from an “exclusive” program that people say was highly disappointing. The 12-week course called “How to grow your Instagram” cost nearly $500 per person. One student said a red flag came early when Lal issued a “challenge” to her students telling them to use an affiliate link to get more people to sign up for the same course they just started. (📷: @travel_inhershoes)

Officials say a concerned citizen called authorities after hearing “a faint voice calling for help” from an empty former Chinese restaurant. First responders found a 29-year-old man trapped in a metal grease duct, unable to move, and covered in oil and grease. The man was rescued and is now being investigated by police for trespassing and a possible burglary. (📷: Alameda County Sheriff’s Office)

Gaye’s family accused the two artists of copyright infringement, saying their single plagiarized from the 1977 song “Got to Give It Up.” Gaye’s family estate has also been ordered to receive a running royalty of 50% of the songwriter and publishing revenue on “Blurred Lines.” (📷: YouTube)

Chérif Chekatt, 29, had been on the run since Tuesday night’s shooting at the renowned Christmas market. Three people were killed, and 12 others injured. After an international manhunt, police discovered him not far from the original focus of their search in Strasbourg. Chekatt shot at the officers, who returned fire and killed him. The suspect had an extensive criminal record in France, Germany, and Switzerland. (📷: AP/Getty)

Jacob Anderson was banned from the University of Texas at Dallas campus, where he is currently a student, after an online petition asking for his removal received more than 28,000 signatures. Anderson was accused of raping a 19-year-old female student at a Phi Delta Theta party in 2016. He avoided jail time and having to register as a sex offender by pleading no contest to a lesser charge. (📷: AP)

Kimberly-Clark is recalling U by Kotex Sleek Tampons, Regular Absorbency, which are sold throughout the US and Canada. The company said it had received reports from people who said the tampons unraveled or came apart during removal, and in some cases, people had to seek medical attention to remove tampon pieces left inside their bodies. Kimberly-Clark recommends anyone who uses the product and experiences pain, bleeding, discomfort, itching, swelling, hot flashes, abdominal pain, nausea, or vomiting should seek immediate medical attention. (📷: Anthony Behar/Sipa USA)

The cute aggression response – the urge some people experience to squeeze, bite, or crush when they’re presented with a cute baby or animal – has been measured for the first time in the brain. The research, published in the journal Frontiers in Behavioural Neuroscience, found that the response was being caused by two strong emotions: a caretaking response and a sense of being overwhelmed by positive feelings 😄💕 (📷: Getty)

“The louder you yell, the faster they go!” the Hasbro website reads about its toy spiders called “Yellies!” These small, furry toys move faster or slower, depending on noise level, which many parents say is exactly what they did NOT need for their kids. Titles of Amazon reviews include “CHAOS,” “OY,” and “A great gift to give people you hate that have kids.” (📷: Hasbro)

200 Conservative members of parliament voted for May to stay on, while 117 voted that they had no confidence in the prime minister. The vote followed a chaotic week of disagreement over her proposed Brexit deal. (📷: Getty)

Denhollander, the recipient of @sportsillustrated’s Inspiration of the Year award, was the first woman to publicly accuse disgraced Michigan State and USA Gymnastics doctor Larry Nassar of sexual abuse. Eventually more than 300 women, including Olympic gold medalists, also came forward. “You took a huge risk and you galvanized future generations to come forward, even when the odds are seemingly stacked against them,” Ford said in a video message. “The lasting lesson is that we all have the power to create real change, and we cannot allow ourselves to be defined by the acts of others.” (📷: Sports Illustrated/Getty)

Cohen, who was one of Trump’s closest confidantes, pleaded guilty to tax fraud, campaign finance violations, and lying to Congress. Prosecutors said some of those crimes were done on Trump’s behalf and others were directed by Trump himself. Cohen himself told the judge he covered up “dirty deeds” for Trump in acts of “blind loyalty.” (📷: Getty)

In a New York Times interview, DeGeneres said she’s weighing the option to leave "The Ellen DeGeneres Show" after her contract is up in the summer of 2020. The show is currently in its 16th season. (📸: Getty Images)

It’s unclear whether “Imagine” is a song or an album, but we know the new music will be released on Thursday at midnight. Grande told fans her upcoming album would deal with “denial” and “exploring new independence.” (📸: Getty Images/@arianagrande)

Three people were killed and 12 inured in a shooting in central Strasbourg, France. Homes, restaurants, and European Parliament were under lockdown for about five hours. The gunman remains at large. (📷: Reuters)

Sydney Arlt and five other classmates created and shared a video on Twitter last Wednesday showing their professor looking upset because only a handful of students showed up to a holiday party he threw. Millions viewed and shared the video, but it was all fake. Their professor, Andrew Cline, gave them an assignment to “go viral.” Arlt obviously got an “A.” (📷: Sydney Arlt via Twitter)

The journalists spotlighted include: Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi, the Washington Post columnist who was killed inside Saudi Arabia’s consulate in Istanbul; Burmese journalists Wa Lone and Kyaw Soe Oo, two Reuters journalists who were jailed for seven years for uncovering a massacre of Rohingya Muslims; the staff of the Capital Gazette in Annapolis, Maryland, where five staff members were shot to death after a gunman opened fire in their newsroom; and Filipino journalist Maria Ressa, the editor of the Rappler, a news site in the Philippines known for its reporting on President Rodrigo Duterte’s extrajudicial killings. (📸: @time)

The series is inspired by Lindy West’s 2016 body positivity memoir, "Shrill: Notes from a Loud Woman," and is set to start streaming on March 15. Bryant stars in the six-episode series as Annie, a young woman who’s trying to succeed in journalism and balance relationships with her difficult boss, family members, and not-so-great love interests. (📸: Allyson Riggs / Hulu)
In a surprise appearance, Markle presented the British Designer of the Year award to Givenchy's Clare Waight Keller, who designed her wedding dress and veil. (📸: Tristan Fewings / Getty Images)

Ali “Ziggy” Mosslmani sued three media outlets for defamation after a photo of him went viral, arguing their stories about his haircut made him out to be a “ridiculous person.” Last week, Mosslmani reached a confidential settlement in the third and final lawsuit after settling in the two other cases earlier this year. “He’s pleased the whole thing is over,” Mosslmani’s lawyer said. (📸: Jeremy Nool)

A woman named Yi Huan won the chili-eating competition by eating 20 chilis in a minute, earning the title of “Chili Queen” 🌶👑🔥 Follow @world for more (bizarre and non-bizarre) news from around the 🌎 (📷: Getty Images)

Breana Rouhselang, who was six months pregnant, was found in a trash dumpster behind a business just hours after she was reported missing. Aaron Trejo, 16, described by police as the baby’s father, was arrested Sunday. In interviews with police, the teen allegedly told police that Breana waited too long to tell him about the pregnancy to get an abortion, and that he stabbed her “in the heart with a knife he brought from home because he thought it would kill her quickly.” (📷: GoFundMe/St. Joseph County Prosecutor’s Office)

Disick encouraged his Instagram followers to purchase a balm by iColour that “can change your eye color naturally.” According to the company, the balm — which is applied to the skin underneath the eye, not directly in the eye — works “by inhibiting melanin production,” thereby changing your eye color over time. Dr. Guillermo Rocha of the Canadian Ophthalmological Society says the claims from iColour are “a bit of a stretch,” adding, “Nothing that can be topically applied will produce an iris that will go from brown to light blue or blue-colored.” (📷: @letthelordbewithyou)

Jacob Anderson was accused of raping a 19-year-old female student at a Phi Delta Theta party in 2016. In a plea deal, the district attorney agreed to dismiss the four sexual assault charges in exchange for Anderson pleading no contest to the third-degree felony charge of unlawful restraint. The judge sentenced Anderson to three years of probation, a $400 fine, and counseling. Anderson will not have to register as a sex offender. “I have to live with the fact that my rapist will go home smiling and happy and laughing at me,” the victim read in court. “He stole my body, virginity, and power over my body and you let him keep it for all eternity.” (📷: AP)

A new report from the personal finance website NerdWallet shows that many US households have sunk deeper into debt in 2018 because rising basic costs have led them to accrue more credit card debt and to delay payments on their already massive student loans 💸 (📸: Getty Images)

Roger, who was 12-years-old, catapulted to global fame in 2015 when a photo emerged of him crushing a bucket. “Roger was our alpha male for many years, and he grew up to be a kangaroo that people from all over the world have grown to love as much as we love him too,” The Kangaroo Sanctuary Alice Springs said on Facebook. (📸: KangarooSanctuary / BuzzFeed Australia)

Ecko, Frida, Evil, Acertijo, Eros, and Nahual played a key role in the search for people who were missing after the Mexico City earthquake in 2017, according to the BBC. 🇲🇽🐶😍 Follow @world more stories from around the 🌎 (📷: @santiago_arau)

Rafael Decomas, 20, of Riviera Beach, Florida, has been charged with intimidation, and specifically with a written threat to kill or injure. According to his arrest record, police were tipped off to a tweet by an account with the name “Cutie Claus.” It read, “Bey I gern fucking kill dis professor bey this is my confession to a premeditated murder.” An officer said they were able to “cross reference” the information on the user’s Twitter profile with a database of FAU students. Decomas told police that he had no real plan or intent “to harm anyone.” (📷: Palm Beach County Sheriff’s Office/ FAU)

Naimeh Salem, an attorney for Noé Aguilar, said that US Embassy officials in Guatemala denied Aguilar's application for a visa because he "didn't have enough ties to his home country, Guatemala." "That is not true," Salem told CNN. "He has family there and his own business." During the service, a letter from Aguilar was read aloud. “Rest in peace, my princess," the letter said. (📷: FBI)

People are sharing photos of their dogs having a grand old time as winter storm Diego progresses over the Carolinas and Virginia. From left to right: Josie and Boomer, both living their best lives, and Bentley, “the senior citizen pug looking miserable [and] wanting to get back inside underneath the blankets,” according to his human 😂 (📷: AP/Kyle Smelser)

The pro-Brexit demonstration, led by the UKIP party and anti-Islam activist Tommy Robinson, pushed a strong anti-immigration message and railed against Prime Minister Theresa May’s proposed Brexit deal, which parliament will vote on on Tuesday. The counterprotest was attended by a number of activist groups supporting immigration. Police have not yet released official estimates of the number of people who attended either protest. (📷: Getty/PA Wire)
🎶 Let's go to the mall, today 🎶 (📸: AP/Getty Images/Ray Stubblebine)

A 69-year-old woman from Seattle, Washington, died after becoming infected with a rare “brain-eating” amoeba. The woman, who had developed a chronic sinus infection, was advised by her doctor to use a saline irrigation to clear out her sinuses and did so for a month, according to a case study published in the International Journal of Infectious Diseases. She used tap water filtered though a Brita water purifier.  The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommends using distilled or sterile water, or tap water that has been boiled for one minute and then cooled. (📸: Getty)

Cyntoia Brown, who fatally shot a man who was paying her for sex when she was just 16, must be imprisoned for at least 51 years, the Tennessee Supreme Court said. Brown, a teenage sex trafficking victim, was sentenced to life in prison for first-degree murder in Tennessee in 2004 after she fatally shot 43-year-old Johnny Michell Allen. Now 30, Brown said she shot him because she feared for her life. Brown is appealing her case in light of a 2012 ruling that mandatory life sentences for juveniles without the possibility of parole are unconstitutional. (📸: Nashville Police)

“John Kelly will be leaving toward the end of the year,” the president told reporters on Saturday. Trump said he would be announcing Kelly’s replacement in the next few days, but sources close to the president told BuzzFeed News they expect Trump to select Vice President Mike Pence’s chief of staff, Nick Ayers. (📸: Getty Images)

Several thousand protesters, most wearing the construction vests that have become a symbol of blue-collar rage against the government, gathered in the center of the capital for the planned demonstration that swiftly turned heated. French police deployed tear gas and stun grenades amid the clashes. (📸: Getty Images)

The scheme was revealed after the Los Angeles archdiocese began a standard audit into St. James Catholic School ahead of Sister Mary Margaret Kreuper’s retirement as principal. Kreuper and another former teacher, Sister Lana Chang, admitted what they had done and said they would pay back the money. (📸: Sisters of St. Joseph)

In an elaborate plot, the thieves shut off power to an electric fence, distracted a 120-pound guard dog named Bundy, and caused thousands of dollars in damages. The goats’ owner, Daniel Allen, says the goats were like family to him. “It’s just as if someone were to take your dog or cat,” he said. “But like 60 of them.” (📷: Green Goat Landscapers)

More than 200 employees signed a petition saying that CEO Ray Kelvin tries to massage staff, insists on hugs, and even asks for sex. The high-end British retailer’s human resources department has ignored widespread complaints of harassment, which included inviting employees to make porn movies together, kissing their ears, and openly talking about his sex life, the petition said. Ted Baker has hired a law firm to investigate the allegations. (📷: Getty)

The charges came after siblings Jade and Baddie Gi, both employees of Angels strip club in Queens, were allegedly attacked in August by members of Cardi’s team with bottles and chairs due to accusations that they’d had sex with Cardi’s husband, Offset. The rapper was released without bail and was ordered to have no contact with the victims of the August incident. (📷: Getty)

Defense attorneys for James Alex Fields Jr. had argued he was in fear of his life when he drove his car into the group of anti-racist demonstrators in 2017 and killing Heather Heyer. He was also found guilty on five counts of malicious wounding, three counts of aggravated malicious wounding, and one count of failing to stop at the scene of an accident involving a death in the attack that injured dozens of others. He now faces a federal hate crime trial. (📷: AP)

After last year’s Grammys were criticized for lacking female nominees, many of this year’s nominations are led by women. Taylor Swift and Ariana Grande were notably shut out of the major categories, while Kendrick Lamar leads the pack with eight nominations 🎶🏆 (📷: Getty)

The West Point Public Schools board voted unanimously to fire high school teacher Peter Vlaming after he repeatedly refused to use a transgender boy's male pronouns, saying that he "repeatedly refused to comply with nondiscrimination, nonharassing policies adopted by this board." Vlaming, who taught at the school for 7 years, told the board "we are here today because a specific worldview is being imposed on me" and that he was "happy to use the new name, I'm happy to avoid the pronouns that offend. I am not happy to use male pronouns for a female." (📷: 8news)

Heather Nauert is a former Fox & Friends host and current State Department spokesperson who has been described as "a proven loyalist." If approved, she will replace Nikki Haley as US ambassador to the UN.

William Barr, Trump's nomination for attorney general, served in the same role under former president George H.W. Bush. He has indicated he would carry on much of Jeff Sessions’ legacy if approved, and wrote in a co-authored Washington Post piece last month that Sessions was an "outstanding" attorney general who "attacked the rampant illegality that riddled our immigration system." (📷: Getty/AP)

The trailer shows those left behind after the devastating battle with Thanos in "Avengers: Infinity War," as they struggle to come to terms with the loss of their friends. It's set to be in theaters in April, earlier than expected (📸: Marvel)

Hart made the announcement on Twitter, writing, “I have made the choice to step down from hosting this year’s Oscar’s....this is because I do not want to be a distraction on a night that should be celebrated by so many amazing talented artists. I sincerely apologize to the LGBTQ community for my insensitive words from my past.” (📷: Getty)

The Time’s Up Legal Defense Fund has brought in more than $22 million since its launch in December 2017. Last year’s top campaign, which raised money for victims of the Las Vegas mass shooting, amassed just over half that: $11.7 million. Moreover, the Hollywood-backed campaign came close to matching what all of the top 10 campaigns of 2017 combined earned (about $23.5 million) 💰 (📷: GoFundMe)

After deleting old, anti-gay tweets that recently resurfaced, comedian Kevin Hart responded to the controversy on Instagram, telling people to “stop searching for reasons to be angry” after it was announced that he will be the next Oscars host. He did not issue an apology. (📷: Getty Images/@kevinhart4real)

Democrats have now won a California House race that was incorrectly called for the Republican incumbent on election night. They’ve also set a record for largest margin of victory in midterm history, receiving 9 million more votes than Republicans. There’s still one more undetermined House race: in North Carolina’s 9th District, officials are still working to determine if the race was tainted by election fraud. (📷: Getty Images)

BuzzFeed News has learned that several of Theresa May’s advisers have urged her to consider a second referendum and others have argued for a softer Brexit as a response to the likely event that her current Brexit deal is rejected by Parliament next week. (📷: Getty)

Kevin Hart has denied being anti-gay in the past, but a quick search through his tweets showcases his flagrant and often mocking use of the words “fag,” “homo,” and “gay.” Benjamin Lee, an editor at the Guardian, was one of the first to point out Hart’s old tweets, posting screenshots of several. The Oscars have removed celebrities from participating in the ceremony for similar transgressions. (📷: Getty Images)
The Golden Globes will air on Sunday, January 6th, and will be co-hosted by Sandra Oh and Andy Samberg ✨
We challenged PROFILE guest @tyrabanks to a trivia challenge with a die-hard “Life-Size” fan ⚡️ Watch her full interview on “PROFILE by BuzzFeed News” on Facebook this Sunday.

Cardi B explained the split in an Instagram video, saying, “Things just haven’t been working out between us for a long time, and it’s nobody’s fault. It’s just like I guess we grew out of love, but we’re not together anymore.” In the comments, Offset responded, “Y’all won,” appearing to blame public pressure for the demise of his marriage 💔 (📷: WireImage)

RuPaul will be hosting the eight-episode series on BBC Three next year, with Michelle Visage joining as judge. In a statement, RuPaul said, “I am beyond excited to celebrate the massive charisma, uniqueness, nerve and talent of the Queen’s queens.” So far, there has been no confirmation on whether the new UK series will be aired in the US 🌈 (📷: @worldofwonder)

The animal rights group said it hoped the phrases listed would become as unacceptable in society as “racist, homophobic, or ableist language.” Many pointed out that it is pretty offensive to equate “bringing home the bacon” to anti-gay behavior or racism. A spokesperson for PETA responded to the online reaction, “With so much negativity in the world, why not lighten up, smile a little more, and use language in a way that encourages being kind to animals?” (📷: PETA)

Nicholas Perkins has been charged with illegally possessing and mistreating a tiger cub that appeared in a 2017 Logan Paul video. Officials used Paul’s video to track Perkins down after receiving an anonymous tip about the cub. The tiger cub was seized by authorities and placed in a large cat rescue and sanctuary where officials say it has made a full recovery. (📷: YouTube/Logan Paul)

Trump, who has previously mocked several members of the Bush family, was seated in a row full of people he had also repeatedly insulted: Barack Obama, Michelle Obama, Bill Clinton, Hillary Clinton, and Jimmy Carter. While the Obamas and Clintons had previously been talking and laughing with each other, the mood seemed markedly different once Trump arrived. He shook hands with the Obamas but didn’t appear to acknowledge the Clintons or Carters, and Hillary Clinton, meanwhile, appeared to be avoiding eye contact with him. (📷: CSPAN)

The arrest came a day after Costa Rican police discovered a body believed to 36-year-old Carla Stefaniak, who was reported missing after traveling to Costa Rica with her sister-in-law. The security guard came into suspicion after the details he provided police were inconsistent with details investigators were able to piece together from surveillance video in the area, local authorities said. (📸: Facebook page)

“I am blown away simply because this has been a goal on my list for a long time…To be able to join the legendary list of host that have graced that stage is unbelievable, @kevinhart4real wrote on his Instagram. The Academy Awards will air February 24, 2019 on ABC 🏆 (📷: Getty Images)

A video from the account “Team VZ” titled “I HAD A MISCARRIAGE PRANK (EMOTIONAL)” is being aggressively flagged by community users. In the video, Vanessa, one of the account’s owners, sets up the disturbing and graphic “prank” by placing fake blood in a toilet, and smearing fake blood around her genital area to “prank” her partner. YouTube has not responded to repeated inquiries from BuzzFeed News about removing the content. It has, however, recently announced it has age-restricted it. (📷: Team VZ/YouTube)

The Trump administration is considering charging immigrants a $50 fee to apply for asylum protection in the US, according to sources close to the administration. There would be no waiver of the fee for those who cannot afford to pay the $50. The US has never charged a fee to apply for asylum before. (📷: Adolfo Flores/Reuters)

Nearly 250 people have gotten sick because of salmonella linked to contaminated beef. Arizona-based processor JBS Tolleson, Inc. is recalling 5.1 million pounds of raw beef products, including ground beef. The company already recalled 6.9 million pounds of raw beef products in October, bringing the total amount of meat recalled to over 12 million pounds. (📷: AP)

Cody Craig was on the clock when his coworker handed him a note from two complete strangers giving him their numbers. Tanner Forbes was playing wingman for a girl friend and helped ask Cody out for her — but he slyly decided to shoot his shot, too. As it turns out, Cody is gay, and he decided to text Tanner after encouragement from coworkers. They’ve already been on one successful date, and are going on another this week ❤️ (📷: Cody Craig)

The song was part of an assignment on the “reconstruction period in American history,” school officials said. The teacher involved in the incident has been placed on leave, while it has not been decided if the students who sang the song will face disciplinary action. (📸: Google Maps)

Teigen posted a photo of her son and wrote that he got the helmet due to his “adorable slightly misshapen head.” Many parents saw the photo and started sharing photos of their kids wearing helmets in support ♥ (📸: @chrissyteigen)

Moments after Hegerberg won the Ballon d’Or, soccer’s most prestigious award, the DJ at the award ceremony asked if she could “twerk.” Murray, who has advocated for gender equality, said the incident was “another example of the ridiculous sexism that still exists in sport.” (📸: Getty Images/@andymurray)

André Aciman, the author of the adored novel the film was based on, tweeted to confirm he’s writing a sequel. The film’s director, Luca Guadagnino, and Timothée Chalamet have both said they would do a sequel to the award-winning movie. (📸: Sony Pictures Classics)

On average, the wait was about four minutes longer for poorer neighborhoods compared to wealthier areas, according to the study in the Journal of the American Medical Association. Dr. Steven Marc Friedman of the University of Toronto said the small disparity can have a big impact. “Four minutes may make the difference between something you can shock back into a normal rhythm and something that’s irreversible.” (📷: Getty)

Earlier today, Netflix users learned that the hit NBC series “Friends” would only be available on the streaming service until Jan. 1, 2019. After a lot of angry reactions from fans, Netflix announced the beloved ’90s sitcom will be there for you to stream throughout 2019 📺 (📷: Warner Bros./Getty)

Ada Hegerberg, 23, received the first women’s Ballon d’Or award, which named her the best women's soccer player in the world. Hegerberg's major victory was marred by the sexist comments of DJ Martin Solveig, who asked her if she could twerk on stage. She responded with a curt "no." (📷: Getty Images)

The announcement about adult content, which includes photos, videos, and GIFs of “explicit sexual content and nudity,” was met with backlash from devoted Tumblr users. Adult content in written form will still be allowed on Tumblr. (📸: Reuters)

Following a whirlwind romance and very public break up with Ariana Grande, Pete Davidson shared a lengthy message that seemed to address their relationship, days after she dropped her “Thank U, Next” music video. (📸: Getty Images / Pete Davidson)

The judge gave Cardi a “one-time opportunity to show” for her next court date, scheduled for Friday, or else the court would pursue a bench warrant for her arrest. The rapper is facing charges of assault and reckless endangerment for an incident at a New York City strip club in August. (📸: Reuters)

“Mission complete,” a Bush family spokesperson captioned the photo. George H.W. Bush received Sully in June from the nonprofit America’s VetDogs, which had trained the dog to respond to the late president’s service needs. The 2-year-old Labrador retriever will now be working with troops in physical and occupational therapy at Walter Reed National Military Medical Center 💔😭 (📷: @sullyhwbush)

The petition, published on the employee campaign platform Organise, has been signed by over 200 staff members, and is now open to the public to sign. It claims that the company's CEO, Ray Kelvin, regularly "tries to massage people around the office, insists on long hugs with staff members, touches them inappropriately and openly asks his staff for sex." It also claims that the company's human resources department has ignored harassment complaints, and calls for the company to set up a way to report harassment to an “independent, external body." (📷: AP/Getty Images)

A 7.0 magnitude earthquake rocked Anchorage Friday morning, cracking buildings and roadways and sending residents running for cover in the strongest shaking to strike the city in decades. There were no reports of significant injuries or deaths. (📷: Reuters/AP/Anchorage Daily News)

Hector Hernandez was teased by friends for his “beer belly,” even though he didn’t drink beer. Exercise didn’t seem to affect his stomach, but his arms were getting thinner. After his family convinced him to see a doctor, Hernandez learned that his beer belly was a giant cancerous tumor. The diagnosis? Retroperitoneal liposarcoma, which is a rare form of cancer that begins in fat cells located toward the back of the abdomen. After a 6-hour operation, Hernandez’s tumor was removed in one giant piece. (📷: Hector Hernandez)

Police targeted people rioting over rising fuel prices and the high cost of living in France with tear gas and water cannons along the Champs-Elysees, effectively turning the city’s most famous avenue into a battle zone for the second weekend in a row. The unrest is part of growing anger towards French president Emmanuel Macron’s economic policies. Speaking from the G20 summit, he described the situation as “chaos” and accused those committing violence of manipulating public dissatisfaction. (📷: Getty)

The school district overseeing Har-Ber High School in Arkansas also threatened to fire the teacher advising the student newspaper after it published an investigation into the transfer of five football players to a rival high school. “They are like, ’Well, you raised an uproar, we’re going to try and silence you,’” Halle Roberts, 17, the paper’s editor-in-chief, told BuzzFeed News. School and district officials did not return requests for comment. (📸: Har-ber Herald / Jimmy Shaddock)

Neil deGrasse Tyson gave his account of the interactions with the women, saying that in his view he is "a friendly and accessible guy," but acknowledged that he "can surely be more sensitive to people’s personal space." A woman who attended graduate school with Tyson has accused him of drugging and raping her at his apartment in the 1980s at the University of Texas at Austin. A second woman says Tyson grabbed her and reached into her dress to see a tattoo, and a third alleges she quit as his assistant after several instances of sexual harassment. Fox Broadcasting Company and National Geographic, which airs the documentary series, are investigating the allegations (📸: Getty)

Gregory Lee Leingang, 42, pleaded guilty to planning to flip President Trump’s limo with a stolen forklift. The incident occurred in September, when Trump visited the state to give a speech at an oil refinery just outside Bismarck. Leingang stole a forklift and drove it onto the presidential motorcade route, which court documents say he attempted to use as a “deadly and dangerous weapon.” “The intent was to basically try to get to the limo, flip the limo, and get to the president, and he wanted to kill the president,” US Assistant State’s Attorney Brandi Sasse Russell said. According to Monteiro, Leingang has ADHD and bipolar disorder, and is seeing a psychiatrist and therapist in prison.(📸: AP)

A group of white supremacist YouTubers are using a new app called Cameo, which allows users to pay to have celebrities record a personalized message for them, to create videos where celebrities make coded anti-Semitic statements. Comedian Andy Dick, rapper Soulja Boy, and NFL legend Brett Favre, whose videos go for $500, all recently recorded videos with a coded anti-Semitic script provided by the group, which goes by GDL, or Goyim Defense League. The video has since been removed and Favre says that he is donating the $500 to charities that combat hate and bigotry. Cameo and representatives for the celebrities told BuzzFeed News they were unaware the messages supported anti-Semitic conspiracy theories. The two alt-right leaders behind the campaign bragged about duping the celebrities in a livestream, and encouraged followers to continue using Cameo to spread the messages. (📸: Cameo)

Director Hannah Lux Davis was preparing pre-production details for Ariana Grande's “Breathin” music video when Grande shared a new song she was working on. The single wasn’t quite finished yet, but it had a name: “Thank U, Next.” According to Davis, the “Thank U, Next” concept came together in about 10 minutes. Other secrets: the "Sorry I dipped" phrase on Pete Davidson's "Burn Book" page was improvised by Ariana as cameras were rolling, it was Grande's idea to get Kris Jenner involved, and the conversation between Grande and "Legally Blonde" star Jennifer Coolidge was totally ad-libbed. (📸: Ariana Grande/YouTube)

Three women have accused Tyson, who hosts the documentary series “Cosmos,” of inappropriate sexual behavior. One of the women first made her allegations in 2014, accusing Tyson of drugging and raping her in the 1980s. A recent interview with that woman prompted the two other women to come forward. (📸: Getty Images)

The couple tied the knot on Saturday in Jodhpur, India, in a Christian ceremony officiated by Nick’s father at the Taj Umaid Bhawan Palace. They’ll have a second ceremony as well — a Hindu one that celebrates Priyanka’s heritage 💕💍🎉 (📸: Getty Images)
"Your success now is our country's success. I am rooting hard for you." (📸: Getty Images)

Bush forged his own distinguished career in public service before he entered the White House, first as vice president and later as president himself. His wife of 73 years, Barbara, died in April with him by her side. He is survived by five children and their spouses as well as 17 grandchildren, eight great-grandchildren and two siblings. (📷: Getty)

George H.W. Bush, the 41st president of the United States and a member of a conservative American political dynasty, has died at 94. George W. Bush said in a statement that his father was “a man of the highest character and the best dad a son or daughter could ask for.” (📷: Getty)

The active-duty troops have been deployed to the border points of entry in Texas, Arizona, and California, and working with US Customs and Border Protection “in a support role.” The Department of Homeland Security has submitted a request to maintain the troop presence along the border until Jan. 31. (📷: AP)

A Texas grand jury returned a murder indictment for Amber Guyger, the 30-year-old former Dallas police officer who shot and killed Botham Jean in his own apartment. Guyger was arrested and charged with manslaughter on Sept. 9, three days after she fatally shot her 26-year-old neighbor as he was watching television in his apartment in South Side Flats. Guyger, who was off duty but in uniform at the time of the shooting, told authorities that she mistook Jean’s apartment for her own and thought he was an intruder. (📷: Kaufman County Sheriff’s Office via AP/Facebook)

It’s finally here and it doesn’t disappoint. The video premiered on YouTube and recreates iconic scenes from Mean Girls, Bring It On, Legally Blonde, and more. Plus, there’s a bonus cameo from @krisjenner (📷: Ariana Grande/YouTube)

Maria Mendoza-Sanchez called her children in Oakland and yelled "Momma is coming home!" after the US Embassy told her that she was approved for a waiver that would wipe away prohibitions preventing her from returning to the US. After over two decades in the US, Mendoza-Sanchez was deported to Mexico. She will be reunited with her four children under a work visa sponsored by the hospital where she was a nurse when she was deported a year ago. (📷: Maria Mendoza-Sanchez)

The company said that hackers gained access to a cache of personal information from Marriott's Starwood guests, including names, passport numbers, addresses and phone numbers. It is also possible that credit card information may have been taken. (📸: Getty Images)

Good news for you and your double life! Once you make your “Close Friends” list, whenever you post a Story, you’ll have the option to make it visible to Close Friends only (you know, just in case you want to post stuff that isn’t for ~everyone~). You can start by making your list, in the top corner menu bars 👯😎 (📷: Instagram)

Forty-two people — 27 men and 15 women and children — were eventually arrested during the nearly two-hour ordeal. Only two men of the 42 were referred to prosecution for illegal entry, but the Justice Department was later asked to drop the charges because of medical issues, an official told BuzzFeed News. It is unclear what will happen to the group now. (📷: AP/Reuters)

The average life expectancy for people in the US peaked in 2014 and has been dropping ever since, a decline experts attribute largely to overdoses. According to the latest official numbers from the National Center for Health Statistics, the average baby born in the US in 2017 can expect to live 78.6 years, a slight drop from the previous year’s estimate of 78.7 years. (📷: Reuters)

Sources say that Michael Cohen, Trump’s lawyer at the time, discussed it with a rep of Putin’s press secretary. This morning, Cohen pleaded guilty to lying to Congress about the plan in order to protect Trump. Check out our Story to read the full report. (📷: Getty Images)

Dasha Fincher was charged with trafficking and possession of meth with intent to distribute after a roadside drug test run by police falsely identified a bag of blue cotton candy in her car as meth. Unable to pay her $1 million cash bond, she spent over 3 months in jail and missed the birth of her grandsons. She’s now suing the county and the manufacturers of the drug test, which ProPublica has previously revealed to be seriously error-prone. (📷: Fincher/13wmaz.com)

The name is pronounced “Ab-city.” The girl’s mom, Traci Redford, told ABC7 that a gate agent started laughing and pointing at them, prompting her daughter to ask, “Mom, why is she laughing at my name?’” The gate agent allegedly posted a photo of the girl’s boarding pass on social media. Southwest says they have followed up with the employee involved. (📷: Getty)

Bolu Babalola literally spoke things into existence when she posted a photoshopped photo of herself and Michael B. Jordan as a joke after seeing a viral tweet from a girl trying to find a long-lost friend. The tweet blew up, and when Babalola went to a “Creed II” Q&A in London, she explained the situation to Jordan and actually got to meet him 😂
Watching porn in Starbucks stores was always banned, but the company did not actively block pornographic content on its in-store WiFi. (📸: Reuters)

Bob Wilson, a Southern California real estate developer, donated to each of Paradise High School’s 982 students and 105 employees, totaling about $1.1 million in donations. “I made up my mind in five minutes,” Wilson said. “I had some of the most profound experiences in my life in high school because I was still able to be a kid and it broke my heart to think of the experience these kids were missing.” ❤️ (📷: Bob Wilson/Monica LeRossignol)

Jake Bilotta and Ian McClurg are facing first-degree murder charges, accused of luring Josh Sosa to their house north of Orlando. The Seminole County sheriff said the victim was stabbed multiple times with a 7-inch chef’s knife upon arriving. A third roommate returned home and discovered McClurg holding a knife and Bilotta putting Sosa’s body into plastic bags. (📷: Getty/Seminole County Sheriff’s Office)

Young Busco, whose real name was Brandon Moore, was a father of five. He created one of the biggest memes of the decade with a clip in which he mocks a police officer’s shoes. It went massively viral after it was posted to Vine and was referenced in “Black Panther.” Moore had previously expressed frustration with the meme’s popularity, but told Vice in 2015 that “everything I do, I do for the people anyway. That’s where my fulfillment comes from. That’s how I got my payment.” (📷: @youngbusco)

"Everything you've ever asked me about Gilead and its inner workings is the inspiration for this book. Well, almost everything!" Atwood said in a tweet. "The other inspiration is the world we've been living in." (📸: Getty Images / AP)

People are sharing their favorite SpongeBob SquarePants episodes and moments after the show's creator, Stephen Hillenburg, died Monday at the age of 57 from ALS. Nickelodeon called Hillenburg a "beloved friend" in a statement to BuzzFeed News. (📷: Getty Images)

The Oscar winner cowrote the script for the "spiritual sequel" to the 1992 horror film with Win Rosenfeld. Peele says the original “Candyman” is “a landmark film for black representation in the horror genre" and "a major inspiration" to him as a filmmaker. He looks at this new sequel, which “Little Woods” director Nia DaCosta will be directing, as an entry point for new fans. Universal Pictures is slated to release the new “Candyman” in the US in June 2020 🎬😱 (📷: MGM Studios/Getty Images)

While playing an online session on his PlayStation 4 gaming console, Daniel Fabian told the witness that he was going to “smash” the 15-year-old girl at his house, which the witness took to mean having sex. The witness said he heard the victim “moan and groan” and say “no.” Fabian was charged with lewd and lascivious battery. He had been previously charged with the same felony count for allegedly raping another 15-year-old girl at his house, just three weeks before the second alleged rape occurred. (📷: Pasco County Sheriff’s Office)

The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has traced an outbreak of E. coli contamination to the central and northern coastal growing regions in California. At least 43 people in 12 states have gotten sick after eating tainted romaine lettuce. (📸: Getty)
Hillenburg, who used his background in marine biology to create the wildly popular series, died from ALS, the network announced Tuesday. He was 57. (📸: Getty Images)
Seasons greetings 😱🎄💉 (📸: White House)

Hassan al-Kontar had been stuck in the transit zone of Malaysia’s Kuala Lumpur international airport since March 7. Kontar’s situation gained international attention when he started tweeting videos of his daily life at the airport, sharing how and where he slept, ate, and washed. (📸: Hassan al-Kontar/AP)

Officials said at least two of the signs appeared to criticize Republican Sen. Cindy Hyde-Smith, who recently joked about attending a public hanging and is fighting to be reelected by voters on Tuesday. Hyde-Smith was blasted for being insensitive to the state’s history of lynching black people. Mississippi Capitol Police are reviewing surveillance video to determine who placed the signs and nooses on the capitol building. (📷: AP/Mississippi Department of Public Safety)

Christine Blasey Ford, the woman who publicly alleged that then-Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh sexually assaulted her when they were teens, said she will be donating extra money raised to pay for her security to organizations that help trauma survivors. A GoFundMe set up on behalf of the Ford family to help cover the cost of private security raised $647,610 in two months with roughly 13,000 donations. "Although coming forward was terrifying, and caused disruption to our lives, I am grateful to have had the opportunity to fulfill my civic duty," Ford said. (📷: Getty Images)

The tricky landing Monday involved slowing the InSight spacecraft to 5 mph before it plopped down on the surface of Mars, assisted by a parachute and rockets. The InSight lander's billion-dollar mission is to probe the interior of Mars and "take the planet's vital signs, its pulse and its temperature," according to NASA. The findings sent back to Earth by the spacecraft will help scientists understand more about how rocky planets are formed and evolve 🚀 (📷: NASA/Getty Images)

Hundreds of kids have traveled with the migrant caravan that started in Honduras and is beginning to arrive at the US–Mexico border. BuzzFeed News gave six of them cameras to show what the world looks like to them.

A hiker found the whales Saturday off the coast of New Zealand’s South Island. Half of them were already dead when they were found, and the remaining whales were euthanized due to their deteriorating condition. “It’s always a heartbreaking decision to make,” a local conservation official said.

Between August 2017 and July 2018 about 3,050 square miles of rainforest were cleared, 13.7% higher than the previous period, according to figures from Brazil’s environment ministry. Greenpeace Brazil says the figures mean approximately 1.185 billion trees were brought down. That’s an area equivalent to 987,500 soccer fields or 5.2 times the sprawling city of São Paulo, which has a population of more than 12 million 🌳🇧🇷 (📷: Getty)

The protests are part of the #NousToutes — which translates to “All of us (women)” — movement, which was started this summer by several French feminist groups to bring more attention to sexual violence against women. Follow @world for more news from around the globe 🇫🇷🌏 (📷: Reuters, AP, Getty)

The medieval bell tower in Italy has straightened by 1.5 inches over the last two decades, a group created to monitor the monument's restoration said. "It's as if it's had two centuries taken off its age," said Professor Salvatore Settis. The Leaning Tower has been leaning ever since one side shifted under the softer clay and sand it is built on when construction began in 1173 🇮🇹 (📷: Getty)

US authorities on Sunday temporarily shut the San Ysidro Port of Entry after a group of migrants from Central America evaded Mexican police, crossed a small river, and marched down a side street in front of a pedestrian crossing. With helicopters circling overhead, border authorities fired tear gas and rubber bullets as some of the marchers approached the US at a metal fence where train tracks run through. At least one person crossed the barrier and was detained by a US border agent, an eyewitness said. Mexican police urged the marchers to return to the stadium where many have been living for days. (📷: Reuters/@adolfof87)

Nearly 200 sea turtles have died off Cape Cod, Massachusetts after apparently falling victim to the recent cold snap in the Northeast US. A spokesperson for the local agency rescuing the turtles told the Cape Cod Times the “vast majority of them” were “frozen solid.” Many of the turtles were found frozen in slushy ice water, while others washed up on shore. (📷: Mass Audubon)

Brianna and Heidi met on a dinner cruise in Honolulu, Hawaii back in 2006 and became fast friends. 12 years later, Brianna put a call out on Twitter for help tracking down Heidi. It took less than 12 hours for the pair to be reconnected. “I honestly thought it would take at least a week to find her,” Brianna told BuzzFeed News.

A border patrol agent said the woman fell off the fence near the San Ysidro point of entry and landed on pieces of rebar that pierced her side and buttocks. She was transported to a local hospital with non-life threatening injuries. (📸: Getty Images)

Since September, at least 13 California sea lions have been reported dead along Washington's shoreline, including six that were confirmed shot. Most recently, one animal washed up on the shore in West Seattle with its head sliced off. All 13 deaths are suspected to have resulted from human interactions, according to the Seal Sitters Marine Mammal Stranding Network. The Marine Mammal Protection Act prohibits the harassment, hunting, capturing, or killing of marine mammals and can result in fines of up to $28,520 and one year in prison. (📸: Getty Images)

In a tweet, "The Good Place" actor Jameela Jamil called out celebs like Cardi B for hawking detox teas on social media. In Cardi's case, she claimed the tea — which has a laxative effect — helped her lose weight she’d gained after giving birth to her daughter. Previously, Jamil called out Kim Kardashian for promoting "appetite suppressing" lollipops, and encouraged anyone who wants to get healthier to see a doctor, rather than mimicking what they see online. (📸: AP, Jameela Jamil)

Indian authorities have completed three expeditions to North Sentinel Island, where 26-year-old American missionary John Allen Chau was killed by a remote tribe last week during an illegal attempt to visit them. Police say they've mapped the area of the island where Chau’s body lies, but in order to recover it "have to see what is possible, taking utmost care of the sensitivity of the group and the legal requirements.” Police are seeking help from anthropologists and academics as part of their investigation, due to the risk posed by interfering with the Sentinelese people, who are the only inhabitants of the island and have remain completely disconnected from the outside world. (📸: AP)

Police responding to a shooting at an Alabama mall on Thanksgiving that left an 18-year-old man shot twice and a 12-year-old girl also wounded shot and killed 21-year-old Emantic Fitzgerald Bradford Jr. as he ran from the scene with a gun. Bradford was initially described as the suspect in the fight-turned-shooting, but later said though he “may have been involved in some aspect of the altercation, he likely did not fire the rounds that injured the 18-year-old victim.” The suspect who possibly shot the 18-year-old and young bystander is still at large.
