Congolese gynecologist Denis Mukwege and Yazidi Kurdish human rights activist Nadia Murad earned the honor for "their efforts to end the use of sexual violence in war and armed conflict." Mukwege, 63, has treated tens of thousands of women who were raped during conflicts in the Democratic Republic of the Congo, while Murad, 24, was the victim of sexual violence while held captive by the Islamic State in Iraq, and has since become a human rights activist. (📷: Getty)

Chiara Bordi was the first woman with prosthesis to ever compete in the Miss Italia finals. Bordi lost her leg in a moped accident five years ago, but that didn’t stop her from becoming a model and pushing for body diversity in the industry 🇮🇹👑 Follow @world for more headlines from around the 🌏 (📸: Getty, @missitalia)

Over the past week, women across the US have taken to the streets to raise their voices against the confirmation of Brett Kavanaugh to the Supreme Court. These pictures capture the energy and emotion behind the protests. (📷: Getty Images/ Reuters)

Actors Amy Schumer and Emily Ratajkowski were among protesters detained at the Hart Senate Office Building while demonstrating against the nomination of Brett Kavanaugh to the Supreme Court. In a video posted to Twitter, a cop asked Schumer, “Do you want to get arrested.” “Yes,” she replied, holding a sign that reads, “We believe Anita Hill.” (📷: Twitter)

The controversial show is a satirical reimagining of the 1989 cult classic film that addresses suicide, guns, and violence in high school. It was supposed to premiere in March, but was canceled after the Parkland school shooting amid criticism that it would be insensitive to air it during such a contentious time. It will now air as a marathon starting on Oct. 25. (📷: Paramount Network)

The former rap mogul hit two men in a Compton, California parking lot after an argument in 2015. In the confrontation, which was captured on surveillance video, Knight backed his truck into Cle “Bone” Sloan before driving forward into Terry Carter, killing him. (📷: AP)

Democrats have criticized the investigation into sexual misconduct allegations against the Supreme Court nominee as being limited and incomplete. “The most notable part of this report is what’s not in it,” Democratic Sen. Dianne Feinstein said. Meanwhile, Republicans say the investigation has cleared Kavanaugh of the sexual misconduct allegations against him and plan to move forward with a procedural vote on his nomination on Friday. The investigation document is currently classified but many senators have said that either the report itself or a summary of it should be made public. (📷: Getty)

The US survey found millennial men were much more likely than women to call themselves a socialist or democratic socialist, with 39% of all men saying they’d identify that way compared to 22% of all women. Forty-eight percent of Democrats said they’d call themselves either a socialist or democratic socialist, compared to 31% of all millennials. About one-third of all millennial men (36%) said they would prefer a white political candidate, if all else was equal. Only 11% of women surveyed held that opinion. The online poll from BuzzFeed News and Maru/Blue surveyed 1,006 millennials. (📸: Getty Images)

One law enforcement officer was killed and six others were wounded Wednesday in Florence, South Carolina after a shooter opened fire on officers attempting to serve a search warrant. Officers were attempting to serve a search warrant at a home when sheriff's deputies were struck by gunfire, and the suspect kept firing as other officers responded to the scene. The officer killed was a 30-year veteran of the department. The suspect, who was barricaded in the home with children, was taken into custody following a two-hour standoff. (📸: AP)

Mischa Barton, best known for playing Marissa Cooper on the “The OC," is joining the cast of MTV's "The Hills: New Beginnings." Barton starred on the first three seasons of "The OC," set in Orange County, California, loosely inspiring the original version of "The Hills" and the reality series it was a spinoff from, "Laguna Beach." The reboot will star former cast members Heidi and Spencer Pratt, Whitney Port, Audrina Patridge, Brody Jenner, Frankie Delgado, Justin "Bobby" Brescia, and Jason Wahler. (📸: Getty)

The film is still in very early stages, so it’s unclear how Disney will bring an alien like Stitch to life. The company is also in the process of making live action remakes of “Mulan”, “Aladdin”, “Dumbo”, “The Lion King”, and “Lady and the Tramp.” (📷: Walt Disney Pictures)

“I won’t be doing a full season of Brooklyn Nine Nine in Season 6,” she wrote. “But that doesn’t mean I won’t ever be back, winky face emoji, heart emoji.” Peretti has been playing the beloved character Gina Linetti since the show began on Fox in 2013. (📷: Getty)

In Dawson’s eight-part docuseries, he speculates about if Jake Paul and/or his brother Logan are “sociopaths,” an outdated layman’s term for antisocial personality disorder, according to medical experts. “The fall of Jake Paul and the darkness of his world is something I’m fascinated by,” Dawson says. Other YouTubers like Keemstar and Philip DeFranco have chimed in and commenters have turned into armchair psychologists overnight, leading some to criticize the series as “irresponsible.” (📷: YouTube)

The Oscar-winning actor is known for pushing his body to its limits for roles and gained 40 pounds to play Cheney. “Vice” will also star Sam Rockwell as former president George W. Bush, Amy Adams as Lynne Cheney, and Steve Carell as former secretary of defense Donald Rumsfeld. The movie premieres on Christmas Day. (📷: Annapurna Pictures/Getty)

Today at 2:18 p.m. ET, FEMA will send the first nationwide test of its presidential alert system, which lets the president send a message to every phone in the US in the event of a national emergency. Just in case you were wondering: Trump *shouldn’t* be able to use the system to broadcast his tweets (the law explicitly states otherwise). (📸:Getty Images/FEMA)

At a rally, President Trump mocked Christine Blasey Ford’s testimony where she said she was sexually assaulted by Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh. “I don't know. I don't know," the president imitated as supporters laughed. He previously said she was "very credible." (📷: AP)

Gage Wilson was digging into the side of a sand dune while he was with two other members of his troop. Once he dug into the other side of the hill, Gage crawled inside the hole, at which point the hill collapsed, trapping him inside the sand at the water’s edge. He was trapped inside the sand between 15 and 30 minutes before other Scouting members realized he was buried inside. “Gage enjoyed helping others whenever he could as an active participant in the Boy Scout Troop #244 in Portage and Pathfinder Church,” his obituary read. (📷: Facebook/ langelands.com)

Apple has announced that redhead emojis are finally available — but only as a part of the iOS public beta. Here’s what you need to do to access them as well as new curly haired, gray-haired, and bald characters. Back up your phone > Head to Apple's Beta software program > Click on "Get Started" and enroll your device by entering your Apple ID credentials > Go to beta.apple.com/profile on your iOS device and tap "Download profile" > Update your iOS device to install any beta software. When the emojis become available to everyone, you can unenroll from the beta program 📲 (📷: Apple)

Two people were hospitalized after a white powdery substance was mailed to Sen. Ted Cruz’s campaign office in Houston. “Upon opening the package, two employees felt ill” and were transported to the hospital, according to the FBI. The agency did not provide further details on their condition. The Houston Fire Department’s HazMat team has investigated the substance and found that it was not hazardous. (📷: AP)

Border Patrol agent Dennis Dickey has pleaded guilty to accidentally starting a massive wildfire that torched 47,000 acres of Arizona's parched grasslands, forcing residents from their homes, requiring 800 firefighters to extinguish the blaze, and, ultimately, costing authorities more than $8 million. The father-to-be filled a target with powder that would burst either pink or blue. He had also added Tannerite, a highly explosive but legal substance, and when he fired his rifle, the blast sent sparks into the state's dry brush and started the Sawmill fire."I feel absolutely horrible about it," the father-to-be said in court. "It was probably one of the worst days of my life." (📷: YouTube)

The wage increase applies to more than 250,000 Amazon and Whole Foods employees as well as the more than 100,000 temporary employees the company will hire for the upcoming holiday season. This comes after members of Congress, including Senator Bernie Sanders, pointed out that some Amazon employees were relying on food stamps while the company was valued at over $1 trillion. (📸: Getty Images)

Anthonius Gunawan Agung, 21, made sure that the plane had safely lifted off before he jumped from the crumbling control tower at Palu Airport. He broke his legs, arms, and ribs and died from internal injuries on his way to the hospital. Follow @world for more coverage of the Indonesia earthquake and tsunami. (📸: @icoze_ricochet/Getty Images)

Sarah Palin's oldest son Track has been arrested after his ex-girlfriend told police he repeatedly punched her in the back of her head when she dropped off their son for a visit. (📷: Getty Images/ KTVA-TV)

Donte Palmer, a father of three boys, ignited many online conversations after his older son snapped a photo of him struggling to change his youngest son’s diaper in a public bathroom. “What’s the deal with not having changing tables in men’s bathroom as if we don’t exist!!” Donte captioned the photos. “Clearly we do this often because look how comfortable my son is.” 👶 (📷: @3boys_1goal)

Robbie Tripp, the guy who went viral last year for describing his wife as a “curvy goddess” in an Instagram post is suing babe.net for comparing his book “Create Rebellion,” to the Unabomber manifesto. Tripp is arguing that the review of his book is “targeted harassment.” However, Harry Shukman, the writer behind the scathing review, has defended his right to free speech, saying “readers of babe dot net deserve to know that in our opinion, the Curvy Wife Guy's book sucks an entire ass.” 👀📚( 📷: @tripp, Babe)

Police told BuzzFeed News the rapper was charged with assault and reckless endangerment after she was allegedly involved in a strip club brawl in which two employees were reportedly hurt. According to the New York Post’s Page Six, siblings Jade and Baddie Gi, who worked at Angels Strip Club, said they were attacked by members of Cardi’s team in late August because of allegations they had sex with the rapper’s husband, Offset. (📸: AP}

“You didn’t want to become the face of a movement; you wanted a procedure that would have saved your life,” Watson wrote in an open letter to Savita Halappanavar, who died in Ireland in 2012 after she was denied access to an abortion. Earlier this year, Ireland voted to overturn the abortion law. (📸: PA Images / Getty Images)

Former FBI director James Comey says the bureau’s investigation into allegations of sexual assault against Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh shouldn’t be limited to one week, calling the process “deeply flawed” and “idiotic.” But, Comey added, the bureau “can find out a lot” during even a one-week investigation: "It is better to give professionals seven days to find facts than have no professional investigation at all.” The White House authorized the FBI to conduct the one-week investigation after Sen. Jeff Flake said he would only vote for Kavanaugh if such a probe took place. But Comey argued neither Republicans nor Democrats are really focused on finding the truth: “If truth were the only goal, there would be no clock," he said. (📸: Reuters)

These devastating photos show the aftermath of what a 10-foot tsunami and a 7.5-magnitude earthquake did to Indonesia: buildings reduced to rubble, people crying for lost loved ones, survivors sorting through the wreckage of their destroyed homes to gather what might be left, and medical personnel helping those injured in a makeshift hospital. (📷: Getty Images/ Reuters)

Hundreds gathered in Paris in memory of Vanesa Campos, a 36-year-old Peruvian transgender sex worker who was shot dead in August while reportedly trying to defend her client from robbers who attacked his car. Follow @world for more headlines from around 🌏 (📷: Getty Images)

Kanye West wore a MAGA hat during his "SNL" musical performance and went on a pro-Trump rant at the end of the show. “The blacks want always Democrats,” Kanye said. “You know it’s like the plan they did, to take the fathers out the home and put them on welfare … does anybody know about that? That’s a Democratic plan.”(📷: Twitter)

“I feel very empathetic, frankly, to victims of sexual assault, sexual harassment, and rape. I’m a victim of sexual assault,” Conway told CNN’s Jake Tapper on State of the Union. “I don’t expect Judge Kavanaugh or Jake Tapper or Jeff Flake or anybody to be held responsible for that. You have to be responsible for your own conduct,” she said. (📸: CNN)

“Now, I’m usually an optimist. I’m a keg is half full kind of guy,” Damon, as Kavanaugh, said. “But what I’ve seen from the monsters on this committee makes me want to puke — and not from beer.” (📸: NBC)

Eight new fall shows on network TV are led by actors of color, doubling from the total of four this time last year. “It influences the way people treat us in real life,” said Kristen Marston from Color of Change, an organization monitors the portrayals of black people on television and in other media.

Wanuri Kahiu’s film “Rafiki” was banned in her home country of Kenya because it featured a love story between two women. But after a judge temporarily lifted the ban, Kenyans had seven days to finally watch it in their own country. One moviegoer, who identifies as queer, wrote on Twitter the movie was a powerful statement “for those struggling to be themselves in a chaotic world,” and those who “wept through the movie because that is their reality.” (📸: Getty Images/Reuters)

At least 380 people are dead and hundreds more were injured a powerful earthquake struck Indonesia, triggering a tsunami. Videos from the scene showed water crashing into buildings, smashing them into pieces. (📸: Getty Images)

Lohan went live from Moscow and approached a family she claimed were Syrian refugees. She then asked a young boy to leave with her, repeatedly telling the adults to let her take him for the night and telling the woman who appeared to be his mother that “if someone is offering them a home and a bed, give it to them. This is not right.” Eventually, Lohan began following the family and accusing them of trafficking children. She reached out for the boy’s hand, the mother appeared to punch her, and Lohan fell to the ground crying. (📷: Lohan)

Kevin Spacey has been sued by a man who alleges the actor groped him and then tried to force him into oral sex during a private massage session in Malibu in 2016. Authorities are already investigating a sexual assault report involving Spacey in Malibu that same year, but have not elaborated on what allegedly happened. The man, identified only as John Doe, alleges that he was called to the actor's home for a private massage session, during which the actor complained of “discomfort in his groin area,” then groped him and asked the man to “let me give you a blow job." The man said Spacey tried to block him from leaving, and that he reported the alleged assault to police afterward. The man is suing for sexual battery, assault, false imprisonment, and intentional infliction of emotional distress. (📸: Getty)

The film's plot is expected to cover the "Mister Rogers' Neighborhood" host and his relationship with journalist Tom Junod (Matthew Rhys), who, while working on a magazine profile of Rogers, learned more about kindness, empathy, and decency. The still-untitled movie is set for an October 2019 release. (📸: Lacey Terrell)

Trump has ordered a one-week FBI investigation of Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh, a day after senators heard testimony from Christine Blasey Ford, who accused him of sexually assaulting her in high school. Republicans agreed to the one-week investigation. The Senate Judiciary Committee voted to advance Kavanaugh's nomination earlier Friday, but only after Republican swing vote Jeff Flake surprised everyone by adding new conditions. Kavanaugh said in a statement sent by the White House that he would cooperate with the FBI probe. (📸: Getty)

If you were asked to log back into Facebook today, this is probably why. “The attackers could use the account as if they are the account holder,” a Facebook executive said. The company says the vulnerability has been patched and it has notified law enforcement. (📷: Getty)

The next step is a full Senate vote on Kavanaugh’s Supreme Court nomination, but Republican Jeff Flake, at the last minute, called for a one-week delay to allow the FBI to investigate the sexual assault allegations made against Kavanaugh. (📷: Reuters)

After Christine Blasey Ford testified about her alleged sexual assault by Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh, the Rape, Abuse, & Incest National Network (@rainn) hotline said it saw an “unprecedented” 147% jump in people seeking support on Thursday. The hotline is at 800-656-4673. More resources are available at rainn.org. (📷: Getty)

UPDATE: On Friday, RAINN released an updated tally and said the number of people helped by the hotline on Thursday was 201% above average.

Tesla CEO Elon Musk is being sued by the Securities and Exchange Commission over “false and misleading public statements” regarding the possibility of taking his corporation private. (📷: Getty Images)

Marks & Spencer has created a clothing line designed for children with disabilities. The clothes have been adapted in different ways for children who need extra help getting dressed 👚👕Follow @world for more headlines from around the 🌏(📷: @marksandspencer)

Actor and longtime liberal activist Jane Fonda expressed sympathy for President Donald Trump during an interview with Politico in which she encouraged his opponents to empathize with him. And people online had thoughts about it. “This is a man who was traumatized as a child by his father, who had a mother that didn’t protect him,” said Fonda. “And the behavior is the language of the wounded.” (📷: Getty Images, Twitter)

Bill Cosby will serve between 3-10 years at the State Correctional Institution at Phoenix for raping Andrea Constand in 2004. The maximum security prison holds 3,830 beds, has a gym, barbershop, religious service rooms, and over 30 classrooms. Initially, the 81-year-old comedian wasn’t given a cellmate because of his high profile, but prison officials are hopeful he’ll join the general population. (📷: Reuters, Supplied, YouTube)

The bitter rivalry between the US and Canadian women’s hockey teams runs deep and has lasted for decades, which makes the marriage of three-time Olympic and world champions Meghan Duggan (Team USA) and Gillian Apps (Team Canada) all the more romantic. Congrats to the happy couple! 💍💕 (📷: Getty/Meghan Duggan/Canadian Press)

Julie Swetnick said in a sworn declaration that the Supreme Court nominee and his friends helped spike punch to incapacitate women at high school house parties. “I have a firm recollection of seeing boys lined up outside rooms at many of these parties waiting for their ‘turn’ with a girl inside the room,” she said, adding that “these boys included” Kavanaugh. Swetnick also wrote that Kavanaugh was present when she was gang raped by a group of boys at a party in 1982. (📷: Getty)

“Top Chef” host Padma Lakshmi said in a New York Times op-ed that she was raped by her boyfriend as a teenager, and was compelled to break her silence on the issue after politicians wondered why two women accusing Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh of sexual misconduct didn’t report it sooner. “I am speaking now because I want us all to fight so that our daughters never know this fear and shame and our sons know that girls’ bodies do not exist for their pleasure and that abuse has grave consequences,” Lakshmi wrote. (📸: Getty Images)

India Landry, then 17, had abstained from the Pledge of Allegiance at her Houston high school more than 200 times without a problem, she says, but on Oct. 2, 2017, she was in Principal Martha Strother’s office when she refused to stand during the pledge. “Principal Strother upon seeing this immediately expelled India from school saying ‘Well you’re kicked outta here,’” according to a federal complaint, adding that a school secretary then added, “This is not the NFL.” Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton filed a brief asking a federal judge for permission to argue against the student in order to defend a state law, which mandates parental permission for students who sit out during the pledge. India's lawyer argues the state has no legitimate interest in whether students sit or stand for the pledge. (📸: KHOU)

Former "Southern Charm" star Thomas Ravenel was arrested and charged with assault and battery after a woman filed a report in May alleging she was raped by the Bravo star at his home in 2015. Ravenel announced he was quitting "Southern Charm" on his Twitter, saying he had "too much to lose" and told the show's producers he wasn't coming back. Bravo confirmed that Ravenel is no longer associated with the show. (📸: Charleston County Sheriff’s Office)

Brooke Crews pleaded guilty to killing 22-year-old Savanna Greywind, a neighbor who she says she killed by cutting a baby out of her and claiming it as her own to cover up a a fabricated pregnancy. Crews testified that her boyfriend William Hoehn issued an ultimatum to "produce a baby" after discovering she had sent him a fake sonogram and pregnancy test. Hoehn is on trial for conspiracy to commit murder for his role in allegedly covering up Greywind's death in 2017, having allegedly hidden Greywind's body in the apartment he shared with Crews and then disposing her body in a river. Greywind's baby survived the attack and is being raised by her family. (📸: Cass County Sheriff’s Department)

Cosby will also be required to register as a sexual predator for life, becoming the first major celebrity of his stature to be sentenced for assault in the #MeToo era. The 81-year-old comedian was sentenced as multiple women who have also accused him of assault looked on. (📸: AP)

Facebook, which purchased Instagram in 2012, was blindsided by Kevin Systrom and Mike Krieger’s decision to leave the company, sources tell BuzzFeed News. In a statement, Systrom wrote, “We’re planning on taking some time off to explore our curiosity and creativity again.” (📸: Getty Images)

Titled "Part 2", the Netflix documentary series will follow Steven Avery's lawyers attempting to prove his innocence and his nephew Brendan Dassey's lawyers, who are trying to prove that his confession was involuntary. It premieres globally October 19. (📷: Netflix)

After seeing Christie Dietz’s five-year-old son park his bike by the lamppost pretty much every day, a neighbor made a parking sticker just for him. Dietz wrote on Twitter that the sticker, “Absolutely made our day. People can be so brilliant.” (📸: Christie Dietz)

These devices called epidural stimulators deliver electrical impulses to the lower spine. That stimulation, combined with an intense rehabilitation program — in one case, 278 sessions in nearly two years — may help sync up the brain’s intention to walk with actual movement of the limbs. (📷: University of Louisville)

Aldi Novel Adilang, 19, was working as a lamp keeper on a floating fish trap in July when the rope fixing to the seabed came loose. He drifted thousands of miles, surviving by catching fish and filtering seawater through his clothes. He was finally picked up by a Panamanian-flagged vessel at the end of August in water nears Guam and taken to Japan. Indonesian consular officials said Aldi was in good health and has been reunited with his family 🌊🙏 (📷: Indonesian Consulate General Osaka)

The walkout was arranged in response to the backlash against Ford, who accused Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh of sexually assaulting her when they were both in their teens. Ford will testify before Congress about the allegation Thursday. Since breaking her silence, Ford has been criticized and had her credibility questioned by conservative media outlets, Republican leaders, and even President Trump. She also reportedly has been forced to leave her home due to death threats against her and her family. (📷: Getty/AP)
⚾☀👨‍👦(📸: Getty Images)

Amber Guyger, 30, shot Botham Jean after entering his apartment allegedly believing it was her own. Guyger was arrested and charged with manslaughter three days after the shooting. (📸: Handout/Reuters/Facebook)

Camerota, who spent more than a decade at Fox News before moving to CNN in 2014, said harassment and bullying were rampant at the network. “There was sexual harassment and there was emotional harassment,” she said on BuzzFeed News’ “Profile,” “And there was sort of bullying and there was ideological harassment.” (📸: BuzzFeed News)

A second woman has come forward with claims of sexual misconduct against Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh. Deborah Ramirez, who attended Yale University with Kavanaugh in the 1980s, told the New Yorker that the then-18-year-old Kavanaugh exposed his penis to her at a college dormitory party. Ramirez said she was drunk at the time, on the floor, and slurring her words, and she recalls someone putting his penis in her face, which she pushed away. The New Yorker was not able to confirm with other eyewitnesses that Kavanaugh was present at the party. Kavanaugh has denied the allegations, which come a week after being accused of sexual misconduct in high school by Christine Blasey Ford. (📸: Getty)

Tammie Hedges, the owner of Crazy's Claws N' Paws, was arrested on criminal charges after she housed the pets of residents who were fleeing the area as Hurricane Florence approached North Carolina. Hedges took in more than 25 cats and dogs at a warehouse in Wayne County that was in the process of being converted into a shelter, but the warehouse had not been officially registered as an animal shelter. Wayne County Animal Services confiscated the animals, and Hedges was charged with 12 counts of practicing veterinary medicine without a license and one count of solicitation of a controlled substance. Hedges was released on a $10,000 bond, and a volunteer for Crazy's Claws N' Paws has started a GoFundMe page to help with her legal fees. (📸: CBS17)
The reboot will premiere sometime in 2019, with production reportedly beginning this fall (📸: Getty Images/CBS)

The patients who received the drug are now suing the pharmacy that mixed it, the company that allegedly designed the shoddy recipe, and the clinics that injected it. The lawsuits spotlight the shadowy, booming industry of “compounding pharmacies.” (📸: BuzzFeed News)

Wanuri Kahiu’s acclaimed film “Rafiki” was banned in her home country of Kenya because it featured a love story between two women. A judge ordered a temporary lift on the ban, allowing Kahiu to submit the film for Academy Award consideration. Follow @buzzfeedlgbt for more 🎥🌟🏳️‍🌈! (📸: Getty Images)

Immigrants who use or are likely to use public benefits, such as food stamps and housing vouchers, could be denied green cards or entry into the United States under a new proposal released by the Trump administration. The proposed regulation would affect roughly 382,000 people per year. Homeland Security Secretary Kirstjen Nielsen said the proposed rule is “intended to promote immigrant self-sufficiency and protect finite resources, while opponents have called it "a new family separation policy [that] it will lead to families being torn apart or becoming sick and hungry." (📸: Getty)

Life expectancy in the US has dropped for the second year in a row and death rates from 5 of the 12 leading causes of death have gone up, with more Americans dying from drug overdoses, chronic liver disease, suicide, Alzheimer's, and septicemia (serious blood infections) than in the past. From 2014 to 2015, life expectancy decreased by 0.2 years, which was the first decline since 1993. The next year it dropped again, another 0.1 years, from 2015 to 2016, according to the CDC. So-called “deaths of despair” are a growing problem in the US, especially among young people. Between 2006 and 2016, the number of deaths from these causes skyrocketed. The age-adjusted death rate for drug overdoses increased 72%, and for suicides it increased 23%. (📸: CDC.gov)

Christine Blasey Ford, the research psychologist who accused Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh of sexually assaulting her in high school, says she will testify about the incident to the Senate Judiciary Committee. Ford and her lawyers have been locked in a week of tense public negotiation with the committee, and her lawyers said they were "disappointed with the leaks and the bullying that have tainted the process." Ford alleges the attack happened at a house party in 1982, and said Kavanaugh was "trying to attack me and remove my clothing." Kavanaugh has denied the allegations, while President Trump attacked Ford's credibility in a series of tweets. (📸: Getty)

Standard tickets started at $29.50 but were sold out on Ticketmaster for all shows after a few hours. Now the cheapest ticket for the speaking event at the Barclays Center in Brooklyn is $996, and the cheapest in Chicago is $500. (📸: becomingmichelleobama.com)

John Miller, 67, and his son, Michael Miller, 31, were charged with first-degree murder in the death of Aaron Howard, 37, who the father and son from Abilene, Texas fatally shot over a dispute about trash. The deadly encounter was recorded on video by Howard’s common-law wife Kara Box, and shows the Millers arguing with Howard over a mattress that Howard had dumped in the shared alleyway. Howard, who did not have a gun, was shot at least twice and died on the way to the hospital. The Millers both admitted to shooting Howard and are each being held on $250,000 bail. (📸: Taylor County Jail, Facebook)

Carson, the secretary of Housing and Urban Development, described the sexual assault allegations against Supreme Court nominee and Judge Brett Kavanaugh as part of a long-running plot to overturn American democracy. Speaking at the Values Voter Summit in Washington, DC, Carson referenced the Fabian Society, founded in 1884 by socialists in the UK, and said "They don’t like what America is and what it represents, and they want to change us to another system. And in order to do that, there are three things that they must control: the educational system, the media, and the courts." The HUD did not return requests for comment. (📸: AP)

Police arrested 58-year-old Roy Charles Waller on suspicion of being the so-called NorCal Rapist, who they say raped 10 women across Northern California from 1991 to 2006, using DNA and a genealogy database much like in the Golden State Killer case. Waller, who had worked at the University Of California, Berkeley, as a safety specialist since 1992, was charged with 12 counts of forcible sexual assault. Police say the NorCal rapist would primarily attack Asian women in their twenties and thirties, entering their homes late at night and sometimes kidnapping them to go to ATMs. The case was cold for 27 years, but forensic scientists made a match within the last 10 days using the internet database GEDmatch and DNA information from crime scenes. Waller faces life in prison if convicted. (📸: Sacramento Police)

When Zoey Oxley, a freshman at Ohio University, couldn't remember her professor's name while writing an essay, she added a temporary nickname in the heading, and joked with a friend about how bad it would be if she accidentally sent it in. Well, Zoey did send in her essay with her teacher's name as "Professor whats his nuts." "As soon as I closed my laptop, it hit me, she said," and after realizing she couldn't undo the mistake, Zoey sent her professor an apology. John Hendel, who's actually an MFA student, said he didn't think much of it until he was grading papers the next day and saw the error, but fortunately he had a sense of humor about it: "I found it hilarious," he said. Now, they've both gone viral, but Hendel says at the next class, "I'm basically going to act like nothing happened." (📸: Zoey Oxley, Hendyhendel via Twitter)
Warner Bros. shared a short clip of Phoenix, who will be playing a new take on the Clown Prince of Crime in an origin film coming October 2019. (📸: Warner Bros.)

Rihanna was appointed as an Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary by Barbados’s Prime Minister. California just became the first state to restrict the distribution of plastic straws at restaurants under a bill signed into law by Gov. Jerry Brown. The new law prohibits full-service, dine-in restaurants from providing single-use plastic straws unless requested by customers. In a letter to legislators, Brown called the law “a very small step” to help reduce waste from single-use plastic products. Violators could face fines of $25 for each day the restaurant is in violation 🍹🚫 (📸: Getty)

It was 1:30 a.m. when Toronto resident Jenny Serwylo heard strange noises coming from her kitchen. When she ran down her hallway, she found three raccoons in the kitchen; one was rifling through the garbage, another was hanging out the window trying to get in, and one was on the counter. The raccoon camped out on the toaster oven ended up eating all of her tortillas and a bag of English muffins until she could make enough noise to scare it away. "I still like them – they need to eat, I guess," Serwylo said. "But they're kind of a pain in the ass." (📸: Jenny Serwylo)

The Safe Haven Pet Sanctuary in Green Bay, Wisconsin, shared adorable photos showing one of their volunteers, Terry, napping with cats. Elizabeth Feldhausen, the founder, told BuzzFeed News that Terry started coming by the shelter about six months ago and over the last few months has started coming every day. "He brushes all of the cats, and can tell you about all of their likes and dislikes. He also accidentally falls asleep most days. We don't mind — Cats needs this!" the shelter said 😻 (📸: safehavengb on Facebook)

After serving 15 years for her role in abducting Elizabeth Smart, Wanda Barzee was released from a Utah state prison on Wednesday. Smart said that Barzee often told her husband, Brian David Mitchell, to rape her and that she doesn't believe Barzee is apologetic for her actions. “I don't think you can just kidnap a 14-year-old girl, but not only sit by her while she's being raped but encourage the rapist to continue, and then at the end of it say ‘I'm sorry’ and really mean it,” Smart told CBS. It will be the basketball star’s first major role since “Trainwreck.” Bugs Bunny will also returning to the sequel with Terence Nance, the creator of the HBO show “Random Acts of Flyness,” directing and “Black Panther” director Ryan Coogler producing. Strangers often compliment Mehlani's eyes. What they don't realize, however, is that Mehlani has Axenfeld-Rieger syndrome, which affects eye development. Martinez wants Mehlani to know she'll always be loved, even if strangers aren't kind. "I’ll just tell her God made her that way for a reason. Everybody has something that makes them different." Manafort's plea deal is a dramatic reversal after he spent the past year fighting the charges filed by special counsel Robert Mueller's office at every turn. Wanda Barzee, 72, is expected to be released after the Utah Board of Pardons and Parole announced it had not taken into account time that she had served in federal prison. “I do believe she is a threat," said Elizabeth Smart, who was kidnapped at 14 and held captive for nine months. The Al Cannon Detention Center in Charleston County and the Berkeley County Detention Center said they will not relocate inmates — as millions of people evacuate the region ahead of Hurricane Florence's expected landfall on Friday. A spokesperson for the Charleston County Sheriff’s Office said the detention center can withstand winds of up to 155 mph and that the facility's overseeing doctor increased medical staffing ahead of the storm. Berkeley County officials said their facility is “self-sustaining and safe.” (📷: Getty Images)

A video shared to Facebook showed a woman screaming at a man behind the wheel of a car, who began recording the interaction. She is seen on the phone with police with her hand on Chris Hampshire’s car, screaming and alleging that she’s being run over and injured by the stationary car. She then begins to scream "Mike! Mike!" repeatedly. The video ended up going viral and cost the woman in the video her job as a gate attendant at a park in Texas. Millions have evacuated in North and South Carolina ahead of the storm, with most coastal areas under mandatory evacuation orders. Katy Williams and her son Finn are seriously injured after they were attacked by a giraffe near their home on a wildlife preserve in South Africa. The female giraffe who attacked the mother and son had recently given birth, and was likely trying to protect her calf. Both the mother and son are stable but remain under sedation. (📷: Supplied)

Dallas police say the white woman officer was returning to what she believed to be her apartment when she encountered the victim, 26-year-old Botham Jean. Grande temporarily disabled her Instagram comments on Friday afternoon amid a flood of abuse from trolls, who wrote vile messages to the star in the wake of the death of her ex-boyfriend, rapper Mac Miller. (📷: Getty, Twitter)

The note — which states students will only be allowed 2 passes to go to the bathroom or nurse, among other things — caused an uproar after being reposted across social media. After nearly three decades and caring for countless babies, Vilma Wong was still able to remember Brandon Seminatore when she noticed a new doctor on her team with a familiar-sounding last name. “I asked him if his dad was a police officer and there was a big silence and then he asked me if I was Vilma. I said yes,” Wong said. Seminatore and Wong hope that the story of their reunion can lift up parents who have babies in the NICU and are going through a difficult time ❤️ (📷: David Seminatore/ Lucile Packard Children’s Hospital Stanford)

The warrant was executed at Kate McClure and Mark D'Amico’s home in New Jersey. The couple raised over $400,000 for Johnny Bobbitt, who they said helped McClure when she ran out of gas on a highway last November. The couple said the GoFundMe money would be used to help Bobbitt get a vehicle, a home, and trust funds in his name. However, Bobbitt came forward to say he'd only received less than half of the money and accused the couple of spending the money themselves, pointing to a recent BMW purchase. (📷: AP)

The star, who according to his family had been dealing with health issues, was known for performing many of his own stunts, as well as that iconic nude centerfold he did for Cosmopolitan magazine that sparked big studio interest (📷: Everett Collection/MediaPunch)

After weeks of equivocation, Twitter has permanently suspended the accounts of Infowars and its founder Alex Jones, following similar moves by other large tech companies, including Apple, Facebook, YouTube, and Spotify. The decision came after series of provocations from Jones that Twitter deemed in violation of its "abusive behavior" rules. (📷: Getty Images)

People protested in favor of abortion rights, civil liberties, and more during the confirmation hearings for Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh. By the second day of the hearings, 73 people were arrested. (📷: Bill Clark/Getty)

There’s nothing new about the probiotic drink — it’s a staple for a ton of Asian households. But according to Bloomberg News, Yakult has seen a spike in mentions on social media, and the company’s stocks have seen growth since the Netflix rom-com’s release. People took to the streets in celebration in India after its Supreme Court struck down a 157-year-old colonial-era law, “Section 377,” that criminalized all sexual activity apart from heterosexual sex as “against the order of nature.” Judges described the law as “arbitrary” and said that freedom could only be fulfilled where the LGBT community possesses equal rights. (📸: Getty)

In a major victory for LGBT rights, India’s Supreme Court just struck down a 157-year-old colonial-era law, “Section 377,” that criminalized all sexual activity apart from heterosexual sex as “against the order of nature.” The ruling could have huge repercussions for LGBT rights battles taking place throughout the Commonwealth, an association of 53 countries made up mostly of former territories of the British Empire 🌈🇮🇳 (📷: Getty Images)

Gwyneth Paltrow’s health and wellness empire agreed to settle a lawsuit alleging it made unscientific claims about several of its products, including its infamous vaginal healing eggs. (📷: Getty, Goop)

Almost a year after her breast cancer diagnosis, the comedy legend says she's feeling “fantastic” and is working on the seventh and final season of HBO's “Veep.” “I feel good. I feel strong. I’ve got energy and, yeah, back to my old tricks," she said. "It feels like I never left." 💪 (📷: HBO)

Jevh Maravilla decided to hang a picture of himself on the wall of his local McDonald’s after noticing there were no Asians featured in any of the restaurant’s ads. Maravilla told BuzzFeed News he was able to pull off the prank by dressing up as a "regional interior coordinator.” As of Monday, the photo had been up for 51 days 😂🍔🍟 (📷: Twitter via Jevholution)

A CDC official said approximately 100 people “complained of illness including cough and some with fever.” The Emirates airline jet, traveling from Dubai to New York City, carried 521 people and was met by ambulances and police vehicles upon landing. The cause of illness has not yet been confirmed. (📷: LarryCoben via Twitter)

The new rule, decided by the national umbrella organization for fraternities, will affect more than 6,100 chapters on 800 campuses. In practical terms, it means at the vast majority of frat houses across the US, no one will be allowed to pour themselves a glass of tequila, whiskey, or vodka. The only time hard alcohol can be served, regardless of an event’s location, by a licensed and insured third-party vendor at a registered social event. Watch our Story for more details (📷: AP)

A new trailer for the final season shows Claire Underwood (Robin Wright) addressing Frank’s grave. Spacey was fired from the show after multiple sexual harassment claims were made against him last year. The season will debut November 2. (📷: Netflix)

A lawyer for Johnny Bobbit, a Philadelphia homeless man who went viral after giving a woman whose car had broken down his last $20 for gas, says most of the more than $400,000 raised for him via GoFundMe is unaccounted for, and it's unclear where it went. The woman, Kate McClure, and her boyfriend Mark D'Amico launched the viral GoFundMe as a way to repay Bobbitt's kindness, and said the money would be used to get him off a vehicle and housing. However, Bobbitt says he only received about $75,000, and is on the streets, unemployed, and using drugs again – which the couple claims is the reason he hasn't received the rest of the money. McClure and D'Amico claimed they gave Bobbitt $200,000, and were ordered to put the rest in an escrow account, but Bobbitt's lawyer says the couple's lawyer has told him there's no money left. GoFundMe says it is working with law enforcement, and has provided $20,000 to Bobbitt during the investigation. (📸: AP)

NBC and producer Dick Wolf are bringing yet another iteration of Law & Order to the screen, "Law & Order: Hate Crimes," which will be based on NYC’s Hate Crimes Task Force. "Considering that last year there was a double-digit rise in hate crimes in our 10 largest cities ... it seemed like this topic is begging to be explored," said Lisa Katz at NBC Entertainment. Wolf said “Law & Order: SVU” had encouraged victims to come forward, and he hopes the new series will do the same "in a world where hate crimes have reached an egregious level." (📸: NBC)

Claire Wineland, a YouTuber beloved for her frank documentation of her life and experience with cystic fibrosis, died Sunday. She suffered a stroke following a successful double lung transplant on Aug. 26, after which she underwent a week of intensive care but "it became clear that it was Claire's time to go," the chair of her foundation said. Cystic fibrosis is an incurable genetic disease that causes lung infections and limits the ability to breathe over time. People with the disease live an average of 30 years. (📸: @claire.wineland)

More than a million people have been warned to evacuate their homes in Japan and six people are dead after the country was hit by the strongest typhoon in 25 years. Follow @world for more 🇯🇵🌊😱 (📸: Reuters, Getty, Jiji)

Colton Underwood, a 26-year-old former NFL player who appeared on Becca Kufrin’s season of “The Bachelorette” and “Bachelor in Paradise.” A lot of people wondered if Tia Booth, who Underwood dated in Paradise, would appear on the show, but she’s said she won't. (📸: ABC)

Democratic Senators also sought to delay Judge Kavanaugh’s hearing over not being given enough time to review the 42,000 pages of documents from his time working in the White House under George W. Bush. The Democrats also protested the Trump administration’s decision to withhold 100,000 Bush-era documents that are Kavanaugh related. (📸: Getty Images)

Nike unveiled its 30th anniversary "Just Do It" campaign with Kaepernick as its face, which many celebrated, while others shared photos and videos of themselves destroying their Nike apparel. Kaepernick was the first NFL player to protest by taking a knee during the national anthem played before football games in protest against police brutality and racial inequality. An estimated 6 million people are infected with Chagas in Central and South America. But the disease has become more common in other parts of the world over the last 40 years, now affecting some 300,000 people in the US alone. The disease is usually spread by the “kissing bug,” which bites people’s faces while they sleep. These bugs contract a parasite called T. cruzi after biting an infected animal or human, and then shed the parasite in their feces. (📷: Getty Images)

From goodbyes to John McCain and Aretha Franklin to the aftermath of riots in South Africa and Germany, here are the most eye-catching and emotional pictures from this past week. Follow @buzzfeedphoto for more 📸(📷: Reuters/Getty/AP)

The director of housing at UC Santa Cruz sent an email to faculty and staff urging them to “[offer] a room for rent” in their private homes due to a city-wide housing crisis. Dave Keller, the executive director of housing services on campus, said there are currently several hundred incoming freshmen still without housing assignments. He’s asking faculty and staff to open their homes up for the entire academic year, if possible. (📷: UCSC)

“The person who is accused of taking Mollie’s life is no more a reflection of the Hispanic community as white supremacists are of all white people,” Rob Tibbetts wrote in the Des Moines Register. (📸: Facebook)

Gaga plays a shy singer whose life is upended when she meets a country rocker (played by Bradley Cooper.) An Idaho neo-Nazi is robocalling Florida residents to disparage Tallahassee Mayor Andrew Gillum, who won the Democratic nomination for the Florida governorship in a primary. Gillum's Republican opponent, Florida Congressman Ron DeSantis, told Fox News after the primary that Florida voters shouldn't "monkey this up" and that Gillum was "an articulate spokesman for the far left." The robocall begins with someone speaking in a minstrel dialect pretending to be Gillum, while monkey sounds play in the background and the speaker mentions DeSantis' comments. The recording says it was paid for by Road To Power, a neo-Nazi podcast and website. (📸: Getty)

Argento, who was dating Anthony Bourdain at the time of his death, appeared in two episodes of the show and directed a third. CNN confirmed to BuzzFeed News that the episodes were removed due to allegations that she sexually assaulted actor Jimmy Bennett when he was a teenager. Argento has denied ever having "any sexual relationship" with him. (📸: Getty)

Bishop Charles H. Ellis III, who led Franklin's funeral, had his hand near the side of Grande's breast. Many people said she looked noticeably uncomfortable and some felt his actions were deliberate. "It would never be my intention to touch any woman's breast," the bishop told AP. "Maybe I crossed the border, maybe I was too friendly or familiar, but again, I apologize." The bishop also apologized for saying: "When I saw Ariana Grande on the program, I thought that was a new something at Taco Bell." (📸: Getty)

Trump, who never served in Vietnam and once mocked McCain for getting captured and becoming a prisoner of war, was not invited to the funeral. Meghan also spoke about how McCain was a brilliant father whose life was "defined by love." (📷: Getty)

The legislation, which is now headed to Gov. Jerry Brown's desk after it was approved by the state Senate in a 27-12 vote Friday, would prohibit internet providers from slowing down websites, charging premiums for higher-quality streaming, and demanding payments from internet companies to reach subscribers. (📷: AP)

Former "ER" and "Melrose Place" actor Vanessa Marquez was shot and killed by police after pointing what was thought to be a gun at officers, officials said. Police were called to perform a welfare check on Marquez, 49, who was having seizures when they arrived. Police said Marquez armed herself with a BB gun that was made to look like a semiautomatic handgun and pointed it at officers, prompting them to open fire. Before her death, Marquez had posted to Facebook about being terminally ill and having seizures, but a friend said she could not afford to see a doctor. (📸: IMDB/NBC/Getty)

Cicely Tyson spoke at Aretha Franklin's funeral, and she did it wearing this giant, amazing hat. People were straight-up stunned by the 91-year-old actor’s elegance and powerful speech, and said Tyson's words – and hat – would have made the Queen of Soul proud. (📸: Getty)

A judge ruled that Katie McClure and her boyfriend, Mark D’Amico, must give what’s left of the more than $400,000 raised for Johnny Bobbitt, a homeless Philadelphia man, to their defense lawyer. The money will be placed in an escrow account, according to NBC News. The money was raised for Bobbitt on GoFundMe after Bobbitt gave McClure $20 for gas when she broke down by the side of the road. Earlier this month it was revealed that the couple was withholding some of the money, claiming Bobbitt would receive it once he got off drugs and became employed. (📸: GoFundMe)

In the video footage, two light-skinned men are seen shoving a young black man towards the open doors of the train while he shouts, “Stop, stop” and desperately holds onto the train’s handrails. In a second video, one man holds the victim in an aggressive headlock, shouting, while other passengers tell him to leave the young man alone. The victim declined to press charges, but police are still investigating. (📷: AnnaMSterling via Twitter)

The initial plan was for the Black Panther to speak with an American or British accent, Boseman told The Hollywood Reporter. Boseman decided in his research that “Wakandans would speak with a click, because some of the languages that have clicks are amongst the oldest in the planet.” He added that Marvel felt “it was maybe too much for the audience to take”, but it was a dealbreaker for him. (📷: Getty)

Aretha Franklin's funeral will be held on Friday in her hometown of Detroit, and many celebrities who were close to the singer are scheduled to perform and speak at her service. Swipe 👈 to see who will be paying tribute to the late Queen of Soul 👑 (📷: Getty/@arianagrande/@faithhill/@tasiasword)

Drinking water has been shut off in all 106 schools in the Detroit Public Schools Community District after elevated copper or lead levels were found in 16 of 24 schools tested this year. In a statement, school district Superintendent Nikolai Vitti said he asked for a districtwide shutdown “out of an abundance of caution.” The Detroit Water and Sewerage Department pointed to aging plumbing in the schools as a source of concern. (📷: Getty)

Kylie Cosmetics, which has made around $420 million in sales since its launch in 2015, will soon be available at Ulta Beauty stores nationwide, Kylie Jenner says. Until now, the only way to buy Kylie Cosmetics products was either online or at a pop-up shop. Ulta Beauty says it plans to sell Kylie Cosmetics in stores and online for the foreseeable future💄 (📷: Getty/@kyliejenner)

George Garofano breached over 200 iCloud accounts in 2014 and stole private photos from celebrities like Jennifer Lawrence and Amber Heard. Upon his release from prison, he’ll be required to serve an additional three years of supervised release and complete 60 hours of community service. The 26-year-old engaged in a sophisticated phishing scheme in which he tricked his victims into providing the usernames and passwords for their Apple iCloud accounts, according to court documents. (📷: Hearst Connecticut Media/ Getty)

It might not surprise you to hear that following body- and appearance-focused accounts (like fitspiration) is linked to greater body dissatisfaction and can drive feelings of inadequacy and anxiety, according to researchers. Posting content that’s a false representation of you can also have a negative effect on a person’s psychology, but the good news is experts say if you’re posting things that make you happy and express who you are, “then there’s actually nothing wrong with it.” (📷: Anna Mendoza for BuzzFeed News)

The woman was seen on haunting surveillance video as she rang doorbells for help in the middle of the night. Police asked the public for information, but no one knew who she was and she didn’t match any reported missing persons. She has now been identified and is safe with family members, according to police, who say she had been the victim of an abusive boyfriend who apparently went on to kill himself. (📷: Montgomery County Sheriff’s Office)

"We regret that a Code Violation was assessed to Ms. Cornet yesterday," the statement said. "We have clarified the policy to ensure this will not happen moving forward." On Tuesday, the French player briefly took off her shirt to fix it, and she was immediately penalized. The apology came following an outcry over a perceived double standard between the treatment of female players and male players. (📸: Twitter user followalexcam and Reuters)

Researchers in the UK analyzed previous studies on people who had a blood alcohol content of zero or close to zero after a night of heavy drinking, and found that during a hangover, people still showed impairments in attention, short- and long-term memory, coordination, and reaction time. "You might still be impaired even after most of the alcohol has left your system," the senior author of the study said. The new research suggests that one night of heavy drinking may continue to impair your brain function for a day or more 🍻👀 (📸: Getty)

Kanye West told Chicago radio station WGCI that he never "approached or addressed the slavery comment fully" because "it’s not something for me to overly intellectualize." In May, West said "When you hear about slavery for 400 years...that sounds like a choice" and apologized to people who felt let down by the comment, and by West wearing a MAGA hat. He also said Trump "cares about the way black people feel about him, and he would like for black people to like him like they did when he was cool in the rap songs." (📸: AFP/Getty)

Paul Guadalupe Gonzales, dubbed the "Dine and Dash Dater," is accused of taking at least eight women on dates to high-end restaurants in Southern California and ditching them before the bill arrived. Prosecutors say the dates took place between May 2016 and April 2018, and each time he would order food and drinks before making an excuse to leave the table and never returning. Twice, the restaurants themselves ended up footing the bill, and Gonzales is accused of defrauding victims a total of more than $950. He could face 13 years in prison if convicted. (📸: CBS Los Angeles)

A judge dismissed child abuse charges against all five adults found living with children and little food or water on a New Mexico compound because the prosecution failed to hold a preliminary hearing within 10 days of their arrest, which is required by state law. Two of the adults were charged with child abuse that resulted in death, and those charges will still stand. Police raided the compound in during an investigation related to the disappearance of 3-year-old Abdul-Ghani Wahhaj, whose remains were found in the compound. Prosecutors said in court that the boy died during a "ritual intended to cast out demonic spirits." (📸: AP)

Cindy McCain kissed the casket of her late husband John McCain during a memorial service at the Arizona Capitol. McCain, a war hero who spent more than three decades in Congress, died Saturday from brain cancer at 81. (📸: Getty Images)

After multiple freshmen currently housed in Purdue's makeshift dorms complained to BuzzFeed News of “unjust” living situations on campus, IDHS’s Building Safety & Services department told BuzzFeed News they’re officially investigating the matter to ensure students feel safe in their dorms. Auxiliary housing is offered to students when there is an over-admission of applicants. Freshmen are placed on a waiting list and can move out if or when other students drop out, and more official dorm space opens up.

Due to the heat, players were given a 10-minute break to cool off and rehydrate, during which Alizé Cornet put on a fresh shirt. When she returned to the court, she realized her shirt was on backward. She quickly took it off and put it back on, prompting umpire Christian Rask to hit her with a code violation. Women's Tennis Association rules dictate that female players may only remove shirts while off-court. No such rules apply to male players, who took their shirts off frequently to deal with the heat. (📸: followalexacam on Twitter)
😀🐐♥ (📸: Getty Images)

"It’s the very first time that a US legislative body has recognized that intersex children deserve bodily autonomy and the right to make decisions about their own bodies just like everyone else," said Kimberly Zieselman, executive director of interACT, the intersex youth advocacy group that authored the legislation. Roughly 1 in every 2,000 babies in the US are born with genetic, chemical, or anatomical features that fall somewhere between what's typically identified as male or female. In the 1950s, most surgeons began "correcting" these perceived abnormalities. (📷: AP)

The revision came after a study was commissioned by Puerto Rican authorities in January after months of media reports calling their figures into question. Researchers also found that Puerto Rico did not adequately prepare residents for Hurricane Maria, which obliterated the island in September 2017, and that doctors were confused about how to classify the dead. (📷: AP)

The California Money Bail Reform Act was signed by Gov. Jerry Brown and takes effect in October 2019. Under the new law, people awaiting trial will be jailed only if they are considered a risk to public safety or likely to miss their future court dates. (📷: California Department of Tax and Fee Administration/Getty Images)

There were nearly 2.3 million cases of chlamydia, gonorrhea, and syphilis diagnosed last year, an increase of over 200,000 compared to 2016. The most common diagnosis was chlamydia, accounting for over 1.7 million of those cases. It's the 4th consecutive year of “steep and sustained” increases in cases, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. (📷: CDC)

Leia Pierce’s son, Jamel Myles, killed himself Thursday — just four days after starting 4th grade. “Four days is all it took at school. I could just imagine what they said to him,” Pierce told a Denver TV station. “My son told my oldest daughter the kids at school told him to kill himself. I’m just sad he didn’t come to me.” (📷: Google Maps)

People from as far away as Las Vegas and Miami paid their respects to the “Queen of Soul,” who was raised in Detroit and got her start there singing gospel. The city is observing a week of mourning for Franklin. (📸: Getty Images/Reuters)
