“I want our girls to grow up knowing that there are no boundaries that can be placed on their futures, period,” Curry wrote in The Player’s  Tribune. “And I want them to grow up believing that they can dream big, and strive for careers where they’ll be treated fairly. And of course: paid equally.” (📸: Getty Images)

The US State Department revised its advisory for travel to Cuba from Level 3 — reconsider travel — to Level 2 — exercise increased caution, putting it in the same category as France, Germany, and Spain. Some involved in tourism hope it will reverse a decline in American visitors too — the Cuban Tourism Ministry’s commercial director said in April that the number of US visitors in 2018 is only 56.6% of what it was in 2017 ✈️🇨🇺 (📷: Getty )

“Don’t let your guard down,” FEMA said, warning that torrential rain would be the largest threat. The storm was downgraded from a hurricane but still brought a historic amount of rain, resulting in flash floods and landslides. (📷: Getty/AP)

29-year-old Nicholas Dagostino told authorities he was acting “in self defense”, but investigators say he “rambles on about female motorists and how incompetent they are and that their sole purpose is to give birth to male children” in Facebook posts. Two women told police they were shot in the arm while driving near his home. He’s facing two felony charges of aggravated assault with a deadly weapon. (📷: Harris County Jail)

Three people, including the gunman, are dead following the shooting in Jacksonville, Florida. At least 11 others are injured, sheriff officials say. Witnesses described an emotional and confusing scene at the bar holding the event, and audio of 12 gunshots and the chaotic aftermath was captured on a Twitch livestream. (📷: AP)
A penguin stands on a scale as part of the ZSL London Zoo’s annual weigh in. The zoo is home to more than 19,000 animals and zookeepers regularly record their heights and weights 🐧 (📸: AP)

Former president Barack Obama, who beat McCain in the 2008 presidential race, wrote that despite their political differences, he and McCain shared "a fidelity to something higher - the ideals for which generations of Americans and immigrants alike have fought, marched, and sacrificed." (📸: Getty Images)

Sen. John McCain spent five years as a prisoner of war in Vietnam, served in Congress for more than three decades, and was the Republican presidential nominee in 2008. He died Saturday from brain cancer at the age of 81 at his home in Arizona, and is survived by his wife, Cindy, and seven children and grandchildren. (📸: AP, Reuters, Getty)

Republican Sen. John McCain has died at the age of 81. The veteran US senator, who spent five years as prisoner of war in Vietnam as a young Navy pilot, had been diagnosed with brain cancer in July 2017. McCain's Senate office confirmed his death in a statement. "With the Senator when he passed were his wife Cindy and their family," it read. "At his death, he had served the United States of America faithfully for sixty years." (📸: Reuters)

YouTubers Logan Paul and KSI brought their beef to the ring on Saturday for a much-hyped boxing match that drew an estimated 2 million viewers. Nearly 800,000 people paid $10 to watch it on pay-per-view YouTube. At least 1 million more people watched on Twitch, and about 20,000 attended in person at Manchester Arena in England. The Logan Paul/KSI feud kicked off in February, when KSI boxed another British YouTuber, Joe Weller. After winning, KSI challenged the Paul Brothers to a fight. The match ultimately ended in a draw, and the two agreed to a rematch (which was actually booked months ago.) (📸: Reuters)

The announcement came after Verizon limited speeds for the Santa Clara County Fire Department as it battled California's largest wildfire on record. Prosecutors say Verizon throttled the department’s internet speeds on their unlimited data as they battled the deadly Mendocino Complex fire, and some firefighters deployed could not use data on the department’s devices. Verizon initially said the department would have to upgrade its data plan, but then acknowledged the company has a policy of removing data speed restrictions during emergencies and should have done so in Santa Clara. It also announced that it is lifting data speed restrictions on firefighters battling blazes in the West and emergency responders in Hawaii. (📸: AP)

Lionel Lebron, who is among the leading voices pushing the nonsensical QAnon mythology, shared photos of him and his wife in the Oval Office with Trump on Twitter and Instagram with QAnon related hash tags. (📸: Reuters/YouTube)

“We are not so fucking small-minded that we generalize a whole population based on some bad individuals,” Samantha Lucas, a member of Tibbetts’ family wrote while replying to a tweet from Candace Owens, the director of communications for the pro-Trump Turning Points USA. “Now stop being a fucking snake and using my cousins death as propaganda. Take her name out of your mouth.”
Too real 😭 (📸: Netflix)

Trevor Heitman, known on YouTube as “McSkillet," died after slamming his McLaren sports car into oncoming traffic near San Diego, colliding head-on with a Hyundai SUV and killing a 43-year-old woman and her 12-year-old daughter. The crash caused a chain reaction involving five other cars. Heitman ran a popular YouTube gaming channel under the name McSkillet where he had almost 900,000 followers. (📸: Facebook)

Johnny Bobbitt made headlines last November when he used his last $20 to help a woman, Kate McClure, stranded on the side of the road in Philadelphia. McClure and her boyfriend Mark D'Amico started a GoFundMe campaign for Bobbitt, and said the funds would be used for a new home, car, and trusts in his name. The campaign went viral, but now Bobbitt says he's only received half of the more than $400,000 raised because McClure and D'Amico are withholding it, reportedly until he is employed and off drugs, according to D’Amico, who said he'd "burn it in front of him" before giving Bobbitt the rest of the money. GoFundMe says it is looking into allegations of misuse, and Bobbitt has been in touch with lawyers. (📸: GoFundMe)

French Tennis Federation president Bernard Giudicelli told Tennis magazine that the French Open would be instituting a dress code for future tournaments, specifically referencing Serena Williams’ compression body suit, which the star wears to promote blood circulation and prevent blood clots. “It will no longer be accepted,” Giudicelli said. “One must respect the game and the place.” Williams said the suit had been designed to help prevent blood clots, an ongoing medical issue that nearly killed her after she gave birth to a daughter last September. (📸: AP)

Instagrammer Katie L. Summers was driving Tuesday night in Kennewick, Washington, when she allegedly struck and killed Leonel Z. Birrueta. Witnesses reportedly said Summers, a 28-year-old mother of two, briefly got out of her Toyota Tundra pickup truck, but did not call for help or identify herself, and then allegedly got back in her truck and drove away. Officers found Summers less than a block away in a grocery store parking lot, and allegedly admitted to police that she had hit Birrueta, and that she had earlier consumed alcohol and marijuana. She is reportedly being held in jail on suspicion of vehicular homicide. (📸: Twitter, YouTube)

First Lieutenant Misa Matsushima, 26, has become Japan’s first female fighter pilot three years after the country lifted its ban on women flying fighter jets and renaissance aircraft. Matsushima, who completed her training to fly F-15s, told local reporters that she had wanted to be a fighter jet pilot ever since watching “Top Gun” as a little girl, and that “as the first female fighter pilot, I will open the way.” 🇯🇵👩‍✈️✈️ Follow @world for more news from around the globe 🌎 (📷: Getty, JASDF_PAO / Twitter)
McCain was diagnosed over a year ago with a glioblastoma. He has largely withdrawn from Washington to spend time with his family. (📸: Getty Images)

Davidson was diagnosed with Crohn’s disease as a teenager. Still, Barstool writers and editors seemed to celebrate the turn of events and “pageviews” on Twitter. Ariana’s second tweet has since been deleted. (📷: Getty)

The legislation still needs to be approved by the governor, but would prohibit full-service, dine-in restaurants in California from providing single-use plastic straws unless requested by customers. Several cities in the Golden State have already adopted policies regulating or banning the use of plastic straws, including San Francisco, Davis, and Malibu. Straws are the sixth most common item found during beach cleanups, according to the California Coastal Commission. Restaurants could face fines of $25 for each day they are in violation 👀🥤 (📸: AP)

The segment, which appeared on "Mornings With Maria,” showed off "fashion-forward" bulletproof backpacks and clothing and featured a snippet of La Roux's hit song. “Using 'Bulletproof,' a song I wrote about relationships, for a piece like this is abhorrent," La Roux told BuzzFeed News. “I have never, and would never approve my music to be used in this way." Fox Business said the song was chosen by the production team "and the selection has been addressed." (📸: Getty, Fox Business)

Police say they were called to a McDonald's in Little Rock after customer Tonio Andrews "became irate" and smashed the lobby's glass door, and then again 30 minutes later after Andrews had a “container filled with boiling hot grease" thrown on his face at the drive-thru by an employee, who became frustrated because Andrews ordered a "20-piece chicken nugget meal but changed his mind when he got up to the window." Andrews was hospitalized for his injuries, and McDonald's says the employee was fired. (📸: Getty)
The AMC zombie drama will return to television on Oct. 7 for Andrew Lincoln's final season. (📸: AMC)

After the Twitter interaction, the woman lost her internship. Hickam later commented on the situation on his blog, saying he was not behind her losing her internship and was trying to "secure her one that will be better than she lost." (📸Twitter: CatlinNyaa)

The Parkland shooting survivor and March for Our Lives leader stated in a New York magazine profile that “the reason Republicans are successful right now is because they’re empowering young people.” He noted Paul Ryan’s age when he became the speaker of the House (at 45, he was elected the youngest-ever speaker), and added, “Older Democrats just won’t move the fuck off the plate and let us take control. Nancy Pelosi is old.” Many people who said they agree with Hogg’s activism called his remarks sexist, ageist, and arrogant. (📷: Getty Images)

Filters can make your eyes appear larger, chin smaller, and nose narrower, and give you a face as smooth and blemish-free as a baby’s. However, some doctors are worried that filters and face-altering apps are creating pressure to look perfect IRL and fueling a rise in surgery requests by younger people. Check out our Story for more details 🤳🏥(📷: Getty Images)

As the current No. 1 sitcom in the world and longest-running multi-camera series in TV history, the CBS comedy is going out...with a bang. In a joint statement, the network, studio, and producers of the show thanked fans for the incredible success of the show and promised an “epic creative close.” The 12th and final season of “The Big Bang Theory” will premiere on Sept. 24 📺💥 (📷: CBS)

You remember Bruno. The 25-pound cat went viral last week after a rescue shelter put him up for adoption. Lauren Paris said she freaked out when she saw him and knew she had to do “whatever it took to be his forever home” — so she literally recorded a song called “Gimme That Fat Cat”, wrote a letter of intent, and sent the shelter a video tour of her home. It worked, and you can now follow Bruno’s adventures at @theebrunobartlett😻(📷: Wright-Way Rescue/Kayla Gardner)

Netflix and Channel 4 made the announcement on Tuesday. Writer Charlie Covell will return for the second season of the dark comedy-drama, but a release date hasn’t been announced yet 📺 (📷: Netflix/Channel 4)

The tweet resurfaced after Cohen, Trump’s former lawyer, pleaded guilty to eight charges. He now faces up to 65 years in prison on charges including tax evasion and campaign finance-related counts, referring to payments he arranged to ensure news of Trump’s alleged sexual affairs were kept private before the election. Cohen told the court he made the payments “in coordination with and at the direction of a candidate for federal office” — meaning Trump. (📷: Reuters)

Thanks to @PETA, the animals on the packaging of Barnum’s Animal Crackers are now free to roam across the wilderness of their Nabisco box, no longer confined behind their cages. “No living being exists simply to be a spectacle or to perform tricks for human entertainment, yet all circuses and traveling shows that use animals treat them as mere props, denying them everything that’s natural and important to them,” PETA said in a statement. Swipe left to behold their prowess 🐘🦁❤️ (📷: AP/PETA)

Cole and Sav, who run a YouTube channel featuring their 3-year-old daughter Everleigh, have been accused of lying about evacuating their California home due to a wildfire. Though they posted a video on August 13th called "WE LEFT OUR HOUSE BECAUSE OF FIRES IN CALIFORNIA," neighbors say the couple's Ladera Ranch community did not receive an evacuation order for the Holy Fire. Neighbors say the couple tried to "exploit the situation," while some fans have defended their decision to leave, noting that they have a young daughter and Savannah is pregnant. The couple has not commented. (📸: YouTube)

Iowa student Mollie Tibbetts, 20, was found dead in a cornfield after an undocumented immigrant charged with killing her led authorities to her body. Cristhian Bahena Rivera, 24, has been arrested and charged with first-degree murder in connection with the death of Tibbetts, who was reported missing after going jogging on July 18. According to his Facebook page, Rivera had lived in Iowa since at least 2013 and was from Mexico. Police have not released a motive or cause of death. (📸: Iowa Law Enforcement)

Michael Cohen pleaded guilty to eight federal charges including campaign finance-related counts and tax evasion and bank-related charges. One of those charges was making an excessive campaign contribution of $130,000 to Stormy Daniels, an adult film star who says she had an affair with Trump, a payment Cohen claimed was for the "principal purpose of influencing the election." Cohen also pleaded guilty to five counts of tax evasion, once count of a false statement to a bank, and one unlawful corporate campaign contribution. Sentencing is set for Dec. 12, and bail was set at $500,000. (📸: Jane Rosenberg)

Paul Manafort was found guilty on multiple counts of the financial crimes charged in the first trial to come out of special counsel Robert Mueller’s investigation. The jury could not reach a verdict on 10 of the charges, and the judge declared a mistrial on those charges. Manafort was found guilty on 5 counts of filing fake tax returns, one count of failing to report foreign bank accounts, and two counts of bank fraud. He was not charged in connection with his work on Trump’s campaign. (📸: Getty)

Madonna was accused of making her “tribute” to Aretha Franklin about herself while presenting an award at the #VMAs. She said paying tribute to the Queen of Soul during the two minutes she had to speak would have been “impossible.” (📸: Getty Images)

“Their words seemed to confirm what growing up as a woman and a person of color already taught me: that I belonged in margins and spaces,” the “Star Wars” actor wrote in The New York Times, her first time speaking out since deleting her Instagram after online harassment. At the end of the piece, Tran lists her accomplishments and writes, “My real name is Loan. And I am just getting started.” (📸: Getty Images)

The group, estimated to be around 300 people, toppled the “Silent Sam” statue, which was erected in 1913 as a monument for Chapel Hill alumni who died during the Civil War and fought for the Confederacy. One person was arrested and charged with concealing their face during a public rally and resisting arrest, according to local media. (📸: AP}

Teacher and part-time pole instructor Kandice Mason has been suspended after a Facebook video she posted of her performing a routine in her home was forwarded to school administrators. "The superintendent, the principal, and another woman basically berated me about how my song choice was vulgar, and that if parents found out they would have an issue,” Mason told BuzzFeed News. A representative from the school declined to give specifics, but cited a policy that employees should be "role models," even when not at work. (📷: Supplied)

Grace Baldridge’s viral coming-out message to her younger self has us in our feelings ❤️ Baldridge told BuzzFeed News she didn’t expect her newlywed post to connect with so many people but she’s glad it did. "As is the case for many, coming out was a process for me. However, their acceptance was never a process, it was immediate. Even when I couldn't express what was going on, they were always patient and supportive,” Baldridge said 🏳️‍🌈 (📸: Twitter)

Dozens of Korean families are seeing each other in person for the first time in 68 years since being separated following the end of the Korean War in 1953 🇰🇵🇰🇷❤️ Follow @world for more details (📷: Getty Images/Reuters)

In an op-ed for Time Magazine, Totah said she’s known she was a girl since she was 5, but her identity crystallized when she watched the TLC show “I Am Jazz” with her mom. “I looked over at her in the middle of the show and said, ‘This is me. I’m transgender. And I need to go through this.’” (📸: Getty Images)

The indie crime-drama was released in only 11 theaters nationwide after Spacey was accused of sexual misconduct. The movie, which also starred Ansel Elgort, Taron Egerton, and Emma Roberts, was released on premium video on demand last month. (📸: YouTube)

The New York Times reported that the Italian actor and prominent #MeToo activist agreed to pay $380,000 to actor Jimmy Bennett, who said she sexually assaulted him when he was 17. Tarana Burke, the founder of the #MeToo movement, commended the “brave young men” who were coming forward with their accusations and wrote on Twitter, “Sexual violence is about power and privilege. That doesn’t change if the perpetrator is your favorite actress, activist or professor of any gender.” (📸: Getty Images)

Name-brand EpiPens have seen skyrocketing prices in recent years. Since Mylan obtained the rights to sell EpiPens in 2007, the price of a two-pack has increased from under $100 to $609. (📸: Getty Images)

YouTube is adding fact checks to videos that question climate change as a part of its ongoing effort to combat the rampant misinformation on its platform. Wikipedia has been helping YouTube describe topics like global warming, the MMR vaccine, and UFOs ♻️🌏 (📷: PragerU/YouTube)

The first major studio release with an all-Asian cast in 25 years made $34 million in its first five days in theaters. It's the best debut for a romantic comedy since “Trainwreck” in 2015, and one of the top three rom-com debuts in the last five years 🎬👏🏼 (📷: Warner Bros. Pictures)

San Francisco has created a new "poop patrol" to clean up its streets because everyone is really tired of dodging shit on the sidewalks. The new program will include a team of six people using pressure washers and steam cleaners to scrub away the feces, according to San Francisco Public Works. The “poop patrol” will begin work in September, focusing on areas that have generated high numbers of complaints 💩 (📷: Getty Images)

Attorneys fear the 16 dads were re-separated as an intimidation tactic to stop them from going on a hunger strike. The fathers and kids were not given any information about when they would see each other again, but were reunited the next day. “We started to die again, not knowing anything about our sons,” one father said. (📷: AP)

Kharisma James was shielding three children, including her own two, from a speeding car in a school parking lot in Texas. The car was driven by a disoriented man, who had apparently pressed the accelerator instead of the brakes, the El Paso Times first reported. According to a local police chief, James tried to “get the attention of the driver and intervene” before stepping into the car’s path. (📸: Facebook)

Rebecca Newby, a 23-year-old high school teacher, loves Cardi B and so do her students. So she turned the “My Momma Said” Cardi B meme into hall passes with hilarious captions, and she said her students’ “faces lit up.” The photos have been shared hundreds of thousands of times with many people shouting out millennial teachers for their unique efforts to connect to students 💕 (📸: Newby)

Venue officials said they evacuated the concert space due to nearby lightning, but about 150 fans in line “did not heed staff’s warnings” and were still in line when high winds and heavy rain knocked over the entrance. The concert has been postponed and the Backstreet Boys said they “will attempt to reschedule.” (📷: AP)

Leslie and Jim Parsons are the owners of Bolley's Famous Franks, a popular restaurant in Waterville, Maine, and say they've been receiving backlash and even threats after switching their crinkly-cut fried to straight fries. "I just want to say I will absolutely not tolerate being sworn at, threatened physical harm to myself, my husband and children," Leslie wrote, and they say a man even threatened to fight Jim after being asked to leave the restaurant for complaining about the change. The couple apologized to loyal customers who "would much prefer the crinkle cut fry," but say they had to make the change due to the cost of equipment to make the crinkle fries. (📸: Facebook)

ICE officers surrounded the couples’ vehicle when they stopped for gas. The man’s wife, Maria del Carmen Venegas, is seen in security footage crying on the phone before she drove herself to the hospital, where she gave birth to a baby boy. “He had to wait for his son for so long,” she said from the hospital. “And someone just took him away.” (📸: CBS LA)

Sgt. Ritchard Blake had a history of violent acts according to department disciplinary records, and he is under investigation for possible criminal charges over the shooting. In surveillance video, Blake is seen placing a knife on the ground next to the victim after shooting him, and picking it up again moments later. The NYPD commissioner said “it looks like” Blake was attempting to plant evidence on the victim, but that an investigation needs to be done. (📷: ABC News)

The Nobel Peace Prize laureate was one of the world’s most revered diplomats and is largely credited with revitalizing the UN. “Long after he had broken barriers, Kofi never stopped his pursuit of a better world,” Barack Obama said. (📷: Reuters)
The actress posted photos of her ring and their engagement ceremony on Instagram. Congrats to the happy couple 💕 (📷: @priyankachopra)

Shafeeq Sheikh was sentenced to 10 years probation Friday after being convicted of raping a patient in her hospital bed while she was heavily sedated. After finding him guilty, jurors recommended Sheikh, who had already lost his medical license, be sentenced to only probation. (📸: Houston Police Department/Google Maps)

Taylor Smith, an 18-year-old from Washington, has been charged with reckless endangerment after video showed her pushing her friend Jordan Holgerson, 16, from the top of a bridge in Moulton Falls Regional Park into the river below. Smith shoved Holgerson after Holgerson hesitated at the top of the bridge saying "No, I won't go," and the 50-foot drop left her with a punctured lung and six broken ribs. Smith has been charged with a misdemeanor for causing "a substantial risk of death or serious physical injury," and Smith says she has tried to apologize to Holgerson but Holgerson has cut her off: "I never intended to hurt her ever," Smith said. (📸: YouTube)

Effective immediately, the school will cover tuition for all current and future students in response to what it calls the “overwhelming financial debt” graduates face. The policy is the first of its kind among top medical schools, and the university says it hopes the measure will attract a more diverse class. (📸: NYU School Of Medicine)

Critics say that the Department of Labor’s new directive tells federal contractors “they are free, in the Trump administration’s view, to use taxpayer dollars to discriminate” and that it attempts to “immunize” them under a religious exemption. The directive applies to millions of people who work for companies that do business with the federal government.
Follow @buzzfeedlgbt for more stories like this. (📸: Getty)

A lot of people were confused over the news that the sketch comedy Vine-star-turned-Instagrammer is now a musician, and some criticized Universal for giving a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to someone who was already incredibly famous. Pons’s first single, “Celoso”, was released on Friday. (📷: Getty/UMG) #LelePons

Get ready for more Flossy Posse 🎉 The actor confirmed the news on @am2dm and said they’re still figuring out scheduling but that fans can rest assured they’re “trying to make it happen.” (📷: Universal Pictures)

Katie Stubblefield is recovering well and regaining the ability to speak, eat, and show emotion — things that were impossible due to the trauma caused by a self-inflicted gunshot wound. The 21-year-old is now using her experience to become an advocate for suicide prevention. Her journey is featured in the cover story of National Geographic’s September issue, which is titled "The Story of a Face.” (📷: Martin Schoeller)

The Purdue Exponent, a student-run paper at Purdue University, shared photos of a "makeshift" dorm on campus, which is a large officelike space divvied up by standard dorm room furniture that typically holds 8-10 students. The university creates new "auxiliary housing" when there's an excess of admitted applicants, and this year Purdue saw about five times more students than anticipated. The school says students in temporary dorms are reassigned "within the first few weeks of class," and though it says the dorm in the photos shared by the school paper is not currently in use, similar ones are. Students say over-admitting is a problem at Purdue and compared the setup to a prison. (📸: @purdueexponent)

Tipping the scales at 25 pounds, Bruno is a 7-year-old polydactyly cat (meaning he has extra toes) who is currently up for adoption in Morton Grove, Illinois. He's currently on a diet, loves being pet while he eats and is very particular about where his water bowls are located. Oh, and he really likes standing on his hind legs: “This usually happens when I want food," Bruno's adoption profile reads. "No, my foster parents did not teach me this. They are not sure how I learned." (📸: Wright Way Rescue Adoption Center)

In a graphic announcing Aretha Franklin's death on Thursday, Fox News showed an image of another famous black singer, Patti LaBelle. Fox apologized, but initially claimed the background photo showed Franklin performing with Patti LaBelle, and in the editing process, Franklin was apparently cropped out. However, the photo appears to be from the Associated Press, which names both women in the caption, but shows only LaBelle in the photo.

Jack Phillips, the owner of Masterpiece Cake Shop, said the blue-and-pink case a trans woman requested for her birthday “would have celebrated messages contrary to his religious belief.” His previous Supreme Court case gained national attention after he refused to make a wedding cake for a gay couple. The Court narrowly sided with Phillips. (📷: Getty) Follow @buzzfeedlgbt for more stories like this!
Celebrity tributes are pouring in for Aretha Franklin. The undisputed Queen of Soul has died at 76. Watch our Story for more on her death.

Aretha Franklin was the first woman to be inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and won 18 Grammy Awards. Her publicist confirmed her death to BuzzFeed News, saying she died from advanced pancreatic cancer. (📷: Getty)

Kynnith Francis, who earned her master's in student affairs administration, told BuzzFeed News that the blanket was inspired by this Kanye reference she made to her mom a year ago: "Your degree won't keep you warm at night though." The 24-year-old says she plans to pass the blanket down to her kids someday. “I’m going to celebrate [them] in the same way that my mother celebrated me,” Francis said 🎓👏🏾 (📷: Kynnith Francis)

Vicky Piper said her husband, Jeff, actually came up with the idea to do a photo “announcement” of their new status, in true millennial fashion. The couple then asked a friend to take the photos outside their church to "celebrate the milestone as parents." “We’ve raised our kids and we still love each other," she said. Enjoy your empty nest, guys! 🐣👋❤️ (📷: Vicky Piper)

After Jessie the macaw parrot’s owner and an animal welfare group were unable to get her down after she spent three days on a neighbor’s roof, Jessie's owner called firefighters. They were instructed to bond with her by telling her "I love you," to which she responded "I love you" but also "fuck off.” Ultimately, Jessie flew off to another roof and then to a tree, and returned home on her own. 🐦 😂(📸: REX/Shutterstock)
Hallquist is running for governor in Vermont. “I’m so proud to be the face of the Democrats tonight,” she told her supporters on Tuesday. Follow @buzzfeedlgbt for more stories like this 🌈

Jimmy Wong will play the warrior Ling, who was known as a prankster in the original 1998 animated film. Doua Moua will play Po, who has an appreciation for good cuisine 😋 The movie is set to open on March 27, 2020. (📷: Getty/Disney/DouaMoua via Instagram)

Ilhan Omar is almost guaranteed to become one of the first Muslim women to be sworn into Congress next January, after she won a heated primary in Minnesota on Tuesday. Her supporters danced around her at a campaign watch party where she declared, “We’re going to Washington, everyone!” (📷: AP)

26-year-old Parisa Pourtaherian is receiving international praise for her general badass attitude 👏👏👏 Women have not been allowed inside Iran’s soccer stadiums since 1979, and Pourtaherian’s colleague said she had searched for hours to find a spot to do her job. (📷: Abolfazl Amanollah/BuzzFeedNews)

Four middle school–aged girls fought off an alleged kidnapping attempt in Michigan, throwing punches, coffee, and a Slurpee, after a man grabbed them outside a gas station convenience store. The girls, aged 11 to 14, were leaving the store when they noticed they were being followed by 22-year-old Bruce Hipkins, who they say grabbed the 11-year-old by the head and said, “You're coming with me." After the girls fought back, Hipkins allegedly fled and was later arrested and charged with kidnapping and assault. “My dad taught me a few moves,” said one of the girls, Allison. “He taught me if anybody tries to get you, just aim for the neck and start punching, kicking, screaming, everything you can do to just get them away.” (📸: Tuscola County Sheriff’s Office, WJRT)

White House press secretary Sarah Huckabee Sanders told reporters that she "can't guarantee" Americans will never hear President Trump saying the n-word in a recording, addressing claims by former White House aide Omarosa Manigault Newman that there are recordings of Trump saying the racial epithet while filming "The Apprentice." "I can tell you that I never heard it," Sanders said, but "I haven't been in every single room." Manigault Newman has been promoting her new book "Unhinged," in which she calls Trump a racist. (📸: AP)

Deputy Scotty Finnegan was patrolling along Fish Lake in Minnesota when he "observed the large inflatable and immediately began to laugh." He said the four women were "not making the best progress towards shore," despite having paddles, because the weeds were so thick and they ended up being stranded on the lake for hours. Officers eventually used a rope to pull the women – and the rainbow unicorn – safely back to shore. 🦄🌈 (📸: Chisago County Sheriff’s Office)

Melissa Howard, who was running in Florida GOP primary, has dropped out of the race after she posed with a fake Miami University in Ohio diploma. Howard posted the photo after a report found that she had attended the university but never graduated. “What I did was wrong and set a bad example for someone seeking public service,” Howard wrote on Facebook. (📸: Facebook)

“This show is dedicated to Aretha Franklin. We love you and thank you,” Beyoncé said at the start of her show, according to The Detroit News. DJ Khaled, who is opening for Beyoncé during the On The Run II tour also played Franklin’s famous “Respect” during his set. (📸: Getty Images)

Did you know that you don't have to save and download your Instagram stories? There's an archive where you can see everything you've ever uploaded — and it's right in the app. First, go to your profile. On the top right of your profile page, you'll see a little timer icon. Smash that button. Now ya know! 📲⏰ (📷: Nicole Nguyen / BuzzFeed News)
There has been an outpouring of support and love for iconic singer Aretha Franklin following reports that she is seriously ill 🙏❤️

Caitlin's mom recently let her order a Barbie on Amazon for her birthday. Caitlin later asked to go back on Amazon to see when the gift would arrive (or so she claimed). The next day, 6 boxes were delivered to their Utah home. It turned out Caitlin ordered $350 worth of toys, video games, and board games. "She’s a little scammer in the making," her cousin said 📦😬 (📷: Ria Diyaolu)

Whitehall, whose casting was already announced, will reportedly play the openly gay brother of Emily Blunt’s character in “The Jungle Cruise,” which is set to be in theaters in October 2019. “As possibly one of the biggest Disney nerds on the planet so exciting to be working on a project with this much history,” Whitehall wrote on Instagram recently. (📸: Getty Images)

Liu Yifei beat out more than 1,000 other people who were vying for the role. The movie, which is scheduled to hit theaters on March 27, 2020, also stars Jet Li, Donnie Yen, Jason Scott Lee, and Gong Li. (📸: Disney/Disney Enterprises)

“Everyone enjoyed it and all laughed and took photos with him,” a friend of the dad told BuzzFeed News. “His two sons weren’t quite sure what was going on and why Dad was wearing a dress.” (📸: Kornpat Ae Sukhom)

The announcement that Rose would play Kate Kane, aka Batwoman, in The CW’s Arrowverse marked the first time an openly gay superhero would lead their own television series. While many welcomed Rose’s casting, some accused the show’s creators of lazy casting and ignoring the character’s Jewish identity. (📸: @rubyrose)

Black women in the US are far less likely than other women to breastfeed, but Chocolate Milk Mommies is working to normalize breastfeeding for black mothers through its Facebook group and these incredible photos. "In our community it's taboo — they look at breastfeeding as a white thing, and it's looked down upon," one of its founders, Jennifer Miller, said. "In Birmingham, we get a lot of backlash for breastfeeding in public, especially with it being a religious state. We get told to cover up a lot." In addition to cultural factors, black women are less likely to breastfeed because they are more likely to have to go back to work earlier, and also often don't get enough information from doctors and lack access to professional breastfeeding support. (📸: Genesis Nalls, Keisha Cahill)

In the recording of what Omarosa says is chief of staff John Kelly firing her inside the White House's Situation Room, Kelly can be heard warning her of "pretty significant legal issues" that could "develop into something that— that’ll make it ugly for you." She said she perceived Kelly's statements as "an obvious threat," adding that she recorded the conversation to protect herself. "This is a White House where everybody lies. ... You have to have your back," she said on NBC's Meet the Press. (📷 Getty Images)

In the hit UK reality show, contestants, aka the Islanders, couple up with one another as they compete for love, friendship, or cash on a sunny Spanish island. Viewers vote for the couple they think should win the grand prize of £50,000 ($65,000). The first four season of Love Island are available on Hulu, and the US version will be coming to CBS. (📷: ITV)

Hundreds of anti-fascist protestors gathered in Charlottesville exactly one year after a white supremacist allegedly killed protestor Heather Heyer during a “Unite The Right” march. Another white supremacist march is set to take place outside the White House on Sunday. (📷: Getty)

29-year-old Richard “Beebo” Russell flew the plane for roughly an hour, performing stunt maneuvers while fighter jets scrambled to fly alongside him. He told air traffic controllers that he was “just a broken guy” with “a few screws loose, I guess.” No other passengers were aboard the plane. (📷: Russell)

Dancer Mark Kanemura (@mkik808), best known for his work with Lady Gaga and on "So You Think You Can Dance", went viral for an iconic video of him dancing to "Cut to the Feeling" and whipping off rainbow wig after rainbow wig. He made a surprise appearance during Carly's performance at the Outside Lands music festival on Friday and the confetti 🎉 went 🎉 flying 🎉 (📷: FilmMagic)

The Salam Sisters represent different ethnicities, a range of hair textures, have interests ranging from fashion design to surfing, and have optional hijabs in multiple styles. "The most priceless responses we've received are from young girls themselves," the creators said. "It made me smile every time I heard a girl saying, 'she looks like me!'" 🧕 ✊(📷: Zileej)

Annovera is a flexible ring that's placed in the vagina for three weeks, then removed, washed, and stored in a case for a week (you might experience a period while the ring is removed.) Unlike other hormonal contraceptive rings, Annovera doesn't need to be entirely replaced every month, but it won't be available until the end of 2019 or early 2020. (📷: The Population Council)

Rodale Books has recalled a cookbook written by Instagram influencer Johnna Holmgren — also known as Fox Meets Bear — after critics warned that some of the recipes in the book could be dangerous, specifically those that instructed readers to consume raw morel mushrooms, elderberries, and unleached acorns. In a statement on the website of its parent company, Crown Publishing, Rodale said it and Holmgren mutually agreed to "discontinue the publication and promotion of the book." Holmgren, who told BuzzFeed News previously that her book was meant for "adventurous eaters," has not addressed the controversy or the recall, but removed her posts about the book on Instagram. (📸: @foxmeetsbear)

Rachel Morrison, who earlier this year became the first woman ever nominated for an Oscar for Best Cinematography for her work on "Mudbound," is expecting her second child with her wife Rachel Garza, and got real about working while pregnant. Morrison, who has also worked on "Fruitvale Station" and "Black Panther," just wrapped "Against All Enemies" while eight months pregnant, and took to Instagram to combat the idea that woman can't go about their normal lives while pregnant. She said she lost jobs after giving birth to her first child, and that while everyone's experience is different, she wants people to know that pregnancy and motherhood don't lessen the quality of a woman's work. (📸: @rmorrison )

Dennis Shields, who was in an on-and-off relationship with the “Real Housewives of New York City” star, was reportedly found dead Friday morning. The death is still under investigation, but an NYPD spokesperson told BuzzFeed News that it’s being looked at as a possible overdose. (📷: Splash News)

Beth Wilensky donated to a local group but also directed people to Miles 4 Migrants, a nonprofit that reunites refugee families around the world. They’ve already received 5.8 million donated airline miles. “The families are government-approved for relocation,” one of the founders said. “The only thing holding them back is the cost of the flight.” (📷: AP)

Thousands of women gathered in Colombia to breastfeed their children in public in an attempt to break the taboo and raise awareness about the health benefits of breastfeeding. Follow @world for more ✊ coverage 🌎 (📷: Getty, AP, Reuters)

Federal officials arrested Brandon Ziobrowski for allegedly posting a murder-for-hire solicitation to kill US Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents on social media. He’s been charged with one count of use of interstate and foreign commerce to transmit a threat to injure another person, according to court documents. (📷: @b_ziobrowski, Twitter)

Like their daughter, Viktor and Amalija Knavs immigrated to the US from Slovenia. They reportedly achieved citizenship through family-based immigration, or “chain migration”, which President Trump has repeatedly lambasted and pushed to ban. (📷: AP)

For months, the Puerto Rican government kept the official death toll at 64, despite plenty of evidence to the contrary. In the weeks after the storm, families and funeral directors in at least two towns told BuzzFeed News that dozens of deaths directly linked to the storm weren’t being included in the tally. We also found that 911 possible hurricane victims were cremated without being examined to see if their death was caused by the storm. (📷: Reuters)

When 21-year-old Siam met his nail tech, Bian, she was a single mother who had recently immigrated to the UK. Despite a language barrier, they became close friends over the years and Siam started babysitting her son (who drew a pictures of the three of them.) When Bian was ready to go back home, she sent Siam a touching text that went viral on Twitter. Siam says he doesn’t believe he made Bian a braver person: “She’s terrible at giving herself credit.” (📷: Siam)

The vote comes six weeks after the lower house of the Argentine Congress passed a measure that would provide access to abortions up to the 14th week of pregnancy, as well as in cases in which the life of the mother was at risk. Complications from illicit abortions are the leading cause of maternal death in Argentina and result in hospitalizations for between 45,000 and 60,000 women each year. (📸: Getty Images)

Attorneys for the former Stanford University student who sexually assaulted an unconscious woman outside a fraternity party argued that there wasn't enough evidence to convict him, and claimed he was only guilty of "sexual outercourse" since his pants remained on during the assault. The California Court of Appeals didn't buy it. Brock Turner will continue to register as a sex offender for the rest of his life. (📷: Reuters)

Lauren Cutshaw also told police she was a cheerleader and a sorority girl, "had perfect grades her whole life," and her "partner is a cop." The 32-year-old real estate agent’s blood alcohol level was recorded at more than twice the legal limit. She was arrested and charged with driving under the influence, speeding, disregarding a stop sign, and marijuana possession. (📷: LinkedIn/ Beaufort County Detention Center)

The tourism campaign for Vilnius, the capital of Lithuania, will focus on drawing in visitors from the UK and Germany, with digital and outdoor ads, and a website that will include "a quiz which allows users to generate a personalized map of the city." There's only one small problem: Pope Francis is due to visit the majority-Catholic country in September, and priests "expressed concerns that the ad used “women’s sexuality for advertising” and gave “wrong ideas.” 🇱🇹😳 (📷: vilnius-tourism.lt)
The changes are designed to address criticism that the Oscars snub movies that are box office successes and that the televised ceremony is too long (last year it was almost four hours.) (📷: AP)

Rep. Jason Lewis promoted extreme opinions about LGBT people on his radio show in 2013, compared gay people to criminals, and said same-sex parents “could harm the kid.” Now, he’s running for reelection in Minnesota’s 2nd District against Angie Craig, a Democrat and lesbian mother of four who narrowly lost a race to him in 2016. (📷: AP)

Rashida Tlaib was once hauled out by security for shouting at President Trump during a speech in Detroit and has deep ties in activist circles. She just won a Democratic primary in Michigan and is almost guaranteed to win November’s general election. (📷: AP)

The fetus was discovered inside an empty bathroom on an American Airlines plane parked at New York's LaGuardia Airport by a cleaning crew. An investigation into what happened remained ongoing, but a spokesperson for the New York City Office of Chief Medical Examiner said the gestational age of the fetus was estimated to be five months. (📸: AP)

Ja'Naea Modest has been thinking about looking for a new job so she could save up for a move, so she tried to (discreetly) visit a job fair on her break – and of course was filmed by the local news filling out a job application. Figuring her cover was blown after being featured on her CBS news station, Modest decided to share her experience on social media, where it quickly went viral. Modest says the attention has been "pretty cool," and she's using her viral fame to help collect donations and school supplies for local students. (📸: Facebook)

Bertram (aka Bertie, aka Bert) the Pomeranian looks just like a teddy bear, so it was only fitting that his mom dressed him up as the beloved Paddington Bear. "As soon as I got the hat on his head I was like, Oh my god. It was an immediate 'Wow' moment," said his owner Kathy Grayson, who got the little costume from Etsy. Grayson said she's purchased some little yellow rain boots, and now just needs a suitcase to complete the look🐻😍 (📸: Studio Canal, @bertiebertthepom)

Ruby Rose has been cast as Batwoman, "an out lesbian and highly trained street fighter," the network announced, and will make her first appearance as the superhero in the annual December crossover event in the CW's DC shows: "Arrow," "The Flash," "Legends of Tomorrow," and "Supergirl." A separate Batwoman show is also in development for the 2019–20 season. Rose, who identifies as gender-fluid, said she hopes the role will inspire LGBT youth 🏳️‍🌈(📸: Reuters, DC/The CW)

Adam Purinton was sentenced to life in prison without the possibility of parole after pleading guilty to a hate crime charge for shooting and killing Srinivas Kuchibhotla in a Kansas City-area bar last year. Purinton admitted to targeting Kuchibhotla and his friend Alok Madasani, who is also Indian, because of their race, skin color, and national origin, and reportedly yelled at them to "Get out of my country." Madasani and another man, Ian Grillot, were also shot but survived the attack. (📸: Clinton Police Department, GoFundMe)
👉 @buzzfeedlgbt is here, queer, and waiting for your follow to keep up with LGBT news and more 🌈🙂 (📸: Chloie Jönsson)

The former NSYNC star said he was told he placed the winning bid on the house, but felt like he was used by the real estate agent. “I truly believe I was used to drive up the price of the home knowing very well that this corporation intended on making their offer,” Bass wrote on Instagram. (📸: Flickr: crackerbunny)

As of Monday, the Change.org petition was fewer than 4,000 names away from its goal of 25,000 signatures. The governor of Batman did not respond to a BuzzFeed News request about the petition. (📸: Google Maps/Change.org)

Curtis Collman III died from acute methamphetamine intoxication after ingesting nearly 180 times the lethal amount of the drug, which his father Curtis Collman II, had left out on the kitchen table. The father told investigators he saw that his son was "not acting right" and that he was "twitching and bouncing his face off the floor.” For four hours that day, Collman knew that his son needed medical attention, but did not call 911 and prevented his friends and family from calling for help. Collman is facing several charges including neglect of a dependent resulting in death. (📷: abc7ny.com/Jackson County Sheriff’s Office)

Makenzie Noland is graduating with a degree in wildlife and fisheries sciences from Texas A&M University in College Station. Big Tex is the 13-foot, 8.5-inch, 1,000-pound gator she’s posing with. He lives at the rescue center that Noland has been interning at all summer 🐊🎓 (📷: Facebook)

Thousands of students across Dhaka have been protesting the deaths of two teenagers who were killed in a road accident by a speeding bus. What started as a protest for better road safety has evolved into a nationwide movement against government corruption in Bangladesh. The demonstrations have been ongoing for around nine days now, and show no sign of letting up, despite many students being beaten up by the police and pro-government activists. (📷: Reuters, AP, Getty)

“We have taken [the pages] down for glorifying violence, which violates our graphic violence policy, and using dehumanizing language to describe people who are transgender, Muslims and immigrants, which violates our hate speech policies,” Facebook said in a statement. The removal came hours after Apple announced it would remove all episodes of Jones’ popular show from its podcast platform. (📸: InfoWars)
Vogue just released the cover for its September issue with Beyoncé. The cover was shot by 23-year-old Tyler Mitchell, who Beyoncé hand-picked to work with 👑💐(📸: @voguemagazine)

Apple's decision to remove all episodes of Alex Jones' popular show is one of the largest enforcement actions intended to curb conspiratorial news content by a technology company to date. "Apple does not tolerate hate speech, and we have clear guidelines that creators and developers must follow to ensure we provide a safe environment for all of our users," a company spokesperson said 📲❌ (📷: Infowars)

Samuel Woodward, 20, has been accused of a hate crime in addition to first-degree murder in the killing of his ex-classmate Blaze Bernstein, who was found stabbed over 20 times and buried in a grave in a California park. A search warrant affidavit revealed Woodward told investigators that Bernstein had kissed him. Investigators found racist, anti-gay, and anti-Semitic images and messages on the suspect's phone and computer. "Today we suffer an added layer of pain from learning [Blaze] was likely killed solely for who he was as a human being," Bernstein's father said. (📷: www.blazebernstein.org/AP)

Four people were arrested at a protest in Portland on Saturday, where hundreds of far-right protesters were met with a counterprotest by far-left demonstrators. Patriot Prayer held the rally, led by Republican Senate candidate Joey Gibson, who billed it as a free speech demonstration and campaign event. Police used flashbangs and other devices on protesters allegedly throwing bottles and rocks. (📷: Getty Images)

Demi Lovato says she “will keep fighting” and focus on her sobriety after being hospitalized following a drug overdose last month. On Sunday, the singer took to Instagram to post this message to her followers. (📷: Getty/@ddlovato)

“I’m not here voicing, but by having these names on my tie in a big platform like the Pro Football Hall of Fame, there’s a lot of stuff going on in our country and I just wanted these family members to know they’re not alone,” Moss told NFL Network after the ceremony. (📸: AP)
It's cool, we're not judging. It was Meghan's 37th birthday too. (📸: PA Images)
Follow @world for more 🌈 🛥 🇳🇱 (📸: Getty Images)

The National Rifle Association is suing the New York State Department of Financial Services and Gov. Andrew Cuomo after the state agency encouraged financial services companies in New York not to do business with the NRA after the Parkland, Florida school shooting. The NRA says it "has suffered tens of millions of dollars in damages" as a result. Gov. Cuomo issued a statement in response saying "If the NRA goes bankrupt because of the State of New York, they'll be in my thoughts and prayers." (📸: Getty)

The Washington, DC museum dedicated to the history of news tweeted "we made a mistake and we apologize" and announced it would remove shirts reading "You Are Very Fake News" after outcry from journalists. The Newseum initially defended the shirts, saying "people with differing viewpoints" visit the museum, and that it supports "free speech," but said Saturday that "a free press is an essential part of our democracy and journalists are not the enemy of the people." The museum will continue to sell MAGA hats and other pro-Trump merchandise. (📸: @ mlcalderone via Twitter)

Alex Kurtzman, the showrunner behind the "Star Trek: Discovery" series currently airing on CBS All Access, announced the news at a fan convention in Las Vegas, bringing out Stewart to a thrilled audience. The new show will stream on CBS All Access and focus on the "next chapter" in the life of the beloved captain of the starship Enterprise. Stewart posted a statement saying he hoped Picard could shine some light in "these often very dark times." (📸: CBS TV Studios)

An unnamed official at Tokyo Medical University told Japanese media that the school believed accepting more male students would help solve the university hospital’s doctor shortage because female doctors would inevitably drop out of the workforce after they get married and give birth to children. A spokesperson for the university said it is conducting an internal investigation. (📸: 時事通信)

The latest push of the false narrative came from actor and prominent conservative James Woods, who tweeted a photo of a rainbow poster with the text “Pedophiles are people too.” A local news station in Oregon confirmed the poster was real and neighbors tore it down, but who put it up remains a mystery. (📸: Twitter)

A US District Judge found “the Court sees no reason to change its earlier determination that DACA’s rescission was arbitrary and capricious.” The decision is put on hold for 20 days to let the government determine whether it will appeal. (📸: Getty Images)

Donald Trump’s tweet came after a CNN re-aired an interview with LeBron James where he said the president “kinda used sports to kinda divide us” and that he would “never sit across from” Trump. This past week, James opened a public school for at-risk children in his hometown of Akron, Ohio. (📸: Getty Images)

The heartwarming moment took place after the officer offered a woman some water during a protest over the banning of all face veils including those worn for religious reasons like a niqab or burqa in Denmark ✊❤️ (📷: Reuters)

The man who opened fire from a high-rise casino in Las Vegas, killing 58 people and injuring hundreds more, had lost $1.5 million in the two years before the Oct. 1 shooting and may have had bipolar disorder, but without a manifesto, "or even a note to answer questions," Sheriff Joe Lombardo said all they can do is speculate on what motivated the shooter. (📷: Getty Images)

Gone are the days of kids tobogganing and sledding during snow days. A school district in South Carolina is planning to replace all inclement weather–related school closures with online courses for students to take at home. They’ll have an additional five days to complete it once they return to school 😩⛷❄️ (📷: Getty Images)

Residents of a neighborhood in Boise, Idaho, woke up to about 100 goats "going house to house and eating everything in sight," KTVB reported. No one knew where they were from, but eventually a truck came, loaded them up, and left. Police told BuzzFeed News the goats belong to We Rent Goats, a company that rents out goats to eat grass, kind of like a lawn-mowing service 🌳🐐(📸: Joe Parris / KTVB, Ruth Brown / Idaho Statesman)

Kaepernick's name was edited out of rapper YG's "Big Bank," a song that appears on the game's soundtrack. The company said the mention of Kaepernick, who helped give rise to the kneeling protests that swept the NFL, wasn't removed for political reasons, but rather due to confusion over whether they had the rights to mention it. His name will be added back in a planned Aug. 6 update. (📸: Getty Images / EA Sports)

An employee at Smith College in Massachusetts called police on Oumou Kanoute because she "seemed to be out of place," school officials said. Kanoute, a student there, recorded videos of the encounter and wrote about it in a post on Facebook, saying she was "blown away at the fact that i cannot even sit down and eat lunch peacefully." (📸: Oumou Kanoute via Facebook)

A new analysis shows that parents with children were the ones sent to court, while adults without kids weren't. The Transactional Records Access Clearinghouse found that in May only 32% of all adult immigrants caught crossing the border were charged. Authorities apprehended 4,458 adults with children that same month, while it arrested 24,465 adults without children. Yet only 9,216 adults were referred for prosecution, far fewer than the number of adults who in theory should have been referred under "zero tolerance." Watch our Story to catch reporter @adolfof87 answering some of your immigration questions. (📷: AP)

Zimbabwean President Emmerson Mnangagwa narrowly beat out his opponent, Nelson Chamisa, in the country’s historic election — its first without ex-president Robert Mugabe on the ballot. Mnangagwa, who became president last November after leading a military takeover of Zimbabwe that effectively forced Mugabe out of office, will now extend his eight months in office and serve a full five-year term 🗳🇿🇼 (📷: Getty Images)

The Multi-Society Task Force for Safety in Gluteal Fat Grafting — which represents a number of plastic surgery associations — released a letter warning that complications may be killing as many as 1 in 3,000 people who get a Brazilian butt lift, a rate that is "greater than any other cosmetic surgery." (📷: Getty)
Apple's market capitalization crossed the trillion-dollar mark Thursday, when the stock price hit $207.05 a share 🍎💰(📷: Getty/AMC)

Erika Martin had just given a bag of dog food to a homeless man in the parking lot of a Safeway when multiple police cars pulled up around her. An officer soon explained that they had been called to the grocery store because she fit the description of a shoplifter. Not only had Martin not stolen anything, she had never entered the store or even left her car. "It happened because we were doing a good deed," she said. Police left without charging anyone, and Safeway says it’s conducting an internal investigation. (📷: Getty/ Erika Martin)

Chaselyn Baca tweeted the conversation one of her best friends, Amy, had with a guy on Tinder named Eric. Eric jokingly suggested Amy "get a girl version" of his dog so they could double-date. Amy then suggested that Eric's dog might be gay and would prefer a male dog, and well, things devolved from there. (📸: Chaselyn Baca)
"Big Little Lies" is currently filming its second season, which is set to debut in 2019. (📸: The Image Direct)

Greg Manteufel was hospitalized in June with a serious infection and went into septic shock, which led to limb amputations and nose damage. Testing showed that Manteufel's infection was caused by a bacteria called Capnocytophaga canimorsus, which can be found in 74% of dogs. Manteufel's wife told the Washington Post that Greg had been around eight dogs before he got sick. “He is so thankful to be alive today and is taking one day at a time," his GoFundMe says. (📷: Dawn Manteufel)

People are sharing screenshots of Austin McBroom’s old tweets which some believe are disparaging to women, specifically black women. Longtime fans are saying the tweets run counter to McBroom's family-man image. Other ardent fans are defending the ACE Family, calling them "genuine & loving people" who are "amazing human beings period." (📷: The ACE Family via YouTube)

“I opened up the lid of the coffee and out pours this pungent smell of chemical,” Sarah Douglas, who is 7 months pregnant, told Lethbridge News Now. The owner of the McDonald’s apologized, saying that the milk supply line was connected to the cleaning solution while her drink was made. Douglas said that she went to see a doctor but did not have any lingering effects as she did not swallow the cleaning liquid ☕️⚠️ (📷: Getty/Global News)

Johnna Holmgren says her cookbook, “Tales From A Forager’s Kitchen”, is meant for “adventurous eaters.” But it has come under scrutiny for some of its recipes, including one that calls for mushrooms to be dipped in chocolate and eaten raw. Experts say eating wild, raw mushrooms can make you sick — and collecting the wrong ones could potentially be deadly. (📷: @foxmeetsbear)

Rihanna posted a picture of her new British Vogue cover and suddenly, people are 🚨 alarmed🚨about the possibility that years of working on their thick brows have gone to waste. We’ll just have to see — the issue comes out in September 👀 (📷: @badgalriri)
Seriously, condoms are meant to be used once. Washing or reusing a condom is pretty gross and will diminish its effectiveness 🙅‍♂️ (📸: Getty Images)

Ellen Maud Bennett, 64, died in May of inoperable cancer. While it's unclear what Bennett's own specific experience with the medical system was, her final words are resonating beyond the grave. Her obituary is being lauded by so many people who've felt discriminated against by doctors for their size. (📷: www.Legacy.com)

Italian discus thrower Daisy Osakue was injured in a suspected racially motivated attack in Italy. Osakue said she was hit in the face by an egg thrown at her from a moving car, allowing eggshell fragments to enter her eye and cause damage to her cornea. “They did not want to hit me, Daisy, they wanted to hit a black girl," she said. Born in Italy to Nigerian immigrant parents, Osakue holds Italy's under-23 discus record and attends and trains at Angelo State University in Texas during the year. (📸: Getty, AP)

If you've been on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, Tumblr, email, Google+, or your group text today, you may have come across a link to this sketchy website, which promises a $100 Chipotle gift card to anyone who gets four friends to click on their referral link. It even includes Facebook reviews from (fake) people, and a reply from a (fake) verified Chipotle account. Chipotle confirmed on Twitter that the link was not affiliated with the chain, saying it "seems to be a scam going around." (📸: chipotle.guacamole.cards)
The news sent the stock price of MoviePass’ parent company tumbling and users are beginning to wonder if time is running out for MoviePass 🎥 📉 (📸: Reuters)

Prosecutors say Dr. Johnnie Barto, 70, sexually assaulted patients, many of whom were between the ages of 8 and 12, as long ago as the 1980s until as recently as January of this year. Barto is currently in jail related to previous assaults, and his medical license was suspended in January. (📸: Cambria County Prison)

Hapag-Lloyd employees were setting up a land station on the Arctic islands of Svalbard when the attack occurred. Guards tried to scare the polar bear away by shouting, jumping, and firing a signal pistol, police said. Two guards then shot and killed the bear. Scientists, celebrities, and others on social media have criticized the cruise company for putting its employees in contact with the bear. The injured employee is in stable condition. (📷: AP)

The news comes amid rumors that Anna Wintour will leave the fashion magazine soon. According to HuffPost, the singer will be choosing 23-year-old Tyler Mitchell as her photographer, making him the first black photographer to snap the cover shot in the publication's 126-year history. Sources also told HuffPost that the agreement gives Beyoncé full control over her photos for the magazine, as well as the captions 👑👏🏾 (📷: Getty)

Sombra, a 6-year-old German shepherd, has sniffed out more than 2,000 kilos of cocaine and has helped capture at least 245 criminals. "We are responsible for her safety," Sombra's handler told the AP. Police are planning to strategically move Sombra around the country so she can continue to fight drug trafficking undetected 🐶🇨🇴 (📷: AP)

Gunn was fired from the upcoming third film in the series because of old tweets dug up by right-wing activists in which he made light of pedophilia. In an open letter signed by the film’s main stars, the cast wrote Gunn’s apology “we believe is from the heart, a heart we all know, trust and love.” (📸: Getty Images/@zoesaldana)

“There’s not a day that goes by that I don’t pray for the opportunity to go back to that day and make it different,” Morgan Miller said on the “TODAY” show Monday. “But now we have the opportunity to make other parents’ days different.” (📸: NBC)

Leslie Cockburn, a Democrat running for a US House seat in Virginia, shared a tweet with a screenshot supposedly taken from her Republican opponent Denver Riggleman’s Instagram account, showing Bigfoot with his private parts censored by a very long black box. In comments to a local newspaper,  Riggleman called Cockburn’s tweet “absurd” and said the posts were jokes played on him by friends. (📸: LeslieCockburn/Twitter)
The sea creature is a hybrid between a melon-headed whale and a rough-toothed dolphin 🐋🐬(📷: Facebook via Cascadia Research Collective)

As many as 468 kids separated from their mothers and fathers at the border have parents who were deported by the Trump administration, according to statistics made public in a San Diego court hearing, and now US authorities must figure out how to reunite them — or whether to reunite them at all (📷: AP)

Ed Bledsoe was running a quick errand when he got a frantic call from his 5-year-old great-grandson, James Roberts, crying that a blazing wildfire had reached their home here. "He told me, 'Grandpa, you need to come. The fire is coming at our house now!'” the 71-year-old told BuzzFeed News, breaking down in tears. That was the last time Bledsoe heard from James; the boy's 5-year-old sister, Emily; or his wife, Melody, 70. The Carr Fire has killed five people and forced nearly 40,000 people from their homes in California. (📷: Supplied)

Spencer will produce and star in an eight-episode limited series about the woman who innovated the black hair care industry for women and became the first self-made female millionaire. LeBron James will also serve as an executive producer 💇🏿‍♀️🌟 (📸: Madam Walker Family Archives/Netflix)

17-year-old activist Ahed Tamimi addressed crowds after spending eight months in jail and told them “resistance is continuing.” She was arrested in December, after IDF soldiers reportedly shot her cousin in the head at point-blank range with a rubber bullet. Tamimi said she “could not keep quiet” after she saw the same soldiers in front of her house an hour later. (📷: AFP)

A video released by police shows the officer stunning the suspect while he was handcuffed and pinned up against his van. While the suspect is struggling to get up after being stunned, the officer points the stun gun at the suspect again. “To let this particular act or anything like it just go away or get swept under the run, that’s not acceptable,” Meridian Police Chief Benny Dubose told local reporters (📷: Meridian Police)

84-year-old Keith Tyssen told BuzzFeed News he’s frequently woken up in the middle of the night by people messing with the leafy lady outside his home. “I get upset when someone just carelessly messed a thing about, a work of art, because they’re ignorant and they don’t know what they’re messing about,” Tyssen said. 😳 🌱 (📸: Google Maps)
Google says it’s rolling out a fix after people reported the ~ suggestive ~ autocomplete feature. (📸: BuzzFeed News)

Michael Dumas, 17, was on a mission trip with his church when he started feeling unwell after visiting the beach. Everyone thought he had an ear infection, but the symptoms didn’t stop. Eventually, doctors realized he had hookworms — which is most commonly contracted by walking on sand or soil contaminated with dog or cat feces. Five other boys on the trip were also infected with hookworm. (📸: Kelli Mulhollen Dumas)

Sara Cunningham, an ordained minister and LGBTQ+ advocate from Oklahoma, told BuzzFeed News her activism is directed by having a gay son. She has married LGBT couples before and recently posted on Facebook that she’ll attend the weddings of any same-sex couples who don’t have support from their parents. “People need hope — I sure do — and we need to be that for each other in any way, shape, or form,” Cunningham said. 🌈 💒 😭 (📸: Facebook)

Viewers across the globe, except in North and Central America, were treated to a "blood moon" eclipse Friday night in what experts said was the longest lunar eclipse of the 21st century. A lunar eclipse occurs when the moon passes through Earth's shadow. Friday's event lasted nearly four hours, with the moon being totally obscured by Earth's shadow for 1 hour, 42 minutes, and 57 seconds. Check out our Story for more incredible photos. (📸: AP, Getty)

The 22-year-old Louisiana woman, who has autism, was allegedly tortured and abused by her relatives for a year while being forced to complete housework and yard work, and was made to live in a cage, eat her mother's ashes, and physically assaulted. She was also allegedly forced to remove her clothes and make sexual advances to men who visited the home and forced to use methamphetamine and prescription painkillers. A federal grand jury has returned a six-count human trafficking and hate crime indictment relating to her abuse by five of her relatives. (📸: Tangipahoa Parish Sheriff's Office)

Fisher's family has given their blessing for the late actor to appear in the upcoming "Star Wars: Episode IX" using previously unreleased footage shot during "The Force Awakens." "We desperately loved Carrie Fisher. Finding a truly satisfying conclusion to the Skywalker saga without her eluded us," director, writer, and producer J.J. Abrams said. "We were never going to recast, or use a CG character." Episode IX is scheduled for release in December 2019. (📸: Lucasfilms / Disney)

When special education teacher Madonna Wilburn's digital coupons didn't apply correctly to her purchase at a Buffalo, New York Dollar General, she says manager Ken Dudek became irritated and told her "you people always want discounts" before instructing an employee to "dispatch police," who ultimately arrived and dismissed the incident. After Wilburn uploaded video of the incident to Facebook, she was messaged by an account with the name Ken Dudek, as well as his family members, threatening her. Dollar General initially offered her a $50 gift card as compensation, but after the incident went viral, Dudek was fired. (Madonna Wilburn)

Westwick won't face charges after being accused by several women of sexual assault, prosecutors said. Three women came forward in February alleging that they had been sexually assaulted by the actor. (📸: Getty Images)
Murphy revealed that Fern, who played David Madson in the second season of "American Crime Story," would play the antichrist.

A ferocious wildfire has torn through acres of land in Northern California, killing one person and injuring others. Fueled by soaring temperatures and high winds, the Carr fire, which began on Monday, rapidly expanded to cover at least 45 square miles by Thursday night. (📸: Getty Images)
Cardi B won't be touring with Bruno Mars this fall, just weeks after giving birth: "I'm not ready to leave my baby behind." 👶❤️ (📷: @iamcardib )

The Trump administration has reunited more than 1,400 families — but hundreds of children remain separated from their parents, the government doesn’t know where many parents are, and it has deemed others ineligible for reunification. (📷: AP, Getty Images)

James Howell, was found taking assault rifles and explosive materials to the LA Pride parade in 2016, has been sentenced to more than seven years in prison on weapons charges. Howell was arrested hours after the massacre at Pulse nightclub in Orlando, Florida. Authorities had feared a copycat crime targeting LGBT people, particularly with the LA Pride festivities taking place that weekend. (📷: AP/Getty Images)

An unknown person untied a yacht owned by the family of billionaire Education Secretary Betsy DeVos from its dock, according to local authorities. Officers are looking for surveillance footage to investigate further 👀🛥 (📷: Reuters, Twitter via Superyachtfan)

Stewart will be joined by Naomi Scott and Ella Balinska playing the angels, with director Elizabeth Banks playing Bosley. The film is to be released in 2019. (📸: Getty Images / @ellabalinska / Randy Shropshire)

Hathaway used her platform to highlight the murder of Wilson, a black teenager killed while standing on a Bay Area Rapid Transit (BART) station platform. John Cowell, a white man and the 27-year-old suspect in the case, was apprehended by authorities. (📸: @annehathaway)

CNN reporter Kaitlan Collins was denied access to a press conference held by Trump Wednesday after she asked him questions about his former lawyer Michael Cohen and Vladimir Putin. Trump did not respond to the questions, one of which was "Did Michael Cohen betray you?" Collins said Press Secretary Sarah Huckabee Sanders told Collins her questions were inappropriate and accused her of shouting, and was told she could not attend the Rose Garden press conference. The White House Correspondants Association condemned the decision, and other reporters offered support for Collins. (📸: AP)

The singer drew both support and criticism after tweeting about a United flight she took with her sister, who has a nut allergy, during which she says the attendant told her there was nothing they could do about it. Many agreed that all airlines should be nut free given the severe allergies many people have, but others told the singer her sister should have informed the airline of her allergy ahead of time. United says it does not serve pre-packaged peanuts, but can't guarantee an allergen-free environment onboard. (📸: @dualipa)

It all began with a tweet from a woman named Gabriella, who shared her experience of being asked for help by a woman she didn't know, who was being followed by a man. Numerous women responded with their own experiences of being made to feel uncomfortable and unsafe by men in public, or of stepping up to protect other women, and encouraged others to do the same. (📸: Regina Acheampong)

In an effort to overthrow the former Stanford student’s sexual assault conviction, Turner’s lawyer argued that he only engaged “sexual outercourse” with the unconscious victim, which did not demonstrate an intent to commit rape. Turner was sentenced to just six months in jail after his initial conviction by a judge who cited concerns that harsher punishment would have a “severe impact” on Turner. After national outrage, that judge has since been recalled. (📷: Greene County Sheriff’s Office)

They all worked together on the set of Disney’s “Camp Rock” beginning in 2008, and Lovato later dated Joe. Lovato is “awake and with her family” now, her representatives said, and noted that some initial reports about the circumstances of her hospitalization were incorrect. (📷: Getty)

"Demi is awake and with her family, who want to express thanks to everyone for the love, prayers, and support," Lovato's publicist said in a statement to BuzzFeed News. Check out our story for more details. (📷: Getty Images)

People online are calling for the release of a well known Palestinian writer and activist who was detained at her house in front of her 3-year-old son, using the hashtag #LamaKhater. (📷: Basem, qudsn.co)

Lovato has been public about her struggle with drugs and alcohol. Her health scare comes one month after she revealed in her song “Sober” that she had relapsed, just three months after celebrating six years of sobriety. (📷: Getty, Twitter)

“After 17 months in Washington, I do not know when or if I will ever return to the business, but I do know that my focus for the foreseeable future will be the work I am doing here in Washington, so making this decision now is the only fair outcome for my team and partners,” Ivanka Trump said in a statement. (📸: Reuters)

When 24-year-old Madison Bilheimer posted a very hilarious video of her golden retriever, Dierks, caught red-handed in the middle of destroying her room, people rushed to his defend him since all floofs are innocent (of course). We're happy to report that the all-around Good Boy, did not get into any trouble. (📸: mpbbbee/Twitter)

Wildfires near Athens have killed at least 50 people and injured more than 150, according to Greek fire services, as hundreds of firefighters and first responders struggled to contain the blazes and evacuate residents. (📸: Getty Images)

If you have Ritz crackers in your pantry, you may want to throw them out. Snack manufacturer Mondelēz Globals has recalled 16 different products due to possible health risks related to one ingredient — whey powder. The products include Ritz cheese cracker sandwiches (bacon, whole wheat, and cream cheese varieties), Ritz Bits products (tiny, cheese-filled cracker sandwiches), and assorted cookie packets that contain the cracker sandwiches along with other products from the same manufacturer ⚠️ (📷: Getty Images)

Tensions between the company and workers came to a breaking point in a worker strike and protest on Prime Day. One protester needed eight stitches in his chin after police hit him with a baton, according to three sources who were present at the demonstration. Workers were protesting low pay and poor working conditions at the company’s fulfillment centers. (📷: @litolizana)

Uber and Lyft revoked Jason Gargac’s driving privileges after he admitted that he livestreamed passengers without their consent on game-streaming site Twitch. The videos reportedly garnered thousands of views and his account had about 4,500 followers with 100 subscribers who paid him $5 monthly. Gargac claims he made about $3,500 from the platform. He defended his behavior, by calling it a form of “people watching” 😳 (📷: St. Louis Post-Dispatch via Twitch)

In a 19-minute song titled “I Admit,” Kelly says, “Said I’m abusing these women, what the fuck that’s some absurd shit / They’re brainwashed, really? / Kidnapped, really? / Can’t eat, really? / Real talk, that shit sound silly.” In July 2017, parents told BuzzFeed News they went to police because Kelly was holding their daughters against their will in an abusive “cult,” saying these women were brainwashed into staying with the artist despite his treatment of them. (📸: Getty Images)

Trump was responding to Iranian President Hassan Rouhani’s comments that “war with Iran is the mother of all wars.” Relations between the two countries have deteriorated since the Trump administration withdrew the US from the Iran nuclear deal. (📸: AP)

Kristina Makeeva is a photographer from Moscow, Russia, who captures women in dresses in some of the world’s most beautiful places. Makeeva told BuzzFeed News that she started this project because she wanted to show that “how a person and his or her creations can organically fit into the beauty of this world.” She said uses a combination of Camera Raw, Photoshop and VSCOCam to edit her images, and the results are absolutely stunning 😍💫 (📷: @hobopeeba)
