Mesut Özil, a German-born soccer star of Turkish origin, was criticized over whether he was loyal to Germany after posing in a photo with President of Turkey Recep Tayyip Erdogan back in May. Özil said he felt singled out by German media to further what he called “right-wing propaganda” and blamed for Germany’s poor performance at the 2018 World Cup. “I am German when we win, but I am an immigrant when we lose,” Özil wrote in a statement. (📸: Getty Images)

Netflix hired Shonda Rhimes away from ABC in a deal reportedly worth more than $150 million. The first batch of Netflix shows will include a series on the migration of African Americans from the Jim Crow South based on the book “The Warmth of Other Suns” and a reimagining of “The Nutcracker” 📺👏🏾 (📷: Reuters)

Jennifer Hudson, James Corden, and Ian McKellen are also set to star in the film adaptation of Andrew Lloyd Webber’s musical. Filming will begin later this year in the UK, according to the Hollywood Reporter 🎬🐱 (📷: AP/Reuters)

The rapper told police that two armed men forced him into their car. The attackers brought him to an undisclosed location, where he was told to make a phone call, after which an undisclosed amount of jewelry was brought to the car. The jewelry was given to the two assailants who then fled the scene, police said. (📷: Getty)
"I had a nice laugh with him when he got to my house and to his credit he did walk really fast," Michael Giambrone said 😂🚶‍♂️(📷: Twitter)

More than 30 sites in the state have detectable levels of toxic chemicals in the water and soil, two of which are linked to heart disease, thyroid disease, and cancer, and are thought to make vaccines less effective in kids. Governor Rick Snyder wants to sue the company responsible for making the chemicals that wound up in the drinking water. (📷: AP)

She had reportedly just moved, and made it rain with cash from the deposit on her previous home. According to the Korea Herald, she didn’t give a clear reason for her random act of charity but “expressed a desire to give money to people.” Legally, picking up the money and taking it for yourself would be considered theft, so witnesses handed the cash in to the police, who are holding on to it for now as she can still lay claim to it. (📷: Daegu Police/Yonhap News)
The photo was taken last week, after the christening of George’s baby brother, Prince Louis 👑 ✨ (📷: @kensingtonroyal)

One woman is dead after a man barricaded himself and dozens of hostages inside the Silver Lake Trader Joe’s following a police pursuit. Authorities say the man shot his grandmother and another woman in a family dispute Saturday afternoon before fleeing and crashing his car at the Trader Joe's. He was taken into police custody three hours later. (📸: Getty)

Eleven members of the Coleman family, from Indianapolis, were aboard the Ride the Ducks tour boat when it sank during a storm near Branson, Missouri Thursday. Only two members of the family, Tia Coleman and her nephew, survived. The boat's driver, Robert Williams, also died, as did father and son Steve and Lance Smith, husband and wife Janice and William Bright, William Asher and Rosemarie Hamann, and Leslie Dennison, who reportedly saved her 12-year-old granddaughter before the boat sank. (📸: Facebook)

Screenshots of the text conversation show a female student, who is black, introducing herself over text to her new Georgia Southern University roommate, who is white. The white roommate's response, seemingly intended for someone else, says her black roommate's Instagram “looks pretty normal, not too n——ish." The white roommate apologized, claiming her phone autocorrected the word "triggerish," but the university has issued a statement apologizing for the "offensive and unacceptable" remark.

Expedited shipping is convenient, but it means your packages aren’t as consolidated as they could be. This leads to more delivery cars and commercial trucks on the road and more packaging waste — and frequent free returns multiply the problem. (📷: Getty)

Hilde Hall wrote that instead of filling out the prescription, the pharmacist questioned her “loudly and in front of other CVS staff and customers”, then refused to hand her the prescription back and refused her doctor’s office direct requests to dispense it, forcing her to go to a Walgreens to have the prescription filled. CVS has apologized and said the pharmacist’s actions do not reflect its values. (📷: ACLU)

Original series creator Joss Whedon will executive produce, and while there are reports that a black woman will star in the lead role, a lot is still up in the air: no actors have signed on yet, and there’s no script or network/streaming service attached to the project. (📷: Getty Images)

Faith Pugh says she allowed Kelton Griffin to drive her car on their date, and when he stopped at a gas station and asked Pugh to buy him something from the store, she returned to find her car – and Griffin – gone. Griffin ignored Pugh's attempts to reach him (he even allegedly deleted her from social media,) and Pugh later got a text from a friend saying she was on a date with Griffin at a drive-in movie theater, where police showed up and later charged him with theft. (📸: WREG TV)

Disney has fired James Gunn as "Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3" director after conservative activists resurfaced old tweets in which Gunn made jokes about pedophilia. "The offensive attitudes and statements discovered on James’ Twitter feed are indefensible and inconsistent with our studio’s values, and we have severed our business relationship with him," Walt Disney Studios said. Gunn tweeted before his firing that he was "truly sorry" for the jokes. (📸: Reuters)

Trump was secretly recorded by his confidant and longtime personal lawyer Michael Cohen, talking about paying off Karen McDougal, the New York Times reported. The reported conversation came just two months before the presidential election. (📸: AP / Getty Images)

During "Breaking Bad's" 10th-anniversary panel at San Diego Comic-Con, Paul talked about how his costar used to prank him. "He’s like, 'Hey, man, it’s been a fun ride.' I was like, 'What do you mean?' He’s like, 'I thought you read the script, right?' [I was like,] 'No.' He’s like, 'Oh,' and then he just walks away." (📸: Getty Images)

At least 13 people, including children, were killed after a tourist boat carrying 31 people capsized and sank during a storm Thursday evening near Branson, Missouri. (📸: The Springfield News-Leader via AP)

The internet is praising 21-year-old server Emelia Holden after video showed her reaction to a man grabbing her backside at Vinnie Van GoGo’s pizzeria. Holden grabbed the man, identified as Ryan Cherwinski, by the collar and slammed him against the wall, and it was all caught on security video. Cherwinski was arrested and has been released from jail on $2,500 bond. (📸: YouTube)

Genevieve Pascolla was seated next to a man on a flight from London to Chicago when she says the man started masturbating under a blanket. After she alerted flight attendants and was given a new seat, she says flight attendants joked "What perfume are you wearing?" and "He's had a bit of wine," and says the man was "allowed to finish." A United spokesperson condemned the "offensive conduct" of the man and gave Pascolla "compensation," though she says her refund was just half the ticket in the form of a voucher, and only after she posted the incident on Twitter. (📸: Genevieve Pascolla)

Dedrick Williams, Michael Boatwright, Trayvon Newsome, and Robert Allen were charged with first-degree murder and robbery in the shooting death of rapper XXXTentacion. Williams and Boatwright are in custody, while Newsome and Allen are still at large. XXXTentacion, born Jahseh Dwayne Onfroy, was killed June 18 while outside a motorcycle dealership near Miami, where he was allegedly confronted by Boatwright and Newsome before Boatwright opened fire. (📸: Getty, Broward County Sheriff)

Cory Hrobowski, 19, used to work at a Chicago web design company – until he received a text from his boss' new number and assumed it was "a random girl" asking for a "dick appointment." "I have bad experiences with unknown numbers so I get fed up pretty quick," Cory said. He hoped he could smooth things over, but says the "situation got awkward" so he shared the mess on Twitter asking for help – and when it blew up there, knew he had to no choice but to resign. Cory says in the future he'll ask "who's this?" when he gets a text from an unknown number. (📷: Cory Hrobowski)

“The sarcophagus has been opened, but we have not been hit by a curse,” an official said, bringing disappointing news to everyone who was 100% ready for the world to end after it was found. Inside are three decomposed skeletons, thought to be the remains of warriors, and red sewage that leaked in 🇪🇬 (📷: Ministry of Antiquities)

It took over a minute for 141 women to fill the stage to accept the Arthur Ashe Courage Award while the audience gave them a standing ovation. “Make no mistake, we’re here on this stage to present an image for the world to see. A portrait of survival,” said Sarah Klein, Nassar’s first known victim. He’s serving an effective life sentence in prison for abusing hundreds of young female athletes under the guise of medical treatment. (📷: Getty)

A refugee from Cameroon was pulled from the wreckage of a migrant ship off the coast of Libya, and the photos are haunting. The group that rescued her, Spanish NGO Proactiva Open Arms, told BuzzFeed News that she had been in the water for 48 hours. The woman, Josefa, was found next to two bodies. (📸: Reuters / Proactiva)

Michael and Heather Martin, who lost custody of two children, are facing criticism for featuring their three other kids in “prank videos” while on probation. A trailer for their new FamilyOFive channel features a clip of one of the kids getting hit with a ball. After our story published, YouTube told BuzzFeed News that the channel would be removed. Watch our Story for more details (📷: YouTube)

Blue Spruce Productions will helm the musical led by Tony Award-winning theatrical producer Scott Delman. And if a “Sisterhood” musical wasn’t enough to look forward to, Alexis Bledel said that a third installment in the film series might be in the works 👖🙌 (📷: Warner Bros)

A TV station has erected a huge statue of an open-shirted Jeff Goldblum near the Tower Bridge to celebrate the 25th anniversary of Jurassic Park, which the iconic statue was modeled after 🦖👀 (📷: Getty, Universal Pictures)

The California Supreme Court ordered the Secretary of State not to place Prop 9, also known as Cal 3, on the Nov. 6 ballot in response to a legal challenge filed against the measure that argued it did not comply with the state constitution. The initiative put forth by Silicon Valley billionaire Tim Draper would have broken California into three new states 🗳❌ (📷: @votecal3)

Netflix and DreamWorks recently unveiled the first images of their reboot of the '80s animated series "She-Ra and the Princesses of Power." But then critics showed up, mostly male, to say that the 2018 She-Ra was too masculine. Some are criticizing the critics for perpetuating the idea that girls, even fictional ones, should adhere to a narrow standard of physical beauty "to prioritize being attractive to adult men." (📸: Mattel, Netflix/DreamWorks)

When asked by a reporter Wednesday if Russia was “still targeting” the US, Trump said, “No.” The declaration is at odds with a statement released by Director of National Intelligence Dan Coats just hours after Trump’s meeting with Putin that cited Russia’s “ongoing, pervasive efforts to undermine our democracy.” (📸: Reuters)
The actor will portray Princess Margaret in the third season of Netflix's "The Crown" 👑 💅 (📸: Netflix)

After 24-year-old Sarah Webb was pulled over for speeding, two Georgia police officers demanded she hand over her license and car keys, and then used a coin flip app to decide whether to ticket her or arrest her, body cam footage shows. Even after the app landed on tails for ticket, the officers begin the arrest process and handcuffed Webb. Both officers are facing an internal investigation, and all charges against Webb have been dropped. (📸: WXIA-TV)

Mara Martin was one of 16 finalists chosen as part of a "Sports Illustrated" open call model search in Miami, and she brought her 5-month-old daughter along on the catwalk. Though some criticized Martin's choice to breastfeed her daughter during the show, she said she hopes it will help normalize breastfeeding and show that women "can do it all." 💪👏 (📸: Getty)

Nickelodeon is bringing back "Rugrats" with 26 new episodes, and they're also producing a live-action film which will feature the characters in CGI, set to be released in November 2020. Both the series and the movie will not only include new adventures, but also introduce new characters. There's no word yet on when the TV series will debut 🙌 (📷: Viacom)
The two stars kissed at the "Mamma Mia!" sequel premiere in London — sending shockwaves around the internet 🌈💕 (📷: @gettyimages)
CVS Health says it “sincerely apologized” to the customer and emphasized it “does not tolerate any practices that discriminate” against shoppers. (📸: Facebook)
A steam-related explosion sent chunks of lava into the air, piercing the roof of a nearby tour boat and injuring at least 23 people 🌋 (📷: Hawaii County Civil Defense)

Seven-year-old DeSandra Thomas was texting police trying to get help after her father crashed their car when she was struck and killed crossing the highway. The little girl's father had been allegedly driving under the influence around 3:30 a.m. when he swerved off, crashed into an abandoned car, and shot through some fencing, police said. (📷: Facebook)

Samantha Whitney Jones has been charged with criminal homicide after her infant son died, allegedly from a combination of drugs transmitted while breastfeeding. An autopsy found that the 11-week-old died from a combination of methadone, amphetamine, and methamphetamine. (📷: Bucks County District Attorney’s Office)

Shoppers planning to squeeze their wallets dry on Monday for the company’s Prime Day sales got error pages featuring dogs instead of pages of deep discounts when they visited the online retailer 😩🛒 (📷: Amazon.com)
Over 70 news emojis are coming to Apple devices, including bald heads, lobsters, superheroes, and moon cakes 🙏 (📸: Apple)

Highlights from that bizarre Trump-Putin press conference: • Putin didn’t deny having compromising information about Trump
• Trump repeatedly slammed the FBI and the Russia probe
• Putin denied interference in the 2016 election and even offered aid in the investigation (📸: Reuters)

President Trump and Russian premier Vladimir Putin shake hands at the start of their bilateral summit in Helsinki, Finland 🤝 (📸: Reuters)
Prince William and Duchess Kate of Cambridge have released the official photographs of Prince Louis’s christening, and they’re absolutely adorable 👑👶 (📷: @kensingtonroyal)

"The manager on duty said that he’d never seen a coupon like the one I had and said that he thought it was fraudulent," Camilla Hudson wrote on Facebook. In a statement, CVS apologized to Hudson. “We sincerely apologize to Ms. Hudson for her experience in one of our stores,” the company said, adding that it’s “actively investigating” what happened. Follow @world for more stories from around the globe 🌎❤️ (📷: Reuters)

The diver, Vern Unsworth, had earlier called Musk’s submarine rescue plan a “PR stunt” that had no chance of working. In a series of tweets, Musk called the diver a “pedo”, told someone else who called his plan absurd to “stay tuned jackass”, and claimed the plan for the submarine was sourced with “experienced cave experts on the Internet.” (📷: Getty)
Allez les Bleus! 🇫🇷 🏆 ⚽️

Gregory Longenecker, 51, was found dead under the rear of the bulldozer that a state trooper and a Pennsylvania Game Commission employee were using to search for him in "thick underbrush" of a field where a suspicious car was reported. State Police Trooper David Beohm told BuzzFeed News that at some point during the incident authorities located 10 marijuana plants in the field. The incident has been criticized as a result of marijuana criminalization, and is currently being investigated by the state police's internal affairs division, while the trooper who was on the bulldozer has been placed on "administrative duty.” (📸: Flickr)

"Days after our baby girl was born, I kissed my wife goodbye before surgery and neither of us knew if she would be coming back," Alexis Ohanian wrote on Instagram after Serena Williams' loss at Wimbledon Saturday. "We just wanted her to survive—10 months later, she's in the #Wimbledon final. Our family knows she'll win many more trophies, too. She's just getting started. And I couldn't be more proud." The shroud has been long been considered by some to be the burial cloth of Jesus, but researchers have concluded that the linen appears patched with inconsistent bloodstains from a standing model, not a crucified man or facedown corpse, adding to evidence that the shroud is a medieval fraud. (📷: Wikimedia Commons)
Kerber won her first Wimbledon title 6-3, 6-3 after a quick match. It was Williams’ first grand-slam final since giving birth just 10 months ago. (📷: Reuters)

They arrived for the women’s singles final between Angelique Kerber and Serena Williams, who is a friend of Meghan’s and attended her wedding to Prince Harry, as well as a bit of the men’s semi-final between Novak Djokovic and Rafael Nadal. (And yes, those are tennis legends Martina Navratilova and Billie Jean King sitting behind them) ✨

The unidentified woman in the so-called #PlaneBae saga, in which photos of her and her male seatmate were posted to Twitter and Instagram by fellow passenger Rosey Blair, released the statement through her lawyer. Police say Orlando Vilchez Lazo, 37, picked up women in San Francisco while they were waiting for a car from a ride-hail company and took them to another location where he sexually assaulted them. The first assault occurred in 2013, the second in February 2018, and the third and fourth in May and June 2018. Uber said the suspect is not a registered driver "and never was." Lyft did not immediately respond to BuzzFeed News' request for comment. Noting the five-year gap between the first and second assaults, investigators believe there may be other victims in other cities. (📸: San Francisco PD)

Alex Childress, 17, was working his summer landscaping job when he accidentally touched a giant hogweed plant, which can grow up to 14 feet tall. When his skin became irritated, he initially thought he'd gotten a sunburn – but when he got home, his skin started peeling off. Alex was hospitalized and is now recovering, but his skin is still peeling and he will have to stay out of the sun for six months to a year. Giant hogweed is an invasive species that was recently discovered in Virginia, and its sap can cause blistering burns, scars, and permanent blindness. (📸: GoFundMe)

Sara Manitoski, a 16-year-old Canadian student, died in her sleep on an overnight school trip last year, and a coroner recently confirmed she died of toxic shock syndrome due to a tampon. Toxic shock syndrome is a rare, life-threatening complication of a bacterial infection, and can be treated with antibiotics if caught early. Sara's family hopes her death will raise awareness about TSS: "My beautiful, incredibly healthy sister died because of this so please share, educate yourselves and be cautious whenever using tampons," her sister Carli wrote on Facebook. Drama teacher Melody Herzfeld — who shielded students during the shooting — accepted the Tony Award for excellence in theater education. “All the goodness and tragedy that has brought me to this point will never be erased,” Herzfeld said. After she spoke, her students sang "Seasons of Love.” ❤️😭 (📷: Getty Images)

The president said he was "seriously" considering pardoning the boxing legend for his draft-evasion conviction. But Ali's family says he doesn’t need a pardon because his conviction was overturned by the US Supreme Court in 1971. (📷: AP)

Florida failed to do national background checks for people who applied for concealed weapons permits for a full year. The reason: the lone employee in charge of running names through the FBI database wasn't able to log in for over a year, a state report found. (📷: AP)

Georgy Cohen spotted the poem while visiting prospective kindergartens for her 5-year-old. Set to the tune of "Twinkle Twinkle, Little Star,” the rhyme is meant to help the kindergarteners prepare for an active shooter situation. "I don’t blame the school at all — they are doing exactly what they need to do to keep little kids safe. I blame our prevailing culture and chronic inaction as a country," she said 🎒💔 (📷: Georgy Cohen)

The “Wedding Crashers” actor was stopped by police early Sunday at a DUI checkpoint in Hermosa Beach. He was arrested for resisting, delaying or obstructing officers, and for driving under the influence, according to the Manhattan Beach Police Department. (📷: Manhattan Beach Police)

The family says their pitbull Penny is a hero for helping two-year-old Charlee Campbell survive in the woods. She was found dehydrated and with tick bites but was relatively unharmed. (📷: Bullitt County Sheriff/WISTV)

Most suicide prevention efforts focus on mental health issues, but “suicide is a public health problem,” a CDC director said. Experts are looking to more comprehensive approaches that include tracking suicide rates more closely and establishing policies for the safe storage of medication and access to firearms among people at risk. (📷: Getty)

There are a record number of job openings right now, and more openings than there are people looking for jobs. The job categories with the most openings right now include medical nurse, management, driver, retail and food, according to job site Indeed.com. (📷: Getty)

Prince George may be a future king, but for now he's still a chatty toddler who isn't exempt from being shushed by his older cousin, Savannah, during important events (like their great-grandmother Queen Elizabeth's 92nd birthday celebration.)(📸: Getty)
The three-year-old thoroughbred is just the 13th horse ever to snag the prestigious Triple Crown, which is a win at the Belmont Stakes, the Preakness Stakes, and the Kentucky Derby 🐎 👑(📸: Getty)

He reportedly caused a commotion while arriving 17 minutes late during another official’s remarks. Many people called his late arrival disrespectful and couldn’t get over the various expressions of women in the photos. (📷: AP)

We can’t stop staring. The photo was released by German Chancellor Angela Merkel’s office. Trump left the G7 summit early on Saturday, after two days of tense meetings with other world leaders. (📷: @bundeskanzlerin)

Her two dogs, one of them injured, reportedly wouldn’t leave the lake’s edge during the search for her body. It was found on Friday and her arm was reportedly found inside a 12-foot alligator authorities removed from the lake. (📷: AP)

Lulabel Seitz said administrators told her not to speak about her and other students’ experiences with sexual assault at the high school. “I wasn’t going to do it because they kept scaring me and threatening me. But I thought, if I don’t stand up for me and the other girls, then who is going to do it?” (📷: Lulabel Seitz)

When Marilyn Hagerty wrote a review calling a new Olive Garden the “most beautiful restaurant now operating in Grand Forks” in 2012, the internet was quick to snark on it — but not Anthony Bourdain. The chef came to her defense, and Hagerty ended up meeting him in New York and eventually getting a book deal to publish her reviews, which Bourdain edited and wrote the foreword for. Hagerty called his death "sad, shocking news" and said she remembered him fondly as someone who celebrated her work. (📸: Grand Forks Herald)

The prequel is set thousands of years before the events of George R.R. Martin's "Song of Ice and Fire" book series, on which "Game of Thrones" is based. HBO says "the series chronicles the world’s descent from the golden Age of Heroes into its darkest hour." 🐉 (📸: HBO)

Jason Wang, the owner of Xi'an Famous Foods in New York City, says Anthony Bourdain "helped bring our family out from living in one room in Flushing to living the American Dream" after the restaurant was featured on "No Reservations" in 2007. Bourdain returned several times after that to try new dishes prepared by Wang's father. Wang says the restaurant will honor Bourdain by donating all of Friday's sales from its 12 locations — an estimated $60,000 — to the National Suicide Hotline. (📸: xianfoods via Twitter)

Barney Greengrass in New York counted Anthony Bourdain as one of its most loyal fans. In tribute to him, they set up a table with his favorite items. "He’d travel all over the world and then come back here, and it’s like nothing’s changed." 🍴❤️ (📷: Food Network/Barney Greengrass) Watch our Story for the latest.
Tributes are pouring in for Anthony Bourdain and his work. Check out our Story for more ⬆️

The TV show host, author, and celebrity chef was found dead in his hotel in France while filming an episode of CNN's "Parts Unknown." Bourdain, 61, was found unresponsive in his room Friday morning by friend and fellow celebrity chef Eric Ripert. Check out our Story for more on how he’s being remembered. (📸: AFP / Getty Images)

Officer Adam Gruler, who was the first to respond at the scene of the shooting, is being sued by 30 survivors and the family members of nine victims. The lawsuit accuses Gruler and 20 other officers of choosing "to remain safely outside" and "allow the patrons of the club to be massacred." (📷: Orlando Police)

3-year-old Luciana Chica “started crying” when she saw that her dad had been arrested while making a delivery to a military base, her mother told BuzzFeed News. “This is going to affect her one way or another ... deep down she knows something is happening to her father.” Pablo Villavicencio is currently in ICE custody, and is expected to be deported to Ecuador. (📷: Facebook via pablovilla2024)
The incident allegedly took place when Trudeau was 28. The Canadian prime minister's press secretary told BuzzFeed News he doesn't recall "any negative interactions." (📷: Creston Valley Advance)

Kato did his best, but rescue officials said the 5-year-old, 120-pound Great Pyrenees was “exhausted and most likely dehydrated” when his humans reached out for assistance 🐶⛰😍(📷: Evergreen Fire Rescue)

Li Shang, everyone’s favorite Hun-slaying thirst trap, will not be in the “Mulan” remake, but actor Yoson An has been cast as Chen Hongui, “a confident and ambitious recruit who joins Commander Tung’s unit,” according to The Hollywood Reporter 🎬 (📷: @yosonosoy)

Giuliani also said Daniels, who is currently suing his client, wasn’t as “classy” as Trump’s three wives on Wednesday. Senator Elizabeth Warren called the comments “an insult to every woman in this country.” (📷: Getty)

Comedian Samantha Bee gave a defiant apology for calling Ivanka Trump a “feckless cunt” on Wednesday night, and said she was mostly sorry that her language drew attention away from the immigration issue that was the focus of her segment last week. (📷: @fullfrontalsamb)

It was reported this week that Reese Witherspoon was finalizing a deal to bring back Elle Woods with her Hello Sunshine production company. She confirmed it on Thursday with an Instagram video recreating a scene from the original movie and wrote “It’s true…” 🙌💕 (📷: MGM/@reesewitherspoon)

Beyoncé and Jay-Z kicked off their "On the Run II" tour this week, and the concert included a photo of Beyoncé holding two babies that fans naturally assumed were twins Sir and Rumi, born last year. Sadly, when asked if those were the pop star's twins, her rep said "it's not.” 🤷‍♀️👶

Russell Berger, CrossFit’s chief knowledge officer and spokesperson, has been placed on an unpaid leave of absence after tweeting his support for an Indiana CrossFit gym’s cancellation of a Pride event, which led many coaches and employees to quit in protest. Crossfit CEO Greg Glassman said Berger’s views are “appalling” and that “he needs to take a big dose of ‘shut the fuck up.’”
